Text

As this [my]0-i story will probably run counter to more than one fashion of the day , literary and other , it is prudent to bow to those fashions wherever [I]0-i honestly can ; and therefore to begin with a scrap of description . The edge of a great fox - cover ; a flat wilderness of low leafless oaks fortified by [a long , dreary , thorn capped clay ditch , with sour red water oozing out at [every yard]432-every yard]431-a long , dreary , thorn capped clay ditch , with sour red water oozing out at every yard ; a broken gate leading into [a straight wood ride]433-a straight wood ride , ragged with dead grasses and black with fallen leaves , the centre mashed into a quagmire by innumerable horsehoofs ; some forty red coats and some four black ; a sprinkling of [young - farmers , resplendent in gold buttons and green]434-young - farmers , resplendent in gold buttons and green ; [a pair of sleek drab stable - keepers , showing off horses for sale]435-a pair of sleek drab stable - keepers , showing off horses for sale ; [the surgeon of the union , in Mackintosh and antigropelos]436-the surgeon of the union , in mackintosh and antigropelos ; [two holiday schoolboys with trousers strapped down to bursting point , like a penny steamer]437-two holiday schoolboys with trousers strapped down to bursting point , like a penny steamer ’s safety - valve ; [a midshipman , the only merry one in [the field]439-the field , bumping about on a fretting , sweating hack , with its nose a foot above its ears]438-a midshipman , the only merry one in the field , bumping about on a fretting , sweating hack , with its nose a foot above its ears ; and [Lancelot Smith]172-lancelot , who then kept [two good horses]440-two good horses , and ‘ rode forward ’[172-lancelot] as [a fine young fellow of three - and - twenty who can afford it]441-a fine young fellow of three - and - twenty who can afford it , and ‘ has nothing else to do , ’[172-lancelot] has a very good right to ride . But what is a description , without a sketch of the weather?—In these Pantheist days especially , when [a hero]442-a hero or [heroine]443-heroine ’s moral state must entirely depend on the barometer , and [authors]444-authors talk as if [Christians]120-christians were cabbages , and [a man]445-a man ’s soul as well as [his]445-a man lungs might be saved by sea - breezes and sunshine ; or [his]445-a man character developed by wearing guano in [his]445-a man shoes , and training [himself]445-a man against a south wall — [we]446-we must have a weather description , though , as [I]0-i shall presently show , one in flat contradiction of the popular theory . Luckily for [our]446-we information , [Lancelot]172-lancelot was very much given to watch both the weather and [himself]172-lancelot , and had indeed , while in [his]172-lancelot teens , combined the two in a sort of a soul - almanack on the principles just mentioned — somewhat in this style : — ‘ Monday , 21st.—Wind S.W. , bright sun , mercury at 30½ inches . Felt [my]172-lancelot heart expanded towards [the universe]3109-the universe . Organs of veneration and benevolence pleasingly excited ; and gave a shilling to [a tramp]3110-a tramp . An inexpressible joy bounded through every vein , and the soft air breathed purity and self - sacrifice through [my]172-lancelot soul . As [I]172-lancelot watched the beetles , [those children of the sun]3111-those children of the sun , who , as [divine Shelley]121-shelley says , “ laden with light and odour , pass over the gleam of the living grass , ” [I]172-lancelot gained an Eden - glimpse of the pleasures of virtue . ‘[172-lancelot] N.B. Found [the tramp]447-the tramp drunk in [a ditch]448-a ditch . [I]0-i could not have degraded [myself]0-i on such a day — ah ! how could [he]447-the tramp ? ‘ Tuesday , 22d.—Barometer rapidly falling . Heavy clouds in [the south - east]3112-the south - east . [My]447-the tramp heart sank into gloomy forebodings . Read [Manfred]122-manfred , and doubted whether [I]447-the tramp should live long . The laden weight of destiny seemed to crush down [my]447-the tramp aching forehead , till the thunderstorm burst , and peace was restored to [my]447-the tramp troubled soul . ’[447-the tramp] This was very bad ; but to do justice to [Lancelot]172-lancelot , [he]172-lancelot had grown out of it at the time when [my]0-i story begins . [He]172-lancelot was now in the fifth act of [his]172-lancelot ‘ Werterean ’[172-lancelot] stage ; that sentimental measles , which [all clever men]449-all clever men must catch once in [their]449-all clever men lives , and which , generally , like the physical measles , if taken early , settles [their]449-all clever men constitution for good or evil ; if taken late , goes far towards killing [them]449-all clever men . [Lancelot]172-lancelot had found [Byron]123-byron and [Shelley]121-shelley pall on [his]172-lancelot taste and commenced devouring [Bulwer]124-bulwer and worshipping [Ernest Maltravers]125-ernest maltravers . [He]172-lancelot had left [Bulwer]124-bulwer for old ballads and romances , and [Mr. Carlyle]126-mr. carlyle ’s reviews ; was next alternately chivalry - mad ; and [Germany]1-germany - mad ; was now reading hard at physical science ; and on the whole , trying to become [a great man]450-a great man , without any very clear notion of what [a great man]450-a great man ought to be . Real education [he]172-lancelot never had had . Bred up at [home]452-home under [[his]172-lancelot father]453-his father , [a rich merchant]454-a rich merchant , [he]172-lancelot had gone to college with a large stock of general information , and a particular mania for dried plants , fossils , butterflies , and sketching , and some such creed as this : — That [he]172-lancelot was very clever . That [he]172-lancelot ought to make [his]172-lancelot fortune . That a great many things were very pleasant — beautiful things among the rest . That it was a fine thing to be ‘ superior , ’[455-gentleman] [gentleman]455-gentleman - like , generous , and courageous . That [a man]445-a man ought to be religious . And left college with a good smattering of classics and mathematics , picked up in the intervals of [boat - racing]457-boat - racing and hunting , and much the same creed as [he]172-lancelot brought with [him]172-lancelot , except in regard to the last article . The scenery - and - natural - history mania was now somewhat at a discount . [He]172-lancelot had discovered a new natural object , including in itself all — more than all — yet found beauties and wonders — [woman]458-woman ! Draw , draw the veil and weep , [guardian angel]459-guardian angel ! if such there be . What was to be expected ? Pleasant things were pleasant — there was no doubt of that , whatever else might be doubtful . [He]172-lancelot had read [Byron]123-byron by stealth ; [he]172-lancelot had been flogged into reading [Ovid]127-ovid and [Tibullus]128-tibullus ; and commanded by [[his]172-lancelot private tutor]460-his private tutor to read [Martial]129-martial and [Juvenal]130-juvenal ‘ for the improvement of [his]172-lancelot style . ’[129-martial] All conversation on the subject of love had been prudishly avoided , as usual , by [[his]172-lancelot parents]461-his parents and [teacher]462-teacher . The parts of the Bible which spoke of it had been always kept out of [his]172-lancelot sight . Love had been to [him]172-lancelot , practically , ground tabooed and ‘ carnal . ’[462-teacher] What was to be expected ? Just what happened — if [woman]458-woman ’s beauty had nothing holy in it , why should [his]172-lancelot fondness for it ? Just what happens every day — that [he]172-lancelot had to sow [his]172-lancelot wild oats for [himself]172-lancelot , and eat the fruit thereof , and the dirt thereof also . [O fathers]464-o fathers ! [fathers]465-fathers ! and [you]466-you , [clergymen , who monopolise education]467-clergymen , who monopolise education ! either tell [boys]468-boys the truth about love , or do not put into [their]468-boys hands , without note or comment , the foul devil ’s lies about it , which make up the mass of [the Latin poets]469-the latin poets — and then go , fresh from teaching [Juvenal]130-juvenal and [Ovid]127-ovid , to declaim at [Exeter Hall]2-exeter hall against poor Peter Dens ’s well - meaning prurience ! Had [we]470-our not better take the beam out of [our]470-our own eye before [we]470-our meddle with the mote in the Jesuit ’s ? But where is [my]0-i description of the weather all this time ? [I]0-i can not , [I]0-i am sorry to say , give any very cheerful account of the weather that day . But what matter ? Are [Englishmen]471-englishmen hedge - gnats , who only take [their]471-englishmen sport when the sun shines ? Is it not , on the contrary , symbolical of [our]470-our national character , that almost all [our]470-our field amusements are wintry ones ? [Our]470-our fowling , [our]470-our hunting , [our]470-our punt - shooting ( pastime for [Hymir]131-hymir [himself]131-hymir and [the frost giants)—our golf]472-the frost giants)—our golf and skating,—our very cricket , and boat - racing , and jack and grayling fishing , carried on till [we]470-our are fairly frozen out . [We]470-our are [a stern people]473-a stern people , and winter suits [us]470-our . [Nature]132-nature then retires modestly into the background , and spares [us]470-our the obtrusive glitter of summer , leaving [us]470-our to think and work ; and therefore it happens that in [England]3-england , it may be taken as a general rule , that whenever [all the rest of [the world]475-the world]474-all the rest of the world is in - doors , [we]470-our are out and busy , and on the whole , the worse the day , the better the deed . The weather that day , the first day [Lancelot]172-lancelot ever saw [[his]172-lancelot beloved]476-his beloved , was truly national . A silent , dim , distanceless , steaming , rotting day in March . The last brown oak - leaf which had stood out the winter ’s frost , spun and quivered plump down , and then lay ; as if ashamed to have broken for a moment the ghastly stillness , like [an awkward guest at a great dumb dinner - party]477-an awkward guest at a great dumb dinner - party . A cold suck of wind just proved its existence , by toothaches on the north side of all faces . [The spiders having been weather - bewitched the night before]478-the spiders having been weather - bewitched the night before , had unanimously agreed to cover every brake and brier with gossamer - cradles , and never a fly to be caught in them ; like [Manchester cotton - spinners madly glutting the markets in the teeth of ‘ no demand]3113-manchester cotton - spinners madly glutting the markets in the teeth of ‘ no demand . ’[3113-manchester cotton - spinners madly glutting the markets in the teeth of ‘ no demand] The steam crawled out of the dank turf , and reeked off the flanks and nostrils of the shivering horses , and clung with clammy paws to frosted hats and dripping boughs . A soulless , skyless , catarrhal day , as if [that bustling dowager , old mother Earth]479-that bustling dowager , old mother earth — what with match - making in spring , and fêtes champêtres in summer , and dinner - giving in autumn — was fairly worn out , and put to bed with the influenza , under wet blankets and the cold - water cure . There sat [Lancelot]172-lancelot by the cover - side , [his]172-lancelot knees aching with cold and wet , thanking [his]172-lancelot stars that [he]172-lancelot was [not one of [the whippers - in who were lashing about in the dripping cover]481-the whippers - in who were lashing about in the dripping cover , laying up for [themselves]481-the whippers - in who were lashing about in the dripping cover , in catering for the amusement of [their]481-the whippers - in who were lashing about in the dripping cover betters]480-not one of the whippers - in who were lashing about in the dripping cover , laying up for themselves , in catering for the amusement of their betters , a probable old age of bed - ridden torture , in the form of rheumatic gout . Not that [he]172-lancelot was at all happy — indeed , [he]172-lancelot had no reason to be so ; for , first , the hounds would not find ; next , [he]172-lancelot had left half - finished at [home]452-home a review article on the Silurian System , which [he]172-lancelot had solemnly promised [an abject and beseeching editor]483-an abject and beseeching editor to send to post that night ; next , [he]172-lancelot was on the windward side of the cover , and dare not light a cigar ; and lastly , [his]172-lancelot mucous membrane in general was not in the happiest condition , seeing that [he]172-lancelot had been dining the evening before with [Mr. Vaurien of Rottenpalings]133-mr. vaurien of rottenpalings , [a young gentleman of a convivial and melodious turn of mind , who sang — and played also — as singing men]484-a young gentleman of a convivial and melodious turn of mind , who sang — and played also — as singing men are wont — in more senses than one , and had ‘ ladies and [gentlemen ’]3114-gentlemen ’[484-a young gentleman of a convivial and melodious turn of mind , who sang — and played also — as singing men] down from [town]485-town to stay with [him]172-lancelot ; and [they]486-they sang and played too ; and so somehow between [vingt - un and champagne - punch]487-vingt - un and champagne - punch , [Lancelot]172-lancelot had not arrived at [home]452-home till seven o’clock that morning , and was in a fit state to appreciate the feelings of [[our]489-our grandfathers]490-our grandfathers , when , after the third bottle of port , [they]490-our grandfathers used to put the black silk tights into [their]490-our grandfathers pockets , slip on the leathers and boots , and ride the crop - tailed hack thirty miles on a winter ’s night , to meet the hounds in [the next county]491-the next county by ten in the morning . [They]490-our grandfathers are ‘ gone down to [Hades]4-hades , even [many stalwart souls of [heroes]3116-heroes]3115-many stalwart souls of heroes , ’[490-our grandfathers] with [John Warde of Squerries]134-john warde of squerries at [their]490-our grandfathers head — [the fathers of [the men who conquered at [Waterloo]5-waterloo]493-the men who conquered at waterloo]492-the fathers of the men who conquered at waterloo ; and [we]489-our [[their]490-our grandfathers degenerate grandsons]494-their degenerate grandsons are left instead , with puny arms , and polished leather boots , and a considerable taint of hereditary disease , to sit in [club - houses]495-club - houses , and celebrate the progress of the species . Whether [Lancelot]172-lancelot or [his]172-lancelot horse , under these depressing circumstances , fell asleep ; or whether thoughts pertaining to such a life , and its fitness for [a clever and ardent young fellow in the nineteenth century]496-a clever and ardent young fellow in the nineteenth century , became gradually too painful , and had to be peremptorily shaken off , this deponent sayeth not ; but certainly , after five - and - thirty minutes of idleness and shivering , [Lancelot]172-lancelot opened [his]172-lancelot eyes with a sudden start , and struck spurs into [[his]172-lancelot hunter]497-his hunter without due cause shown ; whereat [Shiver]135-shiver - the - timbers , who was [no Griselda in temper—(Lancelot]498-no griselda in temper—(lancelot had bought [him]172-lancelot out of [the Pytchley]6-the pytchley for half [his]172-lancelot value , as unrideably vicious , when [he]172-lancelot had killed [a groom]499-a groom , and fallen backwards on [a rough - rider]500-a rough - rider , the first season after [he]172-lancelot came up from Horncastle)—responded by a furious kick or two , threw [his]172-lancelot head up , put [his]172-lancelot foot into a drain , and sprawled down all but on [his]172-lancelot nose , pitching [Lancelot]172-lancelot unawares shamefully on the pommel of [his]172-lancelot saddle . A certain fatality , by the bye , had lately attended all [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s efforts to shine ; [he]172-lancelot never bought a new coat without tearing it mysteriously next day , or tried to make a joke without bursting out coughing in the middle ... and now [the whole field]501-the whole field were looking on at [his]172-lancelot mishap ; between disgust and the start [he]172-lancelot turned almost sick , and felt the blood rush into [his]172-lancelot cheeks and forehead as [he]172-lancelot heard a shout of coarse jovial laughter burst out close to [him]172-lancelot , and [the old master of the hounds]502-the old master of the hounds , [Squire Lavington]136-squire lavington , roared aloud — ‘ A pretty sportsman [you]172-lancelot are , [Mr. Smith]137-mr. smith , to fall asleep by the cover - side and let [your]172-lancelot horse down — and [your]172-lancelot pockets , too ! What ’s that book on the ground ? Sapping and studying still ? [I]136-squire lavington let [nobody]3117-nobody come out with [my]136-squire lavington hounds with [their]3117-nobody pocket full of learning . Hand it up here , [Tom]138-tom ; [we]3118-we ’ll see what it is . French , as [I]136-squire lavington am [no scholar]3119-no scholar ! Translate for [us]3118-we , [Colonel Bracebridge]139-bracebridge ! ’[136-squire lavington] And , amid shouts of laughter , [the gay Guardsman]503-the gay guardsman read out , — ‘ [St. Francis de Sales]140-st. francis de sales : Introduction to a Devout Life . ’[503-the gay guardsman] [Poor Lancelot]172-lancelot ! Wishing [himself]172-lancelot fathoms under - ground , ashamed of [his]172-lancelot book , still more ashamed of [himself]172-lancelot for [his]172-lancelot shame , [he]172-lancelot had to sit there ten physical seconds , or spiritual years , while [the colonel]504-the colonel solemnly returned [him]172-lancelot the book , complimenting [him]172-lancelot on the proofs of its purifying influence which [he]172-lancelot had given the night before , in helping to throw the turnpike - gate into [the river]505-the river . But ‘ all things do end , ’[504-the colonel] and so did this ; and the silence of the hounds also ; and a faint but knowing whimper drove [St. Francis]140-st. francis de sales out of all heads , and [Lancelot]172-lancelot began to stalk slowly with [a dozen horsemen]506-a dozen horsemen up [the wood - ride]507-the wood - ride , to a fitful accompaniment of wandering hound - music , where [the choristers]508-the choristers were as invisible as [nightingales among the thick cover]509-nightingales among the thick cover . And hark ! just as the book was returned to [his]172-lancelot pocket , the sweet hubbub suddenly crashed out into one jubilant shriek , and then swept away fainter and fainter among the trees . The walk became a trot — the trot a canter . Then a faint melancholy shout at a distance , answered by a ‘ Stole away ! ’[172-lancelot] from [the fields]510-the fields ; a doleful ‘ toot ! ’[172-lancelot] of the horn ; the dull thunder of many horsehoofs rolling along [the farther woodside]511-the farther woodside . Then red coats , flashing like sparks of fire across the gray gap of mist at the ride’s - mouth , then a whipper - in , bringing up a belated hound , burst into [the pathway]512-the pathway , smashing and plunging , with shut eyes , through ash - saplings and hassock - grass ; then [a fat farmer , sedulously pounding through the mud]513-a fat farmer , sedulously pounding through the mud , was overtaken and bespattered in spite of all [his]513-a fat farmer , sedulously pounding through the mud struggles;—until the line streamed out into [the wide rushy pasture]514-the wide rushy pasture , startling up pewits and curlews , as [horsemen]515-horsemen poured in from every side , and [cunning old farmers]516-cunning old farmers rode off at inexplicable angles to [some well - known haunts of pug]517-some well - known haunts of pug : and right ahead , chiming and jangling sweet madness , the dappled pack glanced and wavered through the veil of soft grey mist . ‘ What ’s the use of this hurry ? ’[172-lancelot] growled [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ [They]3120-they will all be back again . [I]172-lancelot never have the luck to see a run . ’[172-lancelot] But no ; on and on — down the wind and down [the vale]518-the vale ; and the canter became a gallop , and the gallop a long straining stride ; and a hundred horsehoofs crackled like flame among the stubbles , and thundered fetlock - deep along [the heavy meadows]519-the heavy meadows ; and every fence thinned the cavalcade , till the madness began to stir all bloods , and with grim earnest silent faces , [the initiated few]520-the initiated few settled [themselves]520-the initiated few to [their]520-the initiated few work , and with [the colonel]504-the colonel and [Lancelot]172-lancelot at [their]520-the initiated few head , ‘ took [their]520-the initiated few pleasure sadly , after the manner of [[their]520-the initiated few nation]3121-their nation , ’[504-the colonel] as [old Froissart]142-old froissart has it . ‘ [Thorough bush]3122-thorough bush , through brier , [Thorough park]3123-thorough park , through pale ; ’[504-the colonel] till [the rolling grass - lands]522-the rolling grass - lands spread out into flat black open fallows , crossed with grassy baulks , and here and there a long melancholy line of tall elms , while before [them]520-the initiated few the high chalk ranges gleamed above the mist like a vast wall of emerald enamelled with snow , and [the winding river]523-the winding river glittering at [their]520-the initiated few feet . ‘ [A polite fox]3124-a polite fox ! ’[504-the colonel] observed [the colonel]504-the colonel . ‘ [He]3124-a polite fox ’s leading [the squire]3125-the squire straight [home]452-home to [Whitford]7-whitford , just in time for dinner . ’[504-the colonel] * * * * * [They]520-the initiated few were in [the last meadow]525-the last meadow , with [the stream]526-the stream before [them]520-the initiated few . A line of struggling heads in the swollen and milky current showed [the hounds]527-the hounds ’ opinion of [Reynard]143-reynard ’s course . [The sportsmen]3127-the sportsmen galloped off towards [the nearest bridge]3128-the nearest bridge . [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge looked back at [Lancelot]172-lancelot , who had been keeping by [his]139-bracebridge side in sulky rivalry , following [him]139-bracebridge successfully through all manner of desperate places , and more and more angry with [himself]139-bracebridge and [the guiltless colonel]3129-the guiltless colonel , because [he]139-bracebridge only followed , while [the colonel ’s quicker and unembarrassed wit , which lived wholly in the present moment]3130-the colonel ’s quicker and unembarrassed wit , which lived wholly in the present moment , saw long before [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[528-his] how to cut out [his]528-his work , ’ in [every field]3131-every field . ‘[528-his] [I]0-i sha n’t go round , ’ quietly observed [the colonel]504-the colonel . ‘[0-i] Do [you]0-i fancy [I]0-i shall ? ’ growled [Lancelot]172-lancelot , who took for granted — poor thin - skinned soul ! that the words were meant as a hit at [himself]172-lancelot . ‘[0-i] [You]0-i ’re [a brace of geese]3133-a brace of geese , ’[529-the old squire] politely observed [the old squire]529-the old squire ; ‘ and [you]0-i ’ll find it out in rheumatic fever . [There—“one fool]3134-there—“one fool makes many ! ” [You]0-i ’ll kill [Smith]137-mr. smith before [you]0-i ’re[530-colonel] done , [colonel]530-colonel ! ’ and [the old man]3135-the old man wheeled away up [the meadow]3136-the meadow , as [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge shouted after [him]3135-the old man , — ‘[530-colonel] Oh , [he]0-i ’ll make [a fine rider]531-a fine rider — in time ! ’ ‘[0-i] In time ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot could have knocked [the unsuspecting colonel]3137-the unsuspecting colonel down for the word . It just expressed the contrast , which had fretted [him]172-lancelot ever since [he]172-lancelot began to hunt with [the Whitford Priors]144-whitford priors hounds . [The colonel]504-the colonel ’s long practice and consummate skill in all [he]172-lancelot took in hand,—his experience of [all society]3139-all society , from [the prairie Indian]3140-the prairie indian to [Crockford]8-crockford ’s , from the prize - ring to the continental courts,—his varied and ready store of information and anecdote,—the harmony and completeness of [the man,—his]3141-the man,—his consistency with [his]172-lancelot own small ideal , and [his]172-lancelot consequent apparent superiority everywhere and in everything to the huge awkward Titan - cub , who , though immeasurably beyond [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge in intellect and heart , was still in a state of convulsive dyspepsia , ‘[0-i] swallowing formulæ , ’ and daily well - nigh choked ; diseased throughout with that morbid self - consciousness and lust of praise , for which [God]281-god prepares , with [His]281-god elect , a bitter cure . Alas ! poor [Lancelot]172-lancelot ! an unlicked bear , ‘[0-i] with all [his]0-i sorrows before [him]0-i ! ’ — ‘[136-squire lavington] Come along , ’ quoth [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge , between snatches of a tune , [his]139-bracebridge coolness maddening [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[136-squire lavington] [Old Lavington]136-squire lavington will find [us]532-they dry clothes , a bottle of port , and a brace of [charming daughters]533-charming daughters , at [the Priory]534-the priory . In with [you]535-you , [little Mustang of [the prairie]537-the prairie]536-little mustang of the prairie ! Neck or nothing ! ’ — And in an instant [the small wiry American]3142-the small wiry american , and [the huge Horncastle - bred hunter]3143-the huge horncastle - bred hunter , were wallowing and staggering in [the yeasty stream]3144-the yeasty stream , till [they]532-they floated into a deep reach , and swam steadily down to a low place in the bank . [They]532-they crossed [the stream]526-the stream , passed [the Priory Shrubberies]10-the priory shrubberies , leapt the gate into [the park]3146-the park , and then on and upward , called by [the unseen Ariel]3147-the unseen ariel ’s music before [them.—Up]3148-them.—up , into [the hills]3149-the hills ; past white crumbling chalk - pits , fringed with feathered juniper and tottering ashes , [their]3149-the hills floors strewed with knolls of fallen soil and vegetation , like wooded islets in [a sea of milk.—Up]3150-a sea of milk.—up , between steep ridges of tuft crested with black fir - woods and silver beech , and here and there a huge yew standing out alone , the advanced sentry of [the forest]3151-the forest , with [its]3151-the forest luscious fretwork of green velvet , like a mountain of Gothic spires and pinnacles , all glittering and steaming as the sun drank up the dew - drops . The lark sprang upward into song , and called merrily to [the new - opened sunbeams]3152-the new - opened sunbeams , while the wreaths and flakes of mist lingered reluctantly about the hollows , and clung with dewy fingers to every knoll and belt of pine.—Up into the labyrinthine bosom of the hills,—but who can describe them ? Is not all nature indescribable ? every leaf infinite and transcendental ? How much more those mighty downs , with [their]3149-the hills enormous sheets of spotless turf , where the dizzy eye loses all standard of size and distance before the awful simplicity , the delicate vastness , of those grand curves and swells , soft as the outlines of [a Greek Venus]11-a greek venus , as if [the great goddess]3153-the great goddess - mother [Hertha]3153-the great goddess had laid [herself]3153-the great goddess down among [the hills]3149-the hills to sleep , [her]3153-the great goddess Titan limbs wrapt in a thin veil of silvery green . Up , into [a vast amphitheatre of sward , whose walls banked out the narrow sky above]3155-a vast amphitheatre of sward , whose walls banked out the narrow sky above . And here , in the focus of the huge ring , an object appeared which stirred strange melancholy in [Lancelot,—a little chapel]3156-lancelot,—a little chapel , ivy - grown , girded with a few yews , and elders , and grassy graves . A climbing rose over [the porch]3157-the porch , and iron railings round [the churchyard]3158-the churchyard , told of human care ; and from [the graveyard]3159-the graveyard itself burst up one of those noble springs known as winter - bournes in [the chalk ranges]3160-the chalk ranges , which , awakened in autumn from [the abysses to which it had shrunk during the summer ’s drought]3161-the abysses to which it had shrunk during the summer ’s drought , was hurrying down upon [its]3156-lancelot,—a little chapel six months ’[136-squire lavington] course , a broad sheet of oily silver over a temporary channel of smooth greensward . The hounds had checked in [the woods]538-the woods behind ; now [they]539-they poured down [the hillside]540-the hillside , so close together ‘ that [you]3162-you might have covered them with a sheet , ’[539-they] straight for [the little chapel]541-the little chapel . A saddened tone of feeling spread itself through [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s heart . There were [the everlasting hills around]542-the everlasting hills around , even as [they]542-the everlasting hills around had grown and grown for countless ages , beneath the still depths of [the primeval chalk ocean]543-the primeval chalk ocean , in [the milky youth of [this great English land]545-this great english land]544-the milky youth of this great english land . And here was [he]172-lancelot , the insect of a day , fox - hunting upon [them]542-the everlasting hills around ! [He]172-lancelot felt ashamed , and more ashamed when the inner voice whispered—‘Fox - hunting is not the shame — [thou]546-thou art the shame . If [thou]546-thou art [the insect of a day]547-the insect of a day , it is [thy]546-thou sin that [thou]546-thou art one . ’ And [his]172-lancelot sadness , foolish as it may seem , grew as [he]172-lancelot watched a brown speck fleet rapidly up [the opposite hill]3163-the opposite hill , and heard a gay view - halloo burst from the colonel at [his]172-lancelot side . The chase lost its charm for [him]172-lancelot the moment the game was seen . Then vanished that mysterious delight of pursuing an invisible object , which gives to hunting and fishing [their]542-the everlasting hills around unutterable and almost spiritual charm ; which made [Shakespeare]146-shakespeare [a nightly poacher]3164-a nightly poacher ; [Davy]147-davy and [Chantrey]148-chantrey [the patriarchs of fly - fishing]3165-the patriarchs of fly - fishing ; by which the twelve - foot rod is transfigured into an enchanter ’s wand , potent over the unseen wonders of [the water - world]3166-the water - world , to ‘[546-thou] call up spirits from [the vasty deep]548-the vasty deep , ’ which will really ‘[546-thou] come if [you]549-you do call for them’—at least if the conjuration be orthodox — and [they]550-they there . That spell was broken by the sight of poor wearied pug , [his]551-his once gracefully - floating brush all draggled and drooping , as [he]551-his toiled up the sheep - paths towards the open down above . But [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s sadness reached its crisis , as [he]172-lancelot met the hounds just outside [the churchyard]3158-the churchyard . Another moment — [they]553-they had leaped the rails ; and there [they]553-they swept round under the gray wall , leaping and yelling , like [Berserk fiends among the frowning tombstones]554-berserk fiends among the frowning tombstones , over the cradles of the quiet dead . [Lancelot]172-lancelot shuddered — the thing was not wrong—‘it was [no one]555-no one ’s fault,’—but there was a ghastly discord in it . Peace and strife , time and eternity — the mad noisy flesh , and [the silent immortal spirit,—the frivolous game of life]556-the silent immortal spirit,—the frivolous game of life ’s outside show , and the terrible earnest of its inward abysses , jarred together without and within [him]172-lancelot . [He]172-lancelot pulled [his]172-lancelot horse up violently , and stood as if rooted to the place , gazing at [he]172-lancelot knew not what . The hounds caught sight of the fox , burst into one frantic shriek of joy — and then a sudden and ghastly stillness , as , mute and breathless , [they]553-they toiled up [the hillside]540-the hillside , gaining on [their]553-they victim at every stride . The patter of the horsehoofs and the rattle of rolling flints died away above . [Lancelot]172-lancelot looked up , startled at the silence ; laughed aloud , [he]172-lancelot knew not why , and sat , regardless of [his]172-lancelot pawing and straining horse , still staring at [the chapel]558-the chapel and [the graves]559-the graves . On a sudden the [chapel]560-chapel - door opened , and a figure , timidly yet loftily stepped out without observing [him]172-lancelot , and suddenly turning round , met [him]172-lancelot full , face to face , and stood fixed with surprise as completely as [Lancelot]172-lancelot [himself]172-lancelot . That face and figure , and the spirit which spoke through [them]561-them , entered [his]172-lancelot heart at once , never again to leave it . [Her]562-her features were aquiline and grand , without a shade of harshness ; [her]562-her eyes shone out like twain lakes of still azure , beneath a broad marble cliff of polished forehead ; [her]562-her rich chestnut hair rippled downward round the towering neck . With [her]562-her perfect masque and queenly figure , and earnest , upward gaze , [she]562-her might have been the very model from which [Raphael]149-raphael conceived [his]149-raphael glorious St. Catherine — the ideal of the highest womanly genius , softened into self - forgetfulness by girlish devotion . [She]562-her was simply , almost coarsely dressed ; but a glance told [him]172-lancelot that [she]562-her was [a lady]563-a lady , by the courtesy of [man]564-man as well as by the will of [God]281-god . [They]561-them gazed one moment more at [each other]565-each other — but what is time to spirits ? With [them]561-them , as with [[their]561-them Father]566-their father , ‘ one day is as a thousand years . ’[566-their father] But that eye - wedlock was cut short the next instant by the decided interference of the horse , who , thoroughly disgusted at [[his]172-lancelot master]567-his master ’s whole conduct , gave a significant shake of [his]172-lancelot head , and shamming frightened ( as [both women]568-both women and horses will do when only cross ) , commenced a war - dance , which drove [Argemone Lavington]150-argemone into [the porch]3157-the porch , and gave [the bewildered Lancelot]172-lancelot an excuse for dashing madly up [the hill]570-the hill after [[his]172-lancelot companions]571-his companions . ‘ What a horrible ugly face ! ’[150-argemone] said [Argemone]150-argemone to [herself]150-argemone , ‘ but so clever , and so unhappy ! ’[150-argemone] Blest pity ! [true mother of [that graceless scamp]573-that graceless scamp]572-true mother of that graceless scamp , [young Love , who is ashamed of [his]573-that graceless scamp real pedigree , and swears to this day that [he]573-that graceless scamp is [the child of [Venus!—the coxcomb]151-venus!—the coxcomb]575-the child of venus!—the coxcomb]574-young love , who is ashamed of his real pedigree , and swears to this day that he is the child of venus!—the coxcomb ! * * * * * [ Here , for the sake of [the reader]576-the reader , [we]577-we omit , or rather postpone a long dissertation on the famous Erototheogonic chorus of [Aristophanes]152-aristophanes ’s Birds , with illustrations taken from all earth and heaven , from the Vedas and Proclus to [Jacob Boëhmen]153-jacob boëhmen and [Saint Theresa]154-saint theresa . ] ‘ The dichotomy of [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s personality , ’[172-lancelot] as [the Germans]578-the germans would call it , returned as [he]172-lancelot dashed on . [His]172-lancelot understanding was trying to ride , while [his]172-lancelot spirit was left behind with [Argemone]150-argemone . Hence loose reins and a looser seat . [He]172-lancelot rolled about like [a tipsy man]579-a tipsy man , holding on , in fact , far more by [his]172-lancelot spurs than by [his]172-lancelot knees , to the utter infuriation of [Shiver]135-shiver - the - timbers , who kicked and snorted over the down like one of Mephistopheles ’s Demon - steeds . [They]580-them had mounted [the hill]570-the hill — the deer fled before [them]580-them in terror — [they]580-them neared [the park palings]582-the park palings . In [the road beyond [them]580-them]583-the road beyond them the hounds were just killing [their]580-them fox , struggling and growling in fierce groups for the red gobbets of fur , a panting , steaming ring of horses round [them]580-them . [Half a dozen voices]584-half a dozen voices hailed [him]172-lancelot as [he]172-lancelot came up . ‘ Where have [you]172-lancelot been ? ’[584-half a dozen voices] ‘ [He]172-lancelot ’ll tumble off ! ’[584-half a dozen voices] ‘ [He]172-lancelot ’s had a fall ! ’[584-half a dozen voices] ‘ No [he]172-lancelot has n’t ! ’[584-half a dozen voices] ‘ ’[584-half a dozen voices] Ware hounds , [man]564-man alive ! ’ ‘[584-half a dozen voices] [He]172-lancelot ’ll break [his]172-lancelot neck ! ’ ‘[172-lancelot] [He]172-lancelot has broken it , at last ! ’ shouted [the colonel]504-the colonel , as [Shiver - the - timbers]3168-shiver - the - timbers rushed at [the high pales]3169-the high pales , out of breath , and blind with rage . [Lancelot]172-lancelot saw and heard nothing till [he]172-lancelot was awakened from [his]172-lancelot dream by the long heave of the huge brute ’s shoulder , and the maddening sensation of sweeping through the air over the fence . [He]172-lancelot started , checked [the curb]3170-the curb , the horse threw up [his]172-lancelot head , fulfilling [his]172-lancelot name by driving [his]172-lancelot knees like a battering - ram against the pales — the top - bar bent like a withe , flew out into a hundred splinters , and [man]564-man and horse rolled over headlong into [the hard flint - road]3172-the hard flint - road . For one long sickening second [Lancelot]172-lancelot watched the blue sky between [his]172-lancelot own knees . Then a crash as if a shell had burst in [his]172-lancelot face — a horrible grind — a sheet of flame — and the blackness of night . Did [you]3173-you ever feel it , [reader]3174-reader ? When [he]172-lancelot awoke , [he]172-lancelot found [himself]172-lancelot lying in bed , with [Squire Lavington]136-squire lavington sitting by [him]172-lancelot . There was real sorrow in [the old man]3135-the old man ’s face , ‘[586-himself] Come to [himself]586-himself ! ’ and a great joyful oath rolled out . ‘[586-himself] [The boldest rider of them all]587-the boldest rider of them all ! [I]0-i would n’t have lost [him]586-himself for a dozen ready - made spick and span [Colonel Bracebridges]155-colonel bracebridges ! ’ ‘[588-squire] Quite right , [squire]588-squire ! ’ answered [a laughing voice from behind the curtain]3176-a laughing voice from behind the curtain . ‘[137-mr. smith] [Smith]137-mr. smith has a clear two thousand a year , and [I]0-i live by [my]0-i wits ! ’ [I]0-i heard a story the other day of [[our]3177-our most earnest and genial humorist , who is just now proving [himself]3178-our most earnest and genial humorist , who is just now proving himself also our most earnest and genial novelist also [our]3177-our most earnest and genial novelist]3178-our most earnest and genial humorist , who is just now proving himself also our most earnest and genial novelist . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i like [your]589-your novel exceedingly , ’ said [a lady]563-a lady ; ‘[0-i] [the characters]590-the characters are so natural — all but [the baronet]591-the baronet , and [he]591-the baronet surely is overdrawn : it is impossible to find such coarseness in [his]591-the baronet rank of life ! ’ [The artist]3180-the artist laughed . ‘[591-the baronet] And that character , ’ said [he]3180-the artist , ‘[591-the baronet] is almost the only exact portrait in the whole book . ’ So it is . [People]3181-people do not see the strange things which pass [them]3181-people every day . ‘[591-the baronet] The romance of real life ’ is only one to the romantic spirit . And then [they]3181-people set up for [critics]3182-critics , instead of [pupils]3183-pupils ; as if [the artist]3180-the artist ’s business was not just to see what [they]3181-people can not see — to open [their]3181-people eyes to the harmonies and the discords , the miracles and the absurdities , which seem to [them]3181-people one uniform gray fog of commonplaces . Then let [the reader]576-the reader believe , that whatsoever is commonplace in [my]591-the baronet story is [my]591-the baronet own invention . Whatsoever may seem extravagant or startling is most likely to be historic fact , else [I]591-the baronet should not have dared to write it down , finding [God]281-god ’s actual dealings here much too wonderful to dare to invent many fresh ones for [myself]591-the baronet . [Lancelot]172-lancelot , who had had [a severe concussion of the brain and a broken leg]3186-a severe concussion of the brain and a broken leg , kept [his]172-lancelot bed for a few weeks , and [[his]172-lancelot room]3187-his room for a few more . [Colonel Bracebridge]139-bracebridge installed [himself]139-bracebridge at [the Priory]534-the priory , and nursed [him]172-lancelot with indefatigable good - humour and few thanks . [He]139-bracebridge brought [Lancelot]172-lancelot [his]172-lancelot breakfast before hunting , described the run to [him]172-lancelot when [he]172-lancelot returned , read [him]172-lancelot to sleep , told [him]172-lancelot stories of grizzly bear and buffalo - hunts , made [him]172-lancelot laugh in spite of [himself]172-lancelot at extempore comic medleys , kept [his]172-lancelot tables covered with flowers from [the conservatory]3189-the conservatory , warmed [his]172-lancelot chocolate , and even [his]172-lancelot bed . Nothing came amiss to [him]172-lancelot , and [he]172-lancelot to nothing . [Lancelot]172-lancelot longed at first every hour to be rid of [him]172-lancelot , and eyed [him]172-lancelot about [the room]3190-the room as a bulldog does the monkey who rides [him]172-lancelot . In [his]172-lancelot dreams [he]172-lancelot was [Sinbad the Sailor]156-sinbad the sailor , and [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge [the Old Man of [the Sea]12-the sea]3191-the old man of the sea ; but [he]172-lancelot could not hold out against [the colonel]504-the colonel ’s merry bustling kindliness , and the almost womanish tenderness of [his]504-the colonel nursing . The ice thawed rapidly ; and one evening it split up altogether , when [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge , who was sitting drawing by [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s sofa , instead of amusing [himself]139-bracebridge with [the ladies below]3193-the ladies below , suddenly threw [his]139-bracebridge pencil into the fire , and broke out , à propos de rien — ‘[591-the baronet] What [a strange pair]592-a strange pair [we]593-we are , [Smith]137-mr. smith ! [I]0-i think [you]137-mr. smith just [the best fellow [I]0-i ever met]594-the best fellow i ever met , and [you]137-mr. smith hate [me]0-i like poison — [you]137-mr. smith ca n’t deny it . ’ There was something in [the colonel]504-the colonel ’s tone so utterly different from [his]504-the colonel usual courtly and measured speech , that [Lancelot]172-lancelot was taken completely by surprise , and stammered out , — ‘[0-i] [I]0-i — [I]0-i — [I]0-i — no — no . [I]0-i know [I]0-i am very foolish — ungrateful . But [I]0-i do hate [you]137-mr. smith , ’ [he]0-i said , with a sudden impulse , ‘[0-i] and [I]0-i ’ll tell [you]137-mr. smith why . ’ ‘[0-i] Give [me]0-i [your]137-mr. smith hand , ’ quoth [the colonel]504-the colonel : ‘[0-i] [I]0-i like that . Now [we]595-we shall see [our]595-we way with [each other]565-each other , at least . ’ ‘[0-i] Because , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot slowly , ‘[137-mr. smith] because [you]137-mr. smith are cleverer than [I]0-i , readier than [I]0-i , superior to [me]0-i in every point . ’ [The colonel]504-the colonel laughed , not quite merrily . [Lancelot]172-lancelot went on , holding down [his]172-lancelot shaggy brows . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am [a brute]597-a brute and [an ass!—And yet]598-an ass!—and yet [I]0-i do not like to tell [you]137-mr. smith so . For if [I]0-i am [an ass]599-an ass , what are [you]137-mr. smith ? ’ ‘[137-mr. smith] Heyday ! ’ ‘[137-mr. smith] Look here.—I am wasting [my]0-i time and brains on ribaldry , but [I]0-i am worth nothing better — at least , [I]0-i think so at times ; but [you]137-mr. smith , who can do anything [you]137-mr. smith put [your]137-mr. smith hand to , what business have [you]137-mr. smith , in [the devil]600-the devil ’s name , to be throwing [yourself]137-mr. smith away on [gimcracks and fox - hunting foolery]601-gimcracks and fox - hunting foolery ? Heavens ! If [I]0-i had [your]137-mr. smith talents , [I]0-i ’d be — [I’d]0-i make a name for [myself]0-i before [I]0-i died , if [I]0-i died to make it . ’ [The colonel]504-the colonel griped [his]504-the colonel hand hard , rose , and looked out of the window for a few minutes . There was a dead , brooding silence , till [he]0-i turned to [Lancelot]172-lancelot , — ‘[137-mr. smith] [Mr. Smith]137-mr. smith , [I]0-i thank [you]137-mr. smith for [your]137-mr. smith honesty , but good advice may come too late . [I]0-i am [no saint]602-no saint , and [God]281-god only knows how much less of one [I]0-i may become ; but mark [my]0-i words,—if [you]137-mr. smith are ever tempted by passion , and vanity , and [fine ladies]603-fine ladies , to form liaisons , as [the Jezebels]157-the jezebels call them , snares , and nets , and labyrinths of blind ditches , to keep [you]137-mr. smith down through life , stumbling and grovelling , hating [yourself]137-mr. smith and hating the chain to which [you]137-mr. smith cling — in that hour pray — pray as if [the devil]600-the devil had [you]137-mr. smith by the throat,—to Almighty God , to help [you]137-mr. smith out of that cursed slough ! There is nothing else for it!—pray , [I]0-i tell [you]137-mr. smith ! ’ There was a terrible earnestness about [the guardsman]3198-the guardsman ’s face which could not be mistaken . [Lancelot]172-lancelot looked at [him]3198-the guardsman for a moment , and then dropped [his]172-lancelot eyes ashamed , as if [he]172-lancelot had intruded on [the speaker]3199-the speaker ’s confidence by witnessing [his]172-lancelot emotion . In a moment [the colonel]504-the colonel had returned to [his]504-the colonel smile and [his]504-the colonel polish . ‘[0-i] And now , [[my]0-i dear invalid]605-my dear invalid , [I]0-i must beg [your]137-mr. smith pardon for sermonising . What do [you]137-mr. smith say to a game of écarté ? [We]606-we must play for love , or [we]606-we shall excite [ourselves]606-we , and scandalise [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington ’s piety . ’ And [the colonel]504-the colonel pulled a pack of cards out of [his]504-the colonel pocket , and seeing that [Lancelot]172-lancelot was too thoughtful for play , commenced all manner of [juggler]3202-juggler ’s tricks , and chuckled over [them]3203-them like [any schoolboy]3204-any schoolboy . ‘[607-happy man] [Happy man]607-happy man ! ’ thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[607-happy man] to have the strength of will which can thrust its thoughts away once and for all . ’ No , [Lancelot]172-lancelot ! more happy are [they]3205-they whom [God]281-god will not allow to thrust [their]3205-they thoughts from [them]3205-they till the bitter draught has done its work . From that day , however , there was a cordial understanding between [the two]3206-the two . [They]3206-the two never alluded to the subject ; but [they]3206-the two had known the bottom of each other ’s heart . [[Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s sick - room]3207-lancelot ’s sick - room was now pleasant enough , and [he]172-lancelot drank in daily [[his]172-lancelot new friend]3208-his new friend ’s perpetual stream of anecdote , till March and hunting were past , and [April]159-april was half over . [The old squire]529-the old squire came up after dinner regularly ( during March [he]529-the old squire had hunted every day , and slept every evening ) ; and [the trio]3210-the trio chatted along merrily enough , by the help of whist and backgammon , upon the surface of [this little island of life,—which]3211-this little island of life,—which is , like [Sinbad]156-sinbad the sailor ’s , after all only the back of a floating whale , ready to dive at any moment.—And then ? — But what was [Argemone]150-argemone doing all this time ? [Argemone]150-argemone was busy in [her]150-argemone boudoir ( too often a true boudoir to [her]150-argemone ) among books and statuettes , and dried flowers , fancying [herself]150-argemone , and not unfairly , very intellectual . [She]150-argemone had four new manias every year ; [her]150-argemone last winter ’s one had been that bottle - and - squirt mania , miscalled chemistry ; [her]150-argemone spring madness was for the Greek drama . [She]150-argemone had devoured [Schlegel]160-schlegel ’s lectures , and thought them divine ; and now [she]150-argemone was hard at work on [Sophocles]161-sophocles , with a little help from translations , and thought [she]150-argemone understood [him]161-sophocles every word . Then [she]150-argemone was somewhat High - Church in [[her]150-argemone notions]3212-her notions , and used to go up every Wednesday and Friday to [the chapel in [the hills]3149-the hills]3213-the chapel in the hills , where [Lancelot]172-lancelot had met [her]150-argemone , for an hour ’s mystic devotion , set off by a little graceful asceticism . As for [Lancelot]172-lancelot , [she]150-argemone never thought of [him]172-lancelot but as [an empty - headed fox - hunter who had met with [[his]172-lancelot deserts]3216-his deserts]3215-an empty - headed fox - hunter who had met with his deserts ; and the brilliant accounts which [the all smoothing colonel]3217-the all smoothing colonel gave at dinner of [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s physical well doing and agreeable conversation only made [her]150-argemone set [him]172-lancelot down the sooner as [a twin clever - do - nothing to the despised [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge , whom [she]150-argemone hated for keeping [[her]150-argemone father]3219-her father in a roar of laughter]3218-a twin clever - do - nothing to the despised bracebridge , whom she hated for keeping her father in a roar of laughter . But [[her]150-argemone sister]3220-her sister , [little Honoria]162-honoria , had all the while been busy messing and cooking with [her]3220-her sister own hands for [the invalid]3221-the invalid ; and almost fell in love with [the colonel]504-the colonel for [his]504-the colonel watchful kindness . And here a word about [Honoria]162-honoria , to whom [Nature]132-nature , according to [her]132-nature wo nt with [sisters]3223-sisters , had given almost everything which [Argemone]150-argemone wanted , and denied almost everything which [Argemone]150-argemone had , except beauty . And even in that , [the many - sided mother]3224-the many - sided mother had made [her]3224-the many - sided mother a perfect contrast to [her]150-argemone sister,—tiny and luscious , dark - eyed and dark - haired ; as full of wild simple passion as [an Italian]3225-an italian , thinking little , except where [she]3224-the many - sided mother felt much — which was , indeed , everywhere ; for [she]3224-the many - sided mother lived in a perpetual April - shower of exaggerated sympathy for all suffering , whether in novels or in life ; and daily gave the lie to [that shallow old calumny]3226-that shallow old calumny , that ‘[137-mr. smith] fictitious sorrows harden the heart to real ones . ’ [Argemone]150-argemone was almost angry with [her]3224-the many - sided mother sometimes , when [she]3224-the many - sided mother trotted whole days about [the village]3227-the village from [school]3228-school to [sick - room]3229-sick - room : perhaps conscience hinted to [her]3224-the many - sided mother that [her]3224-the many - sided mother duty , too , lay rather there than among [her]3224-the many - sided mother luxurious day - dreams . But , alas ! though [she]3224-the many - sided mother would have indignantly repelled the accusation of selfishness , yet in self and for self alone [she]3224-the many - sided mother lived ; and while [she]3224-the many - sided mother had force of will for any so - called ‘[137-mr. smith] self - denial , ’ and would fast [herself]3224-the many - sided mother cross and stupefied , and quite enjoy kneeling thinly clad and barefoot on the freezing chapel - floor on a winter ’s morning , yet [her]3224-the many - sided mother fastidious delicacy revolted at sitting , like [Honoria]162-honoria , beside the bed of [[the ploughman]3230-the ploughman ’s consumptive daughter]3231-the ploughman ’s consumptive daughter , in a reeking , stifling , lean - to garret , in which had slept the night before , [the father]3232-the father , [mother]3233-mother , and [two grown - up boys]3234-two grown - up boys , not to mention [a new - married couple]3235-a new - married couple , [the sick girl]3236-the sick girl , and , alas ! [[her]162-honoria baby]3237-her baby . And of such bedchambers there were too many in [Whitford Priors]144-whitford priors . The first evening that [Lancelot]172-lancelot came [downstairs]3238-downstairs , [Honoria]162-honoria clapped [her]162-honoria hands outright for joy as [he]172-lancelot entered , and ran up and down for ten minutes , fetching and carrying endless unnecessary cushions and footstools ; while [Argemone]150-argemone greeted [him]172-lancelot with a cold distant bow , and a fine - lady drawl of carefully commonplace congratulations . [Her]150-argemone heart smote [her]150-argemone though , as [she]150-argemone saw the wan face and the wild , melancholy , moonstruck eyes once more glaring through and through [her]150-argemone ; [she]150-argemone found a comfort in thinking [his]172-lancelot stare impertinent , drew [herself]150-argemone up , and turned away ; once , indeed , [she]150-argemone could not help listening , as [Lancelot]172-lancelot thanked [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington for all the pious and edifying books with which [the good lady]3239-the good lady had kept [[his]172-lancelot room]3187-his room rather than [his]172-lancelot brain furnished for the last six weeks ; [he]172-lancelot was going to say more , but [he]172-lancelot saw [the colonel]504-the colonel ’s quaint foxy eye peering at [him]172-lancelot , remembered [St. Francis de Sales]140-st. francis de sales , and held [his]172-lancelot tongue . But , as [her]150-argemone destiny was , [Argemone]150-argemone found [herself]150-argemone , in the course of the evening , alone with [Lancelot]172-lancelot , at the open window . It was a still , hot , heavy night , after long easterly drought ; sheet - lightning glimmered on the far horizon over [the dark woodlands]3242-the dark woodlands ; the coming shower had sent forward as [his]172-lancelot herald a whispering draught of fragrant air . ‘[137-mr. smith] What a delicious shiver is creeping over those limes ! ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , half to [himself]172-lancelot . The expression struck [Argemone]150-argemone : it was the right one , and it seemed to open vistas of feeling and observation in the speaker which [she]150-argemone had not suspected . There was a rich melancholy in the voice;—she turned to look at [him]172-lancelot . ‘[609-the giver] Ay , ’ [he]172-lancelot went on ; ‘[609-the giver] and the same heat which crisps those thirsty leaves must breed the thunder - shower which cools them ? But so it is throughout [the universe]3109-the universe : every yearning proves the existence of an object meant to satisfy it ; the same law creates both [the giver]609-the giver and [the receiver]610-the receiver , the longing and its home . ’ ‘[610-the receiver] If one could but know sometimes what it is for which one is longing ! ’ said [Argemone]150-argemone , without knowing that [she]150-argemone was speaking from [her]150-argemone inmost heart : but thus does the soul involuntarily lay bare its most unspoken depths in the presence of [its yet unknown mate]3243-its yet unknown mate , and then shudders at its own abandon as it first tries on the wedding garment of [Paradise]14-paradise . [Lancelot]172-lancelot was not yet past the era at which [young geniuses]3244-young geniuses are apt to ‘[610-the receiver] talk book ’ at little . ‘[610-the receiver] For what ? ’ [he]172-lancelot answered , flashing up according to [his]172-lancelot fashion . ‘[610-the receiver] To be;—to be great ; to have done one mighty work before [we]611-we die , and live , unloved or loved , upon the lips of [men]612-men . For this all long who are not mere apes and wall - flies . ’ ‘[613-the founders of babel] So longed [the founders of [Babel]15-babel]613-the founders of babel , ’ answered [Argemone]150-argemone , carelessly , to this tirade . [She]150-argemone had risen a strange fish , [the cunning beauty]3245-the cunning beauty , and now [she]150-argemone was trying [her]150-argemone fancy flies over [him]172-lancelot one by one . ‘[613-the founders of babel] And were [they]613-the founders of babel so far wrong ? ’ answered [he]172-lancelot . ‘[613-the founders of babel] From [the Babel society]614-the babel society sprung [our]611-we architecture , [our]611-we astronomy , politics , and colonisation . No doubt [the old Hebrew sheiks]615-the old hebrew sheiks thought [them]613-the founders of babel impious enough , for daring to build brick walls instead of keeping to the good old - fashioned tents , and gathering [themselves]615-the old hebrew sheiks into [a nation]616-a nation instead of remaining [a mere family horde]617-a mere family horde ; and gave [their]615-the old hebrew sheiks own account of the myth , just as [the antediluvian savages]618-the antediluvian savages gave [theirs]618-the antediluvian savages of that strange Eden scene , by the common interpretation of which [the devil]600-the devil is made [the first inventor of modesty]620-the first inventor of modesty . [Men]612-men are all conservatives ; everything new is impious , till [we]611-we get accustomed to it ; and if it fails , [the mob]622-the mob piously discover a divine vengeance in the mischance , from [Babel]15-babel to Catholic Emancipation . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot had stuttered horribly during the latter part of this most heterodox outburst , for [he]172-lancelot had begun to think about [himself]172-lancelot , and try to say a fine thing , suspecting all the while that it might not be true . But [Argemone]150-argemone did not remark the stammering : the new thoughts startled and pained [her]150-argemone ; but there was a daring grace about them . [She]150-argemone tried , as [women]3246-women will , to answer [him]172-lancelot with arguments , and failed , as [women]3246-women will fail . [She]150-argemone was accustomed to lay down the law à [la Madame de Staël]3248-la madame de staël , to [savants]3249-savants and [non - savants]3250-non - savants and be heard with reverence , as [a woman]3251-a woman should be . But poor truth - seeking [Lancelot]172-lancelot did not see what sex had to do with logic ; [he]172-lancelot flew at [her]150-argemone as if [she]150-argemone had been [a very barrister]3252-a very barrister , and hunted [her]150-argemone mercilessly up and down through all sorts of charming sophisms , as [she]150-argemone begged the question , and shifted [her]150-argemone ground , as thoroughly right in [her]150-argemone conclusion as [she]150-argemone was wrong in [her]150-argemone reasoning , till [she]150-argemone grew quite confused and pettish.—And then [Lancelot]172-lancelot suddenly shrank into [his]172-lancelot shell , claws and all , like [an affrighted soldier - crab]3253-an affrighted soldier - crab , hung down [his]172-lancelot head , and stammered out some incoherencies,—‘N - n - not accustomed to talk to [women]3246-women — [ladies]3255-ladies , [I]623-his mean . F - forgot myself.—Pray forgive [me]623-his ! ’[623-his] And [he]623-his looked up , and [her]624-she eyes , half - amused , met [his]623-his , and [she]624-she saw that they were filled with tears . ‘ What have [I]624-she to forgive ? ’[624-she] [she]624-she said , more gently , wondering on what sort of strange sportsman [she]624-she had fallen . ‘ [You]623-his treat [me]624-she like [an equal]3256-an equal ; [you]623-his will deign to argue with [me]624-she . But [men in general]3257-men in general — oh , [they]3257-men in general hide [their]3257-men in general contempt for [us]3258-us , if not [their]3257-men in general own ignorance , under that mask of chivalrous deference ! ’[624-she] and then in the nasal fine ladies ’ key , which was [her]624-she shell , as bitter brusquerie was [his]623-his , [she]624-she added , with [an Amazon queen]3259-an amazon queen ’s toss of the head,—‘You must come and see [us]3258-us often . [We]3258-us shall suit [each other]565-each other , [I]624-she see , better than [most whom [we]3258-us see here]3261-most whom we see here . ’[624-she] A sneer and a blush passed together over [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s ugliness . ‘ What , better than [the glib Colonel Bracebridge yonder]3262-the glib colonel bracebridge yonder ? ’[624-she] ‘ Oh , [he]504-the colonel is witty enough , but [he]504-the colonel lives on the surface of everything ! [He]504-the colonel is altogether shallow and blasé . [His]504-the colonel good - nature is the fruit of want of feeling ; between [his]504-the colonel gracefulness and [his]504-the colonel sneering persiflage [he]504-the colonel is [a perfect Mephistopheles - Apollo]3263-a perfect mephistopheles - apollo . ’[624-she] What a snare a decently - good nickname is ! Out it must come , though it carry a lie on its back . But the truth was , [Argemone]150-argemone thought [herself]150-argemone infinitely superior to [the colonel]504-the colonel , for which simple reason [she]150-argemone could not in the least understand [him]504-the colonel . [ By the bye , how subtly [Mr. Tennyson]163-mr. tennyson has embodied all this in [The Princess]626-the princess . How [he]163-mr. tennyson shows [us]627-us [the woman]628-the woman , when [she]628-the woman takes [her]628-the woman stand on the false masculine ground of intellect , working out [her]628-the woman own moral punishment , by destroying in [herself]628-the woman the tender heart of flesh , which is either [woman]458-woman ’s highest blessing or [her]628-the woman bitterest curse ; how [she]628-the woman loses all feminine sensibility to the under - current of feeling in [[us]627-us poor world - worn , case - hardened men]630-us poor world - worn , case - hardened men , and falls from pride to sternness , from sternness to sheer inhumanity . [I]0-i should have honoured [myself]0-i by pleading guilty to stealing much of [Argemone]150-argemone ’s character from [The Princess]626-the princess , had not the idea been conceived , and fairly worked out , long before the appearance of that noble poem . ] [They]632-they said no more to [each other]565-each other that evening . [Argemone]150-argemone was called to the piano ; and [Lancelot]172-lancelot took up the Sporting Magazine , and read [himself]172-lancelot to sleep till the party separated for the night . [Argemone]150-argemone went up thoughtfully to [[her]150-argemone own room]634-her own room . The shower had fallen , and the moon was shining bright , while every budding leaf and knot of mould steamed up cool perfume , borrowed from the treasures of the thundercloud . All around was working the infinite mystery of birth and growth , of giving and taking , of beauty and use . All things were harmonious — all things reciprocal without . [Argemone]150-argemone felt [herself]150-argemone needless , lonely , and out of tune with [herself]150-argemone and nature . [She]150-argemone sat in the window , and listlessly read over to [herself]150-argemone a fragment of [her]150-argemone own poetry : — SAPPHO [She]150-argemone lay among the myrtles on [the cliff]635-the cliff ; Above [her]150-argemone glared the moon ; beneath , [the sea]636-the sea . Upon [the white horizon [Athos]16-athos ’ peak]3264-the white horizon athos ’ peak Weltered in burning haze ; all airs were dead ; [The sicale]3265-the sicale slept among the tamarisk ’s hair ; The birds sat dumb and drooping . Far below [The lazy sea]3266-the lazy sea - weed glistened in the sun : The lazy sea - fowl dried their steaming wings ; The lazy swell crept whispering up the ledge , And sank again . [Great Pan]164-great pan was laid to rest ; And [mother Earth]3267-mother earth watched by [him]164-great pan as [he]164-great pan slept , And hushed [[her]3267-mother earth myriad children]3268-her myriad children for awhile . [She]150-argemone lay among the myrtles on [the cliff]635-the cliff ; And sighed for sleep , for sleep that would not hear , But left [her]150-argemone tossing still : for night and day A mighty hunger yearned within [her]150-argemone heart , Till all [her]150-argemone veins ran fever , and [her]150-argemone cheek , [Her]150-argemone long thin hands , and ivory - channell’d feet , Were wasted with the wasting of [her]150-argemone soul . Then peevishly [she]150-argemone flung [her]150-argemone on [her]150-argemone face , And hid [her]150-argemone eyeballs from the blinding glare , And fingered at the grass , and tried to cool [Her]150-argemone crisp hot lips against the crisp hot sward : And then [she]150-argemone raised [her]150-argemone head , and upward cast Wild looks from homeless eyes , whose liquid light Gleamed out between deep folds of blue - black hair , As gleam twin lakes between the purple peaks Of [deep Parnassus]17-deep parnassus , at the mournful moon . Beside [her]150-argemone lay a lyre . [She]150-argemone snatched the shell , And waked wild music from its silver strings ; Then tossed it sadly by,—‘Ah , hush ! ’[637-she] [she]637-she cries , ‘ [Dead offspring of the tortoise and [the mine]3271-the mine]3270-dead offspring of the tortoise and the mine ! Why mock [my]637-she discords with thine harmonies ? ‘[637-she] Although a thrice - Olympian lot be thine , Only to echo back in every tone , The moods of nobler natures than thine own . ’ ‘[637-she] No ! ’ [she]637-she said . ‘[637-she] That soft and rounded rhyme suits ill with [Sappho]165-sappho ’s fitful and wayward agonies . [She]165-sappho should burst out at once into wild passionate life - weariness , and disgust at that universe , with whose beauty [she]165-sappho has filled [her]165-sappho eyes in vain , to find it always a dead picture , unsatisfying , unloving — as [I]0-i have found it . ’ Sweet self - deceiver ! had [you]3272-you no other reason for choosing as [[your]3272-you heroine]3273-your heroine [Sappho]165-sappho , [the victim of the idolatry of intellect]3274-the victim of the idolatry of intellect — trying in vain to fill [her]165-sappho heart with the friendship of [her]165-sappho own sex , and then sinking into mere passion for [a handsome boy]3275-a handsome boy , and so down into self - contempt and suicide ? [She]165-sappho was conscious , [I]0-i do believe , of no other reason than that [she]165-sappho gave ; but consciousness is a dim candle — over a deep mine . ‘[0-i] After all , ’ [she]165-sappho said pettishly , ‘[3181-people] [people]3181-people will call it a mere imitation of [Shelley]121-shelley ’s Alastor . And what harm if it is ? Is there to be [no female]639-no female [Alastor]166-alastor ? Has not [the woman]628-the woman as good a right as [the man to long after ideal beauty]641-the man to long after ideal beauty — to pine and die if [she]628-the woman can not find it ; and regenerate [herself]628-the woman in its light ? ’ ‘[642-you] Yo - hoo - oo - oo ! Youp , youp ! Oh - hooo ! ’ arose doleful through the echoing shrubbery . [Argemone]150-argemone started and looked out . It was not a banshee , but a forgotten fox - hound puppy , sitting mournfully on the gravel - walk beneath , staring at the clear ghastly moon . [She]150-argemone laughed and blushed — there was a rebuke in it . [She]150-argemone turned to go to rest ; and as [she]150-argemone knelt and prayed at [[her]150-argemone velvet faldstool]3276-her velvet faldstool , among all the nicknacks which now - a - days make a luxury of devotion , was it strange if , after [she]150-argemone had prayed for the fate of [nations]3277-nations and churches , and for those who , as [she]150-argemone thought , were fighting at [Oxford]18-oxford [the cause of universal truth and reverend antiquity]3278-the cause of universal truth and reverend antiquity , [she]150-argemone remembered in [her]150-argemone petitions [the poor godless youth]3279-the poor godless youth , with [his]3279-the poor godless youth troubled and troubling eloquence ? But it was strange that [she]150-argemone blushed when [she]150-argemone mentioned [his]3279-the poor godless youth name — why should [she]150-argemone not pray for [him]3279-the poor godless youth as [she]150-argemone prayed for [others]3280-others ? Perhaps [she]150-argemone felt that [she]150-argemone did not pray for [him]3279-the poor godless youth as [she]150-argemone prayed for [others]3280-others . [She]150-argemone left the Æolian harp in the window , as a luxury if [she]150-argemone should wake , and coiled [herself]150-argemone up among lace pillows and eider blemos ; and the hound coiled [himself]3279-the poor godless youth up on the gravel - walk , after a solemn vesper - ceremony of three turns round in [his]3279-the poor godless youth own length , looking vainly for a ‘[642-you] soft stone . ’ [The finest of [us]3283-us]3282-the finest of us are animals after all , and live by eating and sleeping : and , taken as animals , not so badly off either — unless [we]3283-us happen to be [[Dorsetshire]19-dorsetshire labourers]3284-dorsetshire labourers — or [Spitalfields weavers]3285-spitalfields weavers — or [colliery children]3286-colliery children — or [marching soldiers]3287-marching soldiers — or , [I]642-you am afraid , [one half of [English souls]3289-english souls]3288-one half of english souls this day . And [Argemone]150-argemone dreamed;—that [she]150-argemone was a fox , flying for [her]150-argemone life through [a churchyard]3290-a churchyard — and [Lancelot]172-lancelot was a hound , yelling and leaping , in a red coat and white buckskins , close upon [her]150-argemone — and [she]150-argemone felt [his]172-lancelot hot breath , and saw [his]172-lancelot white teeth glare ... And then [[her]150-argemone father]3219-her father was there : and [he]3219-her father was [an Italian boy]3292-an italian boy , and played the organ — and [Lancelot]172-lancelot was a dancing dog , and stood up and danced to the tune of ‘[642-you] C’est l’amour , l’amour , l’amour , ’ pitifully enough , in [his]172-lancelot red coat — and [she]150-argemone stood up and danced too ; but [she]150-argemone found [her]150-argemone fox - fur dress insufficient , and begged hard for a paper frill — which was denied [her]150-argemone : whereat [she]150-argemone cried bitterly and woke ; and saw the Night peeping in with [her]150-argemone bright diamond eyes , and blushed , and hid [her]150-argemone beautiful face in the pillows , and fell asleep again . What the little imp , who managed this puppet - show on [Argemone]150-argemone ’s brain - stage , may have intended to symbolise thereby , and whence [he]172-lancelot stole [his]172-lancelot actors and stage - properties , and whether [he]172-lancelot got up the interlude for [his]172-lancelot own private fun , or for that of [a choir of [brother Eulenspiegels]3294-brother eulenspiegels]3293-a choir of brother eulenspiegels , or , finally , for the edification of [Argemone]150-argemone as to [her]150-argemone own history , past , present , or future , are questions which [we]3295-we must leave unanswered , till [physicians]3296-physicians have become a little more of [metaphysicians]3297-metaphysicians , and have given up [their]3296-physicians present plan of ignoring for nine hundred and ninety - nine pages that most awful and significant custom of dreaming , and then in the thousandth page talking [the boldest materialist twaddle about it]3298-the boldest materialist twaddle about it . In the meantime , [Lancelot]172-lancelot , contrary to [the colonel]504-the colonel ’s express commands , was sitting up to indite the following letter to [[his]172-lancelot cousin]3300-his cousin , [the Tractarian curate]3301-the tractarian curate : — ‘[642-you] [You]642-you complain that [I]0-i waste [my]0-i time in field - sports : how do [you]642-you know that [I]0-i waste [my]0-i time ? [I]0-i find within [myself]0-i certain appetites ; and [I]0-i suppose that [the God]643-the god whom [you]642-you say made [me]0-i , made those appetites as a part of [me]0-i . Why are they to be crushed any more than any other part of [me]0-i ? [I]0-i am the whole of what [I]0-i find in [myself]0-i — am [I]0-i to pick and choose [myself]0-i out of [myself]0-i ? And besides , [I]0-i feel that the exercise of freedom , activity , foresight , daring , independent self - determination , even in a few minutes ’ burst across [country]3302-country , strengthens [me]0-i in mind as well as in body . It might not do so to [you]642-you ; but [you]642-you are of a different constitution , and , from all [I]0-i see , the power of [a man]445-a man ’s muscles , the excitability of [his]445-a man nerves , the shape and balance of [his]445-a man brain , make [him]445-a man what [he]445-a man is . Else what is the meaning of physiognomy ? [Every man]3304-every man ’s destiny , as [the Turks]167-the turks say , stands written on [his]3304-every man forehead . [One]3305-one does not need two glances at [your]642-you face to know that [you]642-you would not enjoy fox - hunting , that [you]642-you would enjoy book - learning and “ refined repose , ” as [they]167-the turks are pleased to call it . [Every man]3304-every man carries [his]3304-every man character in [his]3304-every man brain . [You]642-you all know that , and act upon it when [you]642-you have to deal with [a man]445-a man for sixpence ; but [your]642-you religious dogmas , which make out that [everyman]3308-everyman comes into [the world]475-the world equally brutish and fiendish , make [you]642-you afraid to confess it . [I]0-i do n’t quarrel with [a “ douce ” man like [you]642-you]3310-a “ douce ” man like you , with a large organ of veneration , for following [your]642-you bent . But if [I]0-i am fiery , with a huge cerebellum , why am [I]0-i not to follow mine?—For that is what [you]642-you do , after all — what [you]642-you like best . It is all very easy for [a man]445-a man to talk of conquering [his]445-a man appetites , when [he]445-a man has none to conquer . Try and conquer [your]642-you organ of veneration , or of benevolence , or of calculation — then [I]0-i will call [you]642-you [an ascetic]3312-an ascetic . Why not!—The same Power which made the front of one ’s head made the back , [I]0-i suppose ? ‘[0-i] And , [I]0-i tell [you]644-you , hunting does [me]0-i good . It awakens [me]0-i out of [my]0-i dreary mill - round of metaphysics . It sweeps away that infernal web of self - consciousness , and absorbs [me]0-i in outward objects ; and [my]0-i red - hot [Perillus]168-perillus ’s bull cools in proportion as [my]0-i horse warms . [I]0-i tell [you]644-you , [I]0-i never saw [a man who could cut out [his]645-a man who could cut out his way across country who could not cut his way through better things when his turn came way across country who could not cut [his]645-a man who could cut out his way across country who could not cut his way through better things when his turn came way through better things when [his]645-a man who could cut out his way across country who could not cut his way through better things when his turn came turn came]645-a man who could cut out his way across country who could not cut his way through better things when his turn came . [The cleverest and noblest fellows]646-the cleverest and noblest fellows are sure to be [the best riders in the long run]647-the best riders in the long run . And as for bad company and “ [the world]475-the world , ” when [you]644-you take to going in [the first - class carriages]649-the first - class carriages for fear of meeting [a swearing sailor]650-a swearing sailor in [the second - class]651-the second - class — when [those who have “ renounced the world ”]652-those who have “ renounced the world ” give up buying and selling in the funds — when [[my]0-i uncle]653-my uncle , [the pious banker , who will only “ associate ” with [the truly religious]655-the truly religious , gives up dealing with any scoundrel or heathen who can “ do business ” with [him]653-my uncle]654-the pious banker , who will only “ associate ” with the truly religious , gives up dealing with any scoundrel or heathen who can “ do business ” with him — then [you]644-you may quote [pious people]656-pious people ’s opinions to [me]0-i . In [God]281-god ’s name , if the Stock Exchange , and railway stagging , and the advertisements in the Protestant Hue - and - Cry , and the frantic Mammon - hunting which has been for the last fifty years the peculiar pursuit of [the majority of [Quakers]658-quakers]657-the majority of quakers , [Dissenters]659-dissenters , and [Religious Churchmen]660-religious churchmen , are not [The World]20-the world , what is ? [I]0-i do n’t complain of [them]656-pious people , though ; [Puritanism]169-puritanism has interdicted to [them]656-pious people all art , all excitement , all amusement — except money - making . It is [their]656-pious people dernier ressort , [poor souls]661-poor souls ! ‘ But [you]644-you must explain to [us]3313-we [naughty fox - hunters]3314-naughty fox - hunters how all this agrees with the good book . [We]3313-we see plainly enough , in the meantime , how it agrees with “ poor human nature . ” [We]3313-we see that [the “ religious world]3315-the “ religious world , ” like [the “ great world]3316-the “ great world , ” and [the “ sporting world]3317-the “ sporting world , ” and [the “ literary world]3318-the “ literary world , ” “ Compounds for sins [she]3319-she is inclined to , By damning those [she]3319-she has no mind to ; ” and that because [England]3-england is [a money - making country]3320-a money - making country , and money - making is an effeminate pursuit , therefore all sedentary and spoony sins , like covetousness , slander , bigotry , and self - conceit , are to be cockered and plastered over , while the more masculine vices , and no - vices also , are mercilessly hunted down by [[your]663-you cold - blooded , soft - handed religionists]3321-your cold - blooded , soft - handed religionists . ‘[661-poor souls] This is a more quiet letter than usual from [me]0-i , [[my]0-i dear coz]662-my dear coz , for many of [your]663-you reproofs cut [me]0-i [home]452-home : [they]665-they angered [me]0-i at the time ; but [I]0-i deserve [them]665-they .
