[I]0-i am miserable , self - disgusted , self - helpless , craving for freedom , and yet crying aloud for [some one]666-some one to come and guide [me]0-i , and teach [me]0-i ; and who is there in these days who could teach [a fast man]667-a fast man , even if [he]667-a fast man would try ? Be sure , that as long as [you]663-you and [yours]663-you make piety a synonym for unmanliness , [you]663-you will never convert either [me]0-i or [any other good sportsman]668-any other good sportsman . ‘ By the bye , [[my]663-you dear fellow]3322-my dear fellow , was [I]663-you asleep or awake when [I]663-you seemed to read in the postscript of [your]663-you last letter , something about “ being driven to [Rome]21-rome after all ” ? ... Why thither , of [all places in [heaven or earth]3324-heaven or earth]3323-all places in heaven or earth ? [You]663-you know , [I]663-you have no party interest in the question . [All creeds]3325-all creeds are very much alike to [me]663-you just now . But allow [me]663-you to ask , in a spirit of the most tolerant curiosity , what possible celestial bait , either of the useful or the agreeable kind , can [the present excellent Pope]3326-the present excellent pope , or [[his]3326-the present excellent pope adherents]3327-his adherents , hold out to [you]663-you in compensation for the solid earthly pudding which [you]663-you would have to desert ? ... [I]663-you daresay , though , that [I]663-you shall not comprehend [your]663-you answer when it comes . [I]663-you am , [you]663-you know , utterly deficient in that sixth sense of the angelic or supralunar beautiful , which fills [your]663-you soul with ecstasy . [You]663-you , [I]663-you know , expect and long to become [an angel after death]3328-an angel after death : [I]663-you am under the strange hallucination that [my]663-you body is part of [me]663-you , and in spite of [old Plotinus]170-old plotinus , look with horror at a disembodiment till the giving of that new body , the great perfection of which , in [your]663-you eyes , and those of [every one else]3329-every one else , seems to be , that it will be less , and not more of a body , than [our]3330-our present one ... Is this hope , to [me]663-you at once inconceivable and contradictory , palpable and valuable enough to [you]663-you to send [you]663-you to [that Italian Avernus]3331-that italian avernus , to get it made a little more certain ? If so , [I]663-you despair of [your]663-you making [your]663-you meaning intelligible to [a poor fellow wallowing , like [me]663-you , in the Hylic Borboros]3332-a poor fellow wallowing , like me , in the hylic borboros — or whatever else [you]663-you may choose to call the unfortunate fact of being flesh and blood ... Still , write . ’[663-you] When [Argemone]150-argemone rose in the morning , [her]150-argemone first thought was of [Lancelot]172-lancelot . [His]172-lancelot face haunted [her]150-argemone . The wild brilliance of [his]172-lancelot intellect struggling through foul smoke - clouds , had haunted [her]150-argemone still more . [She]150-argemone had heard of [his]172-lancelot profligacy , [his]172-lancelot bursts of fierce Berserk - madness ; and yet now these very faults , instead of repelling , seemed to attract [her]150-argemone , and intensify [her]150-argemone longing to save [him]172-lancelot . [She]150-argemone would convert [him]172-lancelot ; purify [him]172-lancelot ; harmonise [his]172-lancelot discords . And that very wish gave [her]150-argemone a peace [she]150-argemone had never felt before . [She]150-argemone had formed [her]150-argemone idea ; [she]150-argemone had now a purpose for which to live , and [she]150-argemone determined to concentrate [herself]150-argemone for the work , and longed for the moment when [she]150-argemone should meet [Lancelot]172-lancelot , and begin — how , [she]150-argemone did not very clearly see . It is an old jest — [the fair devotee]669-the fair devotee trying to convert [the young rake]670-the young rake . [Men of [the world]475-the world]671-men of the world laugh heartily at it ; and so does [the devil]600-the devil , no doubt . If [any readers]674-any readers wish to be [fellow - jesters with that personage]675-fellow - jesters with that personage , [they]674-any readers may ; but , as sure as [old Saxon women]676-old saxon women - worship remains for ever a blessed and healing law of life , [the devotee]677-the devotee may yet convert [the rake]678-the rake — and , perhaps , [herself]677-the devotee into the bargain . [Argemone]150-argemone looked almost angrily round at [her]150-argemone beloved books and drawings ; for they spoke a message to [her]150-argemone which [they]679-they had never spoken before , of self - centred ambition . ‘ Yes , ’[150-argemone] [she]150-argemone said aloud to [herself]150-argemone , ‘ [I]150-argemone have been selfish , utterly ! Art , poetry , science — [I]150-argemone believe , after all , that [I]150-argemone have only loved [them]679-they for [my]150-argemone own sake , not for [theirs]679-they , because [they]679-they would make [me]150-argemone something , feed [my]150-argemone conceit of [my]150-argemone own talents . How infinitely more glorious to find [my]150-argemone work - field and [my]150-argemone prize , not in dead forms and colours , or ink - and - paper theories , but in [a living , immortal , human spirit]3333-a living , immortal , human spirit ! [I]150-argemone will study no more , except the human heart , and only that to purify and ennoble it . ’[150-argemone] True , [Argemone]150-argemone ; and yet , like all resolutions , somewhat less than the truth . That morning , indeed , [her]150-argemone purpose was simple as [God]281-god ’s own light . [She]150-argemone never dreamed of exciting [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s admiration , even [his]172-lancelot friendship for [herself]150-argemone . [She]150-argemone would have started as from a snake , from the issue which [the reader]576-the reader very clearly foresees , that [Lancelot]172-lancelot would fall in love , not with [Young Englandism]171-young englandism , but with [Argemone Lavington]150-argemone . But yet self is not eradicated even from [a woman]3251-a woman ’s heart in one morning before breakfast . Besides , it is not ‘ benevolence , ’[682-the real cupid of flesh and blood] but love — [the real Cupid of flesh and blood]682-the real cupid of flesh and blood , who can first ‘ Touch the chord of self which , trembling , Passes in music out of sight . ’[682-the real cupid of flesh and blood] But a time for all things ; and it is now time for [Argemone]150-argemone to go down to breakfast , having prepared some dozen imaginary dialogues between [herself]150-argemone and [Lancelot]172-lancelot , in which , of course , [her]150-argemone eloquence always had the victory . [She]150-argemone had yet to learn , that it is better sometimes not to settle in one ’s heart what [we]683-we shall speak , for the Everlasting Will has good works ready prepared for [us]683-we to walk in , by what [we]683-we call fortunate accident ; and it shall be given [us]683-we in that day and that hour what [we]683-we shall speak . [Lancelot]172-lancelot , in the meantime , shrank from meeting [Argemone]150-argemone ; and was quite glad of the weakness which kept [him]172-lancelot [upstairs]684-upstairs . Whether [he]172-lancelot was afraid of [her]150-argemone — whether [he]172-lancelot was ashamed of [himself]172-lancelot or of [his]172-lancelot crutches , [I]0-i can not tell , but [I]0-i daresay , [reader]3174-reader , [you]3174-reader are getting tired of all this soul - dissecting . So [we]683-we will have a bit of action again , for the sake of variety , if for nothing better . Of all the species of lovely scenery which [England]3-england holds , none , perhaps , is more exquisite than [the banks of [the chalk - rivers]687-the chalk - rivers]686-the banks of the chalk - rivers — the perfect limpidity of [the water]688-the water , the gay and luxuriant vegetation of the banks and ditches , the masses of noble wood embosoming [the villages]689-the villages , the unique beauty of [the water - meadows]690-the water - meadows , living sheets of emerald and silver , tinkling and sparkling , cool under the fiercest sun , brilliant under the blackest clouds.—There , if anywhere , [one]3305-one would have expected to find [Arcadia]22-arcadia among fertility , loveliness , industry , and wealth . But , alas for the sad reality ! the cool breath of [those glittering water - meadows]692-those glittering water - meadows too often floats laden with poisonous miasma . [Those picturesque villages]693-those picturesque villages are generally [the perennial hotbeds of fever and ague]694-the perennial hotbeds of fever and ague , of squalid penury , sottish profligacy , dull discontent too stale for words . There is luxury in [the park]3146-the park , wealth in [the huge farm - steadings]696-the huge farm - steadings , knowledge in [the parsonage]697-the parsonage : but [the poor]698-the poor ? [those by whose dull labour all that luxury and wealth , ay , even that knowledge]699-those by whose dull labour all that luxury and wealth , ay , even that knowledge , is made possible — what are [they]699-those by whose dull labour all that luxury and wealth , ay , even that knowledge ? [We]683-we shall see , please [God]281-god , ere the story ’s end . But of all this [Lancelot]172-lancelot as yet thought nothing . [He]172-lancelot , too , had to be emancipated , as much as [Argemone]150-argemone , from selfish dreams ; to learn to work trustfully in the living Present , not to gloat sentimentally over the unreturning Past . But [his]172-lancelot time was not yet come ; and little [he]172-lancelot thought of all the work which lay ready for [him]172-lancelot within a mile of [the Priory]534-the priory , as [he]172-lancelot watched [the ladies]701-the ladies go out for the afternoon , and slipped down to [the Nun’s - pool]702-the nun’s - pool on [his]172-lancelot crutches to smoke and fish , and build castles in the air . [The Priory]534-the priory , with [[its]534-the priory rambling courts and [gardens]705-gardens]704-its rambling courts and gardens , stood on [an island]706-an island in [the river]505-the river . [The upper stream]708-the upper stream flowed in a straight artificial channel through [the garden]709-the garden , still and broad , towards [the Priory mill]710-the priory mill ; while just above [the Priory]534-the priory wall half [the river]505-the river fell over [a high weir , with all [its]713-a high weir , with all its appendages of bucks appendages of bucks]713-a high weir , with all its appendages of bucks and hatchways , and eel - baskets , into [the Nun’s - pool]702-the nun’s - pool , and then swept round under the ivied walls , with [their]715-their fantastic turrets and gables , and little loopholed windows , peering out over [the stream]526-the stream , as it hurried down over [the shallows]717-the shallows to join the race below [the mill]718-the mill . A postern door in the walls opened on [an ornamental wooden bridge across [the weir - head]720-the weir - head]719-an ornamental wooden bridge across the weir - head — a favourite haunt of [all fishers and sketchers who were admitted to [the dragon - guarded Elysium of Whitford Priors]722-the dragon - guarded elysium of whitford priors]721-all fishers and sketchers who were admitted to the dragon - guarded elysium of whitford priors . [Thither Lancelot]172-lancelot went , congratulating [himself]172-lancelot , strange to say , in having escaped [the only human being whom [he]172-lancelot loved on [earth]724-earth]723-the only human being whom he loved on earth . [He]172-lancelot found on the weir - bridge [two of [the keepers]726-the keepers]725-two of the keepers . [The younger one]727-the younger one , [Tregarva]173-tregarva , was [a stately , thoughtful - looking Cornishman , some six feet three in height , with thews and sinews in proportion]728-a stately , thoughtful - looking cornishman , some six feet three in height , with thews and sinews in proportion . [He]173-tregarva was sitting on [the bridge]729-the bridge looking over a basket of eel - lines , and listening silently to the chat of [[his]173-tregarva companion]730-his companion . [Old Harry Verney]174-old harry , [the other keeper]731-the other keeper , was [a character in [his]174-old harry way , and a very bad character too , though [he]174-old harry was a patriarch among [all the gamekeepers of [the vale]518-the vale]733-all the gamekeepers of the vale]732-a character in his way , and a very bad character too , though he was a patriarch among all the gamekeepers of the vale . [He]174-old harry was [a short , wiry , bandy - legged , ferret - visaged old man , with grizzled hair , and a wizened face tanned brown and purple by constant exposure]735-a short , wiry , bandy - legged , ferret - visaged old man , with grizzled hair , and a wizened face tanned brown and purple by constant exposure . Between rheumatism and constant handling the rod and gun , [his]174-old harry fingers were crooked like a hawk ’s claws . [He]174-old harry kept [his]174-old harry left eye always shut , apparently to save trouble in shooting ; and squinted , and sniffed , and peered , with a stooping back and protruded chin , as if [he]174-old harry were perpetually on the watch for fish , flesh , and fowl , vermin and [Christian]175-christian . The friendship between [himself]174-old harry and [the Scotch terrier at [his]174-old harry heels]736-the scotch terrier at his heels would have been easily explained by [Lessing]176-lessing , for in the transmigration of souls the spirit of [Harry Verney]174-old harry had evidently once animated [a dog of that breed]737-a dog of that breed . [He]174-old harry was dressed in a huge thick fustian jacket , scratched , stained , and patched , with bulging , greasy pockets ; a cast of flies round a battered hat , riddled with shot - holes , a dog - whistle at [his]174-old harry button - hole , and an old gun cut short over [his]174-old harry arm , bespoke [his]174-old harry business . ‘ [I]177-crawy seed that ’[177-crawy] ere [Crawy]177-crawy against [Ashy Down Plantations]23-ashy down plantations last night , [I]0-i ’ll be sworn , ’ said [he]174-old harry , in a squeaking , sneaking tone . ‘[0-i] Well , what harm was [the man]738-the man doing ? ’ ‘[738-the man] Oh , ay , that ’s the way [you]739-you young ’ uns talk . If [he]738-the man warn’t doing mischief , [he]738-the man ’d a been glad to have been doing it , [I]740-the younger man ’ll warrant . If [I]740-the younger man ’d been as young as [you]739-you , [I]740-the younger man ’d have picked a quarrel with [him]738-the man soon enough , and found a cause for tackling [him]738-the man . It ’s worth a brace of sovereigns with [the squire]3125-the squire to haul [him]738-the man up . Eh ? eh ? Ai n’t [old Harry]174-old harry right now ? ’[740-the younger man] ‘ Humph ! ’[740-the younger man] growled [the younger man]740-the younger man . ‘ There , then , [you]739-you get [me]174-old harry a snare and a hare by to - morrow night , ’[174-old harry] went on [old Harry]174-old harry , ‘ and see if [I]174-old harry do n’t nab [him]738-the man . It wo n’t lay long under [the plantation]3335-the plantation afore [he]738-the man picks it up . [You]739-you mind to snare [me]174-old harry a hare to - night , now ! ’[174-old harry] ‘ [I]740-the younger man ’ll do no such thing , nor help to bring fake accusations against [any man]3336-any man ! ’[740-the younger man] ‘ False accusations ! ’[174-old harry] answered [Harry]174-old harry , in [his]174-old harry cringing way . ‘ Look at that now , for [a keeper]3337-a keeper to say ! Why , if [he]3337-a keeper do n’t happen to have a snare just there , [he]3337-a keeper has somewhere else , [you]739-you know . Eh ? Ai n’t [old Harry]174-old harry right now , eh ? ’[174-old harry] ‘ Maybe . ’[740-the younger man] ‘ There , do n’t say [I]174-old harry do n’t know nothing then . [Eh]3338-eh ? What matter who put the snare down , or the hare in , perwided [he]741-he takes it up , [man]564-man ? If ’[174-old harry] twas [his’n]741-he [he]741-he ’d be all the better pleased . [The most notoriousest poacher as walks unhung]742-the most notoriousest poacher as walks unhung ! ’ And [old Harry]174-old harry lifted up [his]174-old harry crooked hands in pious indignation . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll have no more gamekeeping , [Harry]174-old harry . What with hunting down [Christians]120-christians as if they were vermin , all night , and being cursed by [the squire]3125-the squire all day , [I]0-i ’d sooner be [a sheriff ’s runner]744-a sheriff ’s runner , or [a negro slave]745-a negro slave . ’ ‘[745-a negro slave] Ay , ay ! that ’s the way the young dogs always bark afore [they]746-they ’re broke in , and gets to like it , as the eels does skinning . Have n’t [I]746-they bounced pretty near out of [my]746-they skin many a time afore now , on this [here very bridge]3340-here very bridge , with “ [Harry]174-old harry , jump in , [you]174-old harry stupid hound ! ” and “ [Harry]174-old harry , get out , [[you]174-old harry one - eyed tailor]3341-you one - eyed tailor ! ” And then , if [one of [the gentlemen]3343-the gentlemen]3342-one of the gentlemen lost a fish with [their]748-they clumsiness — Oh , [Father]3344-father ! to hear [’em]3345-’em[746-they] let out at [me]0-i and [my]0-i landing - net , and curse fit to fright [the devil]600-the devil ! Dash [their]748-they sarcy tongues ! Eh ! Do n’t [old Harry]174-old harry know [their]748-they ways ? Do n’t [he]174-old harry know ’em , now ? ’[174-old harry] ‘ Ay , ’[749-the young man] said [the young man]749-the young man , bitterly . ‘ [We]3346-we break the dogs , and [we]3346-we load the guns , and [we]3346-we find the game , and mark the game,—and then [they]748-they call [themselves]748-they [sportsmen]3347-sportsmen ; [we]3346-we choose the flies , and [we]3346-we bait the spinning - hooks , and [we]3346-we show [them]748-they where the fish lie , and then when [they]748-they ’ve hooked [them]748-they , [they]748-they ca n’t get [them]748-they out without [us]3346-we and the spoonnet ; and then [they]748-they go [home]452-home to [the ladies]701-the ladies and boast of the lot of fish [they]748-they killed — and who thinks of [the keeper]3350-the keeper ? ’[749-the young man] ‘ Oh ! ah ! Then do n’t say [old Harry]174-old harry knows nothing , then . How nicely , now , [you]173-tregarva and [I]174-old harry might get a living off [this ’[174-old harry] ere manor]3351-this ’ ere manor , if [the landlords]750-the landlords was served like [the French ones]751-the french ones was . Eh , [Paul]173-tregarva ? ’ chuckled [old Harry]174-old harry . ‘[173-tregarva] Would n’t [we]752-we pay [our]752-we taxes with pheasants and grayling , that ’s all , eh ? Ai n’t [old Harry]174-old harry right now , eh ? ’ [The old fox]3352-the old fox was fishing for an assent , not for its own sake , for [he]3352-the old fox was [a fierce Tory]3353-a fierce tory , and would have stood up to be shot at any day , not only for [[his]3352-the old fox master]567-his master ’s sake , but for the sake of a single pheasant of [[his]3352-the old fox master]567-his master ’s ; but [he]3352-the old fox hated [Tregarva]173-tregarva for many reasons , and was daily on the watch to entrap [him]173-tregarva on some of [his]173-tregarva peculiar points , whereof [he]3352-the old fox had , as [we]752-we shall find , a good many . What would have been [Tregarva]173-tregarva ’s answer , [I]174-old harry can not tell ; but [Lancelot]172-lancelot , who had unintentionally overheard the greater part of the conversation , disliked being any longer [a listener]3356-a listener , and came close to [them]755-they . ‘[174-old harry] Here ’s [your]174-old harry gudgeons and minnows , [sir]753-sir , as [you]174-old harry bespoke , ’ quoth [Harry]174-old harry ; ‘[174-old harry] and here ’s that paternoster as [you]174-old harry gave [me]0-i to rig up . Beautiful minnows , [sir]753-sir , white as a silver spoon.—They’re the ones now , ai n’t [they]755-they , [sir]753-sir , eh ? ’ ‘[755-they] [They]755-they ’ll do ! ’ ‘[755-they] Well , then , do n’t say [old Harry]174-old harry do n’t know nothing , that ’s all , eh ? ’ and [the old fellow]3357-the old fellow toddled off , peering and twisting [his]3357-the old fellow head about like a starling . ‘[757-an odd old fellow that , tregarva] [An odd old fellow that , [Tregarva]173-tregarva]757-an odd old fellow that , tregarva , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[757-an odd old fellow that , tregarva] Very , [sir]753-sir , considering who made [him]757-an odd old fellow that , tregarva , ’ answered [the Cornishman]3358-the cornishman , touching [his]3358-the cornishman hat , and then thrusting [his]3358-the cornishman nose deeper than ever into the eel - basket . ‘[753-sir] Beautiful stream this , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , who had a continual longing — right or wrong — to chat with [[his]172-lancelot inferiors]3359-his inferiors ; and was proportionately sulky and reserved to [[his]172-lancelot superiors]3360-his superiors . ‘[753-sir] Beautiful enough , [sir]753-sir , ’ said [the keeper]3350-the keeper , with an emphasis on the first word . ‘[753-sir] Why , has it any other fault ? ’ ‘[753-sir] Not so wholesome as pretty , [sir]753-sir . ’ ‘[753-sir] What harm does it do ? ’ ‘[178-fever] [Fever]178-fever , and ague , and rheumatism , [sir]753-sir . ’ ‘[178-fever] Where ? ’ asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot , a little amused by [the man]738-the man ’s laconic answers . ‘[178-fever] Wherever the white fog spreads , [sir]753-sir . ’ ‘[753-sir] Where ’s that ? ’ ‘[753-sir] Everywhere , [sir]753-sir . ’ ‘[753-sir] And when ? ’ ‘[753-sir] Always , [sir]753-sir . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot burst out laughing . [The man]738-the man looked up at [him]172-lancelot slowly and seriously . ‘[753-sir] [You]753-sir would n’t laugh , [sir]753-sir , if [you]753-sir ’d seen much of the inside of [these cottages]766-these cottages round . ’ ‘[753-sir] Really , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[0-i] [I]0-i was only laughing at [our]767-our making such very short work of such a long and serious story . Do [you]753-sir mean that the unhealthiness of [this country]768-this country is wholly caused by [the river]505-the river ? ’ ‘[753-sir] No , [sir]753-sir . The river - damps are [God]281-god ’s sending ; and so they are not too bad to bear . But there ’s more of [man]564-man ’s sending , that is too bad to bear . ’ ‘[753-sir] What do [you]753-sir mean ? ’ ‘[753-sir] Are [men]612-men likely to be healthy when [they]612-men are worse housed than a pig ? ’ ‘[753-sir] No . ’ ‘[753-sir] And worse fed than a hound ? ’ ‘[753-sir] Good heavens ! No ! ’ ‘[753-sir] Or packed together to sleep , like pilchards in a barrel ? ’ ‘[753-sir] But , [[my]0-i good fellow]773-my good fellow , do [you]753-sir mean that [the labourers]774-the labourers [here]775-here are in [that state]776-that state ? ’ ‘[753-sir] It is n’t far to walk , [sir]753-sir . Perhaps some day , when [the May - fly]778-the may - fly is gone off , and the fish wo n’t rise awhile , [you]753-sir could walk down and see . [I]0-i beg [your]753-sir pardon , [sir]753-sir , though , for thinking of such a thing . They are not places fit for [gentlemen]780-gentlemen , that ’s certain . ’ There was a staid irony in [his]0-i tone , which [Lancelot]172-lancelot felt . ‘[781-the clergyman] But [the clergyman]781-the clergyman goes ? ’ ‘[753-sir] Yes , [sir]753-sir . ’ ‘[753-sir] And [Miss Honoria]162-honoria goes ? ’ ‘[162-honoria] Yes , [God Almighty]281-god bless [her]162-honoria ! ’ ‘[281-god] And do not [they]783-they see that all goes right ? ’ [The giant]3364-the giant twisted [his]3364-the giant huge limbs , as if trying to avoid an answer , and yet not daring to do so . ‘[783-they] Do [clergymen]784-clergymen go about among [the poor]698-the poor much , [sir]753-sir , at [college]787-college , before [they]784-clergymen are ordained ? ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot smiled , and shook [his]172-lancelot head . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i thought so , [sir]753-sir . [[Our]789-our good vicar]790-our good vicar is like [the rest hereabouts]791-the rest hereabouts . [God]281-god knows , [he]790-our good vicar stints neither time nor money — [the souls of [the poor]698-the poor]792-the souls of the poor are well looked after , and [their]698-the poor bodies too — as far as [his]790-our good vicar purse will go ; but that ’s not far . ’ ‘[790-our good vicar] Is [he]790-our good vicar ill - off , then ? ’ ‘[790-our good vicar] [The living]794-the living ’s worth some forty pounds a year . The great tithes , [they]795-they say , are worth better than twelve hundred ; but [Squire Lavington]136-squire lavington has them . ’ ‘[136-squire lavington] Oh , [I]0-i see ! ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’m glad [you]172-lancelot do , [sir]753-sir , for [I]173-tregarva do n’t , ’[173-tregarva] meekly answered [Tregarva]173-tregarva . ‘ But [the vicar]3366-the vicar , [sir]753-sir , [he]3366-the vicar is [a kind man]3368-a kind man , and a good ; but [the poor]698-the poor do n’t understand [him]3366-the vicar , nor [he]3366-the vicar [them]698-the poor . [He]3366-the vicar is too learned , [sir]753-sir , and , saving [your]172-lancelot presence , too fond of [his]3366-the vicar prayer - book . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ [One]3305-one ca n’t be too fond of a good thing . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ Not unless [you]172-lancelot make an idol of it , [sir]753-sir , and fancy that [men]612-men ’s souls were made for the prayer - book , and not the prayer - book for [them]612-men . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ But can not [he]3366-the vicar expose and redress these evils , if they exist ? ’[173-tregarva] [Tregarva]173-tregarva twisted about again . ‘ [I]173-tregarva do not say that [I]173-tregarva think it , [sir]753-sir ; but this [I]173-tregarva know , that [every poor man in [the vale]518-the vale]3375-every poor man in the vale thinks it — that [the parsons]3377-the parsons are afraid of [the landlords]750-the landlords . [They]3377-the parsons must see these things , for [they]3377-the parsons are not blind ; and [they]3377-the parsons try to plaster [them]3377-the parsons up out of [their]3377-the parsons own pockets . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ But why , in [God]281-god ’s name , do n’t [they]3377-the parsons strike at the root of the matter , and go straight to [the landlords]750-the landlords and tell [them]750-the landlords the truth ? ’[172-lancelot] asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ So [people]3181-people say , [sir]753-sir . [I]172-lancelot see no reason for it except the one which [I]172-lancelot gave [you]753-sir . Besides , [sir]753-sir , [you]753-sir must remember , that [a man]445-a man ca n’t quarrel with [[his]445-a man own kin]3384-his own kin ; and so many of [them]3384-his own kin are [[their]3384-his own kin squire ’s brothers]3385-their squire ’s brothers , or [sons]3386-sons , or [nephews]3387-nephews . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Or good friends with [him]445-a man , at least . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ Ay , [sir]753-sir , and , to do [them]3384-his own kin justice , [they]3384-his own kin had need , for [the poor]698-the poor ’s sake , to keep [good friends]3390-good friends with [the squire]3125-the squire . How else are [they]3384-his own kin to get a farthing for [schools]3392-schools , or coal - subscriptions , or lying - in societies , or lending libraries , or penny clubs ? If [they]3384-his own kin spoke [their]3384-his own kin minds to [the great ones]3393-the great ones , [sir]753-sir , how could [they]3384-his own kin keep [the parish]3395-the parish together ? ’[173-tregarva] ‘ [You]753-sir seem to see both sides of a question , certainly . But what a miserable state of things , that [the labouring man]3396-the labouring man should require all these societies , and charities , and helps from the rich!—that [an industrious freeman]3397-an industrious freeman can not live without alms ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ So [I]173-tregarva have thought this long time , ’[173-tregarva] quietly answered [Tregarva]173-tregarva . ‘ But [Miss Honoria,—she]3398-miss honoria,—she is not afraid to tell [[her]3398-miss honoria,—she father]3219-her father the truth ? ’[173-tregarva] ‘ Suppose , [sir]753-sir , when [Adam]179-adam and [Eve]180-eve were in [the garden]709-the garden , that [all the devils]3402-all the devils had come up and played [their]3402-all the devils fiends ’[172-lancelot] tricks before them,—do [you]796-you think [they]797-they ’d have seen any shame in it ? ’ ‘[173-tregarva] [I]0-i really can not tell , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , smiling . ‘[173-tregarva] Then [I]0-i can , [sir]753-sir . [They]797-they ’d have seen no more harm in it than there was harm already in [themselves]797-they ; and that was none . [A man]445-a man ’s eyes can only see what [they]445-a man ’ve learnt to see . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot started : it was a favourite dictum of [his]172-lancelot in [Carlyle]126-mr. carlyle ’s works . ‘[445-a man] Where did [you]796-you get that thought , [[my]0-i friend]800-my friend ’ ‘[796-you] By seeing , [sir]753-sir . ’ ‘[796-you] But what has that to do with [Miss Honoria]162-honoria ? ’ ‘[162-honoria] [She]162-honoria is [an angel of holiness]802-an angel of holiness [herself]162-honoria , [sir]753-sir ; and , therefore , [she]162-honoria goes on without blushing or suspecting , where [our]804-our blood would boil again . [She]162-honoria sees [people]3181-people in want , and thinks it must be so , and pities [them]3181-people and relieves [them]3181-people . But [she]162-honoria do n’t know want [herself]162-honoria ; and , therefore , [she]162-honoria do n’t know that it makes [men beasts]806-men beasts and devils . [She]162-honoria ’s as pure as [God]281-god ’s light [herself]162-honoria ; and , therefore , [she]162-honoria fancies [every one]807-every one is as spotless as [she]162-honoria is . And there ’s another mistake in [[your]808-your charitable great people]809-your charitable great people , [sir]753-sir . When [they]809-your charitable great people see [poor folk sick or hungry before [their]809-your charitable great people eyes]811-poor folk sick or hungry before their eyes , [they]809-your charitable great people pull out [their]809-your charitable great people purses fast enough , [God]281-god bless [them]809-your charitable great people ; for [they]809-your charitable great people would n’t like to be so [themselves]809-your charitable great people . But the oppression that goes on all the year round , and the want that goes on all the year round , and the filth , and the lying , and the swearing , and the profligacy , that go on all the year round , and the sickening weight of debt , and the miserable grinding anxiety from rent - day to rent - day , and Saturday night to Saturday night , that crushes [a man]445-a man ’s soul down , and drives every thought out of [his]445-a man head but how [he]445-a man is to fill [his]445-a man stomach and warm [his]445-a man back , and keep [a house over [his]445-a man head]813-a house over his head , till [he]445-a man dare n’t for [his]445-a man life take [his]445-a man thoughts one moment off the meat that perisheth — oh , [sir]753-sir , [they]809-your charitable great people never felt this ; and , therefore , [they]809-your charitable great people never dream that there are [thousands who pass [them]809-your charitable great people in [their]809-your charitable great people daily walks]815-thousands who pass them in their daily walks who feel this , and feel nothing else ! ’ This outburst was uttered with an earnestness and majesty which astonished [Lancelot]172-lancelot . [He]172-lancelot forgot the subject in [the speaker]3199-the speaker . ‘[753-sir] [You]753-sir are [a very extraordinary gamekeeper]816-a very extraordinary gamekeeper ! ’ said [he]172-lancelot . ‘[816-a very extraordinary gamekeeper] When [the Lord]817-the lord shows [a man]445-a man a thing , [he]445-a man ca n’t well help seeing it , ’ answered [Tregarva]173-tregarva , in [his]173-tregarva usual staid tone . There was a pause . [The keeper]3350-the keeper looked at [him]172-lancelot with a glance , before which [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s eyes fell . ‘[445-a man] Hell is paved with hearsays , [sir]753-sir , and as all this talk of [mine]820-mine is hearsay , if [you]753-sir are in earnest , [sir]753-sir , go and see for [yourself]753-sir . [I]0-i know [you]753-sir have a kind heart , and [they]822-they tell [me]0-i that [you]753-sir are [a great scholar]823-a great scholar , which would to [God]281-god [I]0-i was ! so [you]753-sir ought not to condescend to take [my]0-i word for anything which [you]753-sir can look into [yourself]753-sir ; ’ with which sound piece of common - sense [Tregarva]173-tregarva returned busily to [his]173-tregarva eel - lines . ‘[753-sir] Hand [me]0-i the rod and can , and help [me]0-i out along the buck - stage , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot ; ‘[753-sir] [I]0-i must have some more talk with [you]753-sir , [[my]0-i fine fellow]824-my fine fellow . ’ ‘[753-sir] Amen , ’ answered [Tregarva]173-tregarva , as [he]173-tregarva assisted [[our]3405-our lame hero]3406-our lame hero along a huge beam which stretched out into [the pool]3407-the pool ; and having settled [him]3406-our lame hero there , returned mechanically to [his]173-tregarva work , humming a Wesleyan hymn - tune . [Lancelot]172-lancelot sat and tried to catch perch , but [Tregarva]173-tregarva ’s words haunted [him]172-lancelot . [He]172-lancelot lighted [his]172-lancelot cigar , and tried to think earnestly over the matter , but [he]172-lancelot had got into the wrong place for thinking . All [his]172-lancelot thoughts , all [his]172-lancelot sympathies , were drowned in the rush and whirl of [the water]688-the water . [He]172-lancelot forgot everything else in the mere animal enjoyment of sight and sound . Like [many young men]3409-many young men at [his]172-lancelot crisis of life , [he]172-lancelot had given [himself]172-lancelot up to the mere contemplation of Nature till [he]172-lancelot had become [[her]3410-her slave]3411-her slave ; and now a luscious scene , a singing bird , were enough to allure [his]172-lancelot mind away from the most earnest and awful thoughts . [He]172-lancelot tried to think , but [the river]505-the river would not let [him]172-lancelot . It thundered and spouted out behind [him]172-lancelot from the hatches , and leapt madly past [him]172-lancelot , and caught [his]172-lancelot eyes in spite of [him]172-lancelot , and swept them away down its dancing waves , and let them go again only to sweep them down again and again , till [his]172-lancelot brain felt a delicious dizziness from the everlasting rush and the everlasting roar . And then below , how it spread , and writhed , and whirled into transparent fans , hissing and twining snakes , polished glass - wreaths , huge crystal bells , which boiled up from the bottom , and dived again beneath long threads of creamy foam , and swung round posts and roots , and rushed blackening under dark weed - fringed boughs , and gnawed at [the marly banks]3413-the marly banks , and shook the ever - restless bulrushes , till it was swept away and down over the white pebbles and olive weeds , in one broad rippling sheet of molten silver , towards [the distant sea]3414-the distant sea . [Downwards]181-downwards [it]505-the river fleeted ever , and bore [his]172-lancelot thoughts floating on [its]505-the river oily stream ; and the great trout , with [their]3415-their yellow sides and peacock backs , lounged among the eddies , and [the silver grayling]3416-the silver grayling dimpled and wandered upon [the shallows]717-the shallows , and the may - flies flickered and rustled round [him]172-lancelot like water fairies , with their green gauzy wings ; the coot clanked musically among the reeds ; the frogs hummed their ceaseless vesper - monotone ; [the kingfisher]3418-the kingfisher darted from [his]3418-the kingfisher hole in [the bank]3419-the bank like a blue spark of electric light ; the swallows ’[753-sir] bills snapped as they twined and hawked above the pool ; the swift ’s wings whirred like musket - balls , as they rushed screaming past [his]825-his head ; and ever [the river]505-the river fleeted by , bearing [his]825-his eyes away down the current , till its wild eddies began to glow with crimson beneath the setting sun . The complex harmony of sights and sounds slid softly over [his]825-his soul , and [he]825-his sank away into a still daydream , too passive for imagination , too deep for meditation , and ‘ [Beauty born of murmuring sound]3420-beauty born of murmuring sound , Did pass into [his]825-his face . ’[825-his] Blame [him]825-his not . There are more things in [a man]445-a man ’s heart than ever get in through [his]825-his thoughts . On a sudden , a soft voice behind [him]825-his startled [him]825-his . ‘ Can [a poor cockney artist]3421-a poor cockney artist venture [himself]3421-a poor cockney artist along [this timber]3422-this timber without falling in ? ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot turned . ‘ Come out to [me]172-lancelot , and if [you]3180-the artist stumble , [the naiads]3423-the naiads will rise out of [their]3423-the naiads depths , and “ hold up [their]3423-the naiads pearled wrists ” to save [[their]3423-the naiads favourite]3424-their favourite . ’[172-lancelot] [The artist]3180-the artist walked timidly out along the beams , and sat down beside [Lancelot]172-lancelot , who shook [him]3180-the artist warmly by the hand . ‘ Welcome , [Claude Mellot]182-claude , and all lovely enthusiasms and symbolisms ! Expound to [me]172-lancelot , now , the meaning of that water - lily leaf and its grand simple curve , as it lies sleeping there in the back eddy . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Oh , [I]172-lancelot am too amused to philosophise . [The fair Argemone]150-argemone has just been treating [me]172-lancelot to [her]150-argemone three hundred and sixty - fifth philippic against [my]172-lancelot unoffending beard . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Why , what fault can [she]150-argemone find with such a graceful and natural ornament ? ’[3180-the artist] ‘ Just this , [[my]172-lancelot dear fellow]3322-my dear fellow , that it is natural . As it is , [she]150-argemone considers [me]172-lancelot only “ intelligent - looking . ” If the beard were away , [my]172-lancelot face , [she]150-argemone says , would be “ so refined ! ” And , [I]172-lancelot suppose , if [I]172-lancelot was just a little more effeminate and pale , with a nice retreating under - jaw and a drooping lip , and a meek , peaking simper , like [[your]182-claude starved Romish saints]3426-your starved romish saints , [I]172-lancelot should be “ so spiritual ! ” And if , again , to complete the climax , [I]172-lancelot did but shave [my]172-lancelot head like [a Chinese]3427-a chinese , [I]172-lancelot should be [a model for [St. Francis]140-st. francis de sales [himself]140-st. francis de sales]3428-a model for st. francis himself ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ But really , after all , why make [yourself]172-lancelot so singular by this said beard ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot wear it for a testimony and a sign that [a man]445-a man has no right to be ashamed of the mark of manhood . Oh , that [one or two of [[your]182-claude Protestant clergymen]3431-your protestant clergymen , who ought to be [perfect ideal men]3432-perfect ideal men , would have the courage to get up into the pulpit in a long beard , and testify that the very essential idea of Protestantism is the dignity and divinity of [man]564-man as [God]281-god made [him]564-man]3430-one or two of your protestant clergymen , who ought to be perfect ideal men , would have the courage to get up into the pulpit in a long beard , and testify that the very essential idea of protestantism is the dignity and divinity of man as god made him ! [[Our]3434-our forefathers]3435-our forefathers were not ashamed of [their]3435-our forefathers beards ; but now even [the soldier]3436-the soldier is only allowed to keep [his]3436-the soldier moustache , while [[our]3434-our quill - driving masses]3437-our quill - driving masses shave [themselves]3437-our quill - driving masses as close as [they]3437-our quill - driving masses can ; and in proportion to [a man]445-a man ’s piety [he]445-a man wears less hair , from [the young curate]3439-the young curate who shaves off [his]3439-the young curate whiskers , to [the Popish priest who shaves [his]3439-the young curate crown]3440-the popish priest who shaves his crown ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ What do [you]0-i say , then , to cutting off [nuns]3441-nuns ’[172-lancelot] hair ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i say , that extremes meet , and [prudish Manichæism]829-prudish manichæism always ends in sheer indecency . [Those Papists]830-those papists have forgotten what [woman]458-woman was made for , and therefore , [they]830-those papists have forgotten that [a woman]3251-a woman ’s hair is [her]3251-a woman glory , for it was given to [her]3251-a woman for a covering : as says [[your]833-you friend]834-your friend , [Paul the Hebrew]183-paul the hebrew , who , by the bye , had as fine theories of art as [he]183-paul the hebrew had of society , if [he]183-paul the hebrew had only lived fifteen hundred years later , and had a chance of working them out . ’ ‘[183-paul the hebrew] How remarkably orthodox [you]833-you are ! ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , smiling . ‘[183-paul the hebrew] How do [you]833-you know that [I]0-i am not ? [You]833-you never heard [me]0-i deny the old creed . But what if [an artist]835-an artist ought to be of all creeds at once ? [My]0-i business is to represent the beautiful , and therefore to accept it wherever [I]0-i find it . [Yours]833-you is to be [a philosopher]836-a philosopher , and find the true . ’ ‘[836-a philosopher] But [the beautiful]837-the beautiful must be truly beautiful to be worth anything ; and so [you]833-you , too , must search for the true . ’ ‘[833-you] Yes ; truth of form , colour , chiaroscuro . [They]838-they are worthy to occupy [me]0-i a life ; for they are eternal — or at least that which [they]838-they express : and if [I]0-i am to get at the symbolised unseen , it must be through the beauty of the symbolising phenomenon . If [I]0-i , who live by art , for art , in art , or [you]833-you either , who seem as much [a born artist]839-a born artist as [myself]0-i , am to have a religion , it must be a worship of the fountain of art — of the “ Spirit of beauty , who doth consecrate With [his]840-his own hues whate’er [he]840-his shines upon . ” ’ ‘[121-shelley] As [poor Shelley]121-shelley has it ; and much peace of mind it gave [him]840-his ! ’ answered [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have grown sick lately of such dreary tinsel abstractions . When [you]833-you look through the glitter of the words , [your]833-you “ spirit of beauty ” simply means certain shapes and colours which please [you]833-you in beautiful things and in [beautiful people]841-beautiful people . ’ ‘[842-vile nominalist] [Vile nominalist]842-vile nominalist ! renegade from the ideal and all its glories ! ’ said [Claude]182-claude , laughing . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t care sixpence now for the ideal ! [I]0-i want not beauty , but some beautiful thing — [a woman]3251-a woman perhaps , ’ and [he]0-i sighed . ‘[3251-a woman] But at least [a person]844-a person — [a living , loving person]845-a living , loving person — all lovely itself , and giving loveliness to all things ! If [I]0-i must have an ideal , let it be , for mercy ’s sake , a realised one . ’ [Claude]182-claude opened [his]0-i sketch - book . ‘[846-us] [We]846-us shall get swamped in these metaphysical oceans , [[my]0-i dear dreamer]847-my dear dreamer . But lo , here come [a couple]848-a couple , as near ideals as any in these degenerate days — the two poles of beauty : the milieu of which would be [Venus]184-venus with [us]846-us [Pagans]849-pagans , or the Virgin [Mary]185-mary with [the Catholics]850-the catholics . Look at [them]848-a couple ! [Honoria]162-honoria the dark — symbolic of passionate depth ; [Argemone]150-argemone the fair , type of intellectual light ! Oh , that [I]0-i were [a Zeuxis]851-a zeuxis to unite [them]848-a couple instead of having to paint them in two separate pictures , and split perfection in half , as everything is split in [this piecemeal world]852-this piecemeal world ! ’ ‘[0-i] [You]0-i will have the honour of a sitting this afternoon , [I]0-i suppose , from both beauties ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i hope so , for [my]0-i own sake . There is no path left to immortality , or bread either , now for [us]846-us poor artists but portrait - painting . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i envy [you]0-i [your]0-i path , when it leads through such Elysiums , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[0-i] Come here , [gentlemen]780-gentlemen both ! ’ cried [Argemone]150-argemone from [the bridge]729-the bridge . ‘[854-fairly caught] [Fairly caught]854-fairly caught ! ’ grumbled [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[854-fairly caught] [You]0-i must go , at least ; [my]0-i lameness will excuse [me]0-i , [I]0-i hope . ’ [The two ladies]3443-the two ladies were accompanied by [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge , a gazelle which [he]0-i had given [Argemone]150-argemone , and [a certain miserable cur of [Honoria]162-honoria ’s adopting]3444-a certain miserable cur of honoria ’s adopting , who plays an important part in this story , and , therefore , deserves a little notice . [Honoria]162-honoria had rescued [him]0-i from a watery death in [the village pond]3445-the village pond , by means of [the colonel]504-the colonel , who had revenged [himself]504-the colonel for a pair of wet feet by utterly corrupting the dog ’s morals , and teaching [him]0-i every week to answer to some fresh scandalous name . But [Lancelot]172-lancelot was not to escape . Instead of moving on , as [he]172-lancelot had hoped , [the party]3447-the party stood looking over [the bridge]729-the bridge , and talking — [he]172-lancelot took for granted , [poor thin - skinned fellow — of [him]0-i]3449-poor thin - skinned fellow — of him . And for once [his]172-lancelot suspicions were right ; for [he]172-lancelot overheard [Argemone]150-argemone say — ‘[0-i] [I]0-i wonder how [Mr. Smith]137-mr. smith can be so rude as to sit there in [my]0-i presence over [his]137-mr. smith stupid perch ! Smoking those horrid cigars , too ! How selfish those field - sports do make [men]612-men ! ’ ‘[856-you] Thank [you]856-you ! ’ said [the colonel]504-the colonel , with a low bow . [Lancelot]172-lancelot rose . ‘[856-you] If [a country girl]857-a country girl , now , had spoken in that tone , ’ said [he]172-lancelot to [himself]172-lancelot , ‘[857-a country girl] it would have been called at least “ saucy”—but [Mammon]186-mammon ’s elect ones may do anything . Well — here [I]0-i come , limping to [[my]0-i new tyrant]858-my new tyrant ’s feet , like [Goethe]187-goethe ’s bear to [Lili]188-lili ’s . ’ [She]150-argemone drew [him]172-lancelot away , as [women]3246-women only know how , from the rest of [the party]3447-the party , who were chatting and laughing with [Claude]182-claude . [She]150-argemone had shown off [her]150-argemone fancied indifference to [Lancelot]172-lancelot before [them]3447-the party , and now began in a softer voice — ‘[0-i] Why will [you]0-i be so shy and lonely , [Mr. Smith]137-mr. smith ? ’ ‘[137-mr. smith] Because [I]0-i am not fit for [your]137-mr. smith society . ’ ‘[0-i] Who tells [you]0-i so ? Why will [you]0-i not become so ? ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot hung down [his]172-lancelot head . ‘[0-i] As long as fish and game are [your]0-i only society , [you]0-i will become more and more morne and self - absorbed . ’ ‘[0-i] Really fish were the last things of which [I]0-i was thinking when [you]0-i came . [My]0-i whole heart was filled with the beauty of nature , and nothing else . ’ There was an opening for one of [Argemone]150-argemone ’s preconcerted orations . ‘[0-i] Had [you]0-i no better occupation , ’ [she]150-argemone said gently , ‘[0-i] than nature , the first day of returning to [the open air]859-the open air after so frightful and dangerous an accident ? Were there no thanks due to [One above]860-one above ? ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot understood [her]150-argemone . ‘[860-one above] How do [you]0-i know that [I]0-i was not even then showing [my]0-i thankfulness ? ’ ‘[0-i] What ! with a cigar and a fishing - rod ? ’ ‘[0-i] Certainly . Why not ? ’ [Argemone]150-argemone really could not tell at the moment . The answer upset [her]150-argemone scheme entirely . ‘[0-i] Might not that very admiration of nature have been an act of worship ? ’ continued [[our]861-our hero]3453-our hero . ‘[0-i] How can [we]861-our better glorify [the worker]862-the worker than by delighting in [his]862-the worker work ? ’ ‘[0-i] Ah ! ’ sighed [the lady]3454-the lady , ‘[0-i] why trust to these self - willed methods , and neglect the noble and exquisite forms which [the Church]863-the church has prepared for [us]861-our as embodiments for every feeling of [our]861-our hearts ? ’ ‘[189-miss lavington] Every feeling , [Miss Lavington]189-miss lavington ? ’ [Argemone]150-argemone hesitated . [She]150-argemone had made [the good old stock]3455-the good old stock assertion , as in duty bound ; but [she]150-argemone could not help recollecting that there were several Popish books of devotion at that moment on [her]150-argemone table , which seemed to [her]150-argemone to patch a gap or two in the Prayer - book . ‘[189-miss lavington] [[My]0-i temple]864-my temple as yet , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[0-i] is only [the heaven]865-the heaven and [the earth]866-the earth ; [my]0-i church - music [I]0-i can hear all day long , whenever [I]0-i have the sense to be silent , and “ hear [[my]0-i mother]867-my mother sing ; ” [[my]0-i priests]868-my priests and [preachers]869-preachers are every bird and bee , every flower and cloud . Am [I]0-i not well enough furnished ? Do [you]870-you want to reduce [[my]0-i circular infinite chapel]871-my circular infinite chapel to an oblong hundred - foot one ? [My]0-i sphere harmonies to the Gregorian tones in four parts ? [My]0-i world - wide priesthood , with [their]872-their endless variety of costume , to [one not over - educated gentleman]873-one not over - educated gentleman in a white sheet ? And [my]0-i dreams of [naiads and flower - fairies]874-naiads and flower - fairies , and the blue - bells ringing [God]281-god ’s praises , as they do in “ The story without an End , ” for the gross reality of [naughty charity children]875-naughty charity children , with [their]875-naughty charity children pockets full of apples , bawling out Hebrew psalms of which [they]875-naughty charity children neither feel nor understand a word ? ’ [Argemone]150-argemone tried to look very much shocked at this piece of bombast . [Lancelot]172-lancelot evidently meant it as such , but [he]172-lancelot eyed [her]150-argemone all the while as if there was solemn earnest under the surface . ‘[137-mr. smith] Oh , [Mr. Smith]137-mr. smith ! ’ [she]150-argemone said , ‘[137-mr. smith] how can [you]137-mr. smith dare talk so of a liturgy compiled by the wisest and holiest of [all countries]876-all countries and ages ! [You]137-mr. smith revile that of whose beauty [you]137-mr. smith are not qualified to judge ! ’ ‘[137-mr. smith] There must be a beauty in it all , or such as [you]137-mr. smith are would not love it . ’ ‘[137-mr. smith] Oh , ’ [she]150-argemone said hopefully , ‘[137-mr. smith] that [you]137-mr. smith would but try the Church system ! How [you]137-mr. smith would find it harmonise and methodise every day , every thought for [you]137-mr. smith ! But [I]0-i can not explain [myself]0-i . Why not go to [[our]877-our vicar]878-our vicar and open [your]137-mr. smith doubts to [him]878-our vicar ? ’ ‘[878-our vicar] Pardon , but [you]137-mr. smith must excuse [me]0-i . ’ ‘[137-mr. smith] Why ? [He]878-our vicar is [one of the saintliest of [men]612-men]879-one of the saintliest of men ! ’ ‘[878-our vicar] To tell the truth , [I]0-i have been to [him]878-our vicar already . ’ ‘[0-i] [You]137-mr. smith do not mean it ! And what did [he]878-our vicar tell [you]137-mr. smith ? ’ ‘[878-our vicar] What [the rest of [the world]475-the world]881-the rest of the world does — hearsays . ’ ‘[878-our vicar] But did [you]137-mr. smith not find [him]878-our vicar most kind ? ’ ‘[137-mr. smith] [I]0-i went to [him]878-our vicar to be comforted and guided . [He]878-our vicar received [me]0-i as [a criminal]883-a criminal . [He]878-our vicar told [me]0-i that [my]0-i first duty was penitence ; that as long as [I]0-i lived the life [I]0-i did , [he]878-our vicar could not dare to cast [his]878-our vicar pearls before [swine]884-swine by answering [my]0-i doubts ; that [I]0-i was in a state incapable of appreciating spiritual truths ; and , therefore , [he]878-our vicar had no right to tell [me]0-i any . ’ ‘[878-our vicar] And what did [he]878-our vicar tell [you]137-mr. smith ? ’ ‘[878-our vicar] Several spiritual lies instead , [I]0-i thought . [He]878-our vicar told [me]0-i , hearing [me]0-i quote [Schiller]190-schiller , to beware of [the Germans]191-the germans , for [they]191-the germans were all Pantheists at heart . [I]0-i asked [him]878-our vicar whether [he]878-our vicar included [Lange]192-lange and [Bunsen]193-bunsen , and it appeared that [he]878-our vicar had never read a German book in [his]878-our vicar life . [He]878-our vicar then flew furiously at [Mr. Carlyle]126-mr. carlyle , and [I]0-i found that all [he]878-our vicar knew of [him]878-our vicar was from a certain review in the Quarterly . [He]878-our vicar called [Boehmen]194-boehmen [a theosophic Atheist]885-a theosophic atheist . [I]0-i should have burst out at that , had [I]0-i not read the very words in a High Church review the day before , and hoped that [he]878-our vicar was not aware of the impudent falsehood which [he]878-our vicar was retailing . Whenever [I]0-i feebly interposed an objection to anything [he]878-our vicar said ( for , after all , [he]878-our vicar talked on ) , [he]878-our vicar told [me]0-i to hear [the Catholic Church]886-the catholic church . [I]0-i asked [him]878-our vicar which [Catholic Church]887-catholic church ? [He]878-our vicar said the English . [I]0-i asked [him]878-our vicar whether it was to be [the Church of the sixth century]888-the church of the sixth century , or the thirteenth , or the seventeenth or the eighteenth ? [He]878-our vicar told [me]0-i the one and eternal Church which belonged as much to the nineteenth century as to the first . [I]0-i begged to know whether , then , [I]0-i was to hear [the Church]863-the church according to [Simeon]195-simeon , or according to [Newman]196-newman , or according to [St. Paul]197-st. paul ; for [they]890-they seemed to [me]0-i a little at variance ? [He]878-our vicar told [me]0-i , austerely enough , that the mind of [the Church]863-the church was embodied in [her]863-the church Liturgy and Articles . To which [I]0-i answered , that the mind of [the episcopal clergy]892-the episcopal clergy might , perhaps , be ; but , then , how happened it that [they]892-the episcopal clergy were always quarrelling and calling hard names about the sense of those very documents ? And so [I]0-i left [him]878-our vicar , assuring [him]878-our vicar that , living in the nineteenth century , [I]0-i wanted to hear the Church of the nineteenth century , and no other ; and should be most happy to listen to [her]863-the church , as soon as [she]863-the church had made up [her]863-the church mind what to say . ’ [Argemone]150-argemone was angry and disappointed . [She]150-argemone felt [she]150-argemone could not cope with [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s quaint logic , which , however unsound , cut deeper into questions than [she]150-argemone had yet looked for [herself]150-argemone . Somehow , too , [she]150-argemone was tongue - tied before [him]878-our vicar just when [she]150-argemone wanted to be most eloquent in behalf of [her]150-argemone principles ; and that fretted [her]150-argemone still more . But [his]878-our vicar manner puzzled [her]150-argemone most of all . First [he]878-our vicar would run on with [his]878-our vicar face turned away , as if soliloquising out into the air , and then suddenly look round at [her]150-argemone with most fascinating humility ; and , then , in a moment , a dark shade would pass over [his]878-our vicar countenance , and [he]878-our vicar would look like [one possessed]3456-one possessed , and [his]878-our vicar lips wreathe in a sinister artificial smile , and [his]878-our vicar wild eyes glare through and through [her]150-argemone with such cunning understanding of [himself]878-our vicar and [her]150-argemone , that , for the first time in [her]150-argemone life , [she]150-argemone quailed and felt frightened , as if in the power of [a madman]3457-a madman . [She]150-argemone turned hastily away to shake off the spell . [He]878-our vicar sprang after [her]150-argemone , almost on [his]878-our vicar knees , and looked up into [her]150-argemone beautiful face with an imploring cry . ‘[863-the church] What , do [you]893-you , too , throw [me]0-i off ? Will [you]893-you , too , treat [the poor wild uneducated sportsman]894-the poor wild uneducated sportsman as [a Pariah]895-a pariah and [an outcast]896-an outcast , because [he]894-the poor wild uneducated sportsman is not ashamed to be [a man?—because]897-a man?—because [he]894-the poor wild uneducated sportsman can not stuff [his]894-the poor wild uneducated sportsman soul ’s hunger with cut - and - dried hearsays , but dares to think for himself?—because [he]894-the poor wild uneducated sportsman wants to believe things , and dare not be satisfied with only believing that [he]894-the poor wild uneducated sportsman ought to believe them ? ’ [She]893-you paused , astonished . ‘[897-a man?—because] Ah , yes , ’ [he]0-i went on , ‘[897-a man?—because] [I]0-i hoped too much ! What right had [I]0-i to expect that [you]893-you would understand [me]0-i ? What right , still more , to expect that [you]893-you would stoop , any more than [the rest of [the world]475-the world]881-the rest of the world , to speak to [me]0-i , as if [I]0-i could become anything better than the wild hog [I]0-i seem ? Oh yes!—the chrysalis has no butterfly in it , of course ! Stamp on the ugly motionless thing ! And yet — [you]893-you look so beautiful and good!—are all [my]0-i dreams to perish , about [the Alrunen]198-the alrunen and [prophet - maidens]900-prophet - maidens , how [they]901-they charmed [our]902-our old fighting , hunting [forefathers]903-forefathers into purity and sweet obedience among [[their]901-they Saxon forests]904-their saxon forests ? Has [woman]458-woman forgotten [her]458-woman mission — to look at the heart and have mercy , while [cold man]906-cold man looks at the act and condemns ? Do [you]893-you , too , like [the rest of mankind]907-the rest of mankind , think no - belief better than misbelief ; and smile on hypocrisy , lip - assent , practical Atheism , sooner than on the unpardonable sin of making a mistake ? Will [you]893-you , like the rest of [this wise world]908-this wise world , let [a man]445-a man ’s spirit rot asleep into the pit , if [he]445-a man will only lie quiet and not disturb [your]893-you smooth respectabilities ; but if [he]445-a man dares , in waking , to yawn in an unorthodox manner , knock [him]445-a man on the head at once , and “ break the bruised reed , ” and “ quench the smoking flax ” ? And yet [[you]893-you churchgoers]910-you churchgoers have “ renounced [the world]475-the world ” ! ’ ‘[893-you] What do [you]893-you want , in Heaven ’s name ? ’ asked [Argemone]150-argemone , half terrified . ‘[893-you] [I]0-i want [you]893-you to tell [me]0-i that . Here [I]0-i am , with youth , health , strength , money , every blessing of life but one ; and [I]0-i am utterly miserable . [I]0-i want [some one]666-some one to tell [me]0-i what [I]0-i want . ’ ‘[666-some one] Is it not that [you]893-you want — religion ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i see hundreds who have what [you]893-you call religion , with whom [I]0-i should scorn to change [my]0-i irreligion . ’ ‘[137-mr. smith] But , [Mr. Smith]137-mr. smith , are [you]137-mr. smith not — are [you]137-mr. smith not wicked?—They tell [me]0-i so , ’ said [Argemone]150-argemone , with an effort , ‘[0-i] And is that not the cause of [your]137-mr. smith disease ? ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot laughed . ‘[913-fairest prophetess] No , [fairest prophetess]913-fairest prophetess , it is the disease itself . “ Why am [I]0-i what [I]0-i am , when [I]0-i know more and more daily what [I]0-i could be?”—That is the mystery ; and [my]0-i sins are the fruit , and not the root of it . Who will explain that ? ’ [Argemone]150-argemone began , — ‘[189-miss lavington] [The Church]863-the church — ’ ‘[189-miss lavington] Oh , [Miss Lavington]189-miss lavington , ’ cried [he]0-i , impatiently , ‘[189-miss lavington] will [you]189-miss lavington , too , send [me]0-i back to that cold abstraction ? [I]0-i came to [you]189-miss lavington , however presumptuous , for living , human advice to a living , human heart ; and will [you]189-miss lavington pass off on [me]0-i that Proteus - dream the Church , which in [every man]3304-every man ’s mouth has a different meaning ? In one book , meaning a method of education , only it has never been carried out ; in another , a system of polity,—only it has never been realised;—now a set of words written in books , on whose meaning all are divided ; now a body of [men who are daily excommunicating each other]916-men who are daily excommunicating each other as [heretics and apostates]917-heretics and apostates ; now a universal idea ; now the narrowest and most exclusive of all parties . Really , before [you]189-miss lavington ask [me]0-i to hear [the Church]24-the church , [I]0-i have a right to ask [you]189-miss lavington to define what the Church is . ’ ‘[918-our] [Our]918-our Articles define it , ’ said [Argemone]150-argemone drily . ‘[918-our] The “ [Visible Church]25-visible church , ” at least , it defines as “ a company of [faithful men , in which , ” etc]919-faithful men , in which , ” etc . But how does it define [the “ Invisible ” one]920-the “ invisible ” one ? And what does “ [faithful ”]921-faithful ” mean ? What if [I]0-i thought [Cromwell]199-cromwell and [Pierre Leroux]200-pierre leroux infinitely [more faithful men in [their]922-more faithful men in their way way]922-more faithful men in their way , and [better members of the “ [Invisible Church]924-invisible church]923-better members of the “ invisible church , ” than [the torturer - pedant Laud]925-the torturer - pedant laud , or the facing bothways [Protestant - Manichee Taylor]201-protestant - manichee taylor ? ’ It was lucky for the life of [young Love]202-young love that the discussion went no further : [Argemone]150-argemone was becoming scandalised beyond all measure . But , happily , [the colonel]504-the colonel interposed , — ‘[201-protestant - manichee taylor] Look here ; tell [me]0-i if [you]189-miss lavington know for whom this sketch is meant ? ’ ‘[3350-the keeper] [Tregarva]173-tregarva , [the keeper]3350-the keeper : who can doubt ? ’ answered [they]3459-they both at once . ‘[173-tregarva] Has not [Mellot]182-claude succeeded perfectly ? ’ ‘[3350-the keeper] Yes , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[3350-the keeper] But what wonder , with such a noble subject ! What [a grand benevolence]927-a grand benevolence is enthroned on that lofty forehead ! ’ ‘[927-a grand benevolence] Oh , [you]189-miss lavington would say so , indeed , ’ interposed [Honoria]162-honoria , ‘[189-miss lavington] if [you]189-miss lavington knew [him]182-claude ! The stories that [I]0-i could tell [you]189-miss lavington about [him]182-claude ! How [he]182-claude would go into [cottages]928-cottages , read to [sick people]929-sick people by the hour , dress [the children]930-the children , cook the food for [them]930-the children , as tenderly as [any woman]931-any woman ! [I]0-i found out , last winter , if [you]189-miss lavington will believe it , that [he]182-claude lived on bread and water , to give out of [his]182-claude own wages — which are barely twelve shillings a week — five shillings a week for more than two months to [a poor labouring man]932-a poor labouring man , to prevent [his]182-claude going to [the workhouse]933-the workhouse , and being parted from [[his]182-claude wife]934-his wife and [children]935-children . ’ ‘[182-claude] Noble , indeed ! ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i do not wonder now at the effect [his]182-claude conversation just now had on [me]0-i . ’ ‘[182-claude] Has [he]182-claude been talking to [you]0-i ? ’ said [Honoria]162-honoria eagerly . ‘[182-claude] [He]182-claude seldom speaks to [any one]936-any one . ’ ‘[182-claude] [He]182-claude has to [me]0-i ; and so well , that were [I]0-i sure that [the poor]698-the poor were as ill off as [he]182-claude says , and that [I]0-i had the power of altering the system a hair , [I]0-i could find it in [my]0-i heart to excuse [all political grievance - mongers]938-all political grievance - mongers , and turn one [myself]0-i . ’ [Claude Mellot]182-claude clapped [his]182-claude white woman - like hands . ‘[203-bravo] [Bravo]203-bravo ! bravo ! [[O wonderful conversion !]939-o wonderful conversion !]939-o wonderful conversion ! [Lancelot]172-lancelot has at last discovered that , besides the “ glorious Past , ” there is a Present worthy of [his]172-lancelot sublime notice ! [We]941-we may now hope , in time , that [he]172-lancelot will discover the existence of a Future ! ’ ‘[204-mr. mellot] But , [Mr. Mellot]204-mr. mellot , ’ said [Honoria]162-honoria , ‘[204-mr. mellot] why have [you]204-mr. mellot been so unfaithful to [your]204-mr. mellot original ? why have [you]204-mr. mellot , like [all artists]942-all artists , been trying to soften and refine on [your]204-mr. mellot model ? ’ ‘[204-mr. mellot] Because , [[my]0-i dear lady]943-my dear lady , [we]941-we are bound to see everything in its ideal — not as it is , but as it ought to be , and will be , when the vices of this pitiful civilised world are exploded , and sanitary reform , and a variety of occupation , and harmonious education , let [each man]944-each man fulfil in body and soul the ideal which [God]281-god embodied in [him]944-each man . ’ ‘[281-god] Fourierist ! ’ cried [Lancelot]172-lancelot , laughing . ‘[281-god] But surely [you]204-mr. mellot never saw a face which had lost by wear less of the divine image ? How thoroughly it exemplifies [your]204-mr. mellot great law of Protestant art , that “ the Ideal is best manifested in the Peculiar . ” How classic , how independent of clime or race , is its bland , majestic self - possession ! how thoroughly [Norse]205-norse [its]205-norse massive squareness ! ’ ‘[205-norse] And yet , as [a Cornishman]945-a cornishman , [he]945-a cornishman should be [no Norseman]946-no norseman . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]204-mr. mellot pardon ! Like [all noble races]947-all noble races , [the Cornish]206-the cornish owe [their]206-the cornish nobleness to the impurity of [their]206-the cornish blood — to its perpetual loans from foreign veins . See how the serpentine curve of [his]945-a cornishman nose , [his]945-a cornishman long nostril , and protruding , sharp - cut lips , mark [his]945-a cornishman share of Phœnician or Jewish blood ! how Norse , again , that dome - shaped forehead ! how Celtic those dark curls , that restless gray eye , with its “ swinden blicken , ” like [Von Troneg Hagen]207-von troneg hagen ’s in the Niebelungen Lied ! ’ [He]945-a cornishman turned : [Honoria]162-honoria was devouring [his]945-a cornishman words . [He]945-a cornishman saw it , for [he]945-a cornishman was in love , and young love makes [man]564-man ’s senses as keen as [woman]458-woman ’s . ‘[207-von troneg hagen] Look ! look at [him]945-a cornishman now ! ’ said [Claude]182-claude , in a low voice . ‘[207-von troneg hagen] How [he]945-a cornishman sits , with [his]945-a cornishman hands on [his]945-a cornishman knees , the enormous size of [his]945-a cornishman limbs quite concealed by the careless grace , with [his]945-a cornishman Egyptian face , like [some dumb granite Memnon]948-some dumb granite memnon ! ’ ‘[948-some dumb granite memnon] Only waiting , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[948-some dumb granite memnon] for the day - star to arise on [him]945-a cornishman and awake [him]945-a cornishman into voice . ’ [He]172-lancelot looked at [Honoria]162-honoria as [he]172-lancelot spoke . [She]162-honoria blushed angrily ; and yet a sort of sympathy arose from that moment between [Lancelot]172-lancelot and [herself]162-honoria . [[Our]3462-our hero]3453-our hero feared [he]172-lancelot had gone too far , and tried to turn the subject off . [The smooth mill - head]3464-the smooth mill - head was alive with rising trout . ‘[948-some dumb granite memnon] What a huge fish leapt then ! ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot carelessly ; ‘[948-some dumb granite memnon] and close to [the bridge]729-the bridge , too ! ’ [Honoria]162-honoria looked round , and uttered a piercing scream . ‘[950-my dog] Oh , [my]0-i dog ! [[my]0-i dog]950-my dog ! [Mops]208-mops is in [the river]505-the river ! [That horrid gazelle]952-that horrid gazelle has butted [him]208-mops in , and [he]208-mops ’ll be drowned ! ’ Alas ! it was too true . There , a yard above the one open hatchway , through which the whole force of [the stream]526-the stream was rushing , was the unhappy [Mops]208-mops , alias [Scratch]209-scratch , [alias Dirty Dick]210-alias dirty dick , alias [Jack Sheppard]211-jack sheppard , paddling , and sneezing , and winking , [his]208-mops little bald muzzle turned piteously upward to the sky . ‘[208-mops] [He]208-mops will be drowned ! ’ quoth [the colonel]504-the colonel . There was no doubt of it ; and so [Mops]208-mops thought , as , shivering and whining , [he]208-mops plied every leg , while the glassy current dragged [him]208-mops back and back , and [Honoria]162-honoria sobbed like [a child]3467-a child . [The colonel]504-the colonel lay down on [the bridge]729-the bridge , and caught at [him]208-mops : [his]504-the colonel arm was a foot too short . In a moment the huge form of [Tregarva]173-tregarva plunged solemnly into the water , with a splash like seven salmon , and [Mops]208-mops was jerked out over [the colonel]504-the colonel ’s head high and dry on to [the bridge]729-the bridge . ‘[208-mops] [You]208-mops ’ll be drowned , at least ! ’ shouted [the colonel]504-the colonel , with an oath of [Uncle Toby]212-uncle toby ’s own . [Tregarva]173-tregarva saw [his]173-tregarva danger , made one desperate bound upward , and missed [the bridge]729-the bridge . [The colonel]504-the colonel caught at [him]208-mops , tore off a piece of [his]504-the colonel collar — the calm , solemn face of [the keeper]3350-the keeper flashed past beneath [him]504-the colonel , and disappeared through the roaring gate . [They]3476-they rushed to the other side of [the bridge]729-the bridge — caught one glimpse of [a dark body fleeting and roaring down the foam - way]3478-a dark body fleeting and roaring down the foam - way . [The colonel]504-the colonel leapt the bridge - rail like a deer , rushed out along the buck - stage , tore off [his]504-the colonel coat , and sprung headlong into [the boiling pool]3480-the boiling pool , ‘[208-mops] rejoicing in [his]953-his might , ’ as [old Homer]213-homer would say . [Lancelot]172-lancelot , forgetting [his]172-lancelot crutches , was dashing after [him]504-the colonel , when [he]172-lancelot felt a soft hand clutching at [his]172-lancelot arm . ‘[208-mops] [Lancelot]172-lancelot ! [Mr. Smith]137-mr. smith ! ’ cried [Argemone]150-argemone . ‘[137-mr. smith] [You]172-lancelot shall not go ! [You]172-lancelot are too ill — weak — ’ ‘[172-lancelot] [A fellow - creature]954-a fellow - creature ’s life ! ’ ‘[172-lancelot] What is [his]954-a fellow - creature life to [yours]172-lancelot ? ’ [she]150-argemone cried , in a tone of deep passion . And then , imperiously , ‘[172-lancelot] Stay here , [I]0-i command [you]172-lancelot ! ’ The magnetic touch of [her]150-argemone hand thrilled through [his]172-lancelot whole frame . [She]150-argemone had called [him]172-lancelot [Lancelot]172-lancelot ! [He]172-lancelot shrank down , and stood spell - bound . ‘[0-i] Good heavens ! ’ [she]150-argemone cried ; ‘[0-i] look at [[my]0-i sister]955-my sister ! ’ Out on the extremity of [the buck - stage]3481-the buck - stage ( how [she]150-argemone got there neither [they]3482-they nor [she]150-argemone ever knew ) crouched [Honoria]162-honoria , [her]150-argemone face idiotic with terror , while [she]150-argemone stared with bursting eyes into the foam . A shriek of disappointment rose from [her]150-argemone lips , as in a moment [the colonel]504-the colonel ’s weather - worn head reappeared above , looking for all [the world]475-the world like an old gray shiny - painted seal . ‘[0-i] Poof ! tally - ho ! Poof ! poof ! Heave [me]0-i a piece of wood , [Lancelot]172-lancelot , [[my]0-i boy]956-my boy ! ’ And [he]504-the colonel disappeared again . [They]3482-they looked round , there was not a loose bit near . [Claude]182-claude ran off towards [the house]3485-the house . [Lancelot]172-lancelot , desperate , seized the bridge - rail , tore it off by sheer strength , and hurled it far into [the pool]3407-the pool . [Argemone]150-argemone saw it , and remembered it , like [a true woman]3487-a true woman . Ay , be as Manichæan - sentimental as [you]3488-you will , [fair ladies]3489-fair ladies , physical prowess , [that Eden - right of manhood]3490-that eden - right of manhood , is sure to tell upon [your]3488-you hearts ! Again [the colonel]504-the colonel ’s grizzled head reappeared,—and , oh joy ! beneath it a draggled knot of black curls . In another instant [he]504-the colonel had hold of the rail , and quietly floating down to the shallow , dragged [the lifeless giant high and dry on a patch of gravel]3492-the lifeless giant high and dry on a patch of gravel . [Honoria]162-honoria never spoke . [She]162-honoria rose , walked quietly back along the beam , passed [Argemone]150-argemone and [Lancelot]172-lancelot without seeing [them]3482-they , and firmly but hurriedly led the way round [the pool - side]3493-the pool - side . Before [they]3482-they arrived at [the bank]3419-the bank , [the colonel]504-the colonel had carried [Tregarva]173-tregarva to [it]3419-the bank . [Lancelot]172-lancelot and [two or three workmen]3496-two or three workmen , whom [his]504-the colonel cries had attracted , lifted the body on to [the meadow]3136-the meadow . [Honoria]162-honoria knelt quietly down on the grass , and watched , silent and motionless , the dead face , with [her]162-honoria wide , awestruck eyes . ‘[172-lancelot] [God]281-god bless [her]957-his for a kind soul ! ’ whispered [the wan weather - beaten field drudges]3498-the wan weather - beaten field drudges , as [they]3498-the wan weather - beaten field drudges crowded round the body . ‘[281-god] Get out of the way , [[my]0-i men]958-my men ! ’ quoth [the colonel]504-the colonel . ‘[281-god] Too many cooks spoil the broth . ’ And [he]504-the colonel packed off one here and another there for necessaries , and commenced trying every restorative means with the ready coolness of [a practised surgeon]3500-a practised surgeon ; while [Lancelot]172-lancelot , whom [he]504-the colonel ordered about like [a baby]3501-a baby , gulped down a great choking lump of envy , and then tasted the rich delight of forgetting [himself]172-lancelot in admiring obedience to [a real superior]3502-a real superior . But there [Tregarva]173-tregarva lay lifeless , with folded hands , and a quiet satisfied smile , while [Honoria]162-honoria watched and watched with parted lips , unconscious of the presence of [every one]807-every one . Five minutes!—ten ! ‘[281-god] Carry [him]957-his to [the house]3485-the house , ’ said [the colonel]504-the colonel , in a despairing tone , after another attempt . ‘[957-his] [He]957-his moves ! ’ ‘[957-his] No ! ’ ‘[957-his] [He]957-his does ! ’ ‘[957-his] [He]957-his breathes ! ’ ‘[957-his] Look at [his]957-his eyelids ! ’ Slowly [his]957-his eyes opened . ‘[957-his] Where am [I]0-i ? All gone ? Sweet dreams — blessed dreams ! ’ [His]957-his eye met [Honoria]162-honoria ’s . One big deep sigh swelled to [his]957-his lips and burst . [She]162-honoria seemed to recollect [herself]162-honoria , rose , passed [her]162-honoria arm through [Argemone]150-argemone ’s , and walked slowly away . [Argemone]150-argemone , sweet prude , thought [herself]150-argemone bound to read [Honoria]162-honoria a lecture that night , on [her]162-honoria reckless exhibition of feeling ; but it profited little . The most consummate cunning could not have baffled [Argemone]150-argemone ’s suspicions more completely than [[her]150-argemone sister]3220-her sister ’s utter simplicity . [She]150-argemone cried just as bitterly about [Mops]208-mops ’s danger as about [the keeper]3350-the keeper ’s , and then laughed heartily at [Argemone]150-argemone ’s solemnity ; till at last , when pushed a little too hard , [she]150-argemone broke out into something very like a passion , and told [[her]150-argemone sister]3220-her sister , bitterly enough , that ‘[957-his] [she]960-she was not accustomed to see [men]612-men drowned every day , and begged to hear no more about the subject . ’ Whereat [Argemone]150-argemone prudently held [her]150-argemone tongue , knowing that under all [Honoria]162-honoria ’s tenderness lay a volcano of passionate determination , which was generally kept down by [her]162-honoria affections , but was just as likely to be maddened by [them]612-men . And so this conversation only went to increase the unconscious estrangement between [them]3508-they , though [they]3508-they continued , as [sisters]3223-sisters will do , to lavish upon [each other]565-each other the most extravagant protestations of affection — vowing to live and die only for [each other]565-each other — and believing honestly , [sweet souls]3512-sweet souls , that [they]3508-they felt all [they]3508-they said ; till real imperious Love came in , in one case of the two at least , shouldering all other affections right and left ; and then [the two beauties]3513-the two beauties discovered , as [others]3280-others do , that it is not so possible or reasonable as [they]3508-they thought for [a woman]3251-a woman to sacrifice [herself]3251-a woman and [[her]3251-a woman lover]3516-her lover for the sake of [[her]3251-a woman sister]3220-her sister or [[her]3251-a woman friend]3518-her friend . Next morning [Lancelot]172-lancelot and [the colonel]504-the colonel started out to [[Tregarva]173-tregarva ’s cottage]3520-tregarva ’s cottage , on a mission of inquiry . [They]3508-they found [the giant]3364-the giant propped up in bed with pillows , [his]3364-the giant magnificent features looking in [their]3508-they paleness more than ever like a granite Memnon . Before [him]3364-the giant lay an open [Pilgrim]214-pilgrim ’s Progress , and a drawer filled with feathers and furs , which [he]3364-the giant was busily manufacturing into trout flies , reading as [he]3364-the giant worked .
