[The room]3190-the room was filled with nets , guns , and [keepers]3523-keepers ’[960-she] tackle , while a well - filled shelf of books hung by the wall . ‘ Excuse [my]962-i rising , [gentlemen]780-gentlemen , ’[962-i] [he]962-i said , in [his]962-i slow , staid voice , ‘ but [I]962-i am very weak , in spite of [the Lord]817-the lord ’s goodness to [me]962-i . [You]780-gentlemen are very kind to think of coming to [[my]962-i poor cottage]3526-my poor cottage , ’[962-i] ‘ Well , [[my]504-the colonel man]3527-my man , ’[504-the colonel] said [the colonel]504-the colonel , ‘ and how are [you]3527-my man after [your]3527-my man cold bath ? [You]3527-my man are the heaviest fish [I]962-i ever landed ! ’[962-i] ‘ Pretty well , thank [God]281-god , and [you]3527-my man , [sir]753-sir . [I]962-i am in [your]3527-my man debt , [sir]753-sir , for the dear life . How shall [I]962-i ever repay [you]3527-my man ? ’[962-i] ‘ Repay , [[my]962-i good fellow]773-my good fellow ? [You]3527-my man would have done as much for [me]962-i . ’[962-i] ‘ May be ; but [you]3527-my man did not think of that when [you]3527-my man jumped in ; and no more must [I]962-i in thanking [you]3527-my man . By the bye , [gentlemen]780-gentlemen , [I]962-i hope [you]3527-my man have brought up some trolling - tackle ? ’[962-i] ‘ [We]3534-we came up to see [you]738-the man , and not to fish , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , charmed with the stately courtesy of [the man]738-the man . ‘ Many thanks , [gentlemen]780-gentlemen ; but [old Harry Verney]174-old harry was in [here]775-here just now , and had seen [a great jack]3537-a great jack strike , at the tail of the lower reeds . With this fresh wind [he]174-old harry will run till noon ; and [you]172-lancelot are sure of [him]174-old harry with a dace . After that , [he]174-old harry will not be up again on [the shallows]717-the shallows till sunset . [He]174-old harry works the works of darkness , and comes not to the light , because [his]174-old harry deeds are evil . ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot laughed . ‘ [He]174-old harry does but follow [[his]174-old harry kind]3539-his kind , [poor fellow]3540-poor fellow . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ No doubt , [sir]753-sir , no doubt ; [all the Lord]3542-all the lord ’s works are good : but it is a wonder why [He]174-old harry should have made wasps , now , and blights , and vermin , and jack , and such evil - featured things , that carry spite and cruelty in [their]3543-their very faces — a great wonder . Do [you]753-sir think , [sir]753-sir , all those creatures were in [the Garden of Eden]3545-the garden of eden ? ’[965-you] ‘ [You]753-sir are getting too deep for [me]172-lancelot , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ But why trouble [your]753-sir head about fishing ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]965-you beg [your]965-you pardon for preaching to [you]965-you , [sir]753-sir . [I]965-you ’m[965-you] sure [I]0-i forgot [myself]0-i . If [you]965-you will let [me]0-i , [I]0-i ’ll get up and get [you]965-you a couple of bait from the stew . Why bother [your]753-sir head about pike now ? ’ ‘[753-sir] It is [my]0-i business , [sir]753-sir , and [I]0-i am paid for it , and [I]0-i must do it thoroughly;—and abide in the calling wherein [I]0-i am called , ’ [he]0-i added , in a sadder tone . ‘[0-i] [You]753-sir seem to be fond enough of it , and to know enough about it , at all events , ’ said [the colonel]504-the colonel , ‘[753-sir] tying flies here on a sick - bed . ’ ‘[753-sir] As for being fond of it , [sir]753-sir — those creatures of [the water]688-the water teach [a man]445-a man many lessons ; and when [I]0-i tie flies , [I]0-i earn books . ’ ‘[0-i] How then ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i send [my]0-i flies all over [the country]976-the country , [sir]753-sir , to [Salisbury]26-salisbury and [Hungerford]27-hungerford , and up to [Winchester]28-winchester , even ; and the money buys [me]0-i many a wise book — all [my]0-i delight is in reading ; perhaps so much the worse for [me]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] So much the better , say , ’ answered [Lancelot]172-lancelot warmly . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’ll give [you]753-sir an order for a couple of pounds ’ worth of flies at once . ’[3364-the giant] ‘ [The Lord]3548-the lord reward [you]753-sir , [sir]753-sir , ’[3364-the giant] answered [the giant]3364-the giant . ‘ And [you]753-sir shall make [me]504-the colonel the same quantity , ’[504-the colonel] said [the colonel]504-the colonel . ‘ [You]753-sir can make salmon - flies ? ’[504-the colonel] ‘ [I]3364-the giant made a lot by pattern for [an Irish gent]3550-an irish gent , [sir]753-sir . ’[3364-the giant] ‘ Well , then , [we]3552-we ’ll send [you]753-sir some [Norway]29-norway patterns , and some golden pheasant and parrot feathers . [We]3552-we ’re[504-the colonel] going to [Norway]29-norway this summer , [you]753-sir know , [Lancelot]172-lancelot — ’ [Tregarva]173-tregarva looked up with a quaint , solemn hesitation . ‘[172-lancelot] If [you]753-sir please , [gentlemen]780-gentlemen , [you]753-sir ’ll forgive [a man]445-a man ’s conscience . ’ ‘[753-sir] Well ? ’ ‘[753-sir] But [I]0-i ’d not like to be [a party to the making of [Norway]29-norway]982-a party to the making of norway flies . ’ ‘[0-i] Here ’s [a Protectionist , with a vengeance]983-a protectionist , with a vengeance ! ’ laughed [the colonel]504-the colonel . ‘[983-a protectionist , with a vengeance] Do [you]753-sir want to keep [all [us]985-we fishermen in [England]3-england]984-all us fishermen in england ? eh ? to [fee English keepers]986-fee english keepers ? ‘ No , [sir]753-sir . There ’s pretty fishing in [Norway]29-norway , [I]753-sir hear , and [poor folk that want money]3555-poor folk that want money more than [we]985-we keepers . [God]281-god knows [we]985-we get too much — [we]985-we that hang about [great houses]3556-great houses and serve [great folks]3557-great folks ’[753-sir] pleasure — [you]753-sir toss the money down [our]985-we throats , without [our]985-we deserving it ; and [we]985-we spend it as [we]985-we get it — a deal too fast — while [hard - working labourers]987-hard - working labourers are starving . ’ ‘[753-sir] And yet [you]753-sir would keep [us]985-we in [England]3-england ? ’ ‘[753-sir] Would God [I]0-i could ! ’ ‘[753-sir] Why then , [[my]0-i good fellow]773-my good fellow ? ’ asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot , who was getting intensely interested with the calm , self - possessed earnestness of [the man]738-the man , and longed to draw [him]738-the man out . [The colonel]504-the colonel yawned . ‘[753-sir] Well , [I]0-i ’ll go and get [myself]0-i a couple of bait . Do n’t [you]773-my good fellow stir , [[my]0-i good parson - keeper]989-my good parson - keeper . [Down charge]990-down charge , [I]0-i say ! Odd if [I]0-i do n’t find a bait - net , and a rod for [myself]0-i , under the verandah . ’ ‘[0-i] [You]0-i will , [colonel]530-colonel . [I]0-i remember , now , [I]0-i set it [there]992-there last morning ; but the water washed many things out of [my]0-i brains , and some things into them — and [I]0-i forgot it like a goose . ’ ‘[0-i] Well , good - bye , and lie still . [I]0-i know what a drowning is , and more than one . A day and a night have [I]0-i been in [the deep]993-the deep , like [the man in the good book]994-the man in the good book ; and bed is the best of medicine for a ducking ; ’ and [the colonel]504-the colonel shook [him]0-i kindly by the hand and disappeared . [Lancelot]172-lancelot sat down by [the keeper]3350-the keeper ’s bed . ‘[0-i] [You]0-i ’ll get those fish - hooks into [your]0-i trousers , [sir]753-sir ; and this is a poor place to sit down in . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i want [you]0-i to say [your]0-i say out , [friend]996-friend , fish - hooks or none . ’ [The keeper]3350-the keeper looked warily at the door , and when [the colonel]504-the colonel had passed the window , balancing the trolling - rod on [his]0-i chin , and whistling merrily , [he]0-i began , — ‘[0-i] “ A day and a night have [I]0-i been in the deep!”—and brought back no more from it ! And yet [the Psalms]216-the psalms say how [they]216-the psalms that go down to [the sea]636-the sea in [ships]998-ships see the works of [the Lord!—If]217-the lord!—if [the Lord]817-the lord has opened [their]216-the psalms eyes to see [them]216-the psalms , that must mean — ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot waited . ‘[817-the lord] What [a gallant gentleman that is]1000-a gallant gentleman that is , and [a valiant man of war]1001-a valiant man of war , [I]0-i ’ll warrant,—and to have seen all the wonders [he]1001-a valiant man of war has , and yet to be wasting [his]1001-a valiant man of war span of life like that ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s heart smote [him]172-lancelot . ‘[3305-one] [One]3305-one would think , sir,—You’ll pardon [me]0-i for speaking out . ’ And the noble face worked , as [he]0-i murmured to [himself]0-i , ‘[0-i] When [ye]1003-you are brought before [kings]1004-kings and [princes]1005-princes for [my]0-i name ’s sake.—I dare not hold [my]0-i tongue , [sir]753-sir . [I]0-i am as [one risen from the dead,’—and]1007-one risen from the dead,’—and [his]0-i face flashed up into sudden enthusiasm—‘and woe to [me]0-i if [I]0-i speak not . Oh , why , why are [[you]1003-you [gentlemen]780-gentlemen]1008-you gentlemen running off to [Norway]29-norway , and [foreign parts]1010-foreign parts , whither [God]281-god has not called [you]1003-you ! Are there no graves in [Egypt]30-egypt , that [you]1003-you must go out to die in [the wilderness]1011-the wilderness ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot , quite unaccustomed to the language of [the Dissenting poor]3564-the dissenting poor , felt keenly the bad taste of the allusion . ‘[753-sir] What can [you]753-sir mean ? ’ [he]172-lancelot asked . ‘[753-sir] Pardon [me]0-i , [sir]753-sir , if [I]0-i can not speak plainly ; but are there not temptations enough here in [England]3-england that [you]753-sir must go to waste all [your]753-sir gifts , [your]753-sir scholarship , and [your]753-sir rank , far away there out of the sound of a church - going bell ? [I]0-i do n’t deny it ’s a great temptation . [I]0-i have read of [Norway]29-norway wonders in a book of one [Miss Martineau]218-miss martineau , with a strange name . ’ ‘[218-miss martineau] Feats on [the Fiord]31-the fiord ? ’ ‘[218-miss martineau] That ’s it , [sir]753-sir . [Her]218-miss martineau books are grand books to set one a - thinking ; but [she]218-miss martineau do n’t seem to see [the Lord]817-the lord in all things , does [she]218-miss martineau , [sir]753-sir ? ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot parried the question . ‘[218-miss martineau] [You]753-sir are wandering a little from the point . ’ ‘[218-miss martineau] So [I]0-i am , and thank [you]753-sir for the rebuke . There ’s where [I]0-i find [[you]753-sir [scholars]1017-scholars]1016-you scholars have the advantage of [[us]1018-us poor fellows , who pick up knowledge as [we]1018-us can]1019-us poor fellows , who pick up knowledge as we can . [Your]753-sir book - learning makes [you]753-sir stick to the point so much better . [You]753-sir are taught how to think . After all — [God]281-god forgive [me]0-i if [I]0-i ’m wrong ! but [I]281-god sometimes think that there must be more good in that human wisdom , and philosophy falsely so called , than [we]1018-us [Wesleyans]3565-wesleyans hold . Oh , [sir]753-sir , what a blessing is a good education ! What [[you]753-sir gentlemen]1008-you gentlemen might do with it , if [you]753-sir did but see [your]753-sir own power ! Are there no fish in [England]3-england , [sir]753-sir , to be caught ? precious fish , with [immortal souls]3569-immortal souls ? And is there not One who has said , “ Come with [me]281-god , and [I]281-god will make [[you]753-sir fishers of [men]612-men]3570-you fishers of men ? ” ’[281-god] ‘ Would [you]753-sir have [us]1018-us all turn parsons ? ’[281-god] ‘ Is no one to do [God]281-god ’s work except [the parson]3572-the parson , [sir]753-sir ? Oh , the game that [[you]753-sir rich folks]3574-you rich folks have in [your]753-sir hands , if [you]753-sir would but play it ! [Such a man as [Colonel Bracebridge]139-bracebridge now , with the tongue of the serpent , who can charm any living soul [he]139-bracebridge likes to [his]139-bracebridge will , as a stoat charms a rabbit]3575-such a man as colonel bracebridge now , with the tongue of the serpent , who can charm any living soul he likes to his will , as a stoat charms a rabbit . Or [you]753-sir , [sir]753-sir , with [your]753-sir tongue:—you have charmed one precious creature already . [I]172-lancelot can see it : though neither of [you]753-sir know it , yet [I]172-lancelot know it . ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot started , and blushed crimson . ‘ Oh , that [I]172-lancelot had [your]172-lancelot tongue , [sir]753-sir ! ’[172-lancelot] And [the keeper]3350-the keeper blushed crimson , too , and went on hastily , — ‘ But why could [you]172-lancelot not charm [all alike]3578-all alike ! Do not [the poor]698-the poor want [you]172-lancelot as well as [the rich]3580-the rich ? ’[3350-the keeper] ‘ What can [I]3350-the keeper do for [the poor]698-the poor , [[my]3350-the keeper good fellow]773-my good fellow ? And what do [they]698-the poor want ? Have [they]698-the poor not [houses]3583-houses , work , [a church]3584-a church , and [schools,—and poor - rates]3585-schools,—and poor - rates to fall back on ? ’[3350-the keeper] [The keeper]3350-the keeper smiled sadly . ‘ To fall back on , indeed ! and down on , too . At all events , [you]1023-you rich might help to make [Christians of [them]698-the poor]3586-christians of them , and [men of [them]698-the poor]3587-men of them . For [I]3350-the keeper ’m[3350-the keeper] beginning to fancy strangely , in spite of all [the preachers]1022-the preachers say , that , before ever [you]1023-you can make [[them]1024-them [Christians]1026-christians]1025-them christians , [you]1023-you must make [them]1024-them [men]612-men and [women]3246-women . ’ ‘[1023-you] Are [they]1024-them not so already ? ’ ‘[1023-you] Oh , [sir]753-sir , go and see ! How can [a man]445-a man be [a man in [those crowded styes]1032-those crowded styes , sleeping packed together like Irish pigs in [a steamer]1033-a steamer , never out of the fear of want , never knowing any higher amusement than [the beer - shop]1034-the beer - shop]1031-a man in those crowded styes , sleeping packed together like irish pigs in a steamer , never out of the fear of want , never knowing any higher amusement than the beer - shop ? [Those old Greeks]1035-those old greeks and [Romans]1036-romans , as [I]0-i read , were more like [men]612-men than half [[our]1038-our English labourers]1039-our english labourers . Go and see ! Ask [that sweet heavenly angel]1040-that sweet heavenly angel , [Miss Honoria,’—and]219-miss honoria,’—and [the keeper]3350-the keeper again blushed,—‘And [she]1040-that sweet heavenly angel , too , will tell [you]753-sir . [I]0-i think sometimes if [she]1040-that sweet heavenly angel had been born and bred like [[[her]1040-that sweet heavenly angel father]3219-her father ’s tenants ’ daughters]3588-her father ’s tenants ’ daughters , to sleep where [they]3588-her father ’s tenants ’ daughters sleep , and hear the talk [they]3588-her father ’s tenants ’ daughters hear , and see the things [they]3588-her father ’s tenants ’ daughters see , what would [she]1040-that sweet heavenly angel have been now ? [We]1038-our must n’t think of it . ’[3350-the keeper] And [the keeper]3350-the keeper turned [his]3350-the keeper head away , and fairly burst into tears . [Lancelot]172-lancelot was moved . ‘ Are [the poor]698-the poor very immoral , then ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [You]753-sir ask [the rector]3590-the rector , [sir]753-sir , how many [children hereabouts]3592-children hereabouts are born within six months of the wedding - day . [None of [them]3592-children hereabouts]3593-none of them marry , [sir]753-sir , till [the devil]600-the devil forces [them]3592-children hereabouts . There ’s no sadder sight than [a labourer]3596-a labourer ’s wedding now - a - days . [You]753-sir never see [the parents]3597-the parents come with [them]3592-children hereabouts . [They]3597-the parents just get [another couple]3598-another couple , that are keeping company , like [themselves]3597-the parents , and come sneaking into [church]3599-church , looking all over as if [they]3597-the parents were ashamed of it — and well [they]3597-the parents may be ! ’[3350-the keeper] ‘ Is it possible ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]3350-the keeper say , [sir]753-sir , that [God]281-god makes [[you]753-sir gentlemen]1008-you gentlemen , [gentlemen]780-gentlemen , that [you]753-sir may see into these things . [You]753-sir give away [your]753-sir charities kindly enough , but [you]753-sir do n’t know [the folks [you]753-sir give to]3603-the folks you give to . If a few of [you]753-sir would but be like [the blessed Lord]3604-the blessed lord , and stoop to go out of [the road]3605-the road , just behind the hedge , for once , among [the publicans]3606-the publicans and [harlots]3607-harlots ! Were [you]753-sir ever at [a country fair]3608-a country fair , [sir]753-sir ? Though [I]3350-the keeper suppose [I]3350-the keeper am rude for fancying that [you]753-sir could demean [yourself]753-sir to such company . ’[3350-the keeper] ‘ [I]172-lancelot should not think it demeaning [myself]172-lancelot , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , smiling ; ‘ but [I]172-lancelot never was at one , and [I]172-lancelot should like for once to see the real manners of [the poor]698-the poor . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]3350-the keeper ’m[3350-the keeper] [no haunter of such places]1044-no haunter of such places [myself]0-i , [God]281-god knows ; but — [I]0-i see [you]172-lancelot ’re in earnest now — will [you]172-lancelot come with [me]3350-the keeper , [sir,—for]3611-sir,—for once ? for [God]281-god ’s sake and [the poor]698-the poor ’s sake ? ’[3350-the keeper] ‘ [I]172-lancelot shall be delighted . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Not after [you]172-lancelot ’ve been [there]992-there , [I]3350-the keeper am afraid . ’[3350-the keeper] ‘ Well , it ’s a bargain when [you]172-lancelot are recovered . And , in the meantime , [the squire]3125-the squire ’s orders are , that [you]172-lancelot lie by for a few days to rest ; and [Miss Honoria]162-honoria ’s , too ; and [she]162-honoria has sent [you]172-lancelot down some wine . ’[3350-the keeper] ‘ [She]162-honoria thought of [me]3350-the keeper , did [she]162-honoria ? ’[3350-the keeper] And the still sad face blazed out radiant with pleasure , and then collapsed as suddenly into deep melancholy . [Lancelot]172-lancelot saw it , but said nothing ; and shaking [him]172-lancelot heartily by the hand , had [his]172-lancelot shake returned by an iron grasp , and slipped silently out of [the cottage]1045-the cottage . [The keeper]3350-the keeper lay still , gazing on vacancy . Once [he]3350-the keeper murmured to [himself]3350-the keeper , — ‘ Through strange ways — strange ways — and though [he]3350-the keeper let [them]3615-them wander out of the road in the wilderness;—we know how that goes on — ’[3350-the keeper] And then [he]3350-the keeper fell into a mixed meditation — perhaps into a prayer . At last , after [Lancelot]172-lancelot had waited long in vain , came [[his]172-lancelot cousin]3300-his cousin ’s answer to the letter which [I]0-i gave in [my]0-i second chapter . ‘ [You]3300-his cousin are not fair to [me]0-i , [good cousin]3616-good cousin ... but [I]0-i have given up expecting fairness from [Protestants]220-protestants . [I]0-i do not say that the front and the back of [my]0-i head have different makers , any more than that doves and vipers have ... and yet [I]0-i kill the viper when [I]0-i meet [him]3350-the keeper ... and so do [you]3300-his cousin ... And yet , are [we]3617-we not taught that [our]3617-we animal nature is throughout equally viperous ? ... [The Catholic Church]32-the catholic church , at least , so teaches [...]221-... [She]221-... believes in the corruption of human nature . [She]221-... believes in the literal meaning of Scripture . [She]221-... has no wish to paraphrase away [St. Paul]197-st. paul ’s awful words , that “ in [his]3350-the keeper flesh dwelleth no good thing , ” by the unscientific euphemisms of “ fallen nature ” or “ corrupt humanity . ” The boasted discovery of [phrenologists]3618-phrenologists , that thought , feeling , and passion reside in this material brain and nerves of [ours]3617-we , has ages ago been anticipated by [her]221-... simple faith in the letter of Scripture ; a faith which puts to shame the irreverent vagueness and fantastic private interpretations of those who make an idol of that very letter which [they]3618-phrenologists dare not take literally , because it makes against [their]3618-phrenologists self - willed theories ... ‘[0-i] And so [you]1048-you call [me]0-i [douce and meek]222-douce and meek ? ... [You]1048-you should remember what [I]0-i once was , [Lancelot]172-lancelot ... [I]0-i , at least , have not forgotten ... [I]0-i have not forgotten how that very animal nature , on the possession of which [you]1048-you seem to pride [yourself]1048-you , was in [me]0-i only [the parent of remorse]1049-the parent of remorse . , . . [I]0-i know it too well not to hate and fear it . Why do [you]1048-you reproach [me]0-i , if [I]0-i try to abjure it , and cast away the burden which [I]0-i am too weak to bear ? [I]0-i am weak — Would [you]1048-you have [me]0-i say that [I]0-i am strong ? Would [you]1048-you have [me]0-i try to be [a Prometheus]1050-a prometheus , while [I]0-i am longing to be once more [an infant]1051-an infant on [a mother]1052-a mother ’s breast ? Let [me]0-i alone ... [I]0-i am [a weary child]1053-a weary child , who knows nothing , can do nothing , except lose its way in arguings and reasonings , and “ find no end , in wandering mazes lost . ” Will [you]1048-you reproach [me]0-i , because when [I]0-i see a soft cradle lying open for [me]0-i ... with [a Virgin Mother]1054-a virgin mother ’s face smiling down all [woman]458-woman ’s love about it ... [I]0-i long to crawl into it , and sleep awhile ? [I]0-i want loving , indulgent sympathy ... [I]0-i want detailed , explicit guidance . .. Have [you]1048-you , then , found so much of [them]1056-them in [our]1057-our former creed , that [you]1048-you forbid [me]0-i to go to seek [them]1056-them elsewhere , in [the Church which not only professes [them]1056-them as an organised system , but practises them ... as [you]1048-you would find in [your]1048-you first half - hour ’s]1058-the church which not only professes them as an organised system , but practises them ... as you would find in your first half - hour ’s talk with [one of [[Her]1060-her priests]1061-her priests ... [true priests ... who know the heart of [man]564-man , and pity , and console , and bear for [their]1062-true priests ... who know the heart of man , and pity , and console , and bear for their flock flock]1062-true priests ... who know the heart of man , and pity , and console , and bear for their flock the burdens which [they]1062-true priests ... who know the heart of man , and pity , and console , and bear for their flock can not bear [themselves]1062-true priests ... who know the heart of man , and pity , and console , and bear for their flock]1059-one of her priests ... true priests ... who know the heart of man , and pity , and console , and bear for their flock the burdens which they can not bear themselves ? [You]1048-you ask [me]0-i who will teach [a fast young man]1064-a fast young man ? ... [I]0-i answer , [the Jesuit]1065-the jesuit . Ay , start and sneer , at [that delicate woman]1066-that delicate woman - like tenderness , that subtle instinctive sympathy , which [you]1048-you have never felt ... which is as new to [me]0-i , alas , as it would be to [you]1048-you ! For if there be none now - a - days to teach such as [you]1048-you , who is there who will teach such as [me]0-i ? Do not fancy that [I]0-i have not craved and searched for [teachers]1067-teachers ... [I]0-i went to [one party]1068-one party long ago , and [they]1067-teachers commanded [me]0-i , as the price of [their]1067-teachers sympathy , even of anything but [their]1067-teachers denunciations , to ignore , if not to abjure , all the very points on which [I]0-i came for light — [my]0-i love for the Beautiful and the Symbolic — [my]0-i desire to consecrate and christianise it — [my]0-i longing for a human voice to tell [me]0-i with authority that [I]0-i was forgiven — [my]0-i desire to find some practical and palpable communion between [myself]0-i and [the saints of old]1069-the saints of old . [They]1067-teachers told [me]0-i to cast away , as an accursed chaos , a thousand years of Christian history , and believe that [the devil]600-the devil had been for ages ... just the ages [I]0-i thought noblest , most faithful , most interpenetrated with the thought of [God]281-god ... triumphant over [that church with which [He]281-god had promised to be till the end of [the world]475-the world]1071-that church with which he had promised to be till the end of the world . [No ... by the bye]1073-no ... by the bye , [they]1067-teachers made two exceptions — of [their]1067-teachers own choosing . One in favour of [the Albigenses]223-the albigenses ... who seemed to [me]0-i , from the original documents , to have been very profligate Infidels , of whom [the world]475-the world was well rid ... and [the Piedmontese]1075-the piedmontese ... [poor , simple , ill - used folk enough , but who certainly can not be said to have exercised much influence on the destinies of [mankind]1077-mankind]1076-poor , simple , ill - used folk enough , but who certainly can not be said to have exercised much influence on the destinies of mankind ... and all the rest was chaos and the pit . There never had been , never would be , [a kingdom of [God]281-god on [earth]724-earth]1078-a kingdom of god on earth , but only [a few scattered individuals]1080-a few scattered individuals , each selfishly intent on the salvation of [his]1080-a few scattered individuals own soul — without organisation , without unity , without common purpose , without even a masonic sign whereby to know [one another]1081-one another when [they]1067-teachers chanced to meet . .. except [Shibboleths]224-shibboleths which [the hypocrite]1082-the hypocrite could ape , and virtues which [the heathen]1083-the heathen have performed ... Would [you]1084-i have had [me]0-i accept such a “ Philosophy of History ” ? ‘ And then [I]1084-i went to [another school]3619-another school ... or rather wandered up and down between those whom [I]1084-i have just described , and those who boast on [their]1067-teachers side prescriptive right , and apostolic succession ... and [I]1084-i found that [their]1067-teachers ancient charter went back — just three hundred years ... and there derived its transmitted virtue , it seemed to [me]1084-i , by something very like obtaining goods on false pretences , from the very church which it now anathematises . Disheartened , but not hopeless , [I]1084-i asked how it was that [the priesthood , whose hands bestowed the grace of ordination]3620-the priesthood , whose hands bestowed the grace of ordination , could not withdraw it ... whether , at least , [the schismatic]3621-the schismatic did not forfeit it by the very act of schism ... and instead of any real answer to that fearful spiritual dilemma , [they]1067-teachers set [me]1084-i down to folios of [Nag]225-nag ’s head controversies ... and myths of [an independent British Church]3622-an independent british church , now represented , strangely enough , by [those Saxons who , after its wicked refusal to communicate with [them]1067-teachers , exterminated [it]3622-an independent british church [with fire and sword , and derived its own order]3624-with fire and sword , and derived its own order from [St. Gregory]226-st. gregory ... and decisions of mythical old councils ( held by bishops of a different faith and practice from [their]3620-the priesthood , whose hands bestowed the grace of ordination own]3623-those saxons who , after its wicked refusal to communicate with them , exterminated it with fire and sword , and derived its own order from st. gregory ... and decisions of mythical old councils ( held by bishops of a different faith and practice from their own ) , from which [I]1084-i was to pick the one point which made for [them]1067-teachers , and omit the nine which made against [them]1067-teachers , while [I]1084-i was to believe , by a stretch of imagination ... or common honesty ... , which [I]1084-i leave [you]3625-you to conceive , that [the Church of [Syria]33-syria]3626-the church of syria in the fourth century was , in doctrine , practice , and constitution , like that of [England]3-england in the nineteenth ? ... And what was [I]1084-i to gain by all this ? ... For the sake of what was [I]1084-i to strain logic and conscience ? To believe [myself]1084-i [a member of the same body with [all the Christian nations of the earth?—to]3628-all the christian nations of the earth?—to be able to hail [the Frenchman]3629-the frenchman , [the Italian]3630-the italian , [the Spaniard]3631-the spaniard , as [a brother]3632-a brother]3627-a member of the same body with all the christian nations of the earth?—to be able to hail the frenchman , the italian , the spaniard , as a brother — to have hopes even of [the German]3633-the german and [the Swede]3634-the swede ... if not in this life , still in the life to come ? No ... to be able still to sit apart from all [Christendom]34-christendom in the exclusive pride of insular Pharisaism ; to claim for the modern littleness of [England]3-england the infallibility which [I]1084-i denied to [the primæval mother of [Christendom]34-christendom]3635-the primæval mother of christendom , not to enlarge [my]1084-i communion to [the Catholic]3636-the catholic , but excommunicate , to all practical purposes , over and above [the Catholics]850-the catholics , [all other Protestants except [[my]1084-i own sect]3639-my own sect]3638-all other protestants except my own sect ... or rather , in practice , except [[my]1084-i own party in [[my]1084-i own sect]3639-my own sect]3640-my own party in my own sect ... And this was believing in one Catholic and Apostolic church ! ... this was to be [my]1084-i share of the communion of [saints]3642-saints ! And these were the theories which were to satisfy a soul which longed for [a kingdom of God on [earth]724-earth]1078-a kingdom of god on earth , which felt that unless the highest of [His]172-lancelot promises are a mythic dream , there must be some system on [the earth]866-the earth commissioned to fulfil those promises ; some authority divinely appointed to regenerate , and rule , and guide the lives of [men]612-men , and the destinies of [nations]3277-nations ; who must go mad , unless [he]172-lancelot finds that history is not a dreary aimless procession of lost spirits descending into the pit , or that the salvation of [millions]3648-millions does not depend on an obscure and controverted hair ’s breadth of ecclesiastic law . ‘[1084-i] [I]0-i have tried [them]1085-them both , [Lancelot]172-lancelot , and found [them]1085-them wanting ; and now but [one road]1086-one road remains ... Home , to the fountain - head ; to [the mother of all the churches whose fancied cruelty to [[her]1087-the mother of all the churches whose fancied cruelty to her children children]1088-her children]1087-the mother of all the churches whose fancied cruelty to her children can no more destroy [her]1087-the mother of all the churches whose fancied cruelty to her children motherhood , than [their]1088-her children confest rebellion can ... Shall [I]0-i not hear [her]1087-the mother of all the churches whose fancied cruelty to her children voice , when [she]1087-the mother of all the churches whose fancied cruelty to her children , and [she]1087-the mother of all the churches whose fancied cruelty to her children alone cries to [me]0-i , “ [I]0-i have authority and commission from [the King of [kings]1004-kings]1089-the king of kings to regenerate [the world]475-the world . History is a chaos , only because [mankind]1077-mankind has been ever rebelling against [me]0-i , [[its]1077-mankind lawful ruler]1093-its lawful ruler ... and yet not a chaos ... for [I]0-i still stand , and grow rooted on the rock of ages , and under [my]0-i boughs are fowl of every wing . [I]0-i alone have been and am consistent , progressive , expansive , welcoming every race , and intellect and character into its proper place in [my]0-i great organism ... meeting alike the wants of [the king]1094-the king and [the beggar]1095-the beggar , [the artist]3180-the artist and [the devotee]677-the devotee ... there is free room for all within [my]0-i heaven - wide bosom . Infallibility is not the exclusive heritage of [one proud and ignorant Island]1098-one proud and ignorant island , but of a system which knows no distinction of language , race , or clime . The communion of [saints]3642-saints is not a bygone tale , for [[my]0-i saints , redeemed from every age and every nation under heaven]1100-my saints , redeemed from every age and every nation under heaven , still live , and love , and help and intercede . The union of [heaven]1101-heaven and [earth]724-earth is not a barbaric myth ; for [I]0-i have still [my]0-i miracles , [[my]0-i Host]1103-my host , [my]0-i exorcism , [my]0-i absolution . The present rule of [God]281-god is still , as ever , a living reality ; for [I]0-i rule in [His]281-god name , and fulfil all [His]281-god will . ” ‘ How can [I]0-i turn away from such a voice ? What if some of [her]3649-she doctrines may startle [my]0-i untutored and ignorant understanding ? ... If [she]3649-she is [the appointed teacher]3650-the appointed teacher , [she]3649-she will know best what truths to teach ... [The disciple]3651-the disciple is not above [[his]3651-the disciple master]567-his master ... or wise in requiring [him]3651-the disciple to demonstrate the abstrusest problems ... spiritual problems , too ... before [he]3651-the disciple allows [his]3651-the disciple right to teach the elements . Humbly [I]0-i must enter [the temple porch]3653-the temple porch ; gradually and trustfully proceed with [my]0-i initiation ... When that is past , and not before ... shall [I]0-i be [a fit judge of the mysteries of the inner shrine]3654-a fit judge of the mysteries of the inner shrine . ‘[0-i] There ... [I]0-i have written a long letter ... with [my]0-i own heart ’s blood ... . Think over it well , before [you]1104-you despise it ... And if [you]1104-you can refute it for [me]0-i , and sweep the whole away like a wild dream when [one]3305-one awakes , [none]1106-none will be more thankful — paradoxical as it may seem — than [[your]1104-you unhappy Cousin]1107-your unhappy cousin . ’ And [Lancelot]172-lancelot did consider that letter , and answered it as follows : — ‘[1107-your unhappy cousin] It is a relief to [me]0-i at least , [dear Luke]137-mr. smith , that [you]137-mr. smith are going to [Rome]21-rome in search of a great idea , and not merely from selfish superstitious terror ( as [I]0-i should call it ) about the “ salvation of [your]137-mr. smith soul . ” And it is a new and very important thought to [me]0-i , that [Rome]21-rome ’s scheme of [this world]1108-this world , rather than of the next , forms [her]21-rome chief allurement . But as for that flesh and spirit question , or the apostolic succession one either ; all [you]1104-you seem to [me]0-i , as a looker on , to have logically proved , is that [Protestants , orthodox and unorthodox]1109-protestants , orthodox and unorthodox , must be a little more scientific and careful in [their]1109-protestants , orthodox and unorthodox use of the terms . But as for adopting [your]1104-you use of them , and the consequences thereof — [you]1104-you must pardon [me]0-i , and [I]0-i suspect , [them]1110-them too . Not that . Anything but that . Whatever is right , that is wrong . Better to be inconsistent in truth , than consistent in a mistake . And [your]1104-you Romish idea of [man]564-man is a mistake — utterly wrong and absurd — except in the one requirement of righteousness and godliness , which [Protestants]1112-protestants and [heathen philosophers]1113-heathen philosophers have required and do require just as much as [you]1104-you . [[My]0-i dear]1114-my dear [Luke]137-mr. smith , [[your]1104-you ideal men]1115-your ideal men and [women]3246-women wo n’t do — for [they]1115-your ideal men are not [men]612-men and [women]3246-women at all , but what [you]1104-you call “ [saints ”]1119-saints ” ... [Your]1104-you Calendar , [your]1104-you historic list of [the Earth]35-the earth ’s worthies , wo n’t do — not [they]1115-your ideal men , but [others]3280-others , are [the people who have brought Humanity thus far]1121-the people who have brought humanity thus far . [I]0-i do n’t deny that there are [great souls among [them]1115-your ideal men]1122-great souls among them ; [Beckets]227-beckets , and [Hugh Grostêtes]228-hugh grostêtes , and [Elizabeths of Hungary]229-elizabeths of hungary . But [you]1104-you are [the last people]1123-the last people to praise [them]1115-your ideal men , for [you]1104-you do n’t understand [them]1115-your ideal men . [Thierry]230-thierry honours [Thomas à Becket]138-tom more than [all Canonisations]1124-all canonisations and [worshippers]1125-worshippers do , because [he]138-tom does see where [the man]738-the man ’s true greatness lay , and [you]1104-you do n’t . Why , [you]1104-you may hunt all [Surius]231-surius for such a biography of [a mediaeval worthy as [Carlyle]126-mr. carlyle has given of [[your]1104-you Abbot Samson]1128-your abbot samson]1127-a mediaeval worthy as carlyle has given of your abbot samson . [I]0-i have read , or tried to read [your]1104-you Surius , and [Alban Butler]232-alban butler , and so forth — and [they]1129-they seemed to [me]0-i bats and asses — [One]3305-one really pitied [the poor saints]1131-the poor saints and [martyrs]1132-martyrs for having [such blind biographers]1133-such blind biographers — [such dunghill cocks , who overlooked the pearl of real human love and nobleness in [them]1134-such dunghill cocks , who overlooked the pearl of real human love and nobleness in them , in their greediness to snatch up and parade the rotten chaff of superstition , and self - torture , and spiritual dyspepsia , which had overlaid it , in [their]1134-such dunghill cocks , who overlooked the pearl of real human love and nobleness in them , in their greediness to snatch up and parade the rotten chaff of superstition , and self - torture , and spiritual dyspepsia , which had overlaid it greediness to snatch up and parade the rotten chaff of superstition , and self - torture , and spiritual dyspepsia , which had overlaid it]1134-such dunghill cocks , who overlooked the pearl of real human love and nobleness in them , in their greediness to snatch up and parade the rotten chaff of superstition , and self - torture , and spiritual dyspepsia , which had overlaid it . [[My]0-i dear fellow]3322-my dear fellow , that Calendar ruins [your]1104-you cause — [you]1104-you are “ [sacrés aristocrates”—kings]1136-sacrés aristocrates”—kings and [queens]1137-queens , [bishops]1138-bishops and [virgins]1139-virgins by the hundred at one end ; [a beggar or two at the other]1140-a beggar or two at the other ; and but [one real human]1141-one real human lay [St. Homobonus]233-st. homobonus to fill up the great gulf between — A pretty list to allure [the English middle classes]1142-the english middle classes , or the Lancashire working - men!—Almost as charmingly suited to [England]3-england as the present free , industrious , enlightened , and moral state of [that Eternal City]1143-that eternal city , which has been blest with the visible presence and peculiar rule , temporal as well as spiritual , too , of [[your]1104-you Dalai Lama]1144-your dalai lama . [His]1144-your dalai lama pills do not seem to have had much practical effect there ... [My]0-i good [Luke]137-mr. smith , till [he]1144-your dalai lama can show [us]1145-us a little better specimen of [the kingdom of Heaven]1146-the kingdom of heaven organised and realised on [earth]724-earth , in [the country which does belong to [him]1144-your dalai lama , soil and [people]3181-people , body and soul]1148-the country which does belong to him , soil and people , body and soul , [we]1145-us must decline [his]1144-your dalai lama assistance in realising [that kingdom in [countries which do n’t]1151-countries which do n’t belong to [him]1144-your dalai lama]1150-that kingdom in countries which do n’t belong to him . If the state of [Rome]21-rome do n’t show [his]1144-your dalai lama idea of [man]564-man and society to be a rotten lie , what proof would [you]1104-you have ? ... perhaps the charming results of a century of Jesuitocracy , as they were represented on a French stage in the year 1793 ? [I]0-i ca n’t answer [his]1144-your dalai lama arguments , [you]1104-you see , or [yours]1104-you either ; [I]0-i am [an Englishman]1153-an englishman , and not [a controversialist]1154-a controversialist . The only answer [I]0-i give is [John Bull]234-john bull ’s old dumb instinctive “ Everlasting No ! ” which [he]234-john bull will stand by , if need be , with sharp shot and cold steel—“Not that ; anything but that . [No kingdom of [Heaven]215-heaven]1155-no kingdom of heaven at all for [us]1156-us , if [the kingdom of Heaven]1146-the kingdom of heaven is like that . [No heroes]1158-no heroes at all for [us]1156-us , if [their]1158-no heroes heroism is to consist in [their]1158-no heroes being [not - men]1159-not - men . Better no society at all , but only a competitive wild - beast ’s den , than a sham society . Better no faith , no hope , no love , [no God]1160-no god , than shams thereof . ” [I]0-i take [my]0-i stand on fact and nature ; [you]1104-you may call [them]1161-they [idols]1162-idols and [phantoms]1163-phantoms ; [I]0-i say [they]1161-they need be so no longer to [any man]3336-any man , since [Bacon]235-bacon has taught [us]1156-us to discover the Eternal Laws under the outward phenomena . Here on blank materialism will [I]0-i stand , and testify against all Religions and Gods whatsoever , if [they]1161-they must needs be like that Roman religion , that Roman God . [I]0-i do n’t believe [they]1161-they need — not I. But if [they]1161-they need , [they]1161-they must go . [We]1156-us can not have a “ Deus quidam deceptor . ” If there be [a God]1165-a god , these trees and stones , these beasts and birds must be [His]1165-a god will , whatever else is not . [My]0-i body , and brain , and faculties , and appetites must be [His]1165-a god will , whatever else is not . Whatsoever [I]0-i can do with [them]1161-they in accordance with the constitution of [them]1161-they and nature must be [His]1165-a god will , whatever else is not . Those laws of Nature must reveal [Him]1165-a god , and be revealed by [Him]1165-a god , whatever else is not . [Man]236-man ’s scientific conquest of nature must be one phase of [[His]236-man Kingdom on [Earth]35-the earth]1166-his kingdom on earth , whatever else is not . [I]0-i do n’t deny that there are spiritual laws which [man]564-man is meant to obey — How can [I]0-i , who feel in [my]0-i own daily and inexplicable unhappiness the fruits of having broken them?—But [I]0-i do say , that those spiritual laws must be in perfect harmony with every fresh physical law which [we]1156-us discover : that they can not be intended to compete self - destructively with [each other]565-each other ; that the spiritual can not be intended to be perfected by ignoring or crushing the physical , unless [God]281-god is [a deceiver]1169-a deceiver , and [His]281-god universe a self - contradiction . And by this test alone will [I]0-i try all theories , and dogmas , and spiritualities whatsoever — Are they in accordance with the laws of nature ? And therefore when [[your]1170-your party]1171-your party compare sneeringly Romish Sanctity , and English Civilisation , [I]0-i say , “ Take [you]1170-your the Sanctity , and give [me]0-i the Civilisation ! ” The one may be a dream , for it is unnatural ; the other can not be , for it is natural ; and not an evil in it at which [you]1170-your sneer but is discovered , day by day , to be owing to some infringement of the laws of nature . When [we]1156-us “ draw bills on nature , ” as [Carlyle]126-mr. carlyle says , “ [she]1172-she honours [them,”—our ships]1173-them,”—our ships do sail ; [[our]1156-us mills]1174-our mills do work ; [[our]1156-us doctors]1175-our doctors do cure ; [[our]1156-us soldiers]1176-our soldiers do fight . And [she]1172-she does not honour [yours]1170-your ; for [[your]1170-your Jesuits]1177-your jesuits have , by [their]1177-your jesuits own confession , to lie , to swindle , to get even [man]564-man to accept [theirs]1177-your jesuits for [them]1177-your jesuits . So give [me]0-i [the political economist]1179-the political economist , [the sanitary reformer]1180-the sanitary reformer , [the engineer]1181-the engineer ; and take [your]1170-your saints and virgins , relics and miracles . The spinning - jenny and [the railroad]1182-the railroad , [Cunard ’s liners]1183-cunard ’s liners and the electric telegraph , are to [me]0-i , if not to [you]1170-your , signs that [we]1156-us are , on some points at least , in harmony with [the universe]3109-the universe ; that there is a mighty spirit working among [us]1156-us , who can not be [[your]1170-your anarchic and destroying [Devil]237-devil]1185-your anarchic and destroying devil , and therefore may be [the Ordering and Creating God]1186-the ordering and creating god . ’ Which of [them]3655-them do [you]1170-your think , [reader]3174-reader , had most right on [his]3174-reader side ? [Lancelot]172-lancelot was now so far improved in health as to return to [[his]172-lancelot little cottage ornée]3657-his little cottage ornée . [He]172-lancelot gave [himself]172-lancelot up freely to [his]172-lancelot new passion . With [his]172-lancelot comfortable fortune and good connections , the future seemed bright and possible enough as to circumstances . [He]172-lancelot knew that [Argemone]150-argemone felt for [him]172-lancelot ; how much it seemed presumptuous even to speculate , and as yet no golden - visaged meteor had arisen portentous in [his]172-lancelot amatory zodiac . [No rich man]3658-no rich man had stepped in to snatch , in spite of all [his]3658-no rich man own flocks and herds , at [the poor man]3659-the poor man ’s own ewe - lamb , and set [him]3658-no rich man barking at all [the world]475-the world , as many [a poor lover]3661-a poor lover has to do in defence of [his]3661-a poor lover morsel of enjoyment , now turned into a mere bone of contention and loadstone for all hungry kites and crows . All that had to be done was to render [himself]172-lancelot worthy of [her]150-argemone , and in doing so , to win [her]150-argemone . And now [he]172-lancelot began to feel more painfully [his]172-lancelot ignorance of society , of practical life , and the outward present . [He]172-lancelot blamed [himself]172-lancelot angrily for having , as [he]172-lancelot now thought , wasted [his]172-lancelot time on ancient histories and foreign travels , while [he]172-lancelot neglected the living wonderful present , which weltered daily round [him]172-lancelot , every face embodying [a living soul]3662-a living soul . For now [he]172-lancelot began to feel that those faces did hide living souls ; formerly [he]172-lancelot had half believed — [he]172-lancelot had tried , but from laziness , to make [himself]172-lancelot wholly believe — that [they]3663-they were all empty masks , phantasies , without interest or significance for [him]172-lancelot . But , somehow , in the light of [his]172-lancelot new love for [Argemone]150-argemone , [the whole human race]3664-the whole human race seemed glorified , brought nearer , endeared to [him]172-lancelot . So it must be . [He]172-lancelot had spoken of a law wider than [he]172-lancelot thought in [his]172-lancelot fancy , that [the angels]3665-the angels might learn love for all by love for [an individual]3666-an individual . Do [we]3667-we not all learn love so ? Is it not the first touch of [the mother]3668-the mother ’s bosom which awakens in [the infant]3669-the infant ’s heart that spark of affection which is hereafter to spread itself out towards [every human being]3670-every human being , and to lose none of [its]3670-every human being devotion for its first object , as it expands itself to innumerable new ones ? Is it not by love , too — by looking into loving human eyes , by feeling the care of loving hands,—that [the infant]3669-the infant first learns that there exist other beings beside itself?—that every body which [it]3669-the infant sees expresses a heart and will like its own ? Be sure of it . Be sure that to have found the key to one heart is to have found the key to all ; that truly to love is truly to know ; and truly to love one , is the first step towards truly loving [all who bear the same flesh and blood with the beloved]3672-all who bear the same flesh and blood with the beloved . Like [children]935-children , [we]3667-we must dress up even [our]3667-we unseen future in stage properties borrowed from the tried and palpable present , ere [we]3667-we can look at it without horror . [We]3667-we fear and hate the utterly unknown , and it only . Even pain [we]3667-we hate only when [we]3667-we can not know it ; when [we]3667-we can only feel it , without explaining it , and making it harmonise with [our]3667-we notions of [our]3667-we own deserts and destiny . And as for [human beings]3674-human beings , there surely it stands true , wherever else it may not , that all knowledge is love , and all love knowledge ; that even with the meanest , [we]3667-we can not gain a glimpse into [their]3674-human beings inward trials and struggles , without an increase of sympathy and affection . Whether [he]0-i reasoned thus or not , [Lancelot]172-lancelot found that [his]172-lancelot new interest in [the working classes]3675-the working classes was strangely quickened by [his]172-lancelot passion . It seemed the shortest and clearest way toward a practical knowledge of the present . ‘[1186-the ordering and creating god] Here , ’ [he]172-lancelot said to [himself]172-lancelot , ‘[1186-the ordering and creating god] in the investigation of existing relations between [poor and rich]1187-poor and rich , [I]0-i shall gain more real acquaintance with English society , than by dawdling centuries in [exclusive drawing - rooms]1188-exclusive drawing - rooms . ’ The inquiry had not yet presented itself to [him]172-lancelot as a duty ; perhaps so much the better , that it might be the more thoroughly a free - will offering of love . At least it opened a new field of amusement and knowledge ; it promised [him]172-lancelot new studies of human life ; and as [he]172-lancelot lay on [his]172-lancelot sofa and let [his]172-lancelot thoughts flow , [Tregarva]173-tregarva ’s dark revelations began to mix themselves with dreams about the regeneration of [the Whitford poor]3676-the whitford poor , and those again with dreams about [the heiress of [Whitford]7-whitford]3677-the heiress of whitford ; and many a luscious scene and noble plan rose brightly detailed in [his]172-lancelot exuberant imagination . For [Lancelot]172-lancelot , like [all born artists]3678-all born artists , could only think in a concrete form . [He]172-lancelot never worked out a subject without embodying it in some set oration , dialogue , or dramatic castle in the air . But the more [he]172-lancelot dreamt , the more [he]172-lancelot felt that a material beauty of flesh and blood required [a material house]3679-a material house , [baths]3680-baths , and boudoirs , conservatories , and [carriages]3681-carriages ; a safe material purse , and fixed material society ; law and order , and the established frame - work of society , gained an importance in [his]172-lancelot eyes which [they]1035-those old greeks had never had before . ‘[1035-those old greeks] Well , ’ [he]172-lancelot said to [himself]172-lancelot , ‘[1035-those old greeks] [I]0-i am turning quite practical and auld - warld . [Those old Greeks]1035-those old greeks were not so far wrong when [they]1035-those old greeks said that what made [men citizens]1190-men citizens , [patriots]1191-patriots , [heroes]3116-heroes , was the love of [wedded wife]1193-wedded wife and [child]1194-child . ’ ‘[1035-those old greeks] [Wedded wife and child!’—He]1195-wedded wife and child!’—he shrank in from the daring of the delicious thought , as if [he]0-i had intruded without invitation into [a hidden sanctuary]1196-a hidden sanctuary , and looked round for a book to drive away the dazzling picture . But even there [his]0-i thoughts were haunted by [Argemone]150-argemone ’s face , and ‘ When [his]0-i regard Was raised by intense pensiveness , two eyes , Two starry eyes , hung in the gloom of thought , And seemed , with their serene and azure smiles , To beckon [him]0-i . ’[0-i] [He]0-i took up , with a new interest ‘ Chartism , ’[150-argemone] which alone of all [Mr. Carlyle]126-mr. carlyle ’s works [he]0-i had hitherto disliked , because [his]0-i own luxurious day - dreams had always flowed in such sad discord with the terrible warnings of [the modern seer]1197-the modern seer , and [his]0-i dark vistas of starvation , crime , neglect , and discontent . ‘ Well , ’[0-i] [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i , as [he]0-i closed the book , ‘ [I]0-i suppose it is good for [us]3682-us easy - going ones now and then to face the possibility of a change . Gold has grown on [my]0-i back as feathers do on geese , without [my]0-i own will or deed ; but considering that gold , like feathers , is equally useful to [those who have]3683-those who have and [those who have not , why]3684-those who have not , why , it is worth while for the goose to remember that [he]0-i may possibly one day be plucked . And what remains ? “ [Io]238-io , ” as [Medea]239-medea says ... But [Argemone]150-argemone ? ’[0-i] ... And [Lancelot]172-lancelot felt , for the moment , as conservative as [the tutelary genius of [all special constables]1199-all special constables]1198-the tutelary genius of all special constables . As the last thought passed through [his]172-lancelot brain , [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge ’s little mustang slouched past the window , ridden ( without a saddle ) by [a horseman whom there was no mistaking for [no one]555-no one but [the immaculate colonel]1202-the immaculate colonel]1200-a horseman whom there was no mistaking for no one but the immaculate colonel , [the chevalier sans peur et sans reproche]1203-the chevalier sans peur et sans reproche , dared to go about [the country]976-the country ‘ such a figure . ’[172-lancelot] A minute afterwards [he]172-lancelot walked in , in [a student]1205-a student ’s felt hat , a ragged heather - coloured coatee , and old white ‘ regulation drills , ’[172-lancelot] shrunk half - way up [his]172-lancelot legs , a pair of embroidered Indian mocassins , and an enormous meerschaum at [his]172-lancelot button - hole . ‘ Where have [you]172-lancelot been this last week ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Over head and ears in [Young England]242-young england , till [I]738-the man fled to [you]172-lancelot for a week ’s common sense . A glass of cider , for mercy ’s sake , “ to take the taste of it out of [my]738-the man mouth , ” as [Bill Sykes]240-bill sykes has it . ’[738-the man] ‘ Where have [you]172-lancelot been staying ? ’[738-the man] ‘ With [young Lord Vieuxbois]241-lord vieuxbois , among high art and painted glass , [spade farms]3685-spade farms , and model smell - traps , rubricalities and sanitary reforms , and all other inventions , possible and impossible , for “ stretching the old formula to meet the new fact , ” as [[your]172-lancelot favourite prophet]3686-your favourite prophet says . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Till the old formula cracks under the tension . ’[738-the man] ‘ And cracks its devotees , too , [I]738-the man think . Here comes the cider ! ’[738-the man] ‘ But , [[my]172-lancelot dear fellow]3322-my dear fellow , [you]172-lancelot must not laugh at all this . [Young England]242-young england or [Peelite]243-peelite , this is all right and noble . What a yet unspoken poetry there is in that very sanitary reform ! It is the great fact of the age . [We]3688-we shall have [men]612-men arise and write epics on it , when [they]612-men have learnt that “ to the pure all things are pure , ” and that science and usefulness contain a divine element , even in their lowest appliances . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Write one [yourself]0-i , and call it the Chadwickiad . ’[738-the man] ‘ Why not ? ‘[244-smells] [Smells]244-smells and [the Man]738-the man [I]0-i sing . There ’s a beginning at once . Why do n’t [you]0-i rather , with [your]0-i practical power , turn [sanitary reformer]1207-sanitary reformer — [the only true soldier]1208-the only true soldier — and conquer [those real devils and “ natural enemies ” of [Englishmen]471-englishmen]1209-those real devils and “ natural enemies ” of englishmen , carbonic acid and sulphuretted hydrogen ? ’ ‘[1207-sanitary reformer] Ce n’est pas mon métier , [[my]0-i dear fellow]3322-my dear fellow . [I]0-i am miserably behind the age . [People]3181-people are getting so cursedly in earnest now - a - days , that [I]0-i shall have to bolt to [the backwoods]1213-the backwoods to amuse [myself]0-i in peace ; or else sham dumb as the monkeys do , lest [folks]1214-folks should find out that [I]0-i ’m rational , and set [me]172-lancelot to work . ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot laughed and sighed . ‘ But how on earth do [you]0-i contrive to get on so well with men with whom [you]0-i have not an idea in common ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Savoir faire , [O infant Hercules]3690-o infant hercules ! own daddy to savoir vivre . [I]504-the colonel am [a good listener]3691-a good listener ; and , therefore , the most perfect , because the most silent , of [flatterers]3692-flatterers . When [they]3692-flatterers talk Puginesquery , [I]504-the colonel stick [my]504-the colonel head on one side attentively , and “ think the more , ” like [the lady]3454-the lady ’s parrot . [I]504-the colonel have been all the morning looking over a set of drawings for [[[my]504-the colonel lord]3694-my lord ’s new chapel]3695-my lord ’s new chapel ; and [every soul in the party]3696-every soul in the party fancies [me]504-the colonel a great antiquary , just because [I]504-the colonel have been retailing to [B]245-b as [my]504-the colonel own everything that [A]246-a told [me]504-the colonel the moment before . ’[504-the colonel] ‘ [I]172-lancelot envy [you]172-lancelot [your]172-lancelot tact , at all events . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Why [the deuce]3697-the deuce should [you]172-lancelot ? [You]172-lancelot may rise in time to something better than tact ; to what the good book , [I]172-lancelot suppose , means by “ wisdom . ” [Young geniuses like [you]172-lancelot , who have been green enough to sell [your]172-lancelot souls to “ truth , ”]3698-young geniuses like you , who have been green enough to sell your souls to “ truth , ” must not meddle with tact , unless [you]172-lancelot wish to fare as the donkey did when [he]3699-he tried to play lap - dog . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ At all events , [I]172-lancelot would sooner remain cub till [they]3698-young geniuses like you , who have been green enough to sell your souls to “ truth , ” run [me]172-lancelot down and eat [me]172-lancelot , than give up speaking [my]172-lancelot mind , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ [Fool]3700-fool [I]172-lancelot may be , but [the devil]600-the devil [himself]600-the devil sha n’t make [me]172-lancelot knave . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Quite proper . On two thousand a year [a man]445-a man can afford to be honest . Kick out lustily right and left!—After all , [the world]475-the world is like a spaniel ; the more [you]172-lancelot beat it , the better it likes [you]172-lancelot — if [you]172-lancelot have money . Only do n’t kick too hard ; for , after all , it has a hundred million pair of shins to [your]172-lancelot one . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Do n’t fear that [I]172-lancelot shall run a - muck against society just now . [I]172-lancelot am too thoroughly out of [my]172-lancelot own good books . [I]172-lancelot have been for years laughing at [Young England]242-young england , and yet [its]242-young england little finger is thicker than [my]172-lancelot whole body , for it is trying to do something ; and [I]172-lancelot , alas , am doing utterly nothing . [I]172-lancelot should be really glad to take a lesson of [these men]3704-these men and [their]3704-these men plans for social improvement . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [You]172-lancelot will have a fine opportunity this evening . Do n’t [you]172-lancelot dine at [Minchampstead]39-minchampstead ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Yes . Do [you]172-lancelot ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [Mr. Jingle]247-mr. jingle dines everywhere , except at [home]452-home . Will [you]172-lancelot take [me]172-lancelot over in [[your]172-lancelot trap]3706-your trap ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Done . But between [Saint Venus]184-venus and [Vieuxbois]241-lord vieuxbois [you]172-lancelot may soon learn enough to make [you]172-lancelot [a sadder man]3710-a sadder man , if not [a wiser one]3711-a wiser one . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Why not [a wiser one]3711-a wiser one ? Sadder than now [I]504-the colonel can not be ; or less wise , [God]281-god knows . ’[504-the colonel] [The colonel]504-the colonel looked at [Lancelot]172-lancelot with one of those kindly thoughtful smiles , which came over [him]504-the colonel whenever [[his]504-the colonel better child]1216-his better child ’s heart could bubble up through the thick crust of worldliness . ‘ [[My]504-the colonel young friend]3713-my young friend , [you]172-lancelot have been a little too much on the stilts heretofore . Take care that , now [you]172-lancelot are off them , [you]172-lancelot do n’t lie down and sleep , instead of walking honestly on [your]172-lancelot legs . Have faith in [yourself]172-lancelot ; pick [these men]3704-these men ’s brains , and [all men]3715-all men ’s . [You]172-lancelot can do it . And yet faith in something [I]504-the colonel must have : in [woman]458-woman , perhaps . ’[504-the colonel] ‘ Never ! ’[504-the colonel] said [the colonel]504-the colonel , energetically . ‘ In anything but [woman]458-woman ? [She]458-woman must be led , not [leader]3721-leader . If [you]172-lancelot love [a woman]3251-a woman , make [her]3251-a woman have faith in [you]172-lancelot . [Lord Minchampstead]250-lord minchampstead was [one of [the few noblemen [Lancelot]172-lancelot had ever met who had aroused in [him]250-lord minchampstead a thorough feeling of respect]1221-the few noblemen lancelot had ever met who had aroused in him a thorough feeling of respect]1220-one of the few noblemen lancelot had ever met who had aroused in him a thorough feeling of respect . [He]250-lord minchampstead was always and in all things [a strong man]1222-a strong man . Naturally keen , ready , business - like , daring , [he]250-lord minchampstead had carved out [his]250-lord minchampstead own way through life , and opened [his]250-lord minchampstead oyster — [the world]475-the world , neither with sword nor pen , but with steam and cotton . [[His]250-lord minchampstead father]453-his father was [Mr. Obadiah Newbroom]251-mr. obadiah newbroom , of [the well - known manufacturing firm of [Newbroom]42-newbroom]1225-the well - known manufacturing firm of newbroom , [Stag]43-stag , and [Playforall]44-playforall . [I]252-tom have made [a gentleman]3733-a gentleman of [you]956-my boy , [you]956-my boy must make [a nobleman]3734-a nobleman of [yourself]956-my boy . ’[252-tom] Those were almost the last words of [the stern , thrifty , old Puritan craftsman]1233-the stern , thrifty , old puritan craftsman , and [[his]453-his father son]1227-his son never forgot them . From [a mill - owner]1235-a mill - owner [he]453-his father grew to [coal - owner]1236-coal - owner , [shipowner]1237-shipowner , [banker]1238-banker , [railway director]1239-railway director , [money - lender to [kings]1004-kings and [princes]1005-princes]1240-money - lender to kings and princes ; and last of all , as the summit of [his]453-his father own and [his]453-his father compeer ’s ambition , to [land - owner]1243-land - owner . So , at least , [they]1253-their always said ; but it was remarkable that [their]1253-their name could never be traced farther back than the dissolution of the monasteries : and [Calumnious Dryasdusts]255-calumnious dryasdusts would sometimes insolently father [their]1253-their title on [James I.]256-james i. and one of [his]256-james i. batches of bought peerages . But let [the dead]1254-the dead bury [their]1254-the dead dead . There was now [a new lord]1255-a new lord in [Minchampstead]39-minchampstead ; and [every country]1256-every country [Caliban]257-caliban was finding , to [his]257-caliban disgust , that [he]257-caliban had ‘ got [a new master]3735-a new master , ’[257-caliban] and must perforce ‘ be [a new man]3736-a new man . ’[257-caliban] Oh ! how [the squires]1257-the squires swore and [the farmers]1258-the farmers chuckled , when [the ‘ Parvenu ’]3737-the ‘ parvenu ’[3737-the ‘ parvenu ’] sold the [Minchampstead]39-minchampstead hounds , and celebrated [his]256-james i. 1st of September by exterminating every hare and pheasant on [the estate]1259-the estate ! How [the farmers]1258-the farmers swore and [the labourers]774-the labourers chuckled when [he]256-james i. took all [the cottages]1262-the cottages into [his]256-james i. own hands and rebuilt [them]1262-the cottages , set up [a first - rate industrial school]1263-a first - rate industrial school , gave [every man]3304-every man a pig and a garden , and broke up all the commons ‘ to thin the labour - market . ’[1258-the farmers] Oh , how [the labourers]774-the labourers swore and [the farmers]1258-the farmers chuckled , when [he]256-james i. put up steam - engines on all [[his]256-james i. farms]1267-his farms , refused to give away a farthing in alms , and enforced the new Poor - law to the very letter . How [the country tradesmen]1268-the country tradesmen swore , when [he]256-james i. called [them]1268-the country tradesmen ‘ a pack of [dilatory jobbers]3738-dilatory jobbers , ’[1268-the country tradesmen] and announced [his]256-james i. intention of employing [only [London]46-london [workmen]1270-workmen]1269-only london workmen for [his]256-james i. improvements . Oh ! how [they]1268-the country tradesmen all swore together ( behind [his]256-james i. back , of course , for [his]256-james i. dinners were worth eating ) , and [the very ladies]1271-the very ladies said naughty words , when [the stern political economist]1272-the stern political economist proclaimed at [his]1272-the stern political economist own table that ‘ [he]256-james i. had bought [Minchampstead]39-minchampstead for merely commercial purposes , as a profitable investment of capital , and [he]256-james i. would see that , whatever else it did , it should pay . ’[1272-the stern political economist] But [the new lord]1273-the new lord heard of all the hard words with a quiet self - possessed smile . [He]256-james i. had formed [his]256-james i. narrow theory of the universe , and [he]256-james i. was methodically and conscientiously carrying it out . True , too often , like [[poor Keats]258-poor keats ’s merchant brothers]1274-poor keats ’s merchant brothers , — ‘ [Half - ignorant]3739-half - ignorant , [he]256-james i. turned an easy wheel , Which set sharp racks at work to pinch and peel . ’[256-james i.] But of the harm which [he]256-james i. did [he]256-james i. was unconscious ; in the good which [he]256-james i. did [he]256-james i. was consistent and indefatigable ; infinitely superior , with all [his]256-james i. defects , to [the ignorant , extravagant do - nothing Squire Lavingtons]1275-the ignorant , extravagant do - nothing squire lavingtons around [him]256-james i. . At heart , however , [Mammoth - blinded]259-mammoth - blinded , [he]256-james i. was kindly and upright . [A man of a stately presence]1276-a man of a stately presence ; a broad , honest north - country face ; a high square forehead , bland and unwrinkled .
