[His]1977-the little fiend whole frame shook ; the perspiration stood on [his]1977-the little fiend forehead . As [he]1977-the little fiend took [his]1977-the little fiend railway ticket , [his]1977-the little fiend look was so haggard and painful that [the clerk]1991-the clerk asked [him]1977-the little fiend whether [he]1977-the little fiend were ill . [The train]1992-the train was just starting ; [he]1977-the little fiend threw [himself]1977-the little fiend into [a carriage]1993-a carriage — [he]1977-the little fiend would have locked [himself]1977-the little fiend in if [he]1977-the little fiend could ; and felt an inexpressible relief when [he]1977-the little fiend found [himself]1977-the little fiend rushing past [houses]3583-houses and [market - gardens]1995-market - gardens , whirled onward , whether [he]1977-the little fiend would or not , in the right path — [homeward]1996-homeward . But was it the right path ? for again the temptation flitted past [him]1977-the little fiend . [He]1977-the little fiend threw [himself]1977-the little fiend back , and tried to ask counsel of One above ; but there was no answer , nor any that regarded . [His]1977-the little fiend heart was silent , and dark as midnight fog . Why should there have been an answer ? [He]1977-the little fiend had not listened to the voice within . Did [he]1977-the little fiend wish for a miracle to show [him]1977-the little fiend [his]1977-the little fiend duty ? ‘ Not that [I]1977-the little fiend care for detection , ’[1977-the little fiend] [he]1977-the little fiend said to [himself]1977-the little fiend . ‘ What is shame to [me]1977-the little fiend ? Is it not a glory to be evil - spoken of in the cause of [God]281-god ? How can [the world]475-the world appreciate the motives of [those who are not of the world?—the divine wisdom of the serpent]4588-those who are not of the world?—the divine wisdom of the serpent — at once [the saint]4589-the saint ’s peculiar weapon , and a part of [his]4589-the saint peculiar cross , when [men]612-men call [him]4589-the saint [a deceiver]1169-a deceiver , because [they]612-men confound , forsooth , [his]4589-the saint spiritual subtlety with [their]612-men earthly cunning . Have [I]1977-the little fiend not been called “ liar , ” “ [hypocrite , ” “ Jesuit , ”]4592-hypocrite , ” “ jesuit , ” often enough already , to harden [me]1977-the little fiend towards bearing that name once again ? ’[1977-the little fiend] That led [him]1977-the little fiend into sad thoughts of [his]1977-the little fiend last few years ’ career,—of [the friends]4593-the friends and pupils whose secession to [Rome]21-rome had been attributed to [his]1977-the little fiend hypocrisy , [his]1977-the little fiend ‘[1977-the little fiend] disguised Romanism ; ’ and then the remembrance of poor [Luke Smith]137-mr. smith flashed across [him]1977-the little fiend for the first time since [he]1977-the little fiend left [the bank]3419-the bank . ‘[1977-the little fiend] [I]0-i must see [him]1997-him , ’ [he]0-i said to [himself]0-i ; ‘[0-i] [I]0-i must argue with [him]1997-him face to face . Who knows but that it may be given even to [my]0-i unworthiness to snatch [him]1997-him from [this accursed slough]1998-this accursed slough ? ’ And then [he]0-i remembered that [his]0-i way [home]452-home lay through [the city in which [the new convert ’s parish]4597-the new convert ’s parish was]4596-the city in which the new convert ’s parish was — that [the coach]4598-the coach stopped there to change horses ; and again the temptation leapt up again , stronger than ever , under the garb of an imperative call of duty . [He]0-i made no determination for or against it . [He]0-i was too weak in body and mind to resist ; and in a half sleep , broken with an aching , terrified sense of something wanting which [he]0-i could not find , [he]0-i was swept down the line , got on [the coach]4598-the coach , and mechanically , almost without knowing it , found [himself]0-i set down at [the city of A]4600-the city of a — , and [the coach]4598-the coach rattling away down [the street]4602-the street . [He]0-i sprang from [his]0-i stupor , and called madly after it — ran a few steps — ‘[1999-you] [You]1999-you might as well try to catch the clouds , [sir]753-sir , ’ said [the ostler]4603-the ostler . ‘[1999-you] [Gemmen]2001-gemmen should make up [their]2001-gemmen minds afore [they]2001-gemmen gets down . ’ Alas ! so thought [the vicar]3366-the vicar . But it was too late ; and , with a heavy heart , [he]0-i asked the way to [[the late curate]4605-the late curate ’s house]4606-the late curate ’s house . [Thither]172-lancelot [he]0-i went . [Mr. Luke Smith]137-mr. smith was just at dinner , but [the vicar]3366-the vicar was , nevertheless , shown into [[the bachelor]4608-the bachelor ’s little dining - room]4609-the bachelor ’s little dining - room . But what was [his]3366-the vicar disgust and disappointment at finding [[his]3366-the vicar late pupil]4610-his late pupil tête - à - tête over a comfortable fish - dinner , opposite [a burly , vulgar , cunning - eyed man , with a narrow rim of muslin turned down over [his]4611-a burly , vulgar , cunning - eyed man , with a narrow rim of muslin turned down over his stiff cravat , of whose profession there could be no doubt stiff cravat , of whose profession there could be no doubt]4611-a burly , vulgar , cunning - eyed man , with a narrow rim of muslin turned down over his stiff cravat , of whose profession there could be no doubt . ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i dearest sir]2002-my dearest sir , ’ said [the new convert]4612-the new convert , springing up with an air of extreme empressement , ‘[0-i] what an unexpected pleasure ! Allow [me]0-i to introduce [you]2002-my dearest sir to [[my]0-i excellent friend]2003-my excellent friend , [Padre Bugiardo]318-padre bugiardo ! ’ [The padre]4613-the padre rose , bowed obsequiously , ‘[0-i] was overwhelmed with delight at being at last introduced to one of whom [he]2003-my excellent friend had heard so much , ’ sat down again , and poured [himself]4613-the padre out a bumper of sherry ; while [the vicar]3366-the vicar commenced making the best of a bad matter by joining in the now necessary business of eating . [He]4613-the padre had not a word to say for [himself]4613-the padre . [Poor [Luke]137-mr. smith]4615-poor luke was particularly jovial and flippant , and startlingly unlike [his]4615-poor luke former self . [The padre]4613-the padre went on staring out of the window , and talking in a loud forced tone about the astonishing miracles of the ‘[0-i] Ecstatica ’ and ‘[0-i] Addolorata ; ’ and [the poor vicar]4617-the poor vicar , finding the purpose for which [he]4617-the poor vicar had sacrificed [his]4617-the poor vicar own word of honour utterly frustrated by [the priest]1803-the priest ’s presence , sat silent and crestfallen the whole evening . [The priest]1803-the priest had no intention of stirring . [The late father - confessor]4620-the late father - confessor tried to outstay [[his]4620-the late father - confessor new rival]4621-his new rival , but in vain ; [the padre]4613-the padre deliberately announced [his]4613-the padre intention of taking a bed , and [the vicar]3366-the vicar , with a heavy heart , rose to go to [[his]3366-the vicar inn]4624-his inn . As [he]3366-the vicar went out at the door , [he]3366-the vicar caught an opportunity of saying one word to [the convert]4625-the convert . ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i poor [Luke]137-mr. smith]2004-my poor luke ! and are [you]137-mr. smith happy ? Tell [me]0-i honestly , in [God]281-god ’s sight tell [me]0-i ! ’ ‘[281-god] Happier than ever [I]0-i was in [my]0-i life ! No more self - torture , physical or mental , now . [These good priests]2005-these good priests thoroughly understand poor human nature , [I]0-i can assure [you]137-mr. smith . ’ [The vicar]3366-the vicar sighed , for the speech was evidently meant as a gentle rebuke to [himself]3366-the vicar . But [the young man]749-the young man ran on , half laughing , — ‘[137-mr. smith] [You]137-mr. smith know how [you]137-mr. smith and [the rest]2006-the rest used to tell [us]2007-we what a sad thing it was that [we]2007-we were all cursed with consciences,—what a fearful miserable burden moral responsibility was ; but that [we]2007-we must submit to it as an inevitable evil . Now that burden is gone , thank [God]281-god . [We]2007-we of [the True Church]2008-the true church have some one to keep [our]2007-we consciences for [us]2007-we . [The padre]4613-the padre settles all about what is right or wrong , and [we]2007-we slip on as easily as — ’ ‘[4613-the padre] A hog or a butterfly ! ’ said [the vicar]3366-the vicar , bitterly . ‘[4613-the padre] Exactly , ’ answered [Luke]137-mr. smith . ‘[4613-the padre] And , on [your]137-mr. smith own showing , are [clean gainers of a happy life]2010-clean gainers of a happy life here , not to mention [heaven hereafter]2011-heaven hereafter . [God]281-god bless [you]137-mr. smith ! [We]2007-we shall soon see [you]137-mr. smith one of [us]2007-we . ’ ‘[2007-we] Never , so help [me]0-i [God]281-god ! ’ said [the vicar]3366-the vicar ; all the more fiercely because [he]3366-the vicar was almost at that moment of [the young man]749-the young man ’s opinion . [The vicar]3366-the vicar stepped out into the night . The rain , which had given place during the afternoon to a bright sun and clear chilly evening , had returned with double fury . The wind was sweeping and howling down [the lonely streets]4632-the lonely streets , and lashed the rain into [his]0-i face , while gray clouds were rushing past the moon like terrified ghosts across the awful void of [the black heaven]4633-the black heaven . Above [him]0-i gaunt poplars groaned and bent , like giants cowering from the wrath of [Heaven]215-heaven , yet rooted by grim necessity to [their]2012-them place of torture . The roar and tumult without [him]0-i harmonised strangely with the discord within . [He]0-i staggered and strode along [the plashy pavement]4634-the plashy pavement , muttering to [himself]0-i at intervals , — ‘[281-god] Rest for the soul ? peace of mind ? [I]0-i have been promising [them]2012-them all [my]0-i life to [others]3280-others — have [I]0-i found [them]2012-them [myself]0-i ? And here is [this poor boy]2014-this poor boy saying that [he]2014-this poor boy has gained [them]2012-them — in the very barbarian superstition which [I]0-i have been anathematising to [him]2014-this poor boy ! What is true , at this rate ? What is false ? Is anything right or wrong ? except in as far as [men]612-men feel it to be right or wrong . Else whence does [this poor fellow]2016-this poor fellow ’s peace come , or the peace of [many a convert more]2017-many a convert more ? [They]2018-they have all , one by one , told [me]0-i the same story . And is not a religion to be known by its fruits ? Are [they]2018-they not right in going where [they]2018-they can get peace of mind ? ’ Certainly , [vicar]4299-vicar . If peace of mind be the summum bonum , and religion is merely the science of self - satisfaction , [they]2018-they are right ; and [your]4636-your wisest plan will be to follow [them]2018-they at once , or failing that , to apply to the next best substitute that can be discovered — alcohol and opium . As [he]4299-vicar went on , talking wildly to [himself]4299-vicar , [he]4299-vicar passed [the Union Workhouse]4637-the union workhouse . Opposite the gate , under the lee of a wall , [some twenty men]4638-some twenty men , [women]3246-women , and [children]935-children , were huddled together on the bare ground . [They]4638-some twenty men had been refused lodging in [the workhouse]933-the workhouse , and were going to pass the night in that situation . As [he]4299-vicar came up to [them]4638-some twenty men , coarse jests , and snatches of low drinking - songs , ghastly as the laughter of lost spirits in the pit , mingled with the feeble wailings of [some child of shame]4642-some child of shame . [The vicar]3366-the vicar recollected how [he]3366-the vicar had seen the same sight at the door of [Kensington Workhouse]74-kensington workhouse , walking [home]452-home one night in company with [Luke Smith]137-mr. smith ; and how , too , [he]3366-the vicar had commented to [him]3366-the vicar on that fearful sign of the times , and had somewhat unfairly drawn a contrast between the niggard cruelty of ‘[2018-they] popular Protestantism , ’ and the fancied ‘[2018-they] liberality of the middle age . ’ What wonder if [[his]4299-vicar pupil]4221-his pupil had taken [him]4299-vicar at [his]4299-vicar word ? Delighted to escape from [his]4299-vicar own thoughts by anything like action , [he]4299-vicar pulled out [his]4299-vicar purse to give an alms . There was no silver in it , but only some fifteen or twenty sovereigns , which [he]4299-vicar that day received as payment for some bitter reviews in a leading religious periodical . Everything that night seemed to shame and confound [him]4299-vicar more . As [he]4299-vicar touched the money , there sprang up in [his]4299-vicar mind in an instant the thought of the articles which had procured it ; by one of those terrible , searching inspirations , in which the light which lighteth [every man]3304-every man awakes as a lightning - flash of judgment , [he]4299-vicar saw [them]4647-they , and [his]4299-vicar own heart , for one moment , as [they]4647-they were;—their blind prejudice ; [their]4647-they reckless imputations of motives ; [their]4647-they wilful concealment of any palliating clauses ; [their]4647-they party nicknames , given without a shudder at the terrible accusations which [they]4647-they conveyed . And then the indignation , the shame , the reciprocal bitterness which those articles would excite , tearing still wider the bleeding wounds of [that Church which [they]4647-they professed to defend]4648-that church which they professed to defend ! And then , in this case , too , the thought rushed across [him]4299-vicar , ‘[2018-they] What if [I]0-i should have been wrong and [[my]0-i adversary]2019-my adversary right ? What if [I]0-i have made the heart of the righteous sad whom [God]281-god has not made sad ? [I]0-i ! to have been dealing out Heaven ’s thunders , as if [I]0-i were infallible ! [I]0-i ! who am certain at this moment of no fact in [heaven or earth]3324-heaven or earth , except [my]0-i own untruth ! [God]281-god ! who am [I]0-i that [I]0-i should judge another ? ’ And the coins seemed to [him]4299-vicar like the price of blood — [he]4299-vicar fancied that [he]4299-vicar felt them red - hot to [his]4299-vicar hand , and , in [his]4299-vicar eagerness to get rid of the accursed thing , [he]4299-vicar dealt it away fiercely to [the astonished group]4649-the astonished group , amid whining and flattery , wrangling and ribaldry ; and then , not daring to wait and see the use to which [his]4299-vicar money would be put , hurried off to [the inn]4650-the inn , and tried in uneasy slumbers to forget the time , until the mail passed through at daybreak on its way to [Whitford]7-whitford . At dusk that same evening [the two]3206-the two had started for the village fair . A velveteen shooting - jacket , a pair of corduroy trousers , and a waistcoat , furnished by [Tregarva]173-tregarva , covered with flowers of every imaginable hue , tolerably disguised [Lancelot]172-lancelot , who was recommended by [[his]172-lancelot conductor]4652-his conductor to keep [his]172-lancelot hands in [his]172-lancelot pockets as much as possible , lest [their]3206-the two delicacy , which was , as it happened , not very remarkable , might betray [him]172-lancelot . As [they]3206-the two walked together along [the plashy turnpike road]4653-the plashy turnpike road , overtaking , now and then , [groups of two or three who were out on the same errand as [themselves]3206-the two]4654-groups of two or three who were out on the same errand as themselves , [Lancelot]172-lancelot could not help remarking to [the keeper]3350-the keeper how superior was the look of comfort in [the boys]4656-the boys and [young men]4657-young men , with [their]2021-they ruddy cheeks and smart dresses , to the worn and haggard appearance of [the elder men]4658-the elder men . ‘[281-god] Let [them]2021-they alone , [poor fellows]4063-poor fellows , ’ said [Tregarva]173-tregarva ; ‘[281-god] it wo n’t last long . When [they]2021-they ’ve got [two or three children]2023-two or three children at [their]2021-they heels , [they]2021-they ’ll look as thin and shabby as [[their]2021-they own fathers]2024-their own fathers . ’ ‘[2021-they] [They]2021-they must spend a great deal of money on [their]2021-they clothes . ’ ‘[2021-they] And on [their]2021-they stomachs , too , [sir]753-sir . [They]2021-they never lay by a farthing ; and [I]0-i do n’t see how [they]2021-they can , when [their]2021-they club - money ’s paid , and [their]2021-they insides are well filled . ’ ‘[0-i] Do [you]0-i mean to say that [they]2021-they actually have not as much to eat after [they]2021-they marry ? ’ ‘[0-i] Indeed and [I]0-i do , [sir]753-sir . [They]2021-they get no more wages afterwards round here , and have four or five to clothe and feed off the same money that used to keep one ; and that sum wo n’t take long to work out , [I]0-i think . ’ ‘[0-i] But do [they]2021-they not in some places pay [the married men]2027-the married men higher wages than [the unmarried]2028-the unmarried ? ’ ‘[2021-they] That ’s a worse trick still , [sir]753-sir ; for it tempts [the poor thoughtless boys]2030-the poor thoughtless boys to go and marry [the first girl [they]2030-the poor thoughtless boys can get hold of]2031-the first girl they can get hold of ; and it do n’t want much persuasion to make [them]2030-the poor thoughtless boys do that at any time . ’ ‘[2032-the clergymen] But why do n’t [the clergymen]2032-the clergymen teach [them]2021-they to put into the savings banks ? ’ ‘[2034-he] One here and there , [sir]753-sir , says what [he]2034-he can , though it ’s of very little use . Besides , [every one]807-every one is afraid of [savings banks]2036-savings banks now ; not a year but one reads of some breaking and [the lawyers]2037-the lawyers going off with the earnings of [the poor]698-the poor . And if [they]2021-they did n’t , youth ’s a foolish time at best ; and [the carnal man]2039-the carnal man will be hankering after amusement , [sir]753-sir — amusement . ’ ‘[2039-the carnal man] And no wonder , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot ; ‘[2039-the carnal man] at all events , [I]0-i should not think [they]2021-they got much of it . But it does seem strange that no other amusement can be found for [them]2021-they than [the beer - shop]1034-the beer - shop . Ca n’t [they]2021-they read ? Ca n’t [they]2021-they practise light and interesting handicrafts at [home]452-home , as [the German peasantry]2043-the german peasantry do ? ’ ‘[2043-the german peasantry] Who ’ll teach [’em]2021-they , [sir]753-sir ? From the plough - tail to the reaping - hook , and back again , is all [they]2021-they know . Besides , [sir]753-sir , [they]2021-they are not like [us]4661-us [Cornish]206-the cornish ; [they]2021-they are [a stupid pigheaded generation]4662-a stupid pigheaded generation at the best , [these south countrymen]4663-these south countrymen . [They]2021-they ’re[2043-the german peasantry] [grown - up babies who want [the parson]3572-the parson and [the squire]3125-the squire]2044-grown - up babies who want the parson and the squire to be leading [them]2044-grown - up babies who want the parson and the squire , and preaching to [them]2044-grown - up babies who want the parson and the squire , and spurring [them]2044-grown - up babies who want the parson and the squire on , and coaxing [them]2044-grown - up babies who want the parson and the squire up , every moment . And as for scholarship , [sir]753-sir , [a boy]1316-a boy leaves [school]3228-school at nine or ten to follow the horses ; and between that time and [his]1316-a boy wedding - day [he]1316-a boy forgets every word [he]1316-a boy ever learnt , and becomes , for the most part , as thorough [a heathen savage]2050-a heathen savage at heart as [those wild Indians in [the Brazils]75-the brazils]2051-those wild indians in the brazils used to be . ’ ‘[2050-a heathen savage] And then [we]2052-we call [them]2044-grown - up babies who want the parson and the squire [civilised Englishmen]2053-civilised englishmen ! ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[2050-a heathen savage] [We]2052-we can see that [[your]753-sir Indian]2054-your indian is [a savage]1524-a savage , because [he]2054-your indian wears skins and feathers ; but [[your]753-sir Irish cottar]2056-your irish cottar or [[your]753-sir English labourer]2057-your english labourer , because [he]2057-your english labourer happens to wear a coat and trousers , is to be considered [a civilised man]2058-a civilised man . ’ ‘[2058-a civilised man] It ’s the way of [the world]475-the world , [sir]753-sir , ’ said [Tregarva]173-tregarva , ‘[2058-a civilised man] judging carnal judgment , according to the sight of its own eyes ; always looking at the outsides of things and [men]612-men , [sir]753-sir , and never much deeper . But as for reading , [sir]753-sir , it ’s all very well for [me]0-i , who have been [a keeper]3337-a keeper and dawdled about like [a gentleman with a gun over [my]0-i arm]2065-a gentleman with a gun over my arm ; but did [you]753-sir ever do a good day ’s farm - work in [your]753-sir life ? If [you]753-sir had , [man]564-man or [boy]2067-boy , [you]753-sir would n’t have been game for much reading when [you]753-sir got [home]452-home ; [you]753-sir ’d do just what [these poor fellows]2069-these poor fellows do,—tumble into bed at eight o’clock , hardly waiting to take [your]753-sir clothes off , knowing that [you]753-sir must turn up again at five o’clock the next morning to get a breakfast of bread , and , perhaps , a dab of [the squire]3125-the squire ’s dripping , and then back to work again ; and so on , day after day , [sir]753-sir , week after week , year after year , without a hope or a chance of being anything but what [you]753-sir are , and only too thankful if [you]753-sir can get work to break [your]753-sir back , and catch the rheumatism over . ’ ‘[753-sir] But do [you]753-sir mean to say that [their]2069-these poor fellows labour is so severe and incessant ? ’ ‘[753-sir] It ’s only [God]281-god ’s blessing if it is incessant , [sir]753-sir , for if it stops , [they]2069-these poor fellows starve , or go to [the house]3485-the house to be worse fed than [the thieves in gaol]2074-the thieves in gaol . And as for its being severe , there ’s many [a boy]1316-a boy , as [[their]2069-these poor fellows mothers]2076-their mothers will tell [you]753-sir , comes [home]452-home night after night , too tired to eat [their]2069-these poor fellows suppers , and tumble , fasting , to bed in the same foul shirt which [they]2069-these poor fellows ’ve been working in all the day , never changing [their]2069-these poor fellows rag of calico from week ’s end to week ’s end , or washing the skin that ’s under it once in seven years . ’ ‘[753-sir] No wonder , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[753-sir] that such a life of drudgery makes [them]2069-these poor fellows brutal and reckless . ’ ‘[753-sir] No wonder , indeed , [sir]753-sir : [they]2069-these poor fellows ’ve no time to think ; [they]2069-these poor fellows ’re born to be [machines]4664-machines , and machines [they]2069-these poor fellows must be ; and [I]753-sir think , [sir]753-sir , ’[753-sir] [he]753-sir added bitterly , ‘ it ’s [God]281-god ’s mercy that [they]2069-these poor fellows dare n’t think . It ’s [God]281-god ’s mercy that [they]2069-these poor fellows do n’t feel . [Men that write books and talk at elections]4666-men that write books and talk at elections call this [a free country]4667-a free country , and say that [the poorest and meanest]4668-the poorest and meanest has a free opening to rise and become [prime minister]4669-prime minister , if [he]4668-the poorest and meanest can . But [you]753-sir see , [sir]753-sir , the misfortune is , that in practice [he]4668-the poorest and meanest ca n’t ; for one who gets into [[a gentleman]3733-a gentleman ’s family]4672-a gentleman ’s family , or into [a little shop]4673-a little shop , and so saves a few pounds , [fifty]4674-fifty know that [they]4674-fifty ’ve no chance before [them]4674-fifty , but day - labourer born , [day - labourer]4675-day - labourer live , from hand to mouth , scraping and pinching to get not meat and beer even , but bread and potatoes ; and then , at the end of it all , for a worthy reward , half - a - crown a - week of parish pay — or [the workhouse]933-the workhouse . That ’s a lively hopeful prospect for [a Christian man]4677-a christian man ! ’[753-sir] ‘ But , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘ [I]172-lancelot thought this New Poor - law was to stir [them]4674-fifty up to independence ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Oh , [sir]753-sir , the old law has bit too deep : it made [them]4674-fifty [slaves]1525-slaves and [beggars]4680-beggars at heart . It taught [them]4674-fifty not to be ashamed of parish pay — to demand it as a right . ’[753-sir] ‘ And so it is [their]4674-fifty right , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ In [God]281-god ’s name , if [a country]4681-a country is so ill - constituted that [it]4681-a country can not find [[its]4681-a country own citizens]4682-its own citizens in work , it is bound to find [them]4682-its own citizens in food . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Maybe , [sir]753-sir , maybe . [God]281-god knows [I]753-sir do n’t grudge it [them]4674-fifty . It ’s a poor pittance at best , when [they]4674-fifty have got it . But do n’t [you]753-sir see , [sir]753-sir , how [all poor - laws]4685-all poor - laws , old or new either , suck the independent spirit out of [a man]445-a man ; how [they]4674-fifty make [the poor wretch]4687-the poor wretch reckless ; how [they]4674-fifty tempt [him]4687-the poor wretch to spend every extra farthing in amusement ? ’[753-sir] ‘ How then ? ’[753-sir] ‘ Why , [he]4687-the poor wretch is always tempted to say to [himself]4687-the poor wretch , “ Whatever happens to [me]172-lancelot , [the parish]3395-the parish must keep [me]172-lancelot . If [I]172-lancelot am sick it must doctor [me]172-lancelot ; if [I]172-lancelot am worn out it must feed [me]172-lancelot ; if [I]172-lancelot die it must bury [me]172-lancelot ; if [I]172-lancelot leave [[my]172-lancelot children]4689-my children paupers [the parish]3395-the parish must look after [them]4689-my children , and [they]4689-my children ’ll be as well off with [the parish]3395-the parish as [they]4689-my children were with [me]172-lancelot . Now [they]4689-my children ’ve only got just enough to keep body and soul together , and [the parish]3395-the parish ca n’t give [them]4689-my children less than that . What ’s the use of cutting [myself]172-lancelot off from sixpenny - worth of pleasure here , and sixpenny - worth there . [I]172-lancelot ’m[172-lancelot] not saving money for [[my]0-i children]4689-my children , [I]0-i ’m only saving [the farmers]1258-the farmers ’[753-sir] rates . ” There it is , [sir]753-sir , ’ said [Tregarva]173-tregarva ; ‘[753-sir] that ’s the bottom of it , sir,—“I’m only saving [the farmers]1258-the farmers ’ rates . Let [us]4694-we eat and drink , for to - morrow [we]4694-we die ! ” ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot do n’t see [my]172-lancelot way out of it , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ So says [everybody]1289-everybody , [sir]753-sir . But [I]172-lancelot should have thought [those members of parliament]4697-those members of parliament , and [statesmen]4698-statesmen , and [university scholars]4699-university scholars have been set up in [the high places]4700-the high places , out of the wood where [we]4694-we are all struggling and scrambling , just that [they]4697-those members of parliament might see [their]4697-those members of parliament way out of it ; and if [they]4697-those members of parliament do n’t , [sir]753-sir , and that soon , as sure as [God]281-god is in [heaven]1101-heaven , [these poor fellows]2069-these poor fellows will cut [their]4697-those members of parliament way out of it . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ And blindfolded and ignorant as [they]2069-these poor fellows are , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘ [they]2069-these poor fellows will be certain to cut [their]2069-these poor fellows way out just in the wrong direction . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot ’m[172-lancelot] not so sure of that , [sir]753-sir , ’ said [Tregarva]173-tregarva , lowering [his]173-tregarva voice . ‘[753-sir] What is written ’ ? That there is [One who hears the desire of [the poor]698-the poor]4704-one who hears the desire of the poor . “ [Lord]1679-lord , [Thou]4707-thou preparest [their]2069-these poor fellows hearts and [Thine]4708-thine ear hearkeneth thereto , to help [the fatherless and poor]4709-the fatherless and poor unto [their]2069-these poor fellows right , that [the man of the earth]4710-the man of the earth be no more exalted against [them]2069-these poor fellows . ” ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Why , [you]753-sir are talking like [any Chartist]4711-any chartist , [Tregarva]173-tregarva ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Am [I]2085-my witness , [sir]753-sir ? [I]2085-my witness have n’t heard much Scripture quoted among [them]2069-these poor fellows [myself]2085-my witness , [poor fellows]4063-poor fellows ; but to tell [you]2083-you the truth , [sir]753-sir , [I]2085-my witness do n’t know what [I]2085-my witness am becoming . [I]2085-my witness ’m[2085-my witness] getting half mad with all [I]0-i see going on and not going on ; and [you]2083-you will agree , [sir]753-sir , that what ’s happened this day ca n’t have done much to cool [my]0-i temper or brighten [my]0-i hopes ; though , [God]281-god ’s [[my]0-i witness]2085-my witness , there ’s no spite in [me]0-i for [my]0-i own sake . But what makes [me]0-i maddest of all , [sir]753-sir , is to see that [everybody]1289-everybody sees these evils , except just [the men who can cure]2088-the men who can cure [them]2089-them — [the squires]1257-the squires and [the clergy]1348-the clergy . ’ ‘[2088-the men who can cure] Why surely , [Tregarva]173-tregarva , there are hundreds , if not thousands , of [clergymen]784-clergymen and [landlords working heart and soul]2093-landlords working heart and soul at this moment , to better the condition of [the labouring classes]2094-the labouring classes ! ’ ‘[2096-they] Ay , [sir]753-sir , [they]2096-they see the evils , and yet [they]2096-they do n’t see [them]2089-them . [They]2096-they do not see what is the matter with [the poor man]3659-the poor man ; and the proof of it is , [sir]753-sir , that [the poor]698-the poor have no confidence in [them]698-the poor . [They]698-the poor ’ll take [their]698-the poor alms , but [they]698-the poor ’ll hardly take [their]698-the poor schooling , and [their]698-the poor advice [they]698-the poor wo n’t take at all . And why is it , [sir]753-sir ? Because [the poor]698-the poor have got in [their]698-the poor heads in these days a strange confused fancy , maybe , but still a deep and a fierce one , that [they]698-the poor have n’t got what [they]698-the poor call [their]698-the poor rights . If [you]753-sir were to raise the wages of [every man in [this country]768-this country]2102-every man in this country from nine to twelve shillings a - week to - morrow , [you]753-sir would n’t satisfy [them]698-the poor ; at least , [the only ones whom [you]753-sir would satisfy]2104-the only ones whom you would satisfy would be [the mere hogs among [them]698-the poor]2105-the mere hogs among them , who , as long as [they]698-the poor can get a full stomach , care for nothing else . ’ ‘[698-the poor] What , in [Heaven]215-heaven ’s name , do [they]698-the poor want ? ’ asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[698-the poor] [They]698-the poor hardly know yet , [sir]753-sir ; but [they]698-the poor know well what [they]698-the poor do n’t want . The question with [them]698-the poor , [sir]753-sir , believe [me]0-i , is not so much , How shall [we]2108-we get better fed and better housed , but whom shall [we]2108-we depend upon for [our]2108-we food and for [[our]2108-we house]2109-our house ? Why should [we]2108-we depend on the will and fancy of [any man]3336-any man for [our]2108-we rights ? [They]698-the poor are asking ugly questions among [themselves]698-the poor , [sir]753-sir , about what those two words , rent and taxes , mean , and about what that same strange word , freedom , means . Eight or wrong , [they]698-the poor ’ve got the thought into [their]698-the poor heads , and it ’s growing there , and [they]698-the poor will find an answer for it . Depend upon it , [sir]753-sir , [I]0-i tell [you]753-sir a truth , and [they]698-the poor expect a change . [You]753-sir will hear [them]698-the poor talk of it to - night , [sir]753-sir , if [you]753-sir ’ve luck . ’ ‘[698-the poor] [We]2108-we all expect a change , for that matter , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[2108-we] That feeling is common to all classes and [parties]2114-parties just now . ’ [Tregarva]173-tregarva took off [his]173-tregarva hat . ‘[753-sir] “ For the word of [the Lord]817-the lord hath spoken it . ” Do [you]753-sir know , [sir]753-sir , [I]0-i long at times that [I]0-i did agree with [those Chartists]2117-those chartists ? If [I]0-i did , [I]0-i ’d turn lecturer to - morrow . How [a man]445-a man could speak out then ! If [he]445-a man saw any door of hope , any way of salvation for [these poor fellows]2069-these poor fellows , even if it was nothing better than salvation by Act of Parliament ! ’ ‘[445-a man] But why do n’t [you]753-sir trust [the truly worthy among [the clergy]1348-the clergy and [the gentry]1349-the gentry]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry to leaven [their]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry own ranks and bring all right in time ? ’ ‘[753-sir] Because , [sir]753-sir , [they]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry seem to be going the way only to make things worse . [The people]1331-the people have been so dependent on [them]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry heretofore , that [they]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry have become [thorough beggars]2125-thorough beggars . [You]753-sir can have no knowledge , [sir]753-sir , of the whining , canting , deceit , and lies which [[those poor miserable labourers]2127-those poor miserable labourers ’ wives]4715-those poor miserable labourers ’ wives palm on [charitable ladies]4716-charitable ladies . If [they]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry were n’t angels , [some of [them]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry]4717-some of them , [they]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry ’d lock up [their]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry purses and never give away another farthing . And , [sir]753-sir , these free - schools , and these penny - clubs , and clothing clubs , and these heaps of money which are given away , all make the matter worse and worse . [They]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry make [the labourer]4719-the labourer fancy that [he]4719-the labourer is not to depend upon [God]281-god and [his]4719-the labourer own right hand , but on what [[his]4719-the labourer wife]934-his wife can worm out of the good nature of [the rich]3580-the rich . Why , [sir]753-sir , [they]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry growl as insolently now at [the parson]3572-the parson or [[the squire]3125-the squire ’s wife]4725-the squire ’s wife if [they]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry do n’t get as much money as [[their]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry neighbours]1339-their neighbours , as [they]2120-the truly worthy among the clergy and the gentry used to at [the parish vestrymen]4727-the parish vestrymen under the old law . Look at that [Lord Vieuxbois]241-lord vieuxbois , [sir]753-sir , as sweet a gentleman as ever [God]281-god made . It used to do [me]172-lancelot good to walk behind [him]241-lord vieuxbois when [he]241-lord vieuxbois came over [here]775-here shooting , just to hear the gentle kind - hearted way in which [he]241-lord vieuxbois used to speak to [every old soul [he]241-lord vieuxbois met]4730-every old soul he met . [He]241-lord vieuxbois spends [his]241-lord vieuxbois whole life and time about [the poor]698-the poor , [I]172-lancelot hear . But , [sir]753-sir , as sure as [you]753-sir live [he]241-lord vieuxbois ’s making [[his]241-lord vieuxbois people]4733-his people [slaves]1525-slaves and [humbugs]4735-humbugs . [He]241-lord vieuxbois does n’t see , [sir]753-sir , that [they]4733-his people want to be raised bodily out of this miserable hand - to - mouth state , to be brought nearer up to [him]241-lord vieuxbois , and set on a footing where [they]4733-his people can shift for [themselves]4733-his people . Without meaning it , [sir]753-sir , [all [his]241-lord vieuxbois boundless charities]4738-all his boundless charities are keeping [the people]1331-the people down , and telling [them]1331-the people [they]1331-the people must stay down , and not help [themselves]1331-the people , but wait for what [he]241-lord vieuxbois gives [them]1331-the people . [[He]241-lord vieuxbois fats prize - labourers]4740-he fats prize - labourers , [sir]753-sir , just as [Lord Minchampstead]250-lord minchampstead fats prize - oxen and pigs . ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot could not help thinking of that amusingly inconsistent , however well - meant , scene in [Coningsby]76-coningsby , in which [Mr. Lyle]319-mr. lyle is represented as trying to restore ‘ the independent order of [peasantry]4742-peasantry , ’[172-lancelot] by making [them]2128-them the receivers of public alms at [[his]319-mr. lyle own gate]2129-his own gate , as if [they]2128-them had been [middle - age serfs]2130-middle - age serfs or [vagabonds]2131-vagabonds , and not [citizens of [modern England]2133-modern england]2132-citizens of modern england . ‘ It may suit [the Mr. Lyles]320-the mr. lyles of this age , ’[172-lancelot] thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘ to make [the people]1331-the people constantly and visibly comprehend that property is [[their]1331-the people protector]4744-their protector and [[their]1331-the people friend]4745-their friend , but [I]172-lancelot question whether it will suit [the people]1331-the people [themselves]1331-the people , unless [they]1331-the people can make [property]4747-property understand that it owes [them]1331-the people something more definite than protection . ’[172-lancelot] Saddened by this conversation , which had helped to give another shake to the easy - going complacency with which [Lancelot]172-lancelot had been used to contemplate [the world below [him]172-lancelot]2134-the world below him , and look on its evils as necessaries , ancient and fixed as the universe , [he]172-lancelot entered the village fair , and was a little disappointed at [his]172-lancelot first glimpse of [the village - green]2135-the village - green . Certainly [his]172-lancelot expectations had not been very exalted ; but there had run through [them]2136-them a hope of something melodramatic , dreams of May - pole dancing and athletic games , somewhat of [village]2137-village - belle rivalry , of [the Corin and Sylvia school]2138-the corin and sylvia school ; or , failing that , a few Touchstones and Audreys , [some genial earnest buffo humour]2139-some genial earnest buffo humour here and there . But there did not seem much likelihood of it . [Two or three apple and gingerbread stalls]2140-two or three apple and gingerbread stalls , from which [draggled children]2141-draggled children were turning slowly and wistfully away to go [home]452-home ; [a booth full of trumpery fairings , in front of which [tawdry girls]2144-tawdry girls were coaxing [maudlin youths]2145-maudlin youths , with faded southernwood in [their]2145-maudlin youths button - holes]2143-a booth full of trumpery fairings , in front of which tawdry girls were coaxing maudlin youths , with faded southernwood in their button - holes ; [another long low booth]2146-another long low booth , from every crevice of which reeked odours of stale beer and smoke , by courtesy denominated tobacco , to the treble accompaniment of a jigging fiddle and a tambourine , and the bass one of grumbled oaths and curses within — these were the means of relaxation which the piety , freedom , and civilisation of fourteen centuries , from [Hengist]321-hengist to [Queen Victoria]322-queen victoria , had devised and made possible for [the English peasant]2147-the english peasant ! ‘ There seems very little here to see , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , half peevishly . ‘ [I]172-lancelot think , [sir]753-sir , ’[172-lancelot] quoth [Tregarva]173-tregarva , ‘ that very thing is what ’s most worth seeing . ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot could not help , even at the risk of detection , investing capital enough in sugar - plums and gingerbread , to furnish [the urchins]2148-the urchins around with the material for a whole carnival of stomach - aches ; and [he]172-lancelot felt a great inclination to clear the fairing - stall in a like manner , on behalf of [the poor bedizened sickly - looking girls]2149-the poor bedizened sickly - looking girls round , but [he]172-lancelot was afraid of the jealousy of [some beer - bemuddled swain]2150-some beer - bemuddled swain . The ill - looks of [the young girls]2151-the young girls surprised [him]172-lancelot much . Here and there smiled a plump rosy face enough ; but [the majority]2152-the majority seemed under - sized , under - fed , utterly wanting in grace , vigour , and what [the penny - a - liners]2153-the penny - a - liners call ‘ rude health . ’[172-lancelot] [He]172-lancelot remarked it to [Tregarva]173-tregarva . [The keeper]3350-the keeper smiled mournfully . ‘ [You]753-sir see [those little creatures dragging home babies]4749-those little creatures dragging home babies in arms nearly as big as [themselves]4749-those little creatures dragging home babies , [sir]753-sir . That and bad food , want of milk especially , accounts for [their]4749-those little creatures dragging home babies growing up no bigger than [they]4749-those little creatures dragging home babies do ; and as for [their]4749-those little creatures dragging home babies sad countenances , [sir]753-sir , [most of [them]4749-those little creatures dragging home babies]1563-most of them must carry a lighter conscience before [they]4749-those little creatures dragging home babies carry a brighter face . ’[3350-the keeper] ‘ What do [you]0-i mean ? ’[172-lancelot] asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ [The clergyman who enters the weddings and the baptisms]4753-the clergyman who enters the weddings and the baptisms knows well enough what [I]3350-the keeper mean , [sir]753-sir . But [we]2155-we ’ll go into [that booth]4755-that booth , if [you]753-sir want to see the thick of it , [sir]753-sir ; that ’s to say , if [you]753-sir ’re[3350-the keeper] not ashamed . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i hope [we]2155-we need neither of [us]2155-we do anything to be ashamed of there ; and as for seeing , [I]0-i begin to agree with [you]172-lancelot , that what makes the whole thing most curious is its intense dulness . ’ ‘[0-i] What upon earth is that ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i say , look out there ! ’ ‘[0-i] Well , [you]172-lancelot look out [yourself]172-lancelot ! ’ This was caused by a violent blow across the shins with a thick stick , the deed of [certain drunken wiseacres who were persisting in playing in the dark the never very lucrative game of three sticks a penny , conducted by [a couple of gipsies]4758-a couple of gipsies]4757-certain drunken wiseacres who were persisting in playing in the dark the never very lucrative game of three sticks a penny , conducted by a couple of gipsies . [Poor fellows]4063-poor fellows ! there was one excuse for [them]4063-poor fellows . It was the only thing there to play at , except a set of skittles ; and on those [they]4063-poor fellows had lost [their]4063-poor fellows money every Saturday night for the last seven years each at [[his]753-sir own village beer - shop]4760-his own village beer - shop . So into the booth [they]4063-poor fellows turned ; and as soon as [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s eyes were accustomed to the reeking atmosphere , [he]172-lancelot saw seated at two long temporary tables of board , fifty or sixty of ‘[2156-my brethren] [[My]0-i Brethren]2156-my brethren , ’ as [clergymen]784-clergymen call [them]2156-my brethren in [their]2156-my brethren sermons , wrangling , stupid , beery , with sodden eyes and drooping lips — interspersed with [more girls]4762-more girls and brazen - faced women , with dirty flowers in [their]4758-a couple of gipsies caps , whose whole business seemed to be to cast jealous looks at [each other]565-each other , and defend [themselves]4758-a couple of gipsies from the coarse overtures of [[their]4758-a couple of gipsies swains]4764-their swains . [Lancelot]172-lancelot had been already perfectly astonished at the foulness of language which prevailed ; and the utter absence of anything like chivalrous respect , almost of common decency , towards [women]3246-women . But lo ! the language of [the elder women]4766-the elder women was quite as disgusting as that of [the men]4767-the men , if not worse . [He]172-lancelot whispered a remark on the point to [Tregarva]173-tregarva , who shook [his]173-tregarva head . ‘[2156-my brethren] It ’s the field - work , [sir]753-sir — the field - work , that does it all . [They]2158-they get accustomed there from [their]2158-they childhood to hear words whose very meanings [they]2158-they should n’t know ; and [the older]2159-the older teach [the younger ones]2160-the younger ones , and [the married ones]2161-the married ones are worst of all . It wears [them]2158-they out in body , [sir]753-sir , that field - work , and makes [them]2158-they brutes in soul and in manners . ’ ‘[2158-they] Why do n’t [they]2158-they give it up ? Why do n’t [the respectable ones]2163-the respectable ones set [their]2163-the respectable ones faces against it ? ’ ‘[2163-the respectable ones] [They]2158-they ca n’t afford it , [sir]753-sir . [They]2158-they must go a - field , or go hungered , [most of [them]2158-they]1563-most of them . And [they]2158-they get to like the gossip and scandal , and coarse fun of it , while [[their]2158-they children]2166-their children are left at [home]452-home to play in [the roads]2168-the roads , or fall into the fire , as plenty do every year . ’ ‘[753-sir] Why not at [school]3228-school ? ’ ‘[753-sir] [The big ones]2170-the big ones are kept at [home]452-home , [sir]753-sir , to play at nursing [those little ones who are too young to go]2173-those little ones who are too young to go . Oh , [sir]753-sir , ’ [he]753-sir added , in a tone of deep feeling , ‘[753-sir] it is very little of [a father]2175-a father ’s care , or a [mother]3233-mother ’s love , that [a labourer ’s child]2177-a labourer ’s child knows in these days ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot looked round the booth with a hopeless feeling . There was awkward dancing going on at the upper end . [He]172-lancelot was too much sickened to go and look at it . [He]172-lancelot began examining the faces and foreheads of [the company]4768-the company , and was astonished at the first glance by the lofty and ample development of brain in at least one half . There were [intellects there]4769-intellects there — or rather capacities of intellect , capable , surely , of anything , had not the promise of the brow been almost always belied by the loose and sensual lower features . [They]2179-they were evidently rather [a degraded than an undeveloped race]4770-a degraded than an undeveloped race . ‘[753-sir] The low forehead of [the Kabyle]323-the kabyle and [Koord]324-koord , ’ thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[753-sir] is compensated by the grim sharp lip , and glittering eye , which prove that all the small capabilities of [the man]738-the man have been called out into clear and vigorous action : but here the very features [themselves]2179-they , both by what [they]2179-they have and what [they]2179-they want , testify against that society which carelessly wastes [her]2180-her most precious wealth , the manhood of [[her]2180-her masses]2181-her masses ! [Tregarva]173-tregarva ! [you]173-tregarva have observed a good many things — did [you]173-tregarva ever observe whether [the men with the large foreheads]2182-the men with the large foreheads were better than [the men with the small ones]2183-the men with the small ones ? ’ ‘[173-tregarva] Ay , [sir]753-sir , [I]0-i know what [you]753-sir are driving at . [I]0-i ’ve heard of that new - fangled notion of [scholars]1017-scholars , which , if [you]753-sir ’ll forgive [my]0-i plain speaking , expects [man]564-man ’s brains to do the work of [God]281-god ’s grace . ’ ‘[753-sir] But what have [you]753-sir remarked ? ’ ‘[753-sir] All [I]0-i ever saw was , that [the stupid - looking ones]2187-the stupid - looking ones were [the greatest blackguards]2188-the greatest blackguards , and [the clever - looking ones]2189-the clever - looking ones [the greatest rogues]2190-the greatest rogues . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot was rebuked , but not surprised . [He]172-lancelot had been for some time past suspecting , from the bitter experience of [his]172-lancelot own heart , the favourite modern theory which revives the Neo - Platonism of [Alexandria]278-sandy , by making intellect synonymous with virtue , and then jumbling , like poor bewildered Proclus , the ‘[753-sir] physical understanding ’ of the brain with the pure ‘[753-sir] intellect ’ of the spirit . ‘[753-sir] [You]753-sir ’ll see something , if [you]753-sir look round , [sir]753-sir , a great deal easier to explain — and , [I]0-i should have thought , a great deal easier to cure — than want of wits . ’ ‘[753-sir] And what is that ? ’ ‘[753-sir] How different - looking [the young ones]2192-the young ones are from [[their]2192-the young ones fathers]2193-their fathers , and still more from [[their]2192-the young ones grandfathers]2194-their grandfathers ! Look at [those three or four old grammers]2195-those three or four old grammers talking together there . For all [their]2195-those three or four old grammers being shrunk with age and weather , [you]753-sir wo n’t see [such fine - grown men]2196-such fine - grown men anywhere else in this booth . ’ It was too true . [Lancelot]172-lancelot recollected now having remarked it before when at [church]3599-church ; and having wondered why [almost all the youths]4772-almost all the youths were so much smaller , clumsier , lower - brained , and weaker - jawed than [[their]4772-almost all the youths elders]4773-their elders . ‘[173-tregarva] Why is it , [Tregarva]173-tregarva ? ’ ‘[173-tregarva] Worse food , worse lodging , worse nursing — and , [I]0-i ’m sore afraid , worse blood . There was too much filthiness and drunkenness went on in the old war - times , not to leave a taint behind it , for many a generation . The prosperity of [fools]4774-fools shall destroy [them]4774-fools ! ’[0-i] ‘ Oh ! ’[172-lancelot] thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘ for [some young sturdy Lancashire or Lothian blood]4775-some young sturdy lancashire or lothian blood , to put new life into the old frozen South Saxon veins ! Even a drop of the warm enthusiastic Celtic would be better than none . Perhaps this Irish immigration may do some good , after all . ’[172-lancelot] Perhaps it may , [Lancelot]172-lancelot . Let [us]2197-us hope so , since it is pretty nearly inevitable . [Sadder]325-sadder and sadder , [Lancelot]172-lancelot tried to listen to the conversation of [the men round [him]172-lancelot]2198-the men round him . To [his]172-lancelot astonishment [he]172-lancelot hardly understood a word of it . It was half articulate , nasal , guttural , made up almost entirely of vowels , like the speech of [savages]2199-savages . [He]172-lancelot had never before been struck with the significant contrast between the sharp , clearly - defined articulation , the vivid and varied tones of [the gentleman]2200-the gentleman , or even of [the London street - boy]2201-the london street - boy when compared with the coarse , half - formed growls , as of a company of seals , which [he]172-lancelot heard round [him]172-lancelot . That single fact struck [him]172-lancelot , perhaps , more deeply than any ; it connected itself with many of [his]172-lancelot physiological fancies ; it was the parent of many thoughts and plans of [his]172-lancelot after - life . Here and there [he]172-lancelot could distinguish a half sentence . [An old shrunken man]2202-an old shrunken man opposite [him]172-lancelot was drawing figures in the spilt beer with [his]2202-an old shrunken man pipe - stem , and discoursing of the glorious times before the great war , ‘ when there was more food than there were mouths , and more work than there were hands . ’[2202-an old shrunken man] ‘ Poor human nature ! ’[172-lancelot] thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , as [he]172-lancelot tried to follow one of those unintelligible discussions about the relative prices of the loaf and the bushel of flour , which ended , as usual , in more swearing , and more quarrelling , and more beer to make it up—‘Poor human nature ! always looking back , as [the German sage]2203-the german sage says , to some fancied golden age , never looking forward to the real one which is coming ! ’ ‘[2203-the german sage] But [I]0-i say , [vather]2204-vather , ’ drawled out [some one]666-some one , ‘[0-i] [they]2205-they say there ’s a sight more money in [England]3-england now , than there was afore the war - time . ’ ‘[2205-they] Eees , booy , ’ said [the old man]3135-the old man ; ‘[2205-they] but its got into too few hands . ’ ‘[2205-they] Well , ’ thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[2205-they] there ’s a glimpse of practical sense , at least . ’ And [a pedlar who sat next [him]172-lancelot]4778-a pedlar who sat next him , [a bold , black - whiskered bully , from [the Potteries]4780-the potteries]4779-a bold , black - whiskered bully , from the potteries , hazarded a joke , — ‘[2205-they] It ’s all along of this new sky - and - tough - it farming . [They]2205-they used to spread the money broadcast , but now [they]2205-they drills it all in one place , like bone - dust under [their]2205-they fancy plants , and [we]2206-we [poor self - sown chaps]2207-poor self - sown chaps gets none . ’ This garland of fancies was received with great applause ; whereat [the pedlar]4781-the pedlar , emboldened , proceeded to observe , mysteriously , that ‘[2205-they] donkeys took a beating , but horses kicked at it ; and that [they]2205-they ’d found out that in [Staffordshire]77-staffordshire long ago . [You]2208-you want [a good Chartist lecturer]2209-a good chartist lecturer down here , [[my]0-i covies]2210-my covies , to show [[you]2208-you donkeys of [labouring men]2212-labouring men]2211-you donkeys of labouring men that [you]2208-you have got iron on [your]2208-you heels , if [you]2208-you only know’d how to use it . ’ ‘[2208-you] And what ’s the use of rioting ? ’ asked [some one]666-some one , querulously . ‘[2208-you] Why , if [you]2208-you do n’t riot , [the farmers]1258-the farmers will starve [you]2208-you . ’ ‘[1258-the farmers] And if [we]2206-we do , [they]1258-the farmers ’d turn [sodgers]2214-sodgers — yeomanry , as [they]1258-the farmers call it , though there ai n’t [a yeoman among [them]1258-the farmers in [these parts]2216-these parts]2215-a yeoman among them in these parts ; and then [they]1258-the farmers takes sword and kills [us]2206-we . So , riot or none , [they]1258-the farmers has it all [their]1258-the farmers own way . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot heard many more scraps of this sort . [He]172-lancelot was very much struck with [their]1258-the farmers dread of violence . It did not seem cowardice . It was not loyalty — [the English labourer]4783-the english labourer has fallen below the capability of so spiritual a feeling ; [Lancelot]172-lancelot had found out that already . It could not be apathy , for [he]172-lancelot heard nothing but complaint upon complaint bandied from mouth to mouth the whole evening . [They]1258-the farmers seemed rather sunk too low in body and mind,—too stupefied and spiritless , to follow the example of [the manufacturing districts]4784-the manufacturing districts ; above all , [they]1258-the farmers were too ill - informed . It is not mere starvation which goads [the Leicester weaver]4785-the leicester weaver to madness . It is starvation with education,—an empty stomach and a cultivated , even though miscultivated , mind . At that instant , [a huge hulking farm - boy]4786-a huge hulking farm - boy rolled into the booth , roaring , dolefully , the end of a song , with a punctuation of [his]4786-a huge hulking farm - boy own invention — ‘[2217-he] [He]2217-he ’ll maak [me]0-i [a lady]563-a lady . Zo . Vine to be zyure . And , vaithfully ; love [me]0-i . Although ; [I]0-i ; be - e ; poor - r - r - r. ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot would have laughed heartily at [him]4786-a huge hulking farm - boy anywhere else ; but the whole scene was past a jest ; and a gleam of pathos and tenderness seemed to shine even from that doggerel,—a vista , as it were , of true genial nature , in the far distance . But as [he]172-lancelot looked round again , ‘[281-god] What hope , ’ [he]172-lancelot thought , ‘[281-god] of its realisation ? Arcadian dreams of pastoral innocence and graceful industry , [I]0-i suppose , are to be henceforth monopolised by the stage or the boudoir ? Never , so help [me]0-i , [God]281-god ! ’ The ursine howls of [the new - comer]4787-the new - comer seemed to have awakened the spirit of music in the party . ‘[281-god] Coom , [Blackburd]326-blackburd , gi ’ [us]2219-us zong , [Blackburd]326-blackburd , bo ’[326-blackburd] ! ’ cried a dozen voices to [an impish , dark - eyed gipsy boy , of some thirteen years old]4788-an impish , dark - eyed gipsy boy , of some thirteen years old . ‘[281-god] Put ’ n on taable . Now , then , pipe up ! ’[326-blackburd] ‘ What will ’[281-god] ee ha ’ ? ’[326-blackburd] ‘ [Mary]185-mary ; gi ’[326-blackburd] [us]2219-us [Mary]185-mary . ’ ‘[326-blackburd] [I]0-i shall make [a ’ girls]4789-a ’ girls cry , ’[326-blackburd] quoth [Blackbird]327-blackbird , with a grin . ‘ Do’n good , too ; [they]4789-a ’ girls likes it : zing away . ’[1359-the boy] And [the boy]1359-the boy began , in a broad country twang , which could not overpower the sad melody of the air , or the rich sweetness of [his]1359-the boy flute - like voice , — ‘ [Young Mary]185-mary walked sadly down through the green clover , And sighed as [she]185-mary looked at the babe at [her]185-mary breast ; “ [My]1359-the boy roses are faded , [[my]1359-the boy false love]4790-my false love a rover , The green graves [they]4790-my false love call [me]1359-the boy , ‘[1359-the boy] Come [home]452-home to [your]185-mary rest . ’ ” ‘[0-i] Then by rode [a soldier in gorgeous arraying , And “ Where is [your]185-mary bride - ring , [[my]0-i fair maid]2223-my fair maid]2222-a soldier in gorgeous arraying , and “ where is your bride - ring , my fair maid ? ” [he]0-i cried ; “ [[I]0-i ne’er]2224-i ne’er had a bride - ring , by [false man]2225-false man ’s betraying , Nor token of love but [this babe]2226-this babe at [my]0-i side . ‘ “ Tho ’[0-i] gold could not buy [me]0-i , sweet words could deceive [me]0-i ; So faithful and lonely till death [I]0-i must roam . ” “ Oh , [Mary]185-mary , [sweet Mary]185-mary , look up and forgive [me]0-i , With wealth and with glory [your]185-mary true love comes [home]452-home ; ‘ “ So give [me]185-mary [[my]185-mary own babe]4791-my own babe , those soft arms adorning , [I]185-mary ’ll [we]4792-we d [you]185-mary and cherish [you]185-mary , never to stray ; For it ’s many a dark and a wild cloudy morning , Turns out by the noon - time a sunshiny day . ” ’[185-mary] ‘ A bad moral that , [sir]753-sir , ’[173-tregarva] whispered [Tregarva]173-tregarva . ‘ Better than none , ’[172-lancelot] answered [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ It ’s well if [you]185-mary are right , [sir]753-sir , for [you]185-mary ’ll hear [no other]4795-no other . ’[172-lancelot] [The keeper]3350-the keeper spoke truly ; in a dozen different songs , more or less coarsely , but , in general , with a dash of pathetic sentiment , the same case of lawless love was embodied . It seemed to be [their]2229-their only notion of the romantic . Now and then there was a poaching song ; then one of [the lowest flash [London]46-london school]2230-the lowest flash london school — filth and all — was roared in chorus in presence of [the women]2231-the women . ‘ [I]173-tregarva am afraid that [you]185-mary do not thank [me]173-tregarva for having brought [you]185-mary to any place so unfit for [a gentleman]3733-a gentleman , ’[173-tregarva] said [Tregarva]173-tregarva , seeing [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s sad face . ‘ Because it is so unfit for [a gentleman]3733-a gentleman , therefore [I]173-tregarva do thank [you]185-mary . [I]2232-the blackbird did n’t think [they]4800-they ’d get on to singing that . ’[2232-the blackbird] [The Blackbird]2232-the blackbird was again on the table , but seemed this time disinclined to exhibit . ‘ Out wi ’[2232-the blackbird] un , [boy]2067-boy ; it wain’t burn [thy]2067-boy mouth ! ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i be afeard . ’ ‘[0-i] O ’ who ? ’[173-tregarva] ‘ Keeper there . ’[173-tregarva] [He]173-tregarva pointed to [Tregarva]173-tregarva ; there was a fierce growl round [the room]3190-the room . ‘ [I]173-tregarva am [no keeper]4801-no keeper , ’[173-tregarva] shouted [Tregarva]173-tregarva , starting up . ‘ [I]173-tregarva was turned off this morning for speaking [my]173-tregarva mind about [the squires]1257-the squires , and now [I]173-tregarva ’m[173-tregarva] one of [you]173-tregarva , to live and die . ’ This answer was received with a murmur of applause ; and [a fellow in a scarlet merino neckerchief , three waistcoats , and a fancy shooting - jacket , who had been eyeing [Lancelot]172-lancelot for some time]4803-a fellow in a scarlet merino neckerchief , three waistcoats , and a fancy shooting - jacket , who had been eyeing lancelot for some time , sidled up behind [them]2235-our , and whispered in [Tregarva]173-tregarva ’s ear , — ‘[173-tregarva] Perhaps [you]173-tregarva ’d like an engagement in [our]2235-our line , [young man]2236-young man , and [[your]173-tregarva friend]834-your friend there , [he]834-your friend seems a sporting gent too.—We could show [him]834-your friend very pretty shooting . ’ [Tregarva]173-tregarva answered by the first and last oath [Lancelot]172-lancelot ever heard from [him]173-tregarva , and turning to [him]173-tregarva , as [the rascal]1918-the rascal sneaked off , — ‘[834-your friend] That ’s a poaching crimp from [London]46-london , [sir]753-sir ; tempting [these poor boys]2239-these poor boys to sin , and deceit , and drunkenness , and theft , and [the hulks]2240-the hulks . ’ ‘[834-your friend] [I]0-i fancy [I]0-i saw [him]834-your friend somewhere the night of [our]2235-our row — [you]173-tregarva understand ? ’ ‘[834-your friend] So do [I]0-i , [sir]753-sir , but there ’s no use talking of it . ’ [Blackbird]327-blackbird was by this time prevailed on to sing , and burst out as melodious as ever , while all heads were cocked on one side in delighted attention . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i zeed a vire o ’ Monday night , A vire both great and high ; But [I]0-i wool not tell [you]2239-these poor boys where , [[my]0-i boys]4805-my boys , Nor wool not tell [you]2239-these poor boys why . [The varmer]328-the varmer [he]328-the varmer comes screeching out , To [zave ’[0-i] uns new brood mare]4806-zave ’ uns new brood mare ; [Zays]329-zays [I]0-i , “ [You]0-i and [your]0-i stock may roast , Vor aught [us]2235-our [poor chaps]2242-poor chaps care . ” ‘ Coorus , [boys]468-boys , coorus ! ’[2243-the chorus] And [the chorus]2243-the chorus burst out , — ‘ Then here ’s a curse on [varmers]4808-varmers all As rob and grind [the poor]698-the poor ; To re’p the fruit of all [their]4808-varmers works In * * * * for evermoor - r - r - r. ‘[2243-the chorus] [A blind owld dame]2244-a blind owld dame come to the vire , [Zo]330-zo near as [she]2244-a blind owld dame could get ; [Zays]329-zays , “ Here ’s a luck [I]0-i warn’t asleep To lose [this blessed hett]2245-this blessed hett . ‘ “ [They]4808-varmers robs [us]2235-our of [our]2235-our turfing rights , [Our]2235-our bits of chips and sticks , Till [poor folks]4810-poor folks now ca n’t warm [their]4810-poor folks hands , Except by varmer ’s ricks . ” ‘[0-i] Then , etc . ’ And again [the boy]1359-the boy ’s delicate voice rung out the ferocious chorus , with something , [Lancelot]172-lancelot fancied , of fiendish exultation , and every worn face lighted up with a coarse laugh , that indicated no malice — but also no mercy . [Lancelot]172-lancelot was sickened , and rose to go . As [he]172-lancelot turned , [his]172-lancelot arm was seized suddenly and firmly . [He]172-lancelot looked round , and saw [a coarse , handsome , showily - dressed girl]4812-a coarse , handsome , showily - dressed girl , looking intently into [his]172-lancelot face . [Cowards]2248-cowards ! [you]2247-you are all in a league against [[us]2247-you [poor girls]2250-poor girls]2249-us poor girls ! [You]2247-you can hunt alone when [you]2247-you betray [us]2247-you , and lie fast enough then ? But when [we]2247-you come for justice , [you]2247-you all herd together like a flock of rooks ; and turn so delicate and honourable all of a sudden — to [each other]565-each other ! [Lancelot]172-lancelot almost ran out into the night,—into a triad of fights , [two drunken men]4818-two drunken men , [two jealous wives]4819-two jealous wives , and [a brute who struck [a poor , thin , worn - out woman]4821-a poor , thin , worn - out woman , for trying to coax [him]172-lancelot [home]452-home]4820-a brute who struck a poor , thin , worn - out woman , for trying to coax him home .
