It ’s only [[you]2260-your gentlefolks who can afford such luxuries]2261-you gentlefolks who can afford such luxuries ; [[your]2260-your poor man]2262-your poor man may be tied to [a harlot]2263-a harlot , or [[your]2260-your poor woman]2264-your poor woman to [a ruffian]2265-a ruffian , but once done , done for ever . ’ ‘[2265-a ruffian] Well , ’ thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[2266-their] [we]2266-their English have a characteristic way of proving the holiness of the marriage tie . [The angel of Justice and Pity]2267-the angel of justice and pity can not sever it , only [the stronger demon of Money]2268-the stronger demon of money . ’ [Their]2266-their way [home]452-home lay over [Ashy Down]66-ashy down , [a lofty chalk promontory]4825-a lofty chalk promontory , round whose foot [the river made a sudden bend]4826-the river made a sudden bend . As [they]2266-their paced along over the dreary hedgeless stubbles , [they]2266-their both started , as a ghostly ‘[2268-the stronger demon of money] Ha ! ha ! ha ! ’ rang through the air over [their]2266-their heads , and was answered by a like cry , faint and distant , across [the wolds]4827-the wolds . ‘[2268-the stronger demon of money] That ’s those stone - curlews — at least , so [I]0-i hope , ’ said [Tregarva]173-tregarva . ‘[0-i] [He]2269-he ’ll be round again in a minute . ’ And again , right between [them]2266-their and the clear , cold moon , ‘[2269-he] Ha ! ha ! ha ! ’ resounded over [their]2266-their heads . [They]2266-their gazed up into the cloudless star - bespangled sky , but there was no sign of living thing . ‘[2269-he] It ’s an old sign to [me]0-i , ’ quoth [Tregarva]173-tregarva ; ‘[281-god] [God]281-god grant that [I]0-i may remember it in this black day of [mine]0-i . ’ ‘[281-god] How so ! ’ asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot ; ‘[281-god] [I]0-i should not have fancied [you]0-i [a superstitious man]2270-a superstitious man . ’ ‘[2270-a superstitious man] Names go for nothing , [sir]753-sir , and what [[my]0-i forefathers]2272-my forefathers believed in [I]0-i am not going to be conceited enough to disbelieve in a hurry . But if [you]753-sir heard [my]0-i story [you]753-sir would think [I]0-i had reason enough to remember that devil ’s laugh up there . ’ ‘[753-sir] Let [me]0-i hear it then . ’ ‘[753-sir] Well , [sir]753-sir , it may be a long story to [you]753-sir , but it was a short one to [me]0-i , for it was the making of [me]0-i , out of hand , there and then , blessed be [God]281-god ! But if [you]753-sir will have it — ’ ‘[753-sir] And [I]0-i will have it , friend [Tregarva]173-tregarva , ’ quoth [Lancelot]172-lancelot , lighting [his]172-lancelot cigar . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i was about sixteen years old , just after [I]0-i came [home]452-home from [the Brazils]75-the brazils — ’ ‘[0-i] What ! have [you]0-i been in [the Brazils]75-the brazils ? ’ ‘[0-i] Indeed and [I]0-i have , [sir]753-sir , for three years ; and one thing [I]0-i learnt there , at least , that ’s worth going for . ’ ‘[0-i] What ’s that ? ’ ‘[0-i] What [the Garden of Eden]3545-the garden of eden must have been like . But [those Brazils]75-the brazils , under [God]281-god , were the cause of [my]0-i being [here]775-here ; for [[my]0-i father]3846-my father , who was [a mine - captain]2279-a mine - captain , lost all [his]3846-my father money there , by [no man]1477-no man ’s fault but [his]3846-my father own , and not [his]3846-my father either , [the world]475-the world would say , and when [we]2282-we came back to [Cornwall]79-cornwall [he]3846-my father could not stand the bal work , nor [I]0-i neither . Out of that burning sun , [sir]753-sir , to come [home]452-home [here]775-here , and work in the levels , up to [our]2282-we knees in warm water , with the thermometer at 85 ° , and then up a thousand feet of ladder to grass , reeking wet with heat , and find the easterly sleet driving across [those open furze - crofts]2286-those open furze - crofts — [he]3846-my father could n’t stand it , [sir]753-sir — few stand it long , even of [those who stay in [Cornwall]79-cornwall]2288-those who stay in cornwall . [We]2282-we [miners]2289-miners have a short lease of life ; consumption and strains break [us]2282-we down before [we]2282-we ’re fifty . ’[2290-i] ‘ But how came [you]753-sir [here]775-here ? ’[2290-i] ‘ [The doctor]4115-the doctor told [[my]2290-i father]3846-my father , and [me]2290-i too , [sir]753-sir , that [we]2282-we must give up mining , or die of decline : so [he]3846-my father came up [here]775-here , to [a sister of [his]3846-my father that was married to [[the squire]3125-the squire ’s gardener]4835-the squire ’s gardener]4833-a sister of his that was married to the squire ’s gardener , and here [he]3846-my father died ; and [the squire]3125-the squire , God bless [him]3846-my father and forgive [him]3846-my father , took a fancy to [me]2290-i , and made [me]2290-i under - keeper . And [I]2290-i loved the life , for it took [me]2290-i among [the woods]538-the woods and [the rivers]4838-the rivers , where [I]2290-i could think of [the Brazils]75-the brazils , and fancy [myself]2290-i back again . But must n’t talk of that — where [God]281-god wills is all right . And it is a fine life for reading and thinking , [a gamekeeper]4839-a gamekeeper ’s , for it ’s an idle life at best . Now that ’s over , ’[2290-i] [he]2290-i added , with a sigh , ‘ and [the Lord]817-the lord has fulfilled [His]817-the lord words to [me]2290-i , that [He]817-the lord spoke the first night that ever [I]2290-i heard a stone - plover cry . ’[2290-i] ‘ What on earth can [you]2290-i mean ? ’[172-lancelot] asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot , deeply interested . ‘ Why , [sir]753-sir , it was a wild , whirling gray night , with the air full of sleet and rain , and [[my]172-lancelot father]3846-my father sent [me]172-lancelot over to [Redruth town]80-redruth town to bring home some trade or other . And as [I]172-lancelot came back [I]172-lancelot got blinded with the sleet , and [I]172-lancelot lost [my]172-lancelot way across [the moors]4843-the moors . [You]753-sir know [those Cornish furze - moors]4844-those cornish furze - moors , [sir]753-sir ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ No . ’[2290-i] ‘ Well , then , they are burrowed like a rabbit - warren with [old mine - shafts]4846-old mine - shafts . [You]4847-you ca n’t go in some places ten yards without finding great , ghastly black holes , covered in with furze , and weeds , and bits of rotting timber ; and when [I]2290-i was [a boy]1316-a boy [I]2290-i could n’t keep from [them]4844-those cornish furze - moors . Something seemed to draw [me]2290-i to go and peep down , and drop pebbles in , to hear them rattle against the sides , fathoms below , till they plumped into the ugly black still water at the bottom . And [I]2290-i used to be always after them in [my]2290-i dreams , when [I]2290-i was young , falling down them , down , down , all night long , till [I]2290-i woke screaming ; for [I]2290-i fancied they were hell ’s mouth , every one of them . And it stands to reason , [sir]753-sir ; [we]4850-we miners hold that [the lake of fire]4851-the lake of fire ca n’t be far below . For [we]4850-we find it grow warmer , and warmer , and warmer , the farther [we]4850-we sink a shaft ; and [the learned gentlemen]4852-the learned gentlemen have proved , [sir]753-sir , that it ’s not the blasting powder , nor [the men]4767-the men ’s breaths , that heat [the mine]3271-the mine . ’[2290-i] [Lancelot]172-lancelot could but listen . ‘ Well , [sir]753-sir , [I]2290-i got into [a great furze - croft]4857-a great furze - croft , full of deads ( those are the earth - heaps they throw out of the shafts ) , where [no man]1477-no man in [his]1477-no man senses dare go forward or back in the dark , for fear of the shafts ; and the wind and the snow were so sharp , they made [me]2290-i quite stupid and sleepy ; and [I]2290-i knew if [I]2290-i stayed [there]992-there [I]2290-i should be frozen to death , and if [I]2290-i went on , there were the shafts ready to swallow [me]2290-i up : and what with fear and the howling and raging of the wind , [I]2290-i was like [a mazed boy]4860-a mazed boy , [sir]753-sir . And [I]2290-i knelt down and tried to pray ; and then , in one moment , all the evil things [I]2290-i ’d ever done , and the bad words and thoughts that ever crossed [me]2290-i , rose up together as clear as one page of a print - book ; and [I]2290-i knew that if [I]2290-i died that minute [I]2290-i should go to hell . And then [I]2290-i saw through the ground all the water in the shafts glaring like blood , and all the sides of the shafts fierce red - hot , as if hell was coming up . And [I]2290-i heard [the knockers]4862-the knockers knocking , or thought [I]2290-i heard [them]4862-the knockers , as plain as [I]2290-i hear that grasshopper in the hedge now . ’[2290-i] ‘ What are [the knockers]4862-the knockers ? ’[2290-i] ‘ [They]4862-the knockers are the ghosts , [the miners]4864-the miners hold , of [the old Jews]4865-the old jews , [sir]753-sir , that crucified [[our]4864-the miners Lord]4867-our lord , and were sent for [slaves]1525-slaves by [the Roman emperors]4869-the roman emperors to work [the mines]4870-the mines ; and [we]2292-we find [[their]2291-they old smelting - houses]4871-their old smelting - houses , which [we]2292-we call [[Jews]4872-jews ’[2290-i] houses]4873-jews ’ houses , and [their]2291-they blocks of tin , at the bottom of the great bogs , which [we]2292-we call [Jews]4872-jews ’ tin ; and there ’s [a town among [us]2292-we]4874-a town among us , too , which [we]2292-we call [Market - Jew]81-market - jew — but the old name was [Marazion]334-marazion ; that means [the Bitterness of [Zion]83-zion]82-the bitterness of zion , [they]2291-they tell [me]2290-i . Is n’t it so , [sir]753-sir ? ’[2290-i] ‘ [I]172-lancelot believe it is , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , utterly puzzled in this new field of romance . ‘ And bitter work it was for [them]2291-they , no doubt , [poor souls]661-poor souls ! [We]2292-we used to break into the old shafts and adits which [they]2291-they had made , and find old stags’-horn pickaxes , that crumbled to pieces when [we]2292-we brought them to grass ; and [they]2291-they say , that if [a man]445-a man will listen , [sir]753-sir , of a still night , about [those old shafts]4879-those old shafts , [he]445-a man may hear the ghosts of [them]4879-those old shafts at working , knocking , and picking , as clear as if there was [a man at work in the next level]4880-a man at work in the next level . It may be all an old fancy . [I]172-lancelot suppose it is . But [I]172-lancelot believed it when [I]172-lancelot was [a boy]1316-a boy ; and it helped the work in [me]172-lancelot that night . But [I]172-lancelot ’ll go on with [my]172-lancelot story . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Go on with what [you]753-sir like , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ Well , [sir]753-sir , [I]172-lancelot was down on [my]172-lancelot knees among the furze - bushes , and [I]172-lancelot tried to pray ; but [I]172-lancelot was too frightened , for [I]172-lancelot felt the beast [I]172-lancelot had been , [sir]753-sir ; and [I]172-lancelot expected the ground to open and let [me]172-lancelot down every moment ; and then there came by over [my]172-lancelot head a rushing , and a cry . “ Ha ! ha ! ha ! [Paul]173-tregarva ! ” it said ; and it seemed as if [all the devils]3402-all the devils and [witches]4885-witches were out on the wind , a - laughing at [my]172-lancelot misery . “ Oh , [I]172-lancelot ’ll mend — [I’ll]172-lancelot repent , ” [I]172-lancelot said , “ indeed [I]172-lancelot will : ” and again it came back,—“Ha ! ha ! ha ! [Paul]173-tregarva ! ” it said . [I]172-lancelot knew afterwards that it was a bird ; but [the Lord]4886-the lord sent it to [me]172-lancelot for [a messenger]4111-a messenger , no less , that night . And [I]172-lancelot shook like a reed in the water ; and then , all at once a thought struck [me]172-lancelot . “ Why should [I]172-lancelot be [a coward]4888-a coward ? Why should [I]172-lancelot be afraid of shafts , or devils , or hell , or anything else ? If [I]172-lancelot am [a miserable sinner]4889-a miserable sinner , there ’s [One]3305-one died for [me]172-lancelot — [I]172-lancelot owe [him]3305-one love , not fear at all . [I]172-lancelot ’ll not be frightened into doing right — that ’s a rascally reason for repentance . ” And so it was , [sir]753-sir , that [I]172-lancelot rose up like [a man]445-a man , and said to [the Lord Jesus]335-the lord jesus , right out into the black , dumb air,—“If [you]335-the lord jesus ’ll be on [my]172-lancelot side this night , [good Lord]4893-good lord , that died for [me]172-lancelot , [I]172-lancelot ’ll be on [your]335-the lord jesus side for ever , villain as [I]172-lancelot am , if [I]172-lancelot ’m[172-lancelot] worth making any use of . ” And there and then , [sir]753-sir , [I]0-i saw a light come over the bushes , brighter , and brighter , up to [me]0-i ; and there rose up a voice within [me]0-i , and spoke to [me]0-i , quite soft and sweet,—“Fear not , [Paul]173-tregarva , for [I]0-i will send [thee]173-tregarva far hence unto [the Gentiles]336-the gentiles . ” And what more happened [I]0-i ca n’t tell , for when [I]0-i woke [I]0-i was safe at [home]452-home . [[My]0-i father]3846-my father and [[his]3846-my father folk]2297-his folk had been out with lanterns after [me]0-i ; and there [they]2298-they found [me]0-i , sure enough , in a dead faint on the ground . But this [I]0-i know , [sir]753-sir , that those words have never left [my]0-i mind since for a day together ; and [I]0-i know that they will be fulfilled in [me]0-i this tide , or never . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot was silent a few minutes . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i suppose , [Tregarva]173-tregarva , that [you]173-tregarva would call this [your]173-tregarva conversion ? ’ ‘[173-tregarva] [I]0-i should call it one , [sir]753-sir , because it was one . ’ ‘[173-tregarva] Tell [me]0-i now , honestly , did any real , practical change in [your]173-tregarva behaviour take place after that night ? ’ ‘[753-sir] As much , [sir]753-sir , as if [you]753-sir put a soul into a hog , and told [him]2302-him that [he]2302-him was [[a gentleman]3733-a gentleman ’s son]2304-a gentleman ’s son ; and , if every time [he]2302-him remembered that , [he]2302-him got spirit enough to conquer [his]2302-him hoggishness , and behave like [a man]445-a man , till the hoggishness died out of [him]2302-him , and the manliness grew up and bore fruit in [him]2302-him , more and more each day . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot half understood [him]173-tregarva , and sighed . A long silence followed , as [they]4894-they paced on past [lonely farmyards]4895-lonely farmyards , from which the rich manure - water was draining across [the road]3605-the road in foul black streams , festering and steaming in the chill night air . [Lancelot]172-lancelot sighed as [he]172-lancelot saw the fruitful materials of food running to waste , and thought of the ‘[2308-modern landlords] over - population ’ cry ; and then [he]172-lancelot looked across to the miles of [brown moorland]4897-brown moorland on [the opposite side of [the valley]4899-the valley]4898-the opposite side of the valley , that lay idle and dreary under the autumn moon , except where here and there [a squatter ’s cottage and rood of fruitful garden]4900-a squatter ’s cottage and rood of fruitful garden gave the lie to the laziness and ignorance of [man]564-man , who pretends that it is not worth [his]564-man while to cultivate the soil which [God]281-god has given [him]564-man . ‘[2308-modern landlords] Good heavens ! ’ [he]172-lancelot thought , ‘[2308-modern landlords] had [[our]2306-we forefathers]3435-our forefathers had no more enterprise than [modern landlords]2308-modern landlords , where should [we]2306-we all have been at this moment ? Everywhere waste ? Waste of manure , waste of land , waste of muscle , waste of brain , waste of population — and [we]2306-we call [ourselves]2306-we [the workshop of [the world]475-the world]2309-the workshop of the world ! ’ As [they]2306-we passed through [the miserable hamlet - street of Ashy]4902-the miserable hamlet - street of ashy , [they]2306-we saw a light burning in window . At the door below , [a haggard woman]4903-a haggard woman was looking anxiously down [the village]3227-the village . ‘[337-mistress cooper] What ’s the matter , [Mistress Cooper]337-mistress cooper ? ’ asked [Tregarva]173-tregarva . ‘[337-mistress cooper] Here ’s [[Mrs. Grane]338-mrs. grane ’s poor girl]2311-mrs. grane ’s poor girl lying sick of the fever — [the Lord]817-the lord help [her]2311-mrs. grane ’s poor girl ! and [the boy]1359-the boy died of it last week . [We]2306-we sent for [the doctor]4115-the doctor this afternoon , and [he]4115-the doctor ’s busy with [a poor soul that ’s in [her]2311-mrs. grane ’s poor girl trouble]2315-a poor soul that ’s in her trouble ; and now [we]2306-we ’ve sent down to [[the squire]3125-the squire ’s]2317-the squire ’s , and [the young ladies]2318-the young ladies , [God]281-god bless [them]2318-the young ladies ! sent answer [they]2318-the young ladies ’d come [themselves]2318-the young ladies straightway . ’ ‘[2318-the young ladies] No wonder [you]2319-you have typhus [here]775-here , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[2319-you] with this filthy open drain running right before the door . Why ca n’t [you]2319-you clean it out ? ’ ‘[2319-you] Why , what harm does that do ? ’ answered [the woman]628-the woman , peevishly . ‘[2319-you] Besides , here ’s [[my]0-i master]2321-my master gets up to [his]2321-my master work by five in the morning , and not back till seven at night , and by then [he]2321-my master ai n’t in no humour to clean out gutters . And where ’s the water to come from to keep [a place]2322-a place clean ? It costs many a one of [us]2306-we here a shilling a week the summer through to pay fetching water up [the hill]570-the hill . [We]2306-we ’ve work enough to fill [our]2306-we kettles . The muck must just lie in [the road]3605-the road , smell or none , till the rain carries it away . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot sighed again . ‘[173-tregarva] It would be a good thing for [Ashy]85-ashy , [Tregarva]173-tregarva , if the weir - pool did , some fine morning , run up to [Ashy Down]66-ashy down , as poor [Harry Verney]174-old harry said on [his]174-old harry deathbed . ’ ‘[174-old harry] There wo n’t be much of [Ashy]85-ashy left by that time , [sir]753-sir , if [the landlords]750-the landlords go on pulling down [cottages]928-cottages at [their]750-the landlords present rate ; driving [the people]1331-the people into [the towns]2329-the towns , to herd together there like hogs , and walk out to [their]1331-the people work four or five miles every morning . ’ ‘[85-ashy] Why , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[85-ashy] wherever one goes one sees [commodious new cottages]2330-commodious new cottages springing up . ’ ‘[753-sir] Wherever [you]753-sir go , [sir]753-sir ; but what of wherever [you]753-sir do n’t go ? Along [the roadsides]2332-the roadsides , and round [[the gentlemen]3343-the gentlemen ’s parks]2334-the gentlemen ’s parks , where [the cottages]1262-the cottages are in sight , it ’s all very smart ; but just go into [the outlying hamlets]2336-the outlying hamlets — [a whited sepulchre]2337-a whited sepulchre , [sir]753-sir , is many [a great estate]2339-a great estate ; outwardly swept and garnished , and inwardly full of all uncleanliness , and [dead men]2340-dead men ’s bones . ’ At this moment [two cloaked and veiled figures]4906-two cloaked and veiled figures came up to the door , followed by [a servant]4907-a servant . There was no mistaking those delicate footsteps , and [the two young men]4908-the two young men drew back with fluttering hearts , and breathed out silent blessings on [the ministering angels]4909-the ministering angels , as [they]4908-the two young men entered [the crazy and reeking house]4910-the crazy and reeking house . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ’m thinking , [sir]753-sir , ’[173-tregarva] said [Tregarva]173-tregarva , as [they]2341-them walked slowly and reluctantly away , ‘ that it is hard of [the gentlemen]3343-the gentlemen to leave all [God]281-god ’s work to [the ladies]701-the ladies , as nine - tenths of [them]3343-the gentlemen do . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ And [I]0-i am thinking , [Tregarva]173-tregarva , that both for [ladies]3255-ladies and [gentlemen]780-gentlemen , prevention is better than cure . ’[0-i] ‘ There ’s a great change come over [Miss Argemone]150-argemone , [sir]753-sir . [She]150-argemone used not to be so ready to start out at midnight to visit [dying folk]4917-dying folk . A blessed change ! ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot thought so too , and [he]172-lancelot thought that [he]172-lancelot knew the cause of it . [Argemone]150-argemone ’s appearance , and [their]2341-them late conversation , had started a new covey of strange fancies . [Lancelot]172-lancelot followed [them]2341-them over [hill and dale]2342-hill and dale , glad to escape a moment from the mournful lessons of that evening ; but even over [them]2341-them there was a cloud of sadness . [Harry Verney]174-old harry ’s last words , and [Argemone]150-argemone ’s accidental whisper about ‘ a curse upon [the Lavingtons]248-the lavingtons , ’[150-argemone] rose to [his]172-lancelot mind . [He]172-lancelot longed to ask [Tregarva]173-tregarva , but [he]172-lancelot was afraid — not of [the man]738-the man , for there was a delicacy in [his]738-the man truthfulness which encouraged the most utter confidence ; but of the subject itself ; but curiosity conquered . ‘ What did [Old Harry]174-old harry mean about [the Nun - pool]4918-the nun - pool ? ’[172-lancelot] [he]172-lancelot said at last . ‘ [Every one]807-every one seemed to understand [him]174-old harry . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Ah , [sir]753-sir , [he]174-old harry ought n’t to have talked of it ! But [dying men]4921-dying men , at times , see over [the dark water]4922-the dark water into deep things — deeper than [they]4921-dying men think [themselves]4921-dying men . Perhaps there ’s one speaks through [them]4921-dying men . But [I]172-lancelot thought [every one]807-every one knew the story . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot do not , at least . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Perhaps it ’s so much the better , [sir]753-sir . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Why ? [I]172-lancelot must insist on knowing . It is necessary — proper , that is — that [I]172-lancelot should hear everything that concerns — ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot understand , [sir]753-sir ; so it is ; and [I]172-lancelot ’ll tell [you]753-sir . The story goes , that in the old Popish times , when [the nuns]4926-the nuns held [Whitford Priors]144-whitford priors , [the first Mr. Lavington]276-mr. lavington that ever was came from [the king]1094-the king with a warrant to turn [them]4926-the nuns all out , [poor souls]661-poor souls , and take [the lands]4929-the lands for [his]276-mr. lavington own . And [they]4926-the nuns say [the head lady of [them]4926-the nuns]4930-the head lady of them — [prioress]4931-prioress , or [abbess]4932-abbess , as [they]4926-the nuns called [her]4930-the head lady of them — withstood [him]276-mr. lavington , and cursed [him]276-mr. lavington , in the name of [the Lord]817-the lord , for [a hypocrite who robbed [harmless women]4935-harmless women under the cloak of punishing [them]4935-harmless women for sins [they]4935-harmless women ’d never committed]4934-a hypocrite who robbed harmless women under the cloak of punishing them for sins they ’d never committed ( for [they]4926-the nuns say , [sir]753-sir , [he]276-mr. lavington went up to [court]4937-court , and slandered [the nuns]4926-the nuns [there]992-there for drunkards and worse ) . And [she]4930-the head lady of them told [him]753-sir , “ That the curse of [the nuns of [Whitford]7-whitford]4940-the nuns of whitford should be on [him]276-mr. lavington and [his]276-mr. lavington , till [they]4926-the nuns helped [the poor]698-the poor in the spirit of [the nuns of [Whitford]7-whitford]4940-the nuns of whitford , and [the Nun - pool]4918-the nun - pool ran up to [Ashy]85-ashy Down . ’[172-lancelot] ” ‘ That time is not come yet , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ But the worst is to come , [sir]753-sir . For [he]276-mr. lavington or [his]276-mr. lavington , [sir]753-sir , that night , said or did something to [the lady , that was more than woman]4946-the lady , that was more than woman ’s heart could bear : and the next morning [she]4930-the head lady of them was found dead and cold , drowned in [that weir - pool]4947-that weir - pool . And there [[the gentleman]2200-the gentleman ’s eldest son]4949-the gentleman ’s eldest son was drowned , and more than one [Lavington]276-mr. lavington beside . [[Miss Argemone]150-argemone ’s only brother]4950-miss argemone ’s only brother , that was [the heir]4951-the heir , was drowned there too , when [he]4950-miss argemone ’s only brother was [a little one]4952-a little one . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot never heard that [she]150-argemone had [a brother]3632-a brother . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ No , [sir]753-sir , [no one]555-no one talks of it . There are many things happen in [the great house]4956-the great house that [you]753-sir must go to [the little house]4957-the little house to hear of . But [the country - folk]4958-the country - folk believe , [sir]753-sir , that [the nun]4960-the nun ’s curse holds true ; and [they]4958-the country - folk say , that [Whitford folks]4961-whitford folks have been getting poorer and wickeder ever since that time , and will , till [the Nun - pool]4918-the nun - pool runs up to [Ashy]85-ashy , and [the Lavingtons]248-the lavingtons ’[172-lancelot] name goes out of [Whitford Priors]144-whitford priors . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot said nothing . A presentiment of evil hung over [him]172-lancelot . [He]172-lancelot was utterly down - hearted about [Tregarva]173-tregarva , about [Argemone]150-argemone , about [the poor]698-the poor . The truth was , [he]172-lancelot could not shake off the impression of the scene [he]172-lancelot had left , utterly disappointed and disgusted with the ‘[172-lancelot] revel . ’ [He]172-lancelot had expected , as [I]172-lancelot said before , at least to hear something of pastoral sentiment , and of genial frolicsome humour ; to see some innocent , simple enjoyment : but instead , what had [he]172-lancelot seen but vanity , jealousy , hoggish sensuality , dull vacuity ? [drudges]4964-drudges struggling for one night to forget [their]4964-drudges drudgery . And yet withal , those songs , and the effect which [they]4964-drudges produced , showed that in [these poor creatures]4965-these poor creatures , too , lay the germs of pathos , taste , melody , soft and noble affections . ‘[172-lancelot] What right have [we]2344-we , ’ thought [he]172-lancelot , ‘[172-lancelot] to hinder [their]2345-their development ? Art , poetry , music , science,—ay , even those athletic and graceful exercises on which [we]2344-we all pride [ourselves]2344-we , which [we]2344-we consider necessary to soften and refine [ourselves]2344-we , what [God]281-god has given [us]2344-we a monopoly of them?—what is good for [the rich man]2346-the rich man is good for [the poor]698-the poor . Over - education ? And what of that ? What if [the poor]698-the poor be raised above “ [[their]698-the poor station]2349-their station ” ? What right have [we]2344-we to keep [them]698-the poor down ? How long have [they]698-the poor been [our]2344-we born thralls in soul , as well as in body ? What right have [we]2344-we to say that [they]698-the poor shall know no higher recreation than the hogs , because , forsooth , if [we]2344-we raised [them]698-the poor , [they]698-the poor might refuse to work — for [us]2344-we ? Are [we]2344-we to fix how far [their]698-the poor minds may be developed ? Has not [God]281-god fixed it for [us]2344-we , when [He]281-god gave [them]698-the poor the same passions , talents , tastes , as [our]2344-we own ? ’ [Tregarva]173-tregarva ’s meditations must have been running in a very different channel , for [he]173-tregarva suddenly burst out , after a long silence — ‘[281-god] It ’s a pity these fairs ca n’t be put down . [They]698-the poor do a lot of harm ; ruin all [the young girls]2151-the young girls round , [[the Dissenters]2351-the dissenters ’ children]4966-the dissenters ’ children especially , for [they]4966-the dissenters ’ children run utterly wild ; [[their]4966-the dissenters ’ children parents]4967-their parents have no hold on [them]4966-the dissenters ’ children at all . ’[281-god] ‘ [They]698-the poor tell [them]698-the poor that [they]698-the poor are [children of the devil]4968-children of the devil , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ What wonder if [the children]930-the children take [them]698-the poor at [their]698-the poor word , and act accordingly ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [The parson]3572-the parson here , [sir]753-sir , who is [a God - fearing man]4972-a god - fearing man enough , tried hard to put down this one , but [the innkeepers]4973-the innkeepers were too strong for [him]3572-the parson . ’[281-god] ‘ To take away [their]930-the children only amusement , in short . [He]3572-the parson had much better have set to work to amuse [them]930-the children [himself]3572-the parson . ’[281-god] ‘ [His]3572-the parson business is to save [souls]4334-souls , [sir]753-sir , and not to amuse [them]930-the children . [I]172-lancelot do n’t see , [sir]753-sir , what [Christian people]4977-christian people want with such vanities . ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot did not argue the point , for [he]172-lancelot knew the prejudices of [Dissenters on the subject]2352-dissenters on the subject ; but it did strike [him]172-lancelot that if [Tregarva]173-tregarva ’s brain had been a little less preponderant , [he]172-lancelot , too , might have found the need of some recreation besides books and thought . By this time [they]2353-they were at [[Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s door]2354-lancelot ’s door . [He]172-lancelot bid [the keeper]3350-the keeper a hearty good - night , made [him]3350-the keeper promise to see [him]3350-the keeper next day , and went to bed and slept till nearly noon . When [he]172-lancelot walked into [[his]172-lancelot breakfast - room]2356-his breakfast - room , [he]172-lancelot found a note on the table in [[his]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle ’s handwriting . [[The vicar]3366-the vicar ’s servant]2359-the vicar ’s servant had left it an hour before . [He]172-lancelot opened it listlessly , rang the bell furiously , ordered out [his]172-lancelot best horse , and , huddling on [his]172-lancelot clothes , galloped to [the nearest station]2360-the nearest station , caught [the train]1992-the train , and arrived at [[[his]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle ’s bank]2363-his uncle ’s bank — it had stopped payment two hours before . Yes ! [the bank]3419-the bank had stopped . [The ancient firm of Smith , Brown , Jones]2365-the ancient firm of smith , brown , jones , [Robinson]341-robinson , and Co. , which had been for some years past expanding from a solid golden organism into a cobweb - tissue and huge balloon of threadbare paper , had at last worn through and collapsed , dropping its car and human contents miserably into [the Thames mud]2366-the thames mud . Why detail the pitiable post - mortem examination resulting ? [Lancelot]172-lancelot sickened over it for many a long day ; not , indeed , mourning at [his]172-lancelot private losses , but at the thorough hollowness of the system which it exposed , about which [he]172-lancelot spoke [his]172-lancelot mind pretty freely to [[his]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle , who bore it good - humouredly enough . Indeed , the discussions to which it gave rise rather comforted [the good man]4516-the good man , by turning [his]172-lancelot thought from [his]172-lancelot own losses to general principles . ‘ [I]172-lancelot have ruined [you]172-lancelot , [[my]172-lancelot poor boy]4978-my poor boy , ’[172-lancelot] [he]172-lancelot used to say ; ‘ so [you]172-lancelot may as well take [your]172-lancelot money ’s worth out of [me]172-lancelot in bullying . ’[172-lancelot] Nothing , indeed , could surpass [his]172-lancelot honest and manly sorrow for having been the cause of [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s beggary ; but as for persuading [him]172-lancelot that [his]172-lancelot system was wrong , it was quite impossible . Not that [Lancelot]172-lancelot was hard upon [him]2357-his uncle ; on the contrary , [he]172-lancelot assured [him]2357-his uncle , repeatedly , of [his]172-lancelot conviction , that the precepts of the Bible had nothing to do with the laws of commerce ; that though [the Jews]2369-the jews were forbidden to take interest of [Jews]342-jews , [Christians]1026-christians had a perfect right to be as hard as [they]1026-christians liked on ‘ [brother ’[1026-christians] Christians]4979-brother ’ christians ; that there could not be the least harm in share - jobbing , for though it did , to be sure , add nothing to the wealth of [the community]2371-the community — only conjure money out of [[your]2372-your neighbour]2373-your neighbour ’s pocket into [your]2372-your own — yet was not that all fair in trade ? If [a man]445-a man did not know the real value of the shares [he]445-a man sold [you]2372-your , [you]2372-your were not bound to tell [him]445-a man . Again , [Lancelot]172-lancelot quite agreed with [[his]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle , that though covetousness might be idolatry , yet money - making could not be called covetousness ; and that , on the whole , though making haste to be rich was denounced as a dangerous and ruinous temptation in [St. Paul]197-st. paul ’s times , that was not the slightest reason why it should be so now . All these concessions were made with a freedom which caused [the good banker]2376-the good banker to suspect at times that [[his]2376-the good banker shrewd nephew]2377-his shrewd nephew was laughing at [him]2376-the good banker in [his]2376-the good banker sleeve , but [he]2376-the good banker could not but subscribe to [them]2378-them for the sake of consistency ; though as [a staunch Protestant]2379-a staunch protestant , it puzzled [him]2376-the good banker a little at times to find it necessary to justify [himself]2376-the good banker by getting [[his]2376-the good banker ‘ infidel ’[2376-the good banker] nephew]2380-his ‘ infidel ’ nephew to explain away so much of the Bible for [him]2376-the good banker . But [men]612-men are accustomed to do that now - a - days , and so was [he]2376-the good banker . Once only did [Lancelot]172-lancelot break out with [his]172-lancelot real sentiments when [the banker]1279-the banker was planning how to re - establish [his]172-lancelot credit ; to set to work , in fact , to blow over again the same bubble which had already burst under [him]172-lancelot . ‘ If [I]172-lancelot were [a Christian]4980-a christian , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘ like [you]4981-you , [I]172-lancelot would call this credit system of [yours]4981-you [the devil]600-the devil ’s selfish counterfeit of [God]281-god ’s order of mutual love and trust ; [the child of that miserable dream]4983-the child of that miserable dream , which , as [Dr. Chalmers]343-dr. chalmers well said , expects universal selfishness to do the work of universal love . Look at [your]4981-you credit system , how — not in its abuse , but in its very essence — it carries the seeds of self - destruction . In the first place , [a man]445-a man ’s credit depends , not upon [his]445-a man real worth and property , but upon [his]445-a man reputation for property ; daily and hourly [he]445-a man is tempted , [he]445-a man is forced , to puff [himself]445-a man , to pretend to be richer than [he]445-a man is . ’[172-lancelot] [The banker]1279-the banker sighed and shrugged [his]1279-the banker shoulders . ‘ [We]4985-we all do it , [[my]1279-the banker dear boy]4986-my dear boy . ’[1279-the banker] ‘ [I]1279-the banker know it . [You]4981-you must do it , or be more than human . There is lie the first , and look at lie the second . This credit system is founded on the universal faith and honour of [[men]612-men towards [men]612-men]4988-men towards men . But do [you]4981-you think faith and honour can be [the children of selfishness]4990-the children of selfishness ? [Men]612-men must be chivalrous and disinterested to be honourable . And [you]4981-you expect [them]612-men all to join in universal faith — each for [his]612-men own selfish interest ? [You]4981-you forget that if that is the prime motive , [men]612-men will be honourable only as long as it suits that same self - interest . ’[1279-the banker] [The banker]1279-the banker shrugged [his]1279-the banker shoulders again . ‘ Yes , [[my]172-lancelot dear uncle]4993-my dear uncle , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘ [you]4981-you all forget it , though [you]4981-you suffer for it daily and hourly ; though [the honourable men among [you]4981-you]4994-the honourable men among you complain of the stain which has fallen on the old chivalrous good faith of English commerce , and say that now , abroad as well as at [home]452-home , [an Englishman]1153-an englishman ’s word is no longer worth [other men]4997-other men ’s bonds . [You]4981-you see the evil , and [you]4981-you deplore it in disgust . Ask [yourself]4981-you honestly , how can [you]4981-you battle against it , while [you]4981-you allow in practice , and in theory too , except in [church]3599-church on Sundays , the very falsehood from which it all springs?—that [a man]445-a man is bound to get wealth , not for [[his]445-a man country]5000-his country , but for [himself]445-a man ; that , in short , not patriotism , but selfishness , is the bond of [all society]3139-all society . Selfishness can collect , not unite , a herd of cowardly wild cattle , that [they]5002-they may feed together , breed together , keep off the wolf and bear together . But when one of [your]4981-you wild cattle falls sick , what becomes of the corporate feelings of [the herd]5003-the herd then ? For [one man of [your]4981-you class who is nobly helped by [[his]5004-one man of your class who is nobly helped by his fellows fellows]5005-his fellows]5004-one man of your class who is nobly helped by his fellows , are not [the thousand left behind to perish]5006-the thousand left behind to perish ? [Your]4981-you Bible talks of society , not as a herd , but as a living tree , [an organic individual body]5007-an organic individual body , a holy brotherhood , and kingdom of [God]281-god . And here is an idol which [you]4981-you have set up instead of it ! ’[172-lancelot] But [the banker]1279-the banker was deaf to all arguments . No doubt [he]1279-the banker had plenty , for [he]1279-the banker was [himself]1279-the banker [a just and generous — ay]2386-a just and generous — ay , and [a God - fearing man]4972-a god - fearing man in [his]1279-the banker way , only [he]1279-the banker regarded [[Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s young fancies]2388-lancelot ’s young fancies as too visionary to deserve an answer ; which [they]2388-lancelot ’s young fancies most probably are ; else , having been broached as often as [they]2388-lancelot ’s young fancies have been , [they]2388-lancelot ’s young fancies would surely , ere now , have provoked the complete refutation which can , no doubt , be given to [them]2388-lancelot ’s young fancies by [hundreds of learned votaries of so - called commerce]2389-hundreds of learned votaries of so - called commerce . And here [I]0-i beg [[my]0-i readers]1497-my readers to recollect that [I]0-i am in no way answerable for the speculations , either of [Lancelot]172-lancelot or [any of [[his]172-lancelot acquaintances]2392-his acquaintances]2391-any of his acquaintances ; and that these papers have been , from beginning to end , as in name , so in nature , [Yeast]344-yeast — an honest sample of the questions , which , good or bad , are fermenting in the minds of [the young of this day]2393-the young of this day , and are rapidly leavening the minds of [the rising generation]2394-the rising generation . No doubt they are all as full of fallacies as possible , but as long as the saying of [the German sage]2203-the german sage stands true , that ‘ the destiny of [any nation]5008-any nation , at any given moment , depends on the opinions of [its young men under five - and - twenty]5009-its young men under five - and - twenty , ’[2203-the german sage] so long it must be worth while for [those who wish to preserve the present order of society]2396-those who wish to preserve the present order of society to justify [its]2397-its acknowledged evils somewhat , not only to [the few young men who are interested in preserving them]2398-the few young men who are interested in preserving them , but also to [the many who are not]2399-the many who are not . Though , therefore , [I]0-i am neither [Plymouth Brother]2400-plymouth brother nor [Communist]345-communist , and as thoroughly convinced as the newspapers can make [me]0-i , that to assert the duties of property is only to plot its destruction , and that [a community of goods]2401-a community of goods must needs imply [a community of [wives]2403-wives]2402-a community of wives ( as [every one]807-every one knows was the case with [the apostolic Christians]120-christians ) , [I]0-i shall take the liberty of narrating [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s fanatical conduct , without execratory comment , certain that [he]172-lancelot will still receive [his]172-lancelot just reward of condemnation ; and that , if [I]0-i find facts , [a sensible public]2405-a sensible public will find abhorrence for them . [His]172-lancelot behaviour was , indeed , most singular ; [he]172-lancelot absolutely refused a good commercial situation which [[his]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle procured [him]172-lancelot . [He]172-lancelot did not believe in being ‘ cured by a hair of the dog that bit [him]172-lancelot ; ’[172-lancelot] and [he]172-lancelot refused , also , the really generous offers of [the creditors]2407-the creditors , to allow [him]172-lancelot a sufficient maintenance . ‘ No , ’[172-lancelot] [he]172-lancelot said , ‘ no more pay without work for [me]172-lancelot . [I]172-lancelot will earn [my]172-lancelot bread or starve . It seems [God]281-god ’s will to teach [me]172-lancelot what poverty is — [I]172-lancelot will see that [His]172-lancelot intention is not left half fulfilled . [I]172-lancelot have sinned , and only in the stern delight of a just penance can [I]172-lancelot gain self - respect . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ But , [[my]2357-his uncle dear madman]5010-my dear madman , ’[2357-his uncle] said [[his]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle , ‘ [you]5010-my dear madman are just [the innocent one among [us]5012-us all]5011-the innocent one among us all . [You]5010-my dear madman , at least , were only [a sleeping partner]5013-a sleeping partner . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ And therein lies [my]172-lancelot sin ; [I]172-lancelot took money which [I]172-lancelot never earned , and cared as little how it was gained as how [I]172-lancelot spent it . Henceforth [I]172-lancelot shall touch no farthing which is the fruit of a system which [I]172-lancelot can not approve . [I]172-lancelot accuse [no one]555-no one . Actions may vary in rightfulness , according to the age and [the person]5015-the person . But what may be right for [you]5010-my dear madman , because [you]5010-my dear madman think it right , is surely wrong for [me]172-lancelot because [I]172-lancelot think it wrong . ’[172-lancelot] So , with grim determination , [he]172-lancelot sent to the hammer every article [he]172-lancelot possessed , till [he]172-lancelot had literally nothing left but the clothes in which [he]172-lancelot stood . ‘ [He]172-lancelot could not rest , ’[172-lancelot] [he]172-lancelot said , ‘ till [he]172-lancelot had pulled out all [his]172-lancelot borrowed peacock ’s feathers . When [they]5016-they were gone [he]172-lancelot should be able to see , at last , whether [he]172-lancelot was jackdaw or eagle . ’[172-lancelot] And wonder not , [reader]3174-reader , at this same strength of will . The very genius , which too often makes [its possessor]2410-its possessor self - indulgent in common matters , from the intense capability of enjoyment which it brings , may also , when once [his]172-lancelot whole being is stirred into motion by some great object , transform [him]172-lancelot into [a hero]442-a hero . And [he]172-lancelot carried a letter , too , in [his]172-lancelot bosom , night and day , which routed all coward fears and sad forebodings as soon as they arose , and converted the lonely and squalid lodging to which [he]172-lancelot had retired , into [a fairy palace peopled with bright phantoms of future bliss]2412-a fairy palace peopled with bright phantoms of future bliss . [I]0-i need not say from whom it came . ‘ [Beloved]346-beloved ! ’[0-i] ( it ran ) ‘ [Darling]5017-darling ! [you]2413-you need not pain [yourself]2413-you to tell [me]0-i anything . [I]0-i know all ; and [I]0-i know , too ( do not ask [me]0-i how ) , [your]2413-you noble determination to drink the wholesome cup of poverty to [the very dregs]5018-the very dregs . ‘[0-i] Oh that [I]0-i were with [you]2413-you ! Oh that [I]0-i could give [you]2413-you [my]0-i fortune ! but that is not yet , alas ! in [my]0-i own power . No ! rather would [I]0-i share that poverty with [you]2413-you , and strengthen [you]2413-you in [your]2413-you purpose . And yet , [I]0-i can not bear the thought of [you]2413-you , lonely — perhaps miserable . But , courage ! though [you]2413-you have lost all , [you]2413-you have found [me]0-i ; and now [you]2413-you are knitting [me]0-i to [you]2413-you for ever — justifying [my]0-i own love to [me]0-i by [your]2413-you nobleness ; and am [I]0-i not worth all [the world]475-the world to [you]2413-you ? [I]0-i dare say this to [you]2413-you ; [you]2413-you will not think [me]0-i conceited . Can [we]2415-we misunderstand [each other]565-each other ’s hearts ? And all this while [you]2413-you are alone ! Oh ! [I]0-i have mourned for [you]2413-you ! Since [I]0-i heard of [your]2413-you misfortune [I]0-i have not tasted pleasure . The light of heaven has been black to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i have lived only upon love . [I]0-i will not taste comfort while [you]2413-you are wretched . Would that [I]0-i could be poor like [you]2413-you ! Every night upon the bare floor [I]0-i lie down to sleep , and fancy [you]2413-you in [[your]2413-you little chamber]2417-your little chamber , and nestle to [you]2413-you , and cover that dear face with kisses . Strange ! that [I]0-i should dare to speak thus to [you]2413-you , whom a few months ago [I]0-i had never heard of ! Wonderful simplicity of love ! How all that is prudish and artificial flees before it ! [I]0-i seem to have begun a new life . If [I]0-i could play now , it would be only with [little children]1752-little children . Farewell ! be great — a glorious future is before [you]2413-you and [me]0-i in [you]2413-you ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s answer must remain untold ; perhaps the veil has been already too far lifted which hides the sanctuary of such love . But , alas ! to [his]172-lancelot letter no second had been returned ; and [he]172-lancelot felt — though [he]172-lancelot dared not confess it to [himself]172-lancelot — a gloomy presentiment of evil flit across [him]172-lancelot , as [he]172-lancelot thought of [his]172-lancelot fallen fortunes , and the altered light in which [his]172-lancelot suit would be regarded by [[Argemone]150-argemone ’s parents]5019-argemone ’s parents . Once [he]172-lancelot blamed [himself]172-lancelot bitterly for not having gone to [Mr. Lavington]276-mr. lavington the moment [he]172-lancelot discovered [Argemone]150-argemone ’s affection , and insuring — as [he]172-lancelot then might have done — [his]172-lancelot consent . But again [he]172-lancelot felt that [no sloth]5020-no sloth had kept [him]172-lancelot back , but adoring reverence for [his]172-lancelot God - given treasure , and humble astonishment at [his]172-lancelot own happiness ; and [he]172-lancelot fled from the thought into renewed examination into the state of [the masses]5021-the masses , the effect of which was only to deepen [his]172-lancelot own determination to share [their]5021-the masses lot . But at the same time it seemed to [him]172-lancelot but fair to live , as long as it would last , on that part of [[his]172-lancelot capital]5022-his capital which [[his]172-lancelot creditors]5023-his creditors would have given nothing for — namely , [his]172-lancelot information ; and [he]172-lancelot set to work to write . But , alas ! [he]172-lancelot had but a ‘[281-god] small literary connection ; ’ and the entrée of the initiated ring is not obtained in a day ... Besides , [he]172-lancelot would not write trash.—He was in far too grim a humour for that ; and if [he]172-lancelot wrote on important subjects , [able editors]5024-able editors always were in the habit of entrusting [them]5024-able editors to [old contributors,—men]5025-old contributors,—men , in short , in whose judgment [they]5024-able editors had confidence — not to say anything which would commit the magazine to anything but its own little party - theory . And behold ! poor [Lancelot]172-lancelot found [himself]172-lancelot of no party whatsoever . [He]172-lancelot was in a minority of one against [the whole world]1313-the whole world , on all points , right or wrong . [He]172-lancelot had the unhappiest knack ( as [all geniuses]5027-all geniuses have ) of seeing connections , humorous or awful , between the most seemingly antipodal things ; of illustrating every subject from three or four different spheres which it is anathema to mention in the same page . If [he]172-lancelot wrote a physical - science article , [able editors]5024-able editors asked [him]172-lancelot what [the deuce a scrap of high - churchism]5029-the deuce a scrap of high - churchism did in the middle of it ? If [he]172-lancelot took the same article to a high - church magazine , [the editor]5030-the editor could not commit [himself]172-lancelot to any theory which made [the earth]866-the earth more than six thousand years old , and was afraid that [the public taste]5032-the public taste would not approve of the allusions to free - masonry and [Soyer]347-soyer ’s soup ... And worse than that , one and all — [Jew]348-jew , [Turk]349-turk , [infidel , and heretic]5033-infidel , and heretic , as well as [the orthodox]5034-the orthodox — joined in pious horror at [his]172-lancelot irreverence;—the shocking way [he]172-lancelot had of jumbling religion and politics — the human and the divine — the theories of the pulpit with the facts of the exchange ... The very atheists , who laughed at [him]172-lancelot for believing in [a God]1165-a god , agreed that that , at least , was inconsistent with the dignity of [the God]643-the god — who did not exist ... It was Syncretism ... Pantheism .... ‘[281-god] Very well , [friends]2419-friends , ’ quoth [Lancelot]172-lancelot to [himself]0-i , in bitter rage , one day , ‘[281-god] if [you]2419-friends choose to be without [God]281-god in [the world]475-the world , and to honour [Him]281-god by denying [Him]281-god ... do so ! [You]2419-friends shall have [your]2419-friends way ; and go to the place whither it seems leading [you]2419-friends just now , at railroad pace . But [I]0-i must live ... Well , at least , there is some old college nonsense of [mine]0-i , written three years ago , when [I]0-i believed , like [you]2419-friends , that [all heaven and earth]2421-all heaven and earth was put together out of separate bits , like [a child]3467-a child ’s puzzle , and that each topic ought to have its private little pigeon - hole all to itself in [a man]445-a man ’s brain , like drugs in [[a chemist]2424-a chemist ’s shop]2425-a chemist ’s shop . Perhaps it will suit [you]2419-friends , [friends]2419-friends ; perhaps it will be system - frozen , and narrow , and dogmatic , and cowardly , and godless enough for [you]2419-friends . ’ ... So [he]0-i went forth with [them]5037-them to market ; and behold ! they were bought forthwith . There was verily a demand for such ; ... and in spite of the ten thousand ink - fountains which were daily pouring out similar Stygian liquors , the public thirst remained unslaked . ‘[0-i] Well , ’ thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[0-i] [the negro race]2427-the negro race is not the only one which is afflicted with manias for eating dirt ... By the bye , where is poor [Luke]137-mr. smith ? ’ Ah ! where was poor [Luke]137-mr. smith ? [Lancelot]172-lancelot had received from [him]0-i one short and hurried note , blotted with tears , which told how [he]0-i had informed [[his]0-i father]453-his father ; and how [[his]0-i father]453-his father had refused to see [him]0-i , and had forbid [him]0-i [the house]3485-the house ; and how [he]453-his father had offered [him]0-i an allowance of fifty pounds a year ( it should have been five hundred , [he]453-his father said , if [he]453-his father had possessed it ) , which [[Luke]137-mr. smith ’s director]5041-luke ’s director , sensibly enough , had compelled [him]0-i to accept ... And there the letter ended , abruptly , leaving [the writer]5042-the writer evidently in lower depths than [he]5042-the writer had either experienced already , or expected at all . [Lancelot]172-lancelot had often pleaded for [him]0-i with [[his]0-i father]453-his father ; but in vain . Not that [the good man]4516-the good man was hard - hearted : [he]4516-the good man would cry like [a child]3467-a child about it all to [Lancelot]172-lancelot when [they]5046-they sat together after dinner . But [he]4516-the good man was utterly beside [himself]4516-the good man , what with grief , shame , terror , and astonishment . On the whole , the sorrow was a real comfort to [him]4516-the good man : it gave [him]4516-the good man something beside [his]4516-the good man bankruptcy to think of ; and , distracted between the two different griefs , [he]4516-the good man could brood over neither . But of [the two]3206-the two , certainly [[his]4516-the good man son]1227-his son ’s conversion was the worst in [his]4516-the good man eyes . The bankruptcy was intelligible — measurable ; it was something known and classified — part of the ills which flesh ( or , at least , commercial flesh ) is heir to . But going to [Rome]21-rome ! — ‘[137-mr. smith] [I]0-i ca n’t understand it . [I]0-i wo n’t believe it . It ’s so foolish , [you]0-i see , [Lancelot]172-lancelot — so foolish — like an ass that eats thistles ! ... There must be some reason;—there must be — something [we]2428-we do n’t know , [sir]753-sir ! Do [you]0-i think [they]2430-they could have promised to make [him]2431-he [a cardinal]2432-a cardinal ? ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot quite agreed that there were reasons for it , that [they]2430-they — or , at least , [the banker]1279-the banker — did not know ... ‘[0-i] Depend upon it , [they]2430-they promised [him]2431-he something — [some prince - bishopric]2433-some prince - bishopric , perhaps . Else why on earth could [a man]445-a man go over ! It ’s out of the course of nature ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot tried in vain to make [him]1279-the banker understand that [a man]445-a man might sacrifice everything to conscience , and actually give up all worldly weal for what [he]2431-he thought right . [The banker]1279-the banker turned on [him]0-i with angry resignation — ‘[0-i] Very well — [I]0-i suppose [he]2431-he ’s done right then ! [I]0-i suppose [you]0-i ’ll go next ! Take up a false religion , and give up everything for it ! Why , then , [he]2431-he must be honest ; and if [he]2431-he ’s honest , [he]2431-he ’s in the right ; and [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ’d better go too ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot argued : but in vain . The idea of disinterested sacrifice was so utterly foreign to [the good man]4516-the good man ’s own creed and practice , that [he]172-lancelot could but see one pair of alternatives . ‘[0-i] Either [he]2431-he is [a good man]2435-a good man , or [he]2431-he ’s [a hypocrite]2436-a hypocrite . Either [he]2431-he ’s right , or [he]2431-he ’s gone over for some vile selfish end ; and what can that be but money ? ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot gently hinted that there might be other selfish ends besides [pecuniary ones]5053-pecuniary ones — saving [one]3305-one ’s soul , for instance . ‘[2431-he] Why , if [he]2431-he wants to save [his]2431-he soul , [he]2431-he ’s right . What ought [we]2437-we all to do , but try to save [our]2437-we souls ? [I]0-i tell [you]2438-you there ’s some sinister reason . [They]2439-they ’ve told [him]2431-he that [they]2439-they expect to convert [England]3-england — [I]0-i should like to see [them]2439-they do it!—and that [he]2431-he ’ll be made [a bishop]2440-a bishop . Do n’t argue with [me]0-i , or [you]2438-you ’ll drive [me]0-i mad . [I]0-i know [those Jesuits]2441-those jesuits ! ’ And as soon as [he]0-i began upon [the Jesuits]282-jesuits , [Lancelot]172-lancelot prudently held [his]172-lancelot tongue . [The good man]4516-the good man had worked [himself]4516-the good man up into a perfect frenzy of terror and suspicion about [them]2441-those jesuits . [He]172-lancelot suspected concealed [Jesuits]282-jesuits among [[his]4516-the good man footmen]5056-his footmen and [[his]4516-the good man housemaids]5057-his housemaids ; [Jesuits]5058-jesuits in [[his]4516-the good man counting - house]5059-his counting - house , [Jesuits]5058-jesuits in [his]4516-the good man duns .... ‘[2441-those jesuits] Hang it , [sir]753-sir ! how do [I]0-i know that there ai n’t [a Jesuit]2443-a jesuit listening to [us]2444-us now behind the curtain ? ’ ‘[2443-a jesuit] [I]0-i ’ll go and look , ’ quoth [Lancelot]172-lancelot , and suited the action to the word . ‘[0-i] Well , if there ai n’t there might be . [They]2445-i ’re everywhere , [I]2445-i tell [you]753-sir . [That vicar of [Whitford]7-whitford]5061-that vicar of whitford was [a Jesuit]2443-a jesuit . [I]2445-i was sure of it all along ; but [the man]738-the man seemed so pious ; and certainly [he]738-the man did [[my]2445-i poor dear boy]5064-my poor dear boy a deal of good . But [he]738-the man ruined [you]753-sir , [you]753-sir know . And [I]2445-i ’m[2445-i] convinced — no , do n’t contradict [me]0-i ; [I]0-i tell [you]2446-you , [I]0-i wo n’t stand it — [I’m]0-i convinced that this whole mess of [mine]0-i is a plot of those rascals;—I’m as certain of it as if [they]2447-they ’d told [me]0-i ! ’ ‘[2447-they] For what end ? ’ ‘[2447-they] How [the deuce]3697-the deuce can [I]0-i tell ? Am [I]0-i [a Jesuit]2443-a jesuit , to understand [their]2447-they sneaking , underhand — pah ! [I]0-i ’m sick of life ! Nothing but rogues wherever one turns ! ’[0-i] And then [Lancelot]172-lancelot used to try to persuade [him]172-lancelot to take poor [Luke]137-mr. smith back again . But vague terror had steeled [his]172-lancelot heart . ‘ What ! Why , [he]172-lancelot ’d convert [us]5065-us all ! [He]172-lancelot ’d convert [[his]172-lancelot sisters]5066-his sisters ! [He]172-lancelot ’d bring [[his]172-lancelot priests]5067-his priests in [here]775-here , or [[his]172-lancelot nuns]5069-his nuns disguised as [[ladies]3255-ladies ’[172-lancelot] maids]5071-ladies ’ maids , and [we]2450-we should [all]2451-all go over , [every one of [us]2450-we]2452-every one of us , like a set of nine - pins ! ’ ‘[172-lancelot] [You]172-lancelot seem to think Protestantism a rather shaky cause , if it is so easy to be upset . ’ ‘[753-sir] [Sir]753-sir ! Protestantism is the cause of [England]3-england and Christianity , and civilisation , and freedom , and common sense , [sir]753-sir ! and that ’s the very reason why it ’s so easy to pervert [men]612-men from it ; and the very reason why it ’s a lost cause , and popery , and Antichrist , and the gates of hell are coming in like a flood to prevail against it ! ’ ‘[281-god] Well , ’ thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[281-god] that is the very strangest reason for it ’s being a lost cause ! Perhaps if [[my]0-i poor uncle]2456-my poor uncle believed it really to be the cause of [God]281-god [Himself]2456-my poor uncle , [he]2456-my poor uncle would not be in such extreme fear for it , or fancy it required such a hotbed and greenhouse culture ... Really , if [[his]2456-my poor uncle sisters]5066-his sisters were [little girls of ten years old]2458-little girls of ten years old , who looked up to [him]2456-my poor uncle as [an oracle]2459-an oracle , there would be some reason in it ... But [those tall , ball - going , flirting , self - satisfied cousins of [mine]0-i — who would have been glad enough , either of [them]2460-those tall , ball - going , flirting , self - satisfied cousins of mine — who would have been glad enough , either of them]2460-those tall , ball - going , flirting , self - satisfied cousins of mine — who would have been glad enough , either of them , two months ago , to snap up [me]0-i , infidelity , bad character , and all , as [a charming rich young roué]2461-a charming rich young roué — if [they]2460-those tall , ball - going , flirting , self - satisfied cousins of mine — who would have been glad enough , either of them have not learnt enough Protestantism in the last five - and - twenty years to take care of [themselves]2460-those tall , ball - going , flirting , self - satisfied cousins of mine — who would have been glad enough , either of them , Protestantism must have very few allurements , or else be very badly carried out in practice by [those who talk loudest in favour of it]2462-those who talk loudest in favour of it .... [I]0-i heard [them]2462-those who talk loudest in favour of it praising [O’Blareaway]272-the reverend panurgus o’blareaway ’s “ ministry , ” by [the bye]2463-the bye , the other day . So [he]2456-my poor uncle is up in [town]485-town at last — at the summit of [his]2456-my poor uncle ambition . Well , [he]2456-my poor uncle may suit [them]2462-those who talk loudest in favour of it . [I]0-i wonder how many young creatures like [Argemone]150-argemone and [Luke]137-mr. smith [he]2456-my poor uncle would keep from Popery ! ’ But there was no use arguing with [a man in such a state of mind]5072-a man in such a state of mind ; and gradually [Lancelot]172-lancelot gave it up , in hopes that time would bring [the good man]4516-the good man to [his]4516-the good man sane wits again , and that [a father]2175-a father ’s feelings would prove themselves stronger , because more divine , than [a so - called Protestant]5075-a so - called protestant ’s fears , though that would have been , in [the banker]1279-the banker ’s eyes , and in [the Jesuit]1065-the jesuit ’s also — so do extremes meet — the very reason for expecting [them]2462-those who talk loudest in favour of it to be the weaker ; for it is the rule with all bigots , that the right cause is always a lost cause , and therefore requires — [God]281-god ’s weapons of love , truth , and reason being well known to be too weak — to be defended , if it is to be saved , with the devil ’s weapons of bad logic , spite , and calumny . At last , in despair of obtaining tidings of [[his]172-lancelot cousin]3300-his cousin by any other method , [Lancelot]172-lancelot made up [his]172-lancelot mind to apply to [a certain remarkable man , whose ‘[137-mr. smith] conversion ’ had preceded [Luke]137-mr. smith ’s about a year , and had , indeed , mainly caused it]5079-a certain remarkable man , whose ‘ conversion ’ had preceded luke ’s about a year , and had , indeed , mainly caused it . [He]172-lancelot went , ... and was not disappointed . With the most winning courtesy and sweetness , [his]172-lancelot story and [his]172-lancelot request were patiently listened to . ‘[2465-your] The outcome of [your]2465-your speech , then , [[my]0-i dear sir]4535-my dear sir , as [I]0-i apprehend it , is a request to [me]0-i to send back the fugitive lamb into the jaws of the well - meaning , but still lupine wolf ? ’ This was spoken with so sweet and arch a smile , that it was impossible to be angry . ‘[0-i] On [my]0-i honour , [I]0-i have no wish to convert [him]2467-he . All [I]0-i want is to have human speech of [him]2467-he — to hear from [his]2467-he own lips that [he]2467-he is content . [Whither]350-whither should [I]0-i convert [him]2467-he ? Not to [my]0-i own platform — for [I]0-i am nowhere . Not to that which [he]2467-he has left , ... for if [he]2467-he could have found standing ground there , [he]2467-he would not have gone elsewhere for rest . ’ ‘[2467-he] Therefore [they]2468-they went out from [you]0-i , because [they]2468-they were not of [you]0-i , ’ said [the ‘[2468-they] Father]5080-the ‘ father , ’ half aside . ‘[753-sir] Most true , [sir]753-sir . [I]0-i have felt long that argument was bootless with those whose root - ideas of Deity , [man]564-man , [earth]724-earth , and [heaven]1101-heaven , were as utterly different from [my]0-i own , as if [we]2473-we had been created by [two different beings]2474-two different beings . ’ ‘[0-i] Do [you]0-i include in that catalogue those ideas of truth , love , and justice , which are [Deity]351-deity itself ? Have [you]0-i no common ground in them ? ’ ‘[0-i] [You]0-i are [an elder]2475-an elder and [a better man]2476-a better man than [I]0-i ... [You]0-i shall see [[your]0-i cousin]1512-your cousin . [You]0-i may make what efforts [you]0-i will for [his]1512-your cousin re - conversion . [The Catholic Church]886-the catholic church , ’ continued [he]0-i , with one of [his]0-i arch , deep - meaning smiles , ‘[2480-her] is not , like popular Protestantism , driven into shrieking terror at the approach of [a foe]2479-a foe . [She]2480-her has too much faith in [herself]2480-her , and in [Him]1512-your cousin who gives to [her]2480-her the power of truth , to expect [every gay meadow]2481-every gay meadow to allure away [her]2480-her lambs from the fold . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i assure [you]0-i that [your]0-i gallant permission is unnecessary . [I]0-i am beginning , at least , to believe that there is [a Father in [Heaven]215-heaven who educates [[His]2482-a father in heaven who educates his children children]2483-his children]2482-a father in heaven who educates his children ; and [I]0-i have no wish to interfere with [His]2482-a father in heaven who educates his children methods . Let [[my]0-i cousin]1784-my cousin go [his]1784-my cousin way ... [he]1784-my cousin will learn something which [he]1784-my cousin wanted , [I]0-i doubt not , on [his]1784-my cousin present path , even as [I]0-i shall on [mine]0-i . “ Se tu segui la tua stella ” is [my]0-i motto ... Let it be [his]1784-my cousin too , wherever the star may guide [him]1784-my cousin . If it be a will - o’-the - wisp , and lead to the morass , [he]1784-my cousin will only learn how to avoid morasses better for the future . ’ ‘[0-i] [Ave Maris stella]2485-ave maris stella ! It is the star of [Bethlehem]86-bethlehem which [he]1784-my cousin follows ... the star of [Mary]185-mary , immaculate , all - loving ! ’ ... And [he]0-i bowed [his]0-i head reverently . ‘[185-mary] Would that [you]0-i , too , would submit [yourself]0-i to that guidance ! . .. [You]0-i , too , would seem to want some loving heart whereon to rest . ’ ... [Lancelot]172-lancelot sighed . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am not [a child]3467-a child , but [a man]445-a man ; [I]0-i want not [a mother]1052-a mother to pet , but [a man to rule [me]0-i]2489-a man to rule me . ’ Slowly [[his]172-lancelot companion]730-his companion raised [his]730-his companion thin hand , and pointed to the crucifix , which stood at the other end of [the apartment]5082-the apartment . ‘[1784-my cousin] Behold [him]1784-my cousin ! ’ and [he]730-his companion bowed [his]730-his companion head once more ... and [Lancelot]172-lancelot , [he]172-lancelot knew not why , did the same ... and yet in an instant [he]172-lancelot threw [his]172-lancelot head up proudly , and answered with [George Fox]352-george fox ’s old reply to [the Puritans]5083-the puritans , — ‘[1784-my cousin] [I]0-i want [a live Christ]2490-a live christ , not a dead one ... That is noble ... beautiful . .. it may be true ... But it has no message for [me]0-i . ’ ‘[1784-my cousin] [He]1784-my cousin died for [you]0-i . ’ ‘[1784-my cousin] [I]0-i care for [the world]475-the world , and not [myself]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] [He]1784-my cousin died for [the world]475-the world . ’ ‘[1784-my cousin] And has deserted [it]2493-it , as [folks]1214-folks say now , and become — [an absentee]2495-an absentee , performing [His]1784-my cousin work by deputies ... Do not start ; the blasphemy is not [mine]0-i , but [those who preach it]2496-those who preach it . No wonder that [the owners of the soil]2497-the owners of the soil think it no shame to desert [[their]2497-the owners of the soil estates]2498-their estates , when [preachers]869-preachers tell [them]2497-the owners of the soil that [He]1784-my cousin to whom [they]869-preachers say , all power is given in [heaven and earth]2500-heaven and earth , has deserted [His]1784-my cousin . ’ ‘[1784-my cousin] What would [you]0-i have , [[my]0-i dear sir]4535-my dear sir ? ’ asked [the father]3232-the father . ‘[0-i] What [the Jews]2369-the jews had . [A king of [[my]0-i nation]2504-my nation , and of the hearts of [[my]0-i nation]2504-my nation , who would teach [soldiers]2506-soldiers , [artists]2507-artists , [craftsmen]2508-craftsmen , [statesmen]4698-statesmen , [poets]2510-poets , [priests]2511-priests , if [priests there must be]2512-priests there must be . Farewell . [You]2515-you shall see [[your]2515-you cousin]1512-your cousin here at noon to - morrow . [You]2515-you will not refuse [my]0-i blessing , or [my]0-i prayers , even though they be offered to [a mother]1052-a mother ? ’ ‘[2515-you] [I]0-i will refuse nothing in the form of human love . ’ And [the father]3232-the father blessed [him]0-i fervently , and [he]0-i went out ... ‘[445-a man] What [a man]445-a man ! ’ said [he]0-i to [himself]0-i , ‘[445-a man] or rather the wreck of what [a man]445-a man ! Oh , for such a heart , with the thews and sinews of [a truly English brain]2525-a truly english brain ! ’ Next day [he]3232-the father met [Luke]137-mr. smith in [that room]5086-that room . [Their]5087-their talk was short and sad . [Luke]137-mr. smith was on the point of entering an order devoted especially to the worship of [the Blessed Virgin]5088-the blessed virgin . ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i father]3846-my father has cast [me]0-i out ... [I]0-i must go to [her]2527-her feet . [She]2527-her will have mercy , though [man]564-man has none . ’ ‘[2527-her] But why enter the order ? Why take an irrevocable step ? ’ ‘[2527-her] Because it is irrevocable ; because [I]0-i shall enter an utterly new life , in which old things shall pass away , and all things become new , and [I]0-i shall forget the very names of [Parent]4186-parent , [Englishman]2530-englishman , [Citizen,—the very existence of that strange Babel of man]2531-citizen,—the very existence of that strange babel of man ’s building , whose roar and moan oppress [me]0-i every time [I]0-i walk [the street]4602-the street . Oh , for solitude , meditation , penance ! Oh , to make up by bitter self - punishment [my]0-i ingratitude to [her]2527-her who has been leading [me]0-i unseen , for years , [home]452-home to [[her]2527-her bosom!—The all - prevailing mother]2534-her bosom!—the all - prevailing mother , [daughter of [Gabriel]353-gabriel]2535-daughter of gabriel , [spouse of Deity]2536-spouse of deity , flower of [the earth]866-the earth , whom [I]0-i have so long despised ! Oh , to follow the example of [the blessed Mary of [Oignies]87-oignies , who every day inflicted on [[her]2538-the blessed mary of oignies , who every day inflicted on her most holy person eleven hundred stripes in honour of that all - perfect maiden most holy person]2539-her most holy person eleven hundred stripes in honour of [that all - perfect maiden]2540-that all - perfect maiden]2538-the blessed mary of oignies , who every day inflicted on her most holy person eleven hundred stripes in honour of that all - perfect maiden ! ’ ‘[354-kali] Such an honour , [I]0-i could have thought , would have pleased better [Kali]354-kali , [the murder - goddess of [the Thugs]2542-the thugs]2541-the murder - goddess of the thugs , ’ thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot to [himself]172-lancelot ; but [he]172-lancelot had not the heart to say it , and [he]172-lancelot only replied , — ‘[354-kali] So torture propitiates [the Virgin]2543-the virgin ? That explains the strange story [I]0-i read lately , of [her]2543-the virgin having appeared in [the Cevennes]88-the cevennes , and informed [the peasantry]2544-the peasantry that [she]2543-the virgin had sent the potato disease on account of [their]2544-the peasantry neglecting [[her]2543-the virgin shrines]2545-her shrines ; that unless [they]2544-the peasantry repented , [she]2543-the virgin would next year destroy [their]2544-the peasantry cattle ; and the third year , [themselves]2544-the peasantry . ’ ‘[2543-the virgin] Why not ? ’ asked [poor [Luke]137-mr. smith]4615-poor luke . ‘[2543-the virgin] Why not , indeed ? If [God]281-god is to be capricious , proud , revengeful , why not [the Son of [God]281-god]2546-the son of god ? And if [the Son of God]2546-the son of god , why not [[His]2546-the son of god mother]2548-his mother ? ’ ‘[2549-you] [You]2549-you judge spiritual feelings by the carnal test of the understanding ; [your]2549-you Protestant horror of asceticism lies at the root of all [you]2549-you say . How can [you]2549-you comprehend the self - satisfaction , the absolute delight , of self - punishment ? ’ ‘[2549-you] So far from it , [I]0-i have always had an infinite respect for asceticism , as a noble and manful thing — the only manful thing to [my]0-i eyes left in [popery]2550-popery ; and fast dying out of that under Jesuit influence . [You]2549-you recollect the quarrel between [the Tablet]2551-the tablet and [the Jesuits]2552-the jesuits , over [Faber]355-faber ’s unlucky honesty about [St. Rose of Lima]356-st. rose of lima ? ... But , really , as long as [you]2549-you honour asceticism as a means of appeasing [the angry deities]2553-the angry deities , [I]0-i shall prefer to [St. Dominic]357-st. dominic ’s cuirass or [St. Hedwiga]358-st. hedwiga ’s chilblains , [John Mytton]359-john mytton ’s two hours ’ crawl on the ice in [his]0-i shirt , after a flock of wild ducks . [They]5090-they both endured like [heroes]3116-heroes ; but the former for a selfish , if not a blasphemous end ; the latter , as [a man]445-a man should , to test and strengthen [his]445-a man own powers of endurance ... There , [I]359-john mytton will say no more . Go [your]2549-you way , in [God]281-god ’s name . There must be lessons to be learnt in all strong and self - restraining action ... So [you]2549-you will learn something from the scourge and the hair - shirt . [We]5093-we must all take the bitter medicine of suffering , [I]359-john mytton suppose . ’[359-john mytton] ‘ And , therefore , [I]359-john mytton am the wiser , in forcing the draught on [myself]359-john mytton . ’[359-john mytton] ‘ Provided it be the right draught , and do not require [another and still bitterer one]5094-another and still bitterer one to expel the effects of the poison . [I]359-john mytton have no faith in [people]3181-people ’s doctoring [themselves]3181-people , either physically or spiritually . ’[359-john mytton] ‘ [I]359-john mytton am not [[my]359-john mytton own physician]5096-my own physician ; [I]359-john mytton follow the rules of [an infallible Church]5097-an infallible church , and the examples of [[her]5097-an infallible church canonised saints]5098-her canonised saints . ’[359-john mytton] ‘ Well ... perhaps [they]3181-people may have known what was best for [themselves]3181-people ... But as for [you]2549-you and [me]359-john mytton here , in the year 1849 ... However , [we]5093-we shall argue on for ever . Forgive [me]359-john mytton if [I]359-john mytton have offended [you]2549-you . ’[359-john mytton] ‘ [I]359-john mytton am not offended . [The Catholic Church]886-the catholic church has always been [a persecuted one]5100-a persecuted one . ’[359-john mytton] ‘ Then walk with [me]359-john mytton a little way , and [I]359-john mytton will persecute [you]2549-you no more . ’[359-john mytton] ‘ Where are [you]2549-you going ? ’[359-john mytton] ‘ To ... To — ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot had not the heart to say whither . ‘ To [[my]172-lancelot father]3846-my father ’s ! [Lancelot]172-lancelot , is it impossible to move [him]3846-my father ? [I]172-lancelot do not want to go [home]452-home again ... to live [there]992-there ...
