No ! [I]137-mr. smith will die , and give no sign . ’[137-mr. smith] ‘ [I]172-lancelot must see somewhat more of [you]172-lancelot , indeed . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot will meet [you]172-lancelot here , then , two hours hence . Near [that house]5111-that house — even along the way which leads to [it]5111-that house — [I]172-lancelot can not go . It would be too painful : too painful to think that [you]172-lancelot were walking towards [it,—the old house where [I]172-lancelot was born and bred ... and [I]172-lancelot shut out,—even though it be for the sake of [the kingdom of heaven]1146-the kingdom of heaven]5112-it,—the old house where i was born and bred ... and i shut out,—even though it be for the sake of the kingdom of heaven ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Or for the sake of [your]172-lancelot own share therein , [[my]172-lancelot poor cousin]5114-my poor cousin ! ’[172-lancelot] thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot to [himself]172-lancelot , ‘ which is a very different matter . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Whither , after [you]172-lancelot have been — ? ’[172-lancelot] [Luke]137-mr. smith could not get out the word [home]452-home . ‘ To [Claude Mellot]182-claude ’s . ’[137-mr. smith] ‘ [I]172-lancelot will walk part of the way thither with [you]172-lancelot . But [he]182-claude is a very bad companion for [you]172-lancelot . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]137-mr. smith ca n’t help that . [I]137-mr. smith can not live ; and [I]137-mr. smith am going to turn painter . It is not the road in which to find a fortune ; but still , [the very sign - painters]5115-the very sign - painters live somehow , [I]137-mr. smith suppose . [I]137-mr. smith am going this very afternoon to [Claude Mellot]182-claude , and enlist . [I]137-mr. smith sold the last of [my]137-mr. smith treasured MSS . to a fifth - rate magazine this morning , for what it would fetch . It has been like eating [[one]3305-one ’s own children]5117-one ’s own children — but , at least , [they]5117-one ’s own children have fed [me]137-mr. smith . So now “ to [fresh fields]5118-fresh fields and pastures new . ” ’[137-mr. smith] When [Lancelot]172-lancelot reached [the banker]1279-the banker ’s a letter was put into [his]172-lancelot hand ; it bore the Whitford postmark , and [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington ’s handwriting . [He]172-lancelot tore it open ; it contained a letter from [Argemone]150-argemone , which , it is needless to say , [he]172-lancelot read before [[her]150-argemone mother]1404-her mother ’s : — ‘ [[My]172-lancelot beloved]5119-my beloved ! [my]172-lancelot husband!—Yes — though [you]5119-my beloved may fancy [me]172-lancelot fickle and proud — [I]172-lancelot will call [you]5119-my beloved so to the last ; for were [I]172-lancelot fickle , [I]172-lancelot could have saved [myself]172-lancelot the agony of writing this ; and as for pride , oh ! how that darling vice has been crushed out of [me]172-lancelot ! [I]172-lancelot have rolled at [[my]172-lancelot mother]867-my mother ’s feet with bitter tears , and vain entreaties — and been refused ; and yet [I]172-lancelot have obeyed [her]867-my mother after all . [We]5121-we must write to [each other]565-each other no more . This one last letter must explain the forced silence which has been driving [me]172-lancelot mad with fears that [you]5119-my beloved would suspect [me]172-lancelot . And now [you]5119-my beloved may call [me]172-lancelot weak ; but it is [your]5119-my beloved love which has made [me]172-lancelot strong to do this — which has taught [me]172-lancelot to see with new intensity [my]172-lancelot duty , not only to [you]5119-my beloved , but to [every human being]3670-every human being — to [[my]172-lancelot parents]5124-my parents . By this self - sacrifice alone can [I]172-lancelot atone to [them]5124-my parents for all [my]172-lancelot past undutifulness . Let [me]172-lancelot , then , thus be worthy of [you]5119-my beloved . Hope that by this submission [we]5121-we may win even [her]5119-my beloved to change . How calmly [I]172-lancelot write ! but it is only [my]172-lancelot hand that is calm . As for [my]172-lancelot heart , read [Tennyson]163-mr. tennyson ’s Fatima , and then know how [I]172-lancelot feel towards [you]5119-my beloved ! Yes , [I]172-lancelot love [you]5119-my beloved — madly , [the world]475-the world would say . [I]172-lancelot seem to understand now how [women]3246-women have died of love . Ay , that indeed would be blessed ; for then [my]172-lancelot spirit would seek out [yours]5119-my beloved , and hover over it for ever ! Farewell , [beloved]5127-beloved ! and let [me]172-lancelot hear of [you]5119-my beloved through [your]5119-my beloved deeds . A feeling at [my]172-lancelot heart , which should not be , although it is , a sad one , tells [me]172-lancelot that [we]5128-we shall meet soon — soon . ’[172-lancelot] Stupefied and sickened , [Lancelot]172-lancelot turned carelessly to [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington ’s cover , whose blameless respectability thus uttered itself : — ‘ [I]158-mrs. lavington can not deceive [you]5119-my beloved or [myself]158-mrs. lavington by saying [I]158-mrs. lavington regret that providential circumstances should have been permitted to break off a connection which [I]158-mrs. lavington always felt to be most unsuitable ; and [I]158-mrs. lavington rejoice that the intercourse [[my]158-mrs. lavington dear child]5129-my dear child has had with [you]5119-my beloved has not so far undermined [her]5129-my dear child principles as to prevent [her]5129-my dear child yielding the most filial obedience to [my]158-mrs. lavington wishes on the point of [her]5129-my dear child future correspondence with [you]5119-my beloved . Hoping that all that has occurred will be truly blessed to [you]5119-my beloved , and lead [your]5119-my beloved thoughts to [another world]5130-another world , and to a true concern for the safety of [your]5119-my beloved immortal soul , ‘[158-mrs. lavington] [I]0-i remain , [yours]158-mrs. lavington truly , ‘ [C. LAVINGTON]360-c. lavington . ’[158-mrs. lavington] ‘ [Another world]5130-another world ! ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot to [himself]172-lancelot . ‘ It is most merciful of [you]158-mrs. lavington , certainly , [[my]172-lancelot dear madame]5132-my dear madame , to put one in mind of the existence of [another world]5130-another world , while such as [you]158-mrs. lavington have [their]5134-their own way in this one ! ’[172-lancelot] and thrusting the latter epistle into the fire , [he]172-lancelot tried to collect [his]172-lancelot thoughts . What had [he]172-lancelot lost ? The oftener [he]172-lancelot asked [himself]172-lancelot , the less [he]172-lancelot found to unman [him]172-lancelot . [Argemone]150-argemone ’s letters were so new a want , that the craving for them was not yet established . [His]172-lancelot intense imagination , resting on the delicious certainty of [her]150-argemone faith , seemed ready to fill the silence with bright hopes and noble purposes . [She]150-argemone [herself]150-argemone had said that [he]172-lancelot would see [her]150-argemone soon . But yet — but yet — why did that allusion to death strike chilly through [him]172-lancelot ? They were but words,—a melancholy fancy , such as [women]3246-women love at times to play with . [He]172-lancelot would toss it from [him]172-lancelot . At least here was another reason for bestirring [himself]172-lancelot at once to win fame in the noble profession [he]172-lancelot had chosen . And yet [his]172-lancelot brain reeled as [he]172-lancelot went [upstairs]684-upstairs to [[[his]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle ’s private room]2560-his uncle ’s private room . There , however , [he]172-lancelot found [a person closeted with [the banker]1279-the banker , whose remarkable appearance drove everything else out of [his]172-lancelot mind]2561-a person closeted with the banker , whose remarkable appearance drove everything else out of his mind . [He]2561-a person closeted with the banker , whose remarkable appearance drove everything else out of his mind was [a huge , shaggy , toil - worn man]2563-a huge , shaggy , toil - worn man , the deep melancholy earnestness of whose rugged features reminded [him]172-lancelot almost ludicrously of [one of [Land - seer]2565-land - seer ’s bloodhounds]2564-one of land - seer ’s bloodhounds . But withal there was a tenderness — a genial , though covert humour playing about [his]2561-a person closeted with the banker , whose remarkable appearance drove everything else out of his mind massive features , which awakened in [Lancelot]172-lancelot at first sight a fantastic longing to open [his]172-lancelot whole heart to [him]172-lancelot . [He]2561-a person closeted with the banker , whose remarkable appearance drove everything else out of his mind was dressed like [a foreigner]2566-a foreigner , but spoke English with perfect fluency . [The banker]1279-the banker sat listening , quite crestfallen , beneath [his]2561-a person closeted with the banker , whose remarkable appearance drove everything else out of his mind intense and melancholy gaze , in which , nevertheless , there twinkled some rays of kindly sympathy . ‘ It was all [those foreign railways]5135-those foreign railways , ’[137-mr. smith] said [Mr. Smith]137-mr. smith pensively . ‘ And it serves [you]1279-the banker quite right , ’[2568-the stranger] answered [the stranger]2568-the stranger . ‘ Did [I]2568-the stranger not warn [you]1279-the banker of the folly and sin of sinking capital in [foreign countries]5136-foreign countries while [English land]5137-english land was crying out for tillage , and [English poor]5138-english poor for employment ? ’[2568-the stranger] ‘ [[My]1279-the banker dear friend]5139-my dear friend ’[1279-the banker] ( in a deprecatory tone ) , ‘ it was the best possible investment [I]1279-the banker could make . ’[1279-the banker] ‘ And pray , who told [you]1279-the banker that [you]1279-the banker were sent into [the world]475-the world to make investments ? ’[2568-the stranger] ‘ But — ’[1279-the banker] ‘ But [me]2568-the stranger no buts , or [I]2568-the stranger wo n’t stir a finger towards helping [you]172-lancelot . What are [you]172-lancelot going to do with this money if [I]2568-the stranger procure it for [you]172-lancelot ? ’[2568-the stranger] ‘ Work till [I]1279-the banker can pay back [that poor fellow]5141-that poor fellow ’s fortune , ’[1279-the banker] said [the banker]1279-the banker , earnestly pointing to [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘ And if [I]1279-the banker could clear [my]1279-the banker conscience of that , [I]1279-the banker would not care if [I]1279-the banker starved [myself]1279-the banker , hardly if [[my]1279-the banker own children]5142-my own children did . ’[1279-the banker] ‘ Spoken like [a man]445-a man ! ’[2568-the stranger] answered [the stranger]2568-the stranger ; ‘ work for that and [I]2568-the stranger ’ll help [you]172-lancelot . Be [a new man]3736-a new man , once and for all , [[my]2568-the stranger friend]800-my friend . Do n’t even make this [younker]5146-younker [your]172-lancelot first object . Say to [yourself]172-lancelot , not “ [I]2568-the stranger will invest this money where it shall pay [me]2568-the stranger most , but [I]2568-the stranger will invest it where it shall give most employment to [English hands]5147-english hands , and produce most manufactures for English bodies . ” In short , seek first [the kingdom of [God]281-god]5148-the kingdom of god and [His]281-god justice with this money of [yours]172-lancelot , and see if all other things , profits and suchlike included , are not added unto [you]172-lancelot . ’[2568-the stranger] ‘ And [you]2568-the stranger are certain [you]2568-the stranger can obtain the money ? ’[1279-the banker] ‘ [[My]1279-the banker good friend]5149-my good friend [the Begum of [the Cannibal Islands]89-the cannibal islands]5150-the begum of the cannibal islands has more than [she]5150-the begum of the cannibal islands knows what to do with ; and [she]5150-the begum of the cannibal islands owes [me]1279-the banker a good turn , [you]172-lancelot know . ’[1279-the banker] ‘ What are [you]2568-the stranger jesting about now ? ’[2568-the stranger] ‘ Did [I]1279-the banker never tell [you]2568-the stranger ? [The new king of [the Cannibal Islands]89-the cannibal islands]5151-the new king of the cannibal islands , just like [[your]172-lancelot European ones]5152-your european ones , ran away , and would neither govern [himself]5151-the new king of the cannibal islands nor let [any one else]1547-any one else govern ; so one morning [[his]5151-the new king of the cannibal islands ministers]5154-his ministers , getting impatient , ate [him]5151-the new king of the cannibal islands , and then asked [my]1279-the banker advice . [I]1279-the banker recommended [them]5154-his ministers to put [[his]5151-the new king of the cannibal islands mother]2548-his mother on the throne , who , being old and tough , would run less danger ; and since then everything has gone on smoothly as anywhere else . ’[1279-the banker] ‘ Are [you]172-lancelot mad ? ’[172-lancelot] thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot to [himself]172-lancelot , as [he]172-lancelot stared at [the speaker]3199-the speaker ’s matter - of - fact face . ‘ No , [I]172-lancelot am not mad , [[my]172-lancelot young friend]3713-my young friend , ’[172-lancelot] quoth [he]172-lancelot , facing right round upon [him]172-lancelot , as if [he]172-lancelot had divined [his]172-lancelot thoughts . ‘ [I]172-lancelot — [I]172-lancelot beg [your]172-lancelot pardon , [I]172-lancelot did not speak , ’[172-lancelot] stammered [Lancelot]172-lancelot , abashed at a pair of eyes which could have looked down the boldest mesmerist in three seconds . ‘ [I]172-lancelot am perfectly well aware that [you]172-lancelot did not . [You]172-lancelot wrote those articles in the --- Review about [George Sand]361-george sand , did [you]172-lancelot not ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot did . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Well , there was a great deal of noble feeling in them , and a great deal of abominable nonsense . [You]172-lancelot seem to be very anxious to reform society ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot am . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Do n’t [you]172-lancelot think [you]172-lancelot had better begin by reforming [yourself]172-lancelot ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Really , [sir]753-sir , ’[172-lancelot] answered [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘ [I]172-lancelot am too old for that worn - out quibble . The root of all [my]172-lancelot sins has been selfishness and sloth . Am [I]172-lancelot to cure [them]5158-them by becoming still more selfish and slothful ? What part of [myself]172-lancelot can [I]172-lancelot reform except [my]172-lancelot actions ? and the very sin of [my]172-lancelot actions has been , as [I]172-lancelot take it , that [I]172-lancelot ’ve been doing nothing to reform [others]3280-others ; never fighting against [the world]475-the world , the flesh , and the devil , as [your]753-sir Prayer - book has it . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [My]2568-the stranger Prayer - book ? ’[2568-the stranger] answered [the stranger]2568-the stranger , with a quaint smile . ‘ Upon [my]1279-the banker word , [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ’[1279-the banker] interposed [the banker]1279-the banker , with a frightened look , ‘ [you]172-lancelot must not get into an argument : [you]172-lancelot must be more respectful : [you]172-lancelot do n’t know to whom [you]172-lancelot are speaking . ’[1279-the banker] ‘ And [I]2568-the stranger do n’t much care , ’[2568-the stranger] answered [he]2568-the stranger . ‘ Life is really too grim earnest in these days to stand on ceremony . [I]2568-the stranger am sick of [blind leaders of the blind]5161-blind leaders of the blind , of [respectable preachers]5162-respectable preachers to the respectable , who drawl out second - hand trivialities , which [they]5162-respectable preachers neither practise nor wish to see practised . If [your]2568-the stranger heart is in the right place , [you]2568-the stranger will understand [me]172-lancelot ! if not , the less [we]5169-we talk to [each other]565-each other the better . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Most true , ’[2568-the stranger] answered [the stranger]2568-the stranger ; ‘ and [I]2568-the stranger do understand [you]172-lancelot ; and if , as [I]2568-the stranger hope , [we]5169-we see more of [each other]565-each other henceforth , [we]5169-we will see if [we]5169-we can not solve one or two of these problems between [us]5169-we . ’[2568-the stranger] At this moment [Lancelot]172-lancelot was summoned [downstairs]3238-downstairs , and found , to [his]172-lancelot great pleasure , [Tregarva]173-tregarva waiting for [him]172-lancelot . [That worthy personage]2578-that worthy personage bowed to [Lancelot]172-lancelot reverently and distantly . ‘ [I]172-lancelot am quite ashamed to intrude [myself]172-lancelot upon [you]172-lancelot , [sir]753-sir , but [I]172-lancelot could not rest without coming to ask whether [you]172-lancelot have had any news . ’—He[172-lancelot] broke down at this point in the sentence , but [Lancelot]172-lancelot understood [him]172-lancelot . ‘ [I]172-lancelot have no news , ’[172-lancelot] [he]172-lancelot said . ‘ But what do [you]172-lancelot mean by standing off in that way , as if [we]5169-we were [not old and fast friends]5173-not old and fast friends ? Remember , [I]172-lancelot am as poor as [you]172-lancelot are now ; [you]172-lancelot may look [me]172-lancelot in the face and call [me]172-lancelot [[your]172-lancelot equal]5174-your equal , if [you]172-lancelot will , or [[your]172-lancelot inferior]5175-your inferior ; [I]172-lancelot shall not deny it . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Pardon [me]173-tregarva , [sir]753-sir , ’[173-tregarva] answered [Tregarva]173-tregarva ; ‘ but [I]173-tregarva never felt what a real substantial thing rank is , as [I]173-tregarva have since this sad misfortune of [yours]753-sir . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ And [I]173-tregarva have never till now found out its worthlessness . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ [You]753-sir ’re[173-tregarva] wrong , [sir]753-sir , [you]753-sir are wrong ; look at the difference between [yourself]753-sir and [me]0-i . When [you]753-sir ’ve lost all [you]753-sir have , and seven times more , [you]753-sir ’re still [a gentleman]3733-a gentleman . [No man]1477-no man can take that from [you]753-sir . [You]753-sir may look [the proudest duchess in [the land]4321-the land]5179-the proudest duchess in the land in the face , and claim [her]5179-the proudest duchess in the land as [[your]753-sir equal]5174-your equal ; while [I]2580-i , sir,—I do n’t mean , though , to talk of [myself]2580-i — but suppose that [you]753-sir had loved [a pious and a beautiful lady]5182-a pious and a beautiful lady , and among all [your]753-sir worship of [her]5182-a pious and a beautiful lady , and [your]753-sir awe of [her]5182-a pious and a beautiful lady , had felt that [you]753-sir were worthy of [her]5182-a pious and a beautiful lady , that [you]753-sir could become [her]5182-a pious and a beautiful lady comforter , and [her]5182-a pious and a beautiful lady pride , and [her]5182-a pious and a beautiful lady joy , if it was n’t for that accursed gulf that [men]612-men had put between [you]753-sir , that [you]753-sir were [no gentleman]5184-no gentleman ; that [you]753-sir did n’t know how to walk , and how to pronounce , and when to speak , and when to be silent , not even how to handle [your]753-sir own knife and fork without disgusting [her]5182-a pious and a beautiful lady , or how to keep [your]753-sir own body clean and sweet — Ah , [sir]753-sir , [I]2580-i see it now as [I]2580-i never did before , what a wall all these little defects build up round [a poor man]3882-a poor man ; how [he]3882-a poor man longs and struggles to show [himself]3882-a poor man as [he]3882-a poor man is at heart , and can not , till [he]3882-a poor man feels sometimes as if [he]3882-a poor man was enchanted , pent up , like folks in fairy tales , in the body of some dumb beast . But , [sir]753-sir , ’[2580-i] [he]2580-i went on , with a concentrated bitterness which [Lancelot]172-lancelot had never seen in [him]2580-i before , ‘ just because this gulf which rank makes is such a deep one , therefore it looks to [me]2580-i all the more devilish ; not that [I]2580-i want to pull down [any man]3336-any man to [my]2580-i level ; [I]2580-i despise [my]2580-i own level too much ; [I]2580-i want to rise ; [I]2580-i want those like [me]2580-i to rise with [me]2580-i . Let [the rich]3580-the rich be as rich as [they]3580-the rich will.—I , and those like [me]2580-i , covet not money , but manners . Why should not [the workman]5190-the workman be [a gentleman]3733-a gentleman , and [a workman]5192-a workman still ? Why are [they]3580-the rich to be shut out from all that is beautiful , and delicate , and winning , and stately ? ’[2580-i] ‘ Now perhaps , ’[172-lancelot] said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘ [you]2580-i begin to understand what [I]172-lancelot was driving at on that night of the revel ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ It has come home to [me]172-lancelot lately , [sir]753-sir , bitterly enough . If [you]753-sir knew what had gone on in [me]172-lancelot this last fortnight , [you]753-sir would know that [I]172-lancelot had cause to curse the state of things which brings [a man]445-a man up [a savage]1524-a savage against [his]445-a man will , and cuts [him]445-a man off , as if [he]445-a man were an ape or a monster , from those for whom [the same Lord]5196-the same lord died , and on whom the same Spirit rests . Is that [God]281-god ’s will , [sir]753-sir ? No , it is [the devil]600-the devil ’s will . “ Those whom [God]281-god hath joined , let [no man]1477-no man put asunder . ” ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot coloured , for [he]172-lancelot remembered with how much less reason [he]172-lancelot had been lately invoking in [his]172-lancelot own cause those very words . [He]172-lancelot was at a loss for an answer ; but seeing , to [his]172-lancelot relief , that [Tregarva]173-tregarva had returned to [his]173-tregarva usual impassive calm , [he]172-lancelot forced [him]173-tregarva to sit down , and began questioning [him]173-tregarva as to [his]173-tregarva own prospects and employment . About [them]2581-them [Tregarva]173-tregarva seemed hopeful enough . [He]172-lancelot had found out [a Wesleyan minister in [town]485-town who knew [him]173-tregarva , and had , by [his]173-tregarva means , after assisting for a week or two in [the [London]46-london City Mission]90-the london city mission]2582-a wesleyan minister in town who knew him , and had , by his means , after assisting for a week or two in the london city mission , got some similar appointment in [a large manufacturing town]2584-a large manufacturing town . Of the state of things [he]173-tregarva spoke more sadly than ever . ‘ [The rich]3580-the rich can not guess , [sir]753-sir , how high ill - feeling is rising in these days . It ’s not only [those who are outwardly poorest who long for change]5202-those who are outwardly poorest who long for change ; [the middling people]5203-the middling people , [sir]753-sir , [the small town shopkeepers]5205-the small town shopkeepers especially , are nearly past all patience . [One of [the City Mission]5207-the city mission]5206-one of the city mission assured [me]173-tregarva that [he]5206-one of the city mission has been watching [them]5203-the middling people these several years past , and that nothing could beat [their]5203-the middling people fortitude and industry , and [their]5203-the middling people determination to stand peaceably by law and order ; but yet , this last year or two , things are growing too bad to bear . Do what [they]5203-the middling people will , [they]5203-the middling people can not get [their]5203-the middling people bread ; and when [a man]445-a man can not get that , [sir]753-sir — ’[173-tregarva] ‘ But what do [you]753-sir think is the reason of it ? ’[173-tregarva] ‘ How should [I]281-god tell , [sir]753-sir ? But if [I]281-god had to say , [I]281-god should say this — just what [they]5203-the middling people say [themselves]5203-the middling people — that there are too many of [them]5203-the middling people . Go where [you]753-sir will , in [town]485-town or [country]3302-country , [you]753-sir ’ll find half - [a - dozen shops struggling for a custom that would only keep up one]5213-a - dozen shops struggling for a custom that would only keep up one , and so [they]2586-they ’re[281-god] forced to undersell [one another]1081-one another . And when [they]2586-they ’ve got down prices all [they]2586-they can by fair means , [they]2586-they ’re forced to get [them]2586-they down lower by foul — to sand the sugar , and sloe - leave the tea , and put — Satan only that prompts [’em]5214-’em[281-god] knows what — into the bread ; and then [they]2586-they do n’t thrive — [they]2586-they ca n’t thrive ; [God]281-god ’s curse must be on [them]2586-they . [They]2586-they begin by trying to oust [each other]565-each other , and eat [each other]565-each other up ; and while [they]2586-they ’re eating up [[their]2586-they neighbours]1339-their neighbours , [[their]2586-they neighbours]1339-their neighbours eat up [them]2586-they ; and so [they]2586-they all come to ruin together . ’[2586-they] ‘ Why , [you]5217-you talk like [Mr. Mill]362-mr. mill [himself]362-mr. mill , [Tregarva]173-tregarva ; [you]5217-you ought to have been [a political economist]5218-a political economist , and not [a City missionary]5219-a city missionary . By the bye , [I]2586-they do n’t like that profession for [you]5217-you . ’[2586-they] ‘ It ’s [the Lord]817-the lord ’s work , [sir]753-sir . It ’s the very sending to [the Gentiles]336-the gentiles that [the Lord]817-the lord promised [me]2586-they . ’[2586-they] ‘ [I]3364-the giant do n’t doubt it , [Paul]173-tregarva ; but [you]5217-you are meant for other things , if not better . There are [plenty of smaller men than [you]5217-you to do that work]5223-plenty of smaller men than you to do that work . Do [you]5217-you think that [God]281-god would have given [you]5217-you that strength , that brain , to waste on a work which could be done without [them]5223-plenty of smaller men than you to do that work ? Those limbs would certainly be good capital for [you]5217-you , if [you]5217-you turned [a live model at [the Academy]5225-the academy]5224-a live model at the academy . Perhaps [you]5217-you ’d better be [mine]2586-they ; but [you]5217-you ca n’t even be that if [you]5217-you go to [Manchester]91-manchester . ’[3364-the giant] [The giant]3364-the giant looked hopelessly down at [his]3364-the giant huge limbs . ‘ Well ! [God]281-god only knows what use [they]5223-plenty of smaller men than you to do that work are of just now . But as for the brains , [sir]753-sir — in much learning is much sorrow . [One]3305-one had much better work than read , [I]2590-i find . If [I]2590-i read much more about what [men]612-men might be , and are not , and what [English soil]5229-english soil might be , and is not , [I]2590-i shall go mad . And that puts [me]2590-i in mind of one thing [I]2590-i came here for , though , like [a poor rude country fellow as [I]2590-i am]5230-a poor rude country fellow as i am , [I]2590-i clean forgot it a thinking of — Look here , [sir]753-sir ; [you]753-sir ’ve given [me]2590-i a sight of books in [my]2590-i time , and [God]281-god bless [you]753-sir for it . But now [I]2590-i hear that — that [you]753-sir are determined to be [a poor man like [us]5233-us]5232-a poor man like us ; and that [you]753-sir sha n’t be , while [Paul Tregarva]173-tregarva has ought of [yours]753-sir . So [I]2590-i ’ve just brought all the books back , and there they lie in [the hall]5234-the hall ; and may [God]281-god reward [you]753-sir for the loan of them to [[his]281-god poor child]5235-his poor child ! And so , [sir]753-sir , farewell ; ’[2590-i] and [he]2590-i rose to go . ‘ No , [Paul]173-tregarva ; the books and [you]173-tregarva shall never part . ’[2590-i] ‘ And [I]2586-they say , [sir]753-sir , the books and [you]173-tregarva shall never part . ’[2586-they] ‘ Then [we]5233-us two can never part’—and a sudden impulse flashed over him—‘and [we]5233-us will not part , [Paul]173-tregarva ! [The only man whom [I]2590-i utterly love , and trust , and respect on the face of [[God]281-god ’s earth]5239-god ’s earth]5238-the only man whom i utterly love , and trust , and respect on the face of god ’s earth , is [you]173-tregarva ; and [I]2590-i can not lose sight of [you]173-tregarva . If [we]5233-us are to earn [our]5233-us bread , let [us]5233-us earn it together ; if [we]5233-us are to endure poverty , and sorrow , and struggle to find out the way of bettering [these wretched millions round [us]5233-us]5240-these wretched millions round us , let [us]5233-us learn [our]5233-us lesson together , and help [each other]565-each other to spell it out . ’[2590-i] ‘ Do [you]173-tregarva mean what [you]173-tregarva say ? ’[173-tregarva] asked [Paul]173-tregarva slowly . ‘ [I]173-tregarva do . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ Then [I]2590-i say what [you]173-tregarva say . Where [thou]5242-thou goest , [I]2590-i will go ; and where [thou]5242-thou lodgest , [I]2590-i will lodge . Come what will , [I]2590-i will be [[your]173-tregarva servant]5243-your servant , for good luck or bad , for ever . ’[2590-i] ‘ [[My]2590-i equal]5244-my equal , [Paul]173-tregarva , not [[my]2590-i servant]5245-my servant . ’[2590-i] ‘ [I]173-tregarva know [my]173-tregarva place , [sir]753-sir . When [I]173-tregarva am as learned and as well - bred as [you]173-tregarva , [I]173-tregarva shall not refuse to call [myself]173-tregarva [[your]173-tregarva equal]5174-your equal ; and the sooner that day comes , the better [I]173-tregarva shall be pleased . Till then [I]173-tregarva am [[your]173-tregarva friend]834-your friend and [[your]173-tregarva brother]5249-your brother ; but [I]173-tregarva am [[your]173-tregarva scholar]5250-your scholar too , and [I]173-tregarva shall not set up [myself]173-tregarva against [[my]173-tregarva master]2321-my master . ’[173-tregarva] ‘ [I]2590-i have learnt more of [you]173-tregarva , [Paul]173-tregarva , than ever [you]173-tregarva have learnt of [me]2590-i . But be it as [you]173-tregarva will ; only whatever [you]173-tregarva may call [yourself]173-tregarva , [we]4908-the two young men must eat at the same table , live in [the same room]5252-the same room , and share alike all [this world]1108-this world ’s good things — or [we]4908-the two young men shall have no right to share together [this world]1108-this world ’s bad things . If that is [your]173-tregarva bargain , there is [my]2590-i hand on it . ’[2590-i] ‘ Amen ! ’[2590-i] quoth [Tregarva]173-tregarva ; and [the two young men]4908-the two young men joined hands in that sacred bond — now growing rarer and rarer year by year — the utter friendship of [two equal manful hearts]2592-two equal manful hearts . ‘ And now , [sir]753-sir , [I]2590-i have promised — and [you]753-sir would have [me]2590-i keep [my]2590-i promise — to go and work for [the City Mission in [Manchester]91-manchester]5256-the city mission in manchester — at least , for the next month , till [a young man]5257-a young man ’s place who has just left , is filled up . Will [you]753-sir let [me]2590-i go for that time ? and then , if [you]753-sir hold [your]753-sir present mind , [we]4908-the two young men will join [home]452-home and fortunes thenceforth , and go wherever [the Lord]817-the lord shall send [us]4908-the two young men . There ’s work enough of [His]817-the lord waiting to be done . [I]2590-i do n’t doubt but if [we]4908-the two young men are willing and able , [He]817-the lord will set [us]4908-the two young men about the thing [we]4908-the two young men ’re[2590-i] meant for . ’ As [Lancelot]172-lancelot opened the door for [him]2594-you , [he]172-lancelot lingered on the steps , and grasping [his]2594-you hand , said , in a low , earnest voice : ‘[817-the lord] [The Lord]817-the lord be with [you]2594-you , [sir]753-sir . Be sure that [He]817-the lord has mighty things in store for [you]2594-you , or [He]817-the lord would not have brought [you]2594-you so low in the days of [your]2594-you youth . ’ ‘[817-the lord] And so , ’ as [John Bunyan]363-john bunyan has it , ‘[817-the lord] [he]817-the lord went on [his]817-the lord way ; ’ and [Lancelot]172-lancelot saw [him]817-the lord no more till — but [I]817-the lord must not outrun the order of time . After all , this visit came to [Lancelot]172-lancelot timely . It had roused [him]172-lancelot to hope , and turned off [his]172-lancelot feelings from the startling news [he]172-lancelot had just heard . [He]172-lancelot stepped along arm in arm with [Luke]137-mr. smith , cheerful , and fate - defiant , and as [he]172-lancelot thought of [Tregarva]173-tregarva ’s complaints , — ‘[817-the lord] The beautiful ? ’ [he]172-lancelot said to [himself]172-lancelot , ‘[817-the lord] [they]2596-they shall have it ! At least [they]2596-they shall be awakened to feel [their]2596-they need of it , [their]2596-they right to it . What a high destiny , to be [the artist of [the people]1331-the people]2597-the artist of the people ! to devote one ’s powers of painting , not to mimicking obsolete legends , Pagan or Popish , but to representing to [the working men of [England]3-england]2599-the working men of england the triumphs of the Past and the yet greater triumphs of the Future ! ’ [Luke]137-mr. smith began at once questioning [him]172-lancelot about [[his]137-mr. smith father]453-his father . ‘[2600-he] And is [he]2600-he contrite and humbled ? Does [he]2600-he see that [he]2600-he has sinned ? ’ ‘[2600-he] In what ? ’ ‘[2600-he] It is not for [us]2601-us to judge ; but surely it must have been some sin or other of [his]2600-he which has drawn down such a sore judgment on [him]2600-he . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot smiled ; but [Luke]137-mr. smith went on , not perceiving [him]172-lancelot . ‘[2600-he] Ah ! [we]2601-us can not find out for [him]2600-he . Nor has [he]2600-he , alas ! as [a Protestant]4266-a protestant , much likelihood of finding out for [himself]2600-he . In [[our]2601-us holy church]2603-our holy church [he]2600-he would have been compelled to discriminate [his]2600-he faults by methodic self - examination , and lay [them]2604-them one by one before [[his]2600-he priest]2605-his priest for advice and pardon , and so start [a new and free man]2606-a new and free man once more . ’ ‘[2607-you] Do [you]2607-you think , ’ asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot with a smile , ‘[2607-you] that [he]2600-he who will not confess [his]2600-he faults either to [God]281-god or to [himself]2600-he , would confess [them]2604-them to [man]564-man ? And would [[his]2600-he priest]2605-his priest honestly tell [him]2600-he what [he]2600-he really wants to know ? which sin of [his]2600-he has called down this so - called judgment ? It would be imputed , [I]0-i suppose , to some vague generality , to inattention to religious duties , to idolatry of [the world]475-the world , and so forth . But [a Romish priest]2611-a romish priest would be [the last person]2612-the last person , [I]0-i should think , who could tell [him]2600-he fairly , in the present case , the cause of [his]2600-he affliction ; and [I]0-i question whether [he]2600-he would give a patient hearing to [any one who told it]2613-any one who told it [him]2600-he . ’ ‘[2600-he] How so ? Though , indeed , [I]0-i have remarked that [people]3181-people are perfectly willing to be told [they]3181-people are [miserable sinners]2615-miserable sinners , and to confess [themselves]3181-people such , in a general way ; but if [the preacher]2616-the preacher once begins to specify , to fix on any particular act or habit , [he]2616-the preacher is accused of personality or uncharitableness ; [[his]2616-the preacher hearers]2617-his hearers are ready to confess guilty to any sin but the very one with which [he]2616-the preacher charges [them]2617-his hearers . But , surely , this is just what [I]0-i am urging against [you]2618-you [Protestants]1112-protestants — just what the Catholic use of confession obviates . ’ ‘[0-i] Attempts to do so , [you]0-i mean ! ’ answered [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[0-i] But what if [your]2618-you religion preaches formally that which only remains in [our]2620-our religion as a fast - dying superstition?—That those judgments of [God]281-god , as [you]2618-you call [them]2621-them , are not judgments at all in any fair use of the word , but capricious acts of punishment on the part of [Heaven]215-heaven , which have no more reference to the fault which provokes [them]2621-them , than if [you]2618-you cut off [a man]445-a man ’s finger because [he]445-a man made a bad use of [his]445-a man tongue . That is part , but only a part , of what [I]0-i meant just now , by saying that [people]3181-people represent [God]281-god as capricious , proud , revengeful . ’ ‘[3181-people] But do not [Protestants]220-protestants [themselves]220-protestants confess that [our]2620-our sins provoke [God]281-god ’s anger ? ’ ‘[2618-you] [Your]2618-you common creed , when it talks rightly of [God]281-god as [one “ who has no passions , ”]2624-one “ who has no passions , ” ought to make [you]2618-you speak more reverently of the possibility of any act of ours disturbing the everlasting equanimity of the absolute Love . Why will [men]612-men so often impute to [God]281-god the miseries which [they]612-men bring upon [themselves]612-men ? ’ ‘[612-men] Because , [I]0-i suppose , [their]612-men pride makes [them]612-men more willing to confess [themselves]612-men [sinners]4054-sinners than [fools]4774-fools . ’ ‘[800-my friend] Right , [[my]0-i friend]800-my friend ; [they]612-men will not remember that it is of “ [their]612-men pleasant vices that [God]281-god makes whips to scourge [them]612-men . ” Oh , [I]0-i at least have felt the deep wisdom of that saying of [Wilhelm Meister]364-wilhelm meister ’s harper , that it is “ Voices from the depth of Nature borne Which woe upon the guilty head proclaim . ” Of nature — of those eternal laws of [hers]2629-hers which [we]2630-we daily break . Yes ! it is not because [God]281-god ’s temper changes , but because [God]281-god ’s universe is unchangeable , that such as [I]0-i , such as [[your]2631-your poor father]3844-your poor father , having sown the wind , must reap the whirlwind . [I]0-i have fed [my]0-i self - esteem with luxuries and not with virtue , and , losing them , have nothing left . [He]281-god has sold [himself]281-god to a system which is its own punishment . And yet the last place in which [he]281-god will look for the cause of [his]281-god misery is in that very money - mongering to which [he]281-god now clings as frantically as ever . But so it is throughout [the world]475-the world . Only look down over [that bridge - parapet]2634-that bridge - parapet , at [that huge black - mouthed sewer , vomiting its pestilential riches across the mud]2635-that huge black - mouthed sewer , vomiting its pestilential riches across the mud . There [it]2636-it runs , and will run , hurrying to the sea vast stores of wealth , elaborated by [Nature]132-nature ’s chemistry into the ready materials of food ; which proclaim , too , by [their]2637-their own foul smell , [God]281-god ’s will that [they]2637-their should be buried out of sight in [the fruitful all - regenerating grave of earth]2638-the fruitful all - regenerating grave of earth : [there]992-there [it]2636-it runs , turning [them]2637-their all into the seeds of pestilence , filth , and drunkenness.—And then , when it obeys the laws which [we]2640-we despise , and the pestilence is come at last , [men]612-men will pray against it , and confess it to be “ a judgment for [their]612-men sins ; ” but if [you]2642-you ask what sin , [people]3181-people will talk about “ les voiles d’airain , ” as [Fourier]365-fourier says , and tell [you]2642-you that it is presumptuous to pry into [God]281-god ’s secret counsels , unless , perhaps , [some fanatic]2644-some fanatic should inform [you]2642-you that the cholera has been drawn down on [the poor]698-the poor by the endowment of Maynooth by [the rich]3580-the rich . ’ ‘[2644-some fanatic] It is most fearful , indeed , to think that these diseases should be confined to [the poor]698-the poor — that [a man]445-a man should be exposed to cholera , typhus , and a host of attendant diseases , simply because [he]445-a man is born into [the world]475-the world [an artisan]2650-an artisan ; while [the rich , by the mere fact of money]2651-the rich , by the mere fact of money , are exempt from such curses , except when [they]2651-the rich , by the mere fact of money come in contact with [those whom [they]2651-the rich , by the mere fact of money call on Sunday “ [[their]2651-the rich , by the mere fact of money brethren]2653-their brethren]2652-those whom they call on sunday “ their brethren , ” and on week days [the “ masses]2654-the “ masses . ” ‘ Thank Heaven that [you]2642-you do see that,—that in [a country calling itself civilised and Christian]5261-a country calling itself civilised and christian , pestilence should be the peculiar heritage of [the poor]698-the poor ! It is past all comment . ’[2654-the “ masses] ‘ And yet are not these pestilences a judgment , even on [them]698-the poor , for [their]698-the poor dirt and profligacy ? ’[2650-an artisan] ‘ And how should [they]698-the poor be clean without water ? And how can [you]2642-you wonder if [their]698-the poor appetites , sickened with filth and self - disgust , crave after the gin - shop for temporary strength , and then for temporary forgetfulness ? [Every London doctor]5263-every london doctor knows that [I]2654-the “ masses speak the truth ; would that [every London preacher]5264-every london preacher would tell that truth from [[his]5264-every london preacher pulpit]5265-his pulpit ! ’[2654-the “ masses] ‘ Then would [you]2654-the “ masses too say , that [God]281-god punishes [one class]5266-one class for the sins of another ? ’[2654-the “ masses] ‘ [Some]5267-some would say , ’[172-lancelot] answered [Lancelot]172-lancelot , half aside , ‘ that [He]281-god may be punishing [them]5267-some for not demanding [their]5267-some right to live like [human beings]3674-human beings , to all those social circumstances which shall not make [[their]5267-some children]2166-their children ’s life one long disease . But are not these pestilences a judgment on [the rich]3580-the rich , too , in the truest sense of the word ? Are [they]5267-some not the broad , unmistakable seal to [God]281-god ’s opinion of a state of society which confesses [its]2657-its economic relations to be so utterly rotten and confused , that it actually can not afford to save yearly millions of pounds ’[2654-the “ masses] worth of the materials of food , not to mention thousands of human lives ? Is [not [every man who allows such things hastening the ruin of the society in which [he]2656-every man who allows such things hastening the ruin of the society in which he lives lives]2656-every man who allows such things hastening the ruin of the society in which he lives , by helping to foster the indignation and fury of [[its]2657-its victims]2658-its victims]2655-not every man who allows such things hastening the ruin of the society in which he lives , by helping to foster the indignation and fury of its victims ? Look at [that group of [stunted , haggard artisans]2660-stunted , haggard artisans , who are passing [us]2661-us]2659-that group of stunted , haggard artisans , who are passing us . What if one day [they]2659-that group of stunted , haggard artisans , who are passing us should call to account [the landlords whose coveteousness and ignorance make [[their]2662-the landlords whose coveteousness and ignorance make their dwellings hells on earth dwellings [hells on earth]2664-hells on earth]2663-their dwellings hells on earth]2662-the landlords whose coveteousness and ignorance make their dwellings hells on earth ? ’ By this time [they]2661-us had reached [[the artist]3180-the artist ’s house]5272-the artist ’s house . [Luke]137-mr. smith refused to enter ... ‘[2656-every man who allows such things hastening the ruin of the society in which he lives] [He]2656-every man who allows such things hastening the ruin of the society in which he lives had done with [this world]1108-this world , and [the painters of [this world]1108-this world]2666-the painters of this world . ’ ... And with a tearful last farewell , [he]137-mr. smith turned away up [the street]4602-the street , leaving [Lancelot]172-lancelot to gaze at [his]137-mr. smith slow , painful steps , and abject , earth - fixed mien . ‘[2656-every man who allows such things hastening the ruin of the society in which he lives] Ah ! ’ thought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[2656-every man who allows such things hastening the ruin of the society in which he lives] here is the end of [your]2668-your anthropology ! At first , [[your]2668-your ideal man]2669-your ideal man is [an angel]1778-an angel . But [[your]2668-your angel]2671-your angel is merely [an unsexed woman]2672-an unsexed woman ; and so [you]2668-your are forced to go back to the humanity after all — but to [a woman]3251-a woman , not [a man]445-a man ? And this , in the nineteenth century , when [men]612-men are telling [us]2676-us that the poetic and enthusiastic have become impossible , and that the only possible state of [the world]475-the world henceforward will be a universal good - humoured hive , of the Franklin - Benthamite religion ... a vast prosaic Cockaigne of [steam mills]2678-steam mills for grinding sausages — for those who can get at [them]2678-steam mills . And all the while , in spite of all Manchester schools , and [high and dry orthodox schools]2679-high and dry orthodox schools , here are the strangest phantasms , new and old , sane and insane , starting up suddenly into live practical power , to give [their]2680-their prosaic theories the lie — Popish conversions , Mormonisms , Mesmerisms , Californias , Continental revolutions , Paris days of June ... [[Ye]2668-your hypocrites]2681-ye hypocrites ! [ye]2668-your can discern the face of the sky , and yet [ye]2668-your can not discern the signs of this time ! ’ [He]2669-your ideal man was ushered [upstairs]684-upstairs to the door of [[his]2669-your ideal man studio]5275-his studio , at which [he]2669-your ideal man knocked , and was answered by a loud ‘[2681-ye hypocrites] Come in . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot heard a rustle as [he]2669-your ideal man entered , and caught sight of a most charming little white foot retreating hastily through the folding doors into [the inner room]5276-the inner room . [The artist]3180-the artist , who was seated at [his]3180-the artist easel , held up [his]3180-the artist brush as a signal of silence , and did not even raise [his]3180-the artist eyes till [he]3180-the artist had finished the touches on which [he]3180-the artist was engaged . ‘[2681-ye hypocrites] And now — what do [I]0-i see!—the last man [I]0-i should have expected ! [I]0-i thought [you]0-i were far down in [the country]976-the country . And what brings [you]0-i to [me]0-i with such serious and business - like looks ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i am [a penniless youth]2683-a penniless youth — ’ ‘[2683-a penniless youth] What ? ’ ‘[2683-a penniless youth] Ruined to [my]0-i last shilling , and [I]0-i want to turn [artist]2684-artist . ’ ‘[2684-artist] Oh , [ye]0-i gracious powers ! Come to [my]0-i arms , [brother]2685-brother at last with [me]0-i in the holy order of [those who must work or starve]2686-those who must work or starve . Long have [I]0-i wept in secret over the pernicious fulness of [your]0-i purse ! ’ ‘[0-i] Dry [your]0-i tears , then , now , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[0-i] for [I]0-i neither have ten pounds in [the world]475-the world , nor intend to have till [I]0-i can earn them . ’ ‘[2684-artist] [Artist]2684-artist ! ’ ran on [Mellot]182-claude ; ‘[2684-artist] ah ! [you]0-i shall be [an artist]835-an artist , indeed ! [You]0-i shall stay with [me]0-i and become [the English Michael Angelo]2690-the english michael angelo ; or , if [you]0-i are fool enough , go to [Rome]21-rome , and utterly eclipse [Overbeck]366-overbeck , and throw Schadow for ever into the shade . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i fine [you]0-i a supper , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[0-i] for that execrable attempt at a pun . ’ ‘[0-i] Agreed ! Here , [Sabina]367-sabina , send to [Covent Garden]92-covent garden for huge nosegays , and get out the best bottle of Burgundy . [We]2691-we will pass an evening worthy of [Horace]368-horace , and with garlands and libations honour the muse of painting . ’ ‘[368-horace] Luxurious dog ! ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[0-i] with all [your]0-i ca nt about poverty . ’ As [he]172-lancelot spoke , the folding doors opened , and [an exquisite little brunette]5278-an exquisite little brunette danced in from [the inner room]5276-the inner room , in which , by the bye , had been going on all the while a suspicious rustling , as of garments hastily arranged . [She]5278-an exquisite little brunette was dressed gracefully in a loose French morning - gown , down which [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s eye glanced towards the little foot , which , however , was now hidden in a tiny velvet slipper . [[The artist]3180-the artist ’s wife]5281-the artist ’s wife was [a real beauty , though without a single perfect feature , except a most delicious little mouth , a skin like velvet , and clear brown eyes]5282-a real beauty , though without a single perfect feature , except a most delicious little mouth , a skin like velvet , and clear brown eyes , from which beamed earnest simplicity and arch good humour . [She]5278-an exquisite little brunette darted forward to [[[her]5278-an exquisite little brunette husband]4183-her husband ’s friend]5284-her husband ’s friend , while [her]5278-an exquisite little brunette rippling brown hair , fantastically arranged , fluttered about [her]5278-an exquisite little brunette neck , and seizing [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s hands successively in both of [hers]5278-an exquisite little brunette , broke out in an accent prettily tinged with French , — ‘[0-i] Charming!—delightful ! And so [you]0-i are really going to turn [painter]2692-painter ! And [I]0-i have longed so to be introduced to [you]0-i ! [Claude]182-claude has been raving about [you]0-i these two years ; [you]0-i already seem to [me]0-i [the oldest friend in [the world]475-the world]2693-the oldest friend in the world . [You]0-i must not go to [Rome]21-rome . [We]2695-we shall keep [you]0-i , [Mr. Lancelot]172-lancelot ; positively [you]0-i must come and live with [us]2695-we — [we]2695-we shall be [the happiest trio in [London]46-london]2696-the happiest trio in london . [I]0-i will make [you]0-i so comfortable : [you]0-i must let [me]0-i cater for [you]0-i — cook for [you]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] And be [[my]0-i study]2697-my study sometimes ? ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , smiling . ‘[0-i] Ah , ’ [she]5285-she said , blushing , and shaking [her]5285-she pretty little fist at [Claude]182-claude , ‘[2698-that madcap] [that madcap]2698-that madcap ! how [he]2699-he has betrayed [me]0-i ! When [he]2699-he is at [his]2699-he easel , [he]2699-he is so in [the seventh heaven]2700-the seventh heaven , that [he]2699-he sees nothing , thinks of nothing , but [his]2699-he own dreams . ’ At this moment a heavy step sounded on the stairs , the door opened , and there entered , to [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s astonishment , [the stranger who had just puzzled [him]172-lancelot so much at [[his]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle ’s]5286-the stranger who had just puzzled him so much at his uncle ’s . [Claude]182-claude rose reverentially , and came forward , but [Sabina]367-sabina was beforehand with [him]182-claude , and running up to [[her]367-sabina visitor]5288-her visitor , kissed [his]182-claude hand again and again , almost kneeling to [him]182-claude . ‘[2701-the dear master] [The dear master]2701-the dear master ! ’ [she]367-sabina cried ; ‘[2701-the dear master] what a delightful surprise ! [we]2702-we have not seen [you]2701-the dear master this fortnight past , and gave [you]2701-the dear master up for lost . ’ ‘[2702-we] Where do [you]2701-the dear master come from , [[my]0-i dear master]2703-my dear master ? ’ asked [Claude]182-claude . ‘[2701-the dear master] From going to and fro in [the earth]866-the earth , and from walking up and down in it , ’ answered [he]0-i , smiling , and laying [his]0-i finger on [his]0-i lips , ‘[2705-my dear pupils] [[my]0-i dear pupils]2705-my dear pupils . And [you]2705-my dear pupils are both well and happy ? ’ ‘[2701-the dear master] Perfectly , and doubly delighted at [your]2701-the dear master presence to - day , for [your]2701-the dear master advice will come in a providential moment for [[my]0-i friend]800-my friend [here]775-here . ’ ‘[2701-the dear master] Ah ! ’ said [the strange man]5289-the strange man , ‘[2701-the dear master] well met once more ! So [you]2705-my dear pupils are going to turn [painter]2692-painter ? ’ [He]0-i bent a severe and searching look on [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[2705-my dear pupils] [You]2705-my dear pupils have [a painter]2709-a painter ’s face , [young man]2236-young man , ’ [he]0-i said ; ‘[2705-my dear pupils] go on and prosper . What branch of art do [you]2705-my dear pupils intend to study ? ’ ‘[2711-the ancient italian painters] [The ancient Italian painters]2711-the ancient italian painters , as [my]0-i first step . ’ ‘[2711-the ancient italian painters] Ancient ? it is not four hundred years since [Perugino]370-perugino died . But [I]0-i should suppose [you]2705-my dear pupils do not intend to ignore classic art ? ’ ‘[2705-my dear pupils] [You]2705-my dear pupils have divined rightly . [I]0-i wish , in the study of the antique , to arrive at the primeval laws of unfallen human beauty . ’ ‘[372-praxiteles] Were [Phidias]371-phidias and [Praxiteles]372-praxiteles , then , so primeval ? [the world]475-the world had lasted many a thousand years before [their]2713-their turn came . If [you]2705-my dear pupils intend to begin at the beginning , why not go back at once to [the garden of Eden]3545-the garden of eden , and there study the true antique ? ’ ‘[372-praxiteles] If there were but any relics of it , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , puzzled , and laughing . ‘[2705-my dear pupils] [You]2705-my dear pupils would find it very near [you]2705-my dear pupils , [young man]2236-young man , if [you]2705-my dear pupils had but eyes to see it . ’ [Claude Mellot]182-claude laughed significantly , and [Sabina]367-sabina clapped [her]367-sabina little hands . ‘[2705-my dear pupils] Yet till [you]2705-my dear pupils take [him]2716-him with [you]2705-my dear pupils , [master]1667-master , and show it to [him]2716-him , [he]2716-him must needs be content with the Royal Academy and the Elgin marbles . ’ ‘[2716-him] But to what branch of painting , pray , ’ said [the master]5290-the master to [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[2705-my dear pupils] will [you]2705-my dear pupils apply [your]2705-my dear pupils knowledge of the antique ? Will [you]2705-my dear pupils , like [this foolish fellow]2718-this foolish fellow here ’ ( with a kindly glance at [Claude]182-claude ) , ‘[2705-my dear pupils] fritter [yourself]2705-my dear pupils away on Nymphs and [Venuses]373-venuses , in which neither [he]2716-him nor [any one else]1547-any one else believes ? ’ ‘[2705-my dear pupils] Historic art , as the highest , ’ answered [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[0-i] is [my]0-i ambition . ’ ‘[0-i] It is well to aim at the highest , but only when it is possible for [us]2720-us . And how can such a school exist in [England]3-england now ? [You]2721-you English must learn to understand [your]2721-you own history before [you]2721-you paint it . Rather follow in the steps of [your]2721-you Turners , and [Landseers]93-landseers , and Standfields , and [Creswicks]94-creswicks , and add [your]2721-you contribution to [the present noble school of [naturalist painters]2723-naturalist painters]2722-the present noble school of naturalist painters . That is the niche in [the temple which [God]281-god has set [you]2721-you English]2724-the temple which god has set you english to fill up just now . [These men]3704-these men ’s patient , reverent faith in Nature as [they]3704-these men see [her]2726-her , [their]3704-these men knowledge that the ideal is neither to be invented nor abstracted , but found and left where [God]281-god has put it , and where alone it can be represented , in actual and individual phenomena;—in these lies an honest development of the true idea of Protestantism , which is paving the way to the mesothetic art of the future . ’ ‘[5083-the puritans] Glorious ! ’ said [Sabina]367-sabina : ‘[5083-the puritans] not a single word that [we]2720-us [poor creatures]2727-poor creatures can understand ! ’ But [[our]2720-us hero , who always took a virtuous delight in hearing what [he]5291-our hero , who always took a virtuous delight in hearing what he could not comprehend could not comprehend]5291-our hero , who always took a virtuous delight in hearing what he could not comprehend , went on to question [the orator]5292-the orator . ‘[5083-the puritans] What , then , is the true idea of Protestantism ? ’ said [he]5291-our hero , who always took a virtuous delight in hearing what he could not comprehend . ‘[5083-the puritans] The universal symbolism and dignity of matter , whether in man or nature . ’ ‘[5083-the puritans] But [the Puritans]5083-the puritans — ? ’ ‘[5083-the puritans] Were inconsistent with [themselves]5083-the puritans and with Protestantism , and therefore [God]281-god would not allow [them]5083-the puritans to proceed . Yet [their]5083-the puritans repudiation of all art was better than the Judas - kiss which [Romanism]374-romanism bestows on it , in the meagre eclecticism of [the ancient religious schools]2729-the ancient religious schools , and of [[your]2730-your modern Overbecks and [Pugins]375-pugins]2731-your modern overbecks and pugins . [The only really wholesome designer of great power whom [I]0-i have seen in [Germany]1-germany]2732-the only really wholesome designer of great power whom i have seen in germany is [Kaulbach]376-kaulbach ; and perhaps [every one]807-every one would not agree with [my]0-i reasons for admiring [him]376-kaulbach , in this whitewashed age . But [you]2730-your , [young sir]2734-young sir , were meant for better things than art . [Many young geniuses]2735-many young geniuses have an early hankering , as [Goethe]187-goethe had , to turn [painters]2736-painters . It seems the shortest and easiest method of embodying [their]2735-many young geniuses conceptions in visible form ; but [they]2735-many young geniuses get wiser afterwards , when [they]2735-many young geniuses find in [themselves]2735-many young geniuses thoughts that can not be laid upon the canvas . Come with [me]0-i — [I]0-i like striking while the iron is hot ; walk with [me]0-i towards [[my]0-i lodgings]2737-my lodgings , and [we]2738-we will discuss this weighty matter . ’ And with a gay farewell to [the adoring little Sabina]5293-the adoring little sabina , [he]0-i passed an iron arm through [[Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s]5294-lancelot ’s , and marched [him]0-i down into [the street]4602-the street . [Lancelot]172-lancelot was surprised and almost nettled at the sudden influence which [he]172-lancelot found [this quaint personage]5296-this quaint personage was exerting over [him]172-lancelot . But [he]172-lancelot had , of late , tasted the high delight of feeling [himself]172-lancelot under the guidance of a superior mind , and longed to enjoy it once more . Perhaps [they]5297-they were reminiscences of this kind which stirred in [him]172-lancelot the strange fancy of a connection , almost of a likeness , between [[his]172-lancelot new acquaintance]5298-his new acquaintance and [Argemone]150-argemone . [He]172-lancelot asked , humbly enough , why Art was to be a forbidden path to [him]172-lancelot ? ‘[2738-we] Besides [you]2739-you are [an Englishman]1153-an englishman , and [a man of uncommon talent]2741-a man of uncommon talent , unless [your]2739-you physiognomy belies [you]2739-you ; and one , too , for whom [God]281-god has strange things in store , or [He]281-god would not have so suddenly and strangely overthrown [you]2739-you . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot started . [He]172-lancelot remembered that [Tregarva]173-tregarva had said just the same thing to [him]172-lancelot that very morning , and the ( to [him]172-lancelot ) strange coincidence sank deep into [his]172-lancelot heart . ‘[281-god] [You]2739-you must be [a politician]2742-a politician , ’ [the stranger]2568-the stranger went on . ‘[2742-a politician] [You]2739-you are bound to it as [your]2739-you birthright . It has been [England]242-young england ’s privilege hitherto to solve all political questions as they arise for [the rest of [the world]475-the world]881-the rest of the world ; it is [her]242-young england duty now . [Here]775-here , or nowhere , must the solution be attempted of those social problems which are convulsing more and more all [Christendom]34-christendom . [She]242-young england can not afford to waste brains like [yours]2739-you , while in thousands of reeking alleys , such as that one opposite [us]2746-us , [heathens]4322-heathens and [savages]2199-savages are demanding the rights of citizenship . Whether [they]2749-they be right or wrong , is what [you]2739-you , and such as [you]2739-you , have to find out at this day . ’ Silent and thoughtful , [Lancelot]172-lancelot walked on by [his]2739-you side . ‘[2749-they] What is become of [[your]2739-you friend]834-your friend [Tregarva]173-tregarva ? [I]0-i met [him]173-tregarva this morning after [he]173-tregarva parted from [you]2739-you , and had some talk with [him]173-tregarva . [I]0-i was sorely minded to enlist [him]173-tregarva . Perhaps [I]0-i shall ; in the meantime , [I]0-i shall busy [myself]0-i with [you]2739-you . ’ ‘[0-i] In what way , ’ asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[2751-most strange sir] [most strange sir]2751-most strange sir , of whose name , much less of whose occupation , [I]0-i can gain no tidings . ’ ‘[0-i] [My]0-i name for the time being is [Barnakill]377-barnakill . And as for business , as it is [your]2739-you English fashion to call new things obstinately by old names , careless whether they apply or not , [you]2739-you may consider [me]0-i as [a recruiting - sergeant]2752-a recruiting - sergeant ; which trade , indeed , [I]0-i follow , though [I]0-i am no more like the popular red - coated ones than [your]2739-you present “ glorious constitution ” is like [William the Third]378-william the third ’s , or [Overbeck]366-overbeck ’s high art like [Fra Angelico]379-fra angelico ’s . Farewell ! When [I]0-i want [you]2739-you , which will be most likely when [you]2739-you want [me]0-i , [I]0-i shall find [you]2739-you again . ’ The evening was passed , as [Claude]182-claude had promised , in a truly Horatian manner . [Sabina]367-sabina was most piquante , and [Claude]182-claude interspersed [his]182-claude genial and enthusiastic eloquence with various wise saws of ‘[2753-the prophet] [the prophet]2753-the prophet . ’ ‘[2753-the prophet] But why on [earth]724-earth , ’ quoth [Lancelot]172-lancelot , at last , ‘[0-i] do [you]0-i call [him]2753-the prophet [a prophet]2755-a prophet ? ’ ‘[0-i] Because [he]2753-the prophet is [one]3305-one ; it ’s [his]2753-the prophet business , [his]2753-the prophet calling . [He]2753-the prophet gets [his]2753-the prophet living thereby , as [the showman]2757-the showman did by [his]2757-the showman elephant . ’ ‘[2753-the prophet] But what does [he]2753-the prophet foretell ? ’ ‘[2753-the prophet] Oh , son of [the earth]866-the earth ! And [you]0-i went to [Cambridge]49-cambridge — are reported to have gone in for the thing , or phantom , called the tripos , and taken a first class ! . .. Did [you]0-i ever look out the word “ prophetes ” in [Liddell]380-liddell and [Scott]381-scott ? ’ ‘[0-i] Why , what do [you]0-i know about [Liddell]380-liddell and [Scott]381-scott ? ’ ‘[381-scott] Nothing , thank goodness ; [I]0-i never had time to waste over the crooked letters . But [I]0-i have heard say that [prophetes]2759-prophetes means , not [a foreteller]2760-a foreteller , but [an out - teller]2761-an out - teller — one who declares the will of [a deity]2762-a deity , and interprets [his]2762-a deity oracles . Is it not so ? ’ ‘[2761-an out - teller] Undeniably . ’ ‘[2761-an out - teller] And that [he]2753-the prophet became [a foreteller among [heathens]4322-heathens]2763-a foreteller among heathens at least — as [I]0-i consider , among [all peoples]2765-all peoples whatsoever — because knowing the real bearing of what had happened , and what was happening , [he]2753-the prophet could discern the signs of the times , and so had what [the world]475-the world calls a shrewd guess — what [I]0-i , like [a Pantheist]2767-a pantheist as [I]0-i am denominated , should call a divine and inspired foresight — of what was going to happen . ’ ‘[2768-no scollard] A new notion , and a pleasant one , for it looks something like a law . ’ ‘[2768-no scollard] [I]0-i am [no scollard]2768-no scollard , as [they]2769-they would say in [Whitford]7-whitford , [you]2770-you know ; but it has often struck [me]0-i , that if [folks]1214-folks would but believe that [the Apostles]4374-the apostles talked not such very bad Greek , and had some slight notion of the received meaning of the words [they]4374-the apostles used , and of the absurdity of using the same term to express nineteen different things , the New Testament would be found to be a much simpler and more severely philosophic book than “ [Theologians]2773-theologians ” ( “ Anthropo - sophists ” [I]0-i call [them]2773-theologians ) fancy . ’ ‘[2775-this prophet] Where on earth did [you]0-i get all this wisdom , or foolishness ? ’ ‘[2753-the prophet] From [the prophet]2753-the prophet , a fortnight ago . ’ ‘[2753-the prophet] Who is [this prophet]2775-this prophet ? [I]0-i will know . ’ ‘[0-i] Then [you]2770-you will know more than [I]0-i do . [Sabina]367-sabina — light [my]0-i meerschaum , there ’s a darling ; it will taste the sweeter after [your]2770-you lips . ’ And [Claude]182-claude laid [his]182-claude delicate woman - like limbs upon the sofa , and looked the very picture of luxurious nonchalance . ‘[2753-the prophet] What is [he]2753-the prophet , [[you]0-i pitiless wretch]2776-you pitiless wretch ? ’ ‘[2753-the prophet] [Fairest Hebe]382-fairest hebe , fill [our]2777-our Prometheus Vinctus another glass of Burgundy , and find [your]2770-you guitar , to silence [him]2753-the prophet . ’ ‘[2778-the ocean nymphs] It was [the ocean nymphs]2778-the ocean nymphs who came to comfort [Prometheus]383-prometheus — and unsandalled , too , if [I]0-i recollect right , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , smiling at [Sabina]367-sabina . ‘[2778-the ocean nymphs] Come , now , if [he]2753-the prophet will not tell [me]0-i , perhaps [you]2770-you will ? ’ [Sabina]367-sabina only blushed , and laughed mysteriously . ‘[2770-you] [You]0-i surely are intimate with [him]2753-the prophet , [Claude]182-claude ? When and where did [you]0-i meet [him]2753-the prophet first ? ’ ‘[2753-the prophet] Seventeen years ago , on the barricades of the three days , in [the charming little pandemonium called [Paris]63-paris]2779-the charming little pandemonium called paris , [he]2753-the prophet picked [me]0-i out of a gutter , [a boy of fifteen]1566-a boy of fifteen , with a musket - ball through [my]0-i body ; mended [me]0-i , and sent [me]0-i to [[a painter]2709-a painter ’s studio]2782-a painter ’s studio ... The next séjour [I]0-i had with [him]2753-the prophet began in sight of [the Demawend]95-the demawend . [Sabina]367-sabina , perhaps [you]367-sabina might like to relate to [Mr. Smith]137-mr. smith that interview , and the circumstances under which [you]367-sabina made [your]367-sabina first sketch of that magnificent and little - known volcano ? ’ [Sabina]367-sabina blushed again — this time scarlet ; and , to [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s astonishment , pulled off [her]367-sabina slipper , and brandishing it daintily , uttered some unintelligible threat , in an Oriental language , at the laughing [Claude]182-claude . ‘[367-sabina] Why , [you]367-sabina must have been in [the East]96-the east ? ’ ‘[367-sabina] Why not ! Do [you]367-sabina think [that figure]2783-that figure and that walk were picked up in [stay - ridden , toe - pinching [England]3-england]2784-stay - ridden , toe - pinching england ? ... Ay , in [the East]96-the east ; and why not elsewhere ? Do [you]367-sabina think [I]0-i got [my]0-i knowledge of [the human figure]2785-the human figure from the live - model in [the Royal Academy]2786-the royal academy ? ’ ‘[367-sabina] [I]0-i certainly have always had [my]0-i doubts of it . [You]367-sabina are [the only man [I]0-i know who can paint muscle in motion]2787-the only man i know who can paint muscle in motion . ’ ‘[367-sabina] Because [I]0-i am almost [the only man in [England]3-england who has ever seen it]2788-the only man in england who has ever seen it . [Artists]2507-artists should go to [the Cannibal Islands]2790-the cannibal islands for that ... J’ai fait le grand tour . [I]0-i should not wonder if [the prophet]2753-the prophet made [you]367-sabina take it . ’ ‘[2753-the prophet] That would be very much as [I]0-i chose . ’ ‘[0-i] Or otherwise . ’ ‘[0-i] What do [you]367-sabina mean ? ’ ‘[367-sabina] That if [he]2753-the prophet wills [you]367-sabina to go , [I]0-i defy [you]367-sabina to stay . Eh , [Sabina]367-sabina ! ’ ‘[367-sabina] Well , [you]367-sabina are [a very mysterious pair,—and a very charming one]2792-a very mysterious pair,—and a very charming one . ’ ‘[2792-a very mysterious pair,—and a very charming one] So [we]2793-we think [ourselves]2793-we — as to the charmingness ... and as for the mystery . .. “ Omnia exeunt in mysterium , ” says [somebody]3878-somebody , somewhere — or if [he]3878-somebody do n’t , ought to , seeing that it is so . [You]367-sabina will be a mystery some day , and a myth , and a thousand years hence [pious old ladies]2795-pious old ladies will be pulling caps as to whether [you]367-sabina were [a saint]2796-a saint or [a devil]2797-a devil , and whether [you]367-sabina did really work miracles or not , as corroborations of [your]367-sabina ex - supra - lunar illumination on social questions ... Yes ... [you]367-sabina will have to submit , and see [Bogy]384-bogy , and enter the Eleusinian mysteries . Eh , [Sabina]367-sabina ? ’ ‘[367-sabina] [[My]0-i dear]1114-my dear [Claude]182-claude , what between [the Burgundy]385-the burgundy and [your]182-claude usual foolishness , [you]182-claude seem very much inclined to divulge the Eleusinian mysteries . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t well do that , [[my]0-i beauty]2799-my beauty , seeing that , if [you]182-claude recollect , [we]2800-we were both turned back at [the vestibule]2801-the vestibule , for [a pair of naughty children]2802-a pair of naughty children as [we]2800-we are . ’ ‘[182-claude] Do be quiet ! and let [me]0-i enjoy , for once , [[my]0-i woman]2803-my woman ’s right to the last word ! ’ And in this hopeful state of mystification , [Lancelot]172-lancelot went [home]452-home , and dreamt of [Argemone]150-argemone . [[His]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle would , and , indeed , as it seemed , could , give [him]172-lancelot very little information on the question which had so excited [his]172-lancelot curiosity . [He]172-lancelot had met [the man in [India]41-india]5302-the man in india many years before , had received there from [him]172-lancelot most important kindnesses , and considered [him]172-lancelot , from experience , of oracular wisdom . [He]172-lancelot seemed to have an unlimited command of money , though most frugal in [his]172-lancelot private habits ; visited [England]3-england for a short time every few years , and always under a different appellation ; but as for [his]172-lancelot real name , habitation , or business , here or at [home]452-home , [the good banker]2376-the good banker knew nothing , except that whenever questioned on [them]5305-them , [he]172-lancelot wandered off into [Pantagruelist]97-pantagruelist jokes , and ended in [Cloud - land]98-cloud - land . So that [Lancelot]172-lancelot was fain to give up [his]172-lancelot questions and content [himself]172-lancelot with longing for the reappearance of [this inexplicable sage]5306-this inexplicable sage . A few mornings afterwards , [Lancelot]172-lancelot , as [he]172-lancelot glanced [his]172-lancelot eye over the columns of The Times , stopped short at the beloved name of [Whitford]144-whitford priors . To [his]172-lancelot disgust and disappointment , it only occurred in one of those miserable cases , now of weekly occurrence , of concealing the birth of [a child]3467-a child . [He]172-lancelot was turning from [it]5308-it , when [he]172-lancelot saw [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge ’s name . Another look sufficed to show [him]172-lancelot that [he]172-lancelot ought to go at once to [the colonel , who had returned the day before from [Norway]29-norway]5309-the colonel , who had returned the day before from norway . A few minutes brought [him]172-lancelot to [[[his]172-lancelot friend]5310-his friend ’s lodging]5311-his friend ’s lodging , but [The Times]5312-the times had arrived [there]992-there before [him]172-lancelot . [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge was sitting over [his]139-bracebridge untasted breakfast , [his]139-bracebridge face buried in [his]139-bracebridge hands . ‘[2803-my woman] Do not speak to [me]0-i , ’ [he]0-i said , without looking up . ‘[2803-my woman] It was right of [you]0-i to come — kind of [you]0-i ; but it is too late . ’ [He]0-i started , and looked wildly round [him]0-i , as if listening for some sound which [he]0-i expected , and then laid [his]139-bracebridge head down on the table . [Lancelot]172-lancelot turned to go . ‘[185-mary] No — do not leave [me]0-i ! Not alone , for God ’s sake , not alone ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot sat down . There was a fearful alteration in [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge . [His]139-bracebridge old keen self - confident look had vanished . [He]139-bracebridge was haggard , life - weary , shame - stricken , almost abject . [His]139-bracebridge limbs looked quite shrunk and powerless , as [he]139-bracebridge rested [his]139-bracebridge head on the table before [him]139-bracebridge , and murmured incoherently from time to time , — ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i own child]1850-my own child ! And [I]0-i never shall have another ! No second chance for those who — Oh [Mary]185-mary ! [Mary]185-mary ! [you]185-mary might have waited — [you]185-mary might have trusted [me]0-i ! And why should [you?—ay]2805-you?—ay , why , indeed ? And such [a pretty baby]2806-a pretty baby , too!—just like [[his]2806-a pretty baby father]453-his father ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot laid [his]172-lancelot hand kindly on [his]139-bracebridge shoulder . ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i dearest]2808-my dearest [Bracebridge]139-bracebridge , the evidence proves that [the child]2809-the child was born dead . ’ ‘[2810-they] [They]2810-they lie ! ’ [he]172-lancelot said , fiercely , starting up . ‘[2810-they] It cried twice after it was born ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot stood horror - struck . ‘[2810-they] [I]0-i heard it last night , and the night before that , and the night before that again , under [my]0-i pillow , shrieking — stifling — two little squeaks , like a caught hare ; and [I]0-i tore the pillows off it — [I]0-i did ; and once [I]0-i saw [it]2809-the child , and it had beautiful black eyes — just like [[its]2809-the child father]2811-its father — just like a little miniature that used to lie on [[my]0-i mother]867-my mother ’s table , when [I]0-i knelt at [her]867-my mother knee , before [they]2810-they sent [me]0-i out “ to see life , ” and [Eton]386-eton , and the army , and [Crockford]8-crockford ’s , and [Newmarket]388-newmarket , and [fine gentlemen]2813-fine gentlemen , and [fine ladies]603-fine ladies , and luxury , and flattery , brought [me]0-i to this ! Oh , [father]3344-father ! [father]3344-father ! was that the only way to make [a gentleman of [your]3344-father son?—There]2817-a gentleman of your son?—there it is again ! Do n’t [you]3344-father hear it?—under the sofa cushions ! Tear them off ! Curse [you]3344-father ! Save it ! ’ And , with a fearful oath , [the wretched man]5314-the wretched man sent [Lancelot]172-lancelot staggering across [the room]3190-the room , and madly tore up the cushions . [A long postman]5316-a long postman ’s knock at [the door.—He]5317-the door.—he suddenly rose up quite collected . ‘[2818-she] The letter ! [I]0-i knew it would come . [She]2818-she need not have written it : [I]0-i know what is in it . ’ [The servant]5318-the servant ’s step came up the stairs . [Poor Bracebridge]389-bracebridge turned to [Lancelot]172-lancelot with something of [his]0-i own stately determination . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i must be alone when [I]0-i receive this letter . Stay [here]775-here . ’ And with compressed lips and fixed eyes [he]0-i stalked out at the door , and shut it . [Lancelot]172-lancelot heard [him]0-i stop ; then [the servant]5318-the servant ’s footsteps down the stairs ; then [the colonel]504-the colonel ’s treading , slowly and heavily , went step by step up to [the room above]5321-the room above . [He]0-i shut that door too . A dead silence followed . [Lancelot]172-lancelot stood in fearful suspense , and held [his]172-lancelot breath to listen . Perhaps [he]172-lancelot had fainted ? No , for then [he]172-lancelot would have heard a fall . Perhaps [he]172-lancelot had fallen on the bed ? [He]172-lancelot would go and see . No , [he]172-lancelot would wait a little longer . Perhaps [he]172-lancelot was praying ? [He]172-lancelot had told [Lancelot]172-lancelot to pray once — [he]172-lancelot dared not interrupt [him]172-lancelot now . A slight stir — a noise as of an opening box . Thank [God]281-god , [he]172-lancelot was , at least , alive ! Nonsense ! Why should [he]172-lancelot not be alive ? What could happen to [him]172-lancelot ? And yet [he]172-lancelot knew that something was going to happen . The silence was ominous — unbearable ; the air of [the room]3190-the room felt heavy and stifling , as if a thunderstorm were about to burst . [He]172-lancelot longed to hear [the man]738-the man raging and stamping . And yet [he]172-lancelot could not connect the thought of [one so gay and full of gallant life]5324-one so gay and full of gallant life , with the terrible dread that was creeping over [him]172-lancelot — with the terrible scene which [he]172-lancelot had just witnessed . It must be all a temporary excitement — a mistake — a hideous dream , which the next post would sweep away . [He]172-lancelot would go and tell [him]738-the man so . No , [he]172-lancelot could not stir . [His]172-lancelot limbs seemed leaden , [his]172-lancelot feet felt rooted to the ground , as in long nightmare . And still the intolerable silence brooded overhead . What broke it ? A dull , stifled report , as of a pistol fired against the ground ; a heavy fall ; and again the silence of death .
