[He]172-lancelot rushed [upstairs]684-upstairs . A corpse lay on its face upon the floor , and from among its hair , a crimson thread crept slowly across the carpet . It was all over . [He]172-lancelot bent over the head , but one look was sufficient . [He]172-lancelot did not try to lift it up . On the table lay the fatal letter . [Lancelot]172-lancelot knew that [he]172-lancelot had a right to read it . It was scrawled , mis - spelt — but there were no tear - blots on the paper : — ‘[753-sir] [Sir]753-sir — [I]0-i am in [prison]2821-prison — and where are [you]753-sir ? [Cruel man]2822-cruel man ! Where were [you]753-sir all those miserable weeks , while [I]0-i was coming nearer and nearer to [my]0-i shame ? [Murdering dumb beasts in [foreign lands]2824-foreign lands]2823-murdering dumb beasts in foreign lands . [You]753-sir have murdered more than [them]2825-them . How [I]0-i loved [you]753-sir once ! How [I]0-i hate [you]753-sir now ! But [I]0-i have [my]0-i revenge . [[Your]753-sir baby]2826-your baby cried twice after it was born ! ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot tore the letter into a hundred pieces , and swallowed them , for every foot in [the house]3485-the house was on the stairs . So there was terror , and confusion , and running in and out : but there were no wet eyes there except those of [[Bracebridge]389-bracebridge ’s groom]5327-bracebridge ’s groom , who threw [himself]5327-bracebridge ’s groom on the body , and would not stir . And then there was [a coroner]5328-a coroner ’s inquest ; and it came out in the evidence how ‘[2827-the deceased] [the deceased]2827-the deceased had been for several days very much depressed , and had talked of voices and apparitions ; ’ whereat [the jury]5329-the jury — as [twelve honest , good - natured Christians]5330-twelve honest , good - natured christians were bound to do — returned a verdict of temporary insanity ; and in a week more [the penny - a - liners]2153-the penny - a - liners grew tired ; and [the world]475-the world , too , who never expects anything , not even [French revolutions]5333-french revolutions , grew tired also of repeating,—‘Dear [me]2827-the deceased ! who would have expected it ? ’[2827-the deceased] and having filled up [[the colonel]504-the colonel ’s place]2829-the colonel ’s place , swaggered on as usual , arm - in - arm with the flesh and the devil . [Bracebridge]389-bracebridge ’s death had , of course , a great effect on [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s spirit . Not in the way of warning , though — such events seldom act in that way , on the highest as well as on the lowest minds . After all , [your]2830-your ‘ Rakes ’[2830-your] Progresses , ’ and ‘[5334-atheists ’ deathbeds] [Atheists ’ Deathbeds]5334-atheists ’ deathbeds , ’[5334-atheists ’ deathbeds] do no more good than noble [George Cruikshank]390-george cruikshank ’s ‘ Bottle ’[390-george cruikshank] will , because [every one]807-every one knows that [they]807-every one are the exception , and not the rule ; that [the Atheist]2832-the atheist generally dies with a conscience as comfortably callous as a rhinocerous - hide ; and [the rake]678-the rake , when old age stops [his]678-the rake power of sinning , becomes generally rather more respectable than [[his]678-the rake neighbours]2834-his neighbours . The New Testament deals very little in appeals ad terrorem ; and it would be well if [some]5267-some , who fancy that [they]5267-some follow it , would do the same , and by abstaining from making ‘ hell - fire ’[5267-some] the chief incentive to virtue , cease from tempting many [a poor fellow]2836-a poor fellow to enlist on [the devil]600-the devil ’s side the only manly feeling [he]172-lancelot has left — personal courage . But yet [Lancelot]172-lancelot was affected . And when , on the night of [the colonel]504-the colonel ’s funeral , [he]172-lancelot opened , at hazard , [[Argemone]150-argemone ’s Bible]2839-argemone ’s bible , and [his]172-lancelot eyes fell on the passage which tells how ‘ one shall be taken and another left , ’[172-lancelot] great honest tears of gratitude dropped upon the page ; and [he]172-lancelot fell on [his]172-lancelot knees , and in bitter self - reproach thanked [the new found Upper Powers , who , as [he]172-lancelot began to hope , were leading [him]172-lancelot not in vain,—that [he]172-lancelot had yet a life before [him]172-lancelot]391-the new found upper powers , who , as he began to hope , were leading him not in vain,—that he had yet a life before him wherein to play [the man]738-the man . And now [he]172-lancelot felt that the last link was broken between [him]172-lancelot and all [[his]172-lancelot late frivolous companions]2841-his late frivolous companions . [All]2451-all had deserted [him]172-lancelot in [his]172-lancelot ruin but this one — and [he]172-lancelot was silent in the grave . And now , from [the world]475-the world and all its toys and revelry , [he]172-lancelot was parted once and for ever ; and [he]172-lancelot stood alone in [the desert]1738-the desert , like [the last Arab of [a plague - stricken tribe]2846-a plague - stricken tribe]2845-the last arab of a plague - stricken tribe , looking over [the wreck of [ancient cities]2848-ancient cities]2847-the wreck of ancient cities , across [barren sands , where far rivers gleamed in the distance]2849-barren sands , where far rivers gleamed in the distance , that seemed to beckon [him]172-lancelot away into other climes , other hopes , other duties . Old things had passed away — when would all things become new ? Not yet , [Lancelot]172-lancelot . [Thou]2850-thou hast still one selfish hope , one dream of bliss , however impossible , yet still cherished . [Thou]2850-thou art [a changed man]2851-a changed man — but for whose sake ? For [Argemone]150-argemone ’s . Is [she]150-argemone to be [[thy]2850-thou god]2852-thy god , then ? Art [thou]2850-thou to live for [her]150-argemone , or for the sake of One greater than [she]150-argemone ? All thine idols are broken — swiftly the desert sands are drifting over them , and covering them in.—All but one — must that , too , be taken from [thee]2850-thou ? One morning a letter was put into [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s hands , bearing the Whitford postmark . Tremblingly [he]172-lancelot tore it open . It contained a few passionate words from [Honoria]162-honoria . [Argemone]150-argemone was dying of typhus fever , and entreating to see [him]172-lancelot once again ; and [Honoria]162-honoria had , with some difficulty , as [she]162-honoria hinted , obtained leave from [[her]162-honoria parents]4189-her parents to send for [him]172-lancelot . [His]172-lancelot last bank note carried [him]172-lancelot down to [Whitford]7-whitford ; and , calm and determined , as one who feels that [he]172-lancelot has nothing more to lose on [earth]724-earth , and whose torment must henceforth become [his]172-lancelot element , [he]172-lancelot entered [the Priory]534-the priory that evening . [He]172-lancelot hardly spoke or looked at [a soul]2856-a soul ; [he]172-lancelot felt that [he]172-lancelot was there on an errand which [none]1106-none understood ; that [he]172-lancelot was moving towards [Argemone]150-argemone through [a spiritual world]4164-a spiritual world , in which [he]172-lancelot and [she]150-argemone were alone ; that , in [his]172-lancelot utter poverty and hopelessness , [he]172-lancelot stood above all the luxury , even above all the sorrow , around [him]172-lancelot ; that [she]150-argemone belonged to [him]172-lancelot , and to [him]172-lancelot alone ; and [the broken - hearted beggar]2859-the broken - hearted beggar followed [the weeping Honoria]2860-the weeping honoria towards [[[his]2859-the broken - hearted beggar lady]2861-his lady ’s chamber]2862-his lady ’s chamber , with the step and bearing of [a lord]2863-a lord . [He]172-lancelot was wrong ; there were pride and fierceness enough in [his]172-lancelot heart , mingled with that sense of nothingness of rank , money , chance and change , yea , death itself , of all but Love;—mingled even with that intense belief that [his]172-lancelot sorrows were but [his]172-lancelot just deserts , which now possessed all [his]172-lancelot soul . And in after years [he]172-lancelot knew that [he]172-lancelot was wrong ; but so [he]172-lancelot felt at the time ; and even then the strength was not all of earth which bore [him]172-lancelot manlike through that hour . [He]172-lancelot entered [the room]3190-the room ; the darkness , the silence , the cool scent of vinegar , struck a shudder through [him]172-lancelot . [The squire]3125-the squire was sitting half idiotic and helpless , in [his]3125-the squire arm - chair . [His]3125-the squire face lighted up as [Lancelot]172-lancelot entered , and [he]3125-the squire tried to hold out [his]3125-the squire palsied hand . [Lancelot]172-lancelot did not see [him]3125-the squire . [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington moved proudly and primly back from the bed , with a face that seemed to say through its tears , ‘ [I]158-mrs. lavington at least am responsible for nothing that occurs from this interview . ’[158-mrs. lavington] [Lancelot]172-lancelot did not see [her]158-mrs. lavington either : [he]172-lancelot walked straight up towards the bed as if [he]172-lancelot were treading on [his]172-lancelot own ground . [His]172-lancelot heart was between [his]172-lancelot lips , and yet [his]172-lancelot whole soul felt as dry and hard as some burnt - out volcano - crater . A faint voice — oh , how faint , how changed!—called [him]172-lancelot from within the closed curtains . ‘ [He]172-lancelot is there ! [I]172-lancelot know it is [he]172-lancelot ! [Lancelot]172-lancelot ! [[my]172-lancelot [Lancelot]172-lancelot]5335-my lancelot ! ’[172-lancelot] Silently still [he]172-lancelot drew aside the curtain ; the light fell full upon [her]158-mrs. lavington face . What a sight ! [Her]158-mrs. lavington beautiful hair cut close , a ghastly white handkerchief round [her]158-mrs. lavington head , those bright eyes sunk and lustreless , those ripe lips baked , and black and drawn ; [her]158-mrs. lavington thin hand fingering uneasily the coverlid.—It was too much for [him]172-lancelot . [He]172-lancelot shuddered and turned [his]172-lancelot face away . Quick - sighted that love is , even to the last ! slight as the gesture was , [she]158-mrs. lavington saw it in an instant . ‘ [You]172-lancelot are not afraid of infection ? ’[158-mrs. lavington] [she]158-mrs. lavington said , faintly . ‘ [I]158-mrs. lavington was not . ’[158-mrs. lavington] [Lancelot]172-lancelot laughed aloud , as [men]612-men will at strangest moments , sprung towards [her]158-mrs. lavington with open arms , and threw [himself]172-lancelot on [his]172-lancelot knees beside the bed . With sudden strength [she]158-mrs. lavington rose upright , and clasped [him]172-lancelot in [her]158-mrs. lavington arms . ‘ Once more ! ’[158-mrs. lavington] [she]158-mrs. lavington sighed , in a whisper to [herself]158-mrs. lavington , ‘ Once more on [earth]724-earth ! ’[158-mrs. lavington] And [the room]3190-the room , and [the spectators]2868-the spectators , and disease itself faded from around [them]2869-they like vain dreams , as [she]158-mrs. lavington nestled closer and closer to [him]172-lancelot , and gazed into [his]172-lancelot eyes , and passed [her]158-mrs. lavington shrunken hand over [his]172-lancelot cheeks , and toyed with [his]172-lancelot hair , and seemed to drink in magnetic life from [his]172-lancelot embrace . [No one]555-no one spoke or stirred . [They]2869-they felt that an awful and blessed spirit overshadowed [the lovers]2871-the lovers , and were hushed , as if in the sanctuary of [God]281-god . Suddenly again [she]158-mrs. lavington raised [her]158-mrs. lavington head from [his]172-lancelot bosom , and in a tone , in which [her]158-mrs. lavington old queenliness mingled strangely with the saddest tenderness , — ‘ All of [you]172-lancelot go away now ; [I]2869-they must talk to [[my]2869-they husband]5337-my husband alone . ’[2869-they] [They]2869-they went , leading out [the squire]3125-the squire , who cast puzzled glances toward [the pair]2873-the pair , and murmured to [himself]3125-the squire that ‘ [she]158-mrs. lavington was sure to get well now [Smith]137-mr. smith was come : everything went right when [he]137-mr. smith was in the way . ’[3125-the squire] So [they]2869-they were left alone . ‘ [I]2874-her do not look so very ugly , [[my]2874-her darling]5338-my darling , do [I]2874-her ? Not so very ugly ? though [they]2869-they have cut off all [my]2874-her poor hair , and [I]2874-her told [them]2869-they so often not ! But [I]2874-her kept a lock for [you]3125-the squire ; ’[2874-her] and feebly [she]2874-her drew from under the pillow a long auburn tress , and tried to wreathe it round [his]3125-the squire neck , but could not , and sunk back . [Poor fellow]3540-poor fellow ! [he]3125-the squire could bear no more . [He]3125-the squire hid [his]3125-the squire face in [his]3125-the squire hands , and burst into a long low weeping . ‘ [I]3125-the squire am very thirsty , [darling]5017-darling ; reach [me]3125-the squire — No , [I]3125-the squire will drink no more , except from [your]2874-her dear lips . ’[3125-the squire] [He]3125-the squire lifted up [his]3125-the squire head , and breathed [his]3125-the squire whole soul upon [her]2874-her lips ; [his]3125-the squire tears fell on [her]2874-her closed eyelids . ‘ Weeping ? No.—You must not cry . See how comfortable [I]3125-the squire am . [They]5340-they are all so kind — soft bed , cool room , fresh air , sweet drinks , sweet scents . Oh , so different from [that room]5086-that room ! ’[3125-the squire] ‘ What room?—my own ! ’[2874-her] ‘ Listen , and [I]2874-her will tell [you]2874-her . Sit down — put [your]2874-her arm under [my]2874-her head — so . When [I]2874-her am on [your]2874-her bosom [I]2874-her feel so strong . [God]281-god ! let [me]2874-her last to tell [him]3125-the squire all . It was for that [I]2874-her sent for [him]3125-the squire . ’[2874-her] And then , in broken words , [she]2874-her told [him]3125-the squire how [she]2874-her had gone up to [the fever patient at [Ashy]85-ashy]2876-the fever patient at ashy , on the fatal night on which [Lancelot]172-lancelot had last seen [her]2874-her . Shuddering , [she]2874-her hinted at the horrible filth and misery [she]2874-her had seen , at the foul scents which had sickened [her]2874-her . A madness of remorse , [she]2874-her said , had seized [her]2874-her . [She]2874-her had gone , in spite of [her]2874-her disgust , to [several houses which [she]2874-her found open]2877-several houses which she found open . There were [worse [cottages]928-cottages [there]992-there than even [[her]2874-her father]3219-her father ’s]2878-worse cottages there than even her father ’s ; [some tradesmen in [a neighbouring town]2883-a neighbouring town]2882-some tradesmen in a neighbouring town had been allowed to run up a set of rack rent hovels.—Another shudder seized [her]2874-her when [she]2874-her spoke of [them]2884-them ; and from that point in [her]2874-her story all was fitful , broken , like the images of a hideous dream . ‘ Every instant those foul memories were defiling [her]2874-her nostrils . A horrible loathing had taken possession of [her]2874-her , recurring from time to time , till it ended in delirium and fever . [A scent - fiend]5342-a scent - fiend was haunting [her]2874-her night and day , ’[2874-her] [she]2874-her said . ‘ And now the curse of [the Lavingtons]248-the lavingtons had truly come upon [her]2874-her . To perish by [the people whom [they]5343-the people whom they made made]5343-the people whom they made . [Their]5343-the people whom they made neglect , cupidity , oppression , are avenged on [me]2874-her ! Why not ? Have [I]2874-her not wantoned in down and perfumes , while [they]5343-the people whom they made , by whose labour [my]2874-her luxuries were bought , were pining among scents and sounds,—one day of which would have driven [me]2874-her mad ! And then [they]5343-the people whom they made wonder why [men]612-men turn [Chartists]5345-chartists ! There are those horrible scents again ! Save [me]2874-her from [them]5343-the people whom they made ! [Lancelot]172-lancelot — darling ! Take [me]2874-her to the fresh air ! [I]2874-her choke ! [I]2874-her am festering away ! [The Nun - pool]4918-the nun - pool ! Take all the water , every drop , and wash Ashy clean again ! Make a great fountain in it — beautiful marble — to bubble and gurgle , and trickle and foam , for ever and ever , and wash away the sins of [the Lavingtons]248-the lavingtons , that [the little rosy children]5347-the little rosy children may play round it , and [the poor toil - bent woman]5348-the poor toil - bent woman may wash — and wash — and drink — Water ! water ! [I]2874-her am dying of thirst ! ’[2874-her] [He]2885-he gave [her]2886-her water , and then [she]2886-her lay back and babbled about [the Nun - pool]4918-the nun - pool sweeping ‘ [all the houses of [Ashy]85-ashy]5349-all the houses of ashy into [one beautiful palace]5350-one beautiful palace , among [great flower - gardens]5351-great flower - gardens , where [the school children]5352-the school children will sit and sing such merry hymns , and never struggle with great pails of water up [the hill of [Ashy]85-ashy]5353-the hill of ashy any more . ’[2886-her] ‘ [You]172-lancelot will do it ! [darling]5017-darling ! Strong , wise , noble - hearted that [you]172-lancelot are ! Why do [you]172-lancelot look at [me]2888-i ? [You]172-lancelot will be rich some day . [You]172-lancelot will own land , for [you]172-lancelot are worthy to own it . Oh that [I]2888-i could give [you]172-lancelot [Whitford]144-whitford priors ! No ! It was [mine]2888-i too long — therefore [I]2888-i die ! because [I]2888-i — [Lord Jesus]335-the lord jesus ! have [I]2888-i not repented of [my]2888-i sin ? ’[2888-i] Then [she]2888-i grew calm once more . A soft smile crept over [her]2888-i face , as it grew sharper and paler every moment . Faintly [she]2888-i sank back on the pillows , and faintly whispered to [him]2889-he to kneel and pray . [He]2889-he obeyed [her]2888-i mechanically .... ‘ No — not for [me]2889-he , for [them]5355-them — for [them]5355-them , and for [yourself]2888-i — that [you]2889-he may save [them]5355-them whom [I]2889-he never dreamt that [I]2889-he was bound to save ! ’[2889-he] And [he]2889-he knelt and prayed ... what , [he]2889-he alone and [those who heard [his]2889-he prayer]2890-those who heard his prayer , can tell ... * * * * * When [he]2889-he lifted up [his]2889-he head at last , [he]2889-he saw that [Argemone]150-argemone lay motionless . For a moment [he]2889-he thought [she]150-argemone was dead , and frantically sprang to the bell . [The family]2891-the family rushed in with [the physician]2892-the physician . [She]150-argemone gave some faint token of life , but none of consciousness . [The doctor]4115-the doctor sighed , and said that [her]150-argemone end was near . [Lancelot]172-lancelot had known that all along . ‘ [I]158-mrs. lavington think , [sir]753-sir , [you]753-sir had better leave [the room]3190-the room , ’[158-mrs. lavington] said [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington ; and followed [him]2889-he into [the passage]2894-the passage . What [she]158-mrs. lavington was about to say remained unspoken ; for [Lancelot]172-lancelot seized [her]158-mrs. lavington hand in spite of [her]158-mrs. lavington , with frantic thanks for having allowed [him]172-lancelot this one interview , and entreaties that [he]172-lancelot might see [her]158-mrs. lavington again , if but for one moment . [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington , somewhat more softly than usual , said,—‘That the result of this visit had not been such as to make a second desirable — that [she]158-mrs. lavington had no wish to disturb [[her]158-mrs. lavington daughter]1686-her daughter ’s mind at such a moment with earthly regrets . ’ ‘[158-mrs. lavington] Earthly regrets ! ’ How little [she]158-mrs. lavington knew what had passed there ! But if [she]158-mrs. lavington had known , would [she]158-mrs. lavington have been [one whit softened]5358-one whit softened ? For , indeed , [Argemone]150-argemone ’s spirituality was not in [[her]150-argemone mother]1404-her mother ’s language . And yet [the good woman]5360-the good woman had prayed , and prayed , and wept bitter tears , by [[her]5360-the good woman daughter]1686-her daughter ’s bedside , day after day ; but [she]5360-the good woman had never heard [her]5360-the good woman pronounce the talismanic formula of words , necessary in [her]5360-the good woman eyes to ensure salvation ; and so [she]5360-the good woman was almost without hope for [her]5360-the good woman . Oh , [Bigotry]392-bigotry ! [Devil]237-devil , who turnest [God]281-god ’s love into [man]564-man ’s curse ! are not human hearts hard and blind enough of [themselves]5363-themselves , without [thy]281-god cursed help ? For one moment a storm of unutterable pride and rage convulsed [Lancelot]172-lancelot — the next instant love conquered ; and [the strong proud man]5364-the strong proud man threw [himself]5364-the strong proud man on [his]5364-the strong proud man knees at the feet of [the woman [he]5364-the strong proud man despised]5365-the woman he despised , and with wild sobs entreated for one moment more — one only ! At that instant a shriek from [Honoria]162-honoria resounded from [the sick chamber]5366-the sick chamber . [Lancelot]172-lancelot knew what it meant , and sprang up , as [men]612-men do when shot through the heart.—In a moment [he]5364-the strong proud man was [himself]5364-the strong proud man again . A new life had begun for [him]172-lancelot — alone . ‘[158-mrs. lavington] [You]2896-you will not need to grant [my]0-i prayer , [madam]2897-madam , ’ [he]0-i said , calmly : ‘[2896-you] [Argemone]150-argemone is dead . ’ Let [us]5368-us pass over the period of dull , stupefied misery that followed , when [Lancelot]172-lancelot had returned to [[his]172-lancelot lonely lodging]5369-his lonely lodging , and the excitement of [his]172-lancelot feelings had died away . It is impossible to describe that which could not be separated into parts , in which there was no foreground , no distance , but only one dead , black , colourless present . After a time , however , [he]172-lancelot began to find that fancies , almost ridiculously trivial , arrested and absorbed [his]172-lancelot attention ; even as when [our]5368-us eyes have become accustomed to darkness , every light - coloured mote shows luminous against the void blackness of night . So [we]5368-us are tempted to unseemly frivolity in [churches]5370-churches , and at funerals , and all most solemn moments ; and so [Lancelot]172-lancelot found [his]172-lancelot imagination fluttering back , half amused , to every smallest circumstance of the last few weeks , as objects of mere curiosity , and found with astonishment that [they]5371-they had lost [their]5371-they power of paining [him]172-lancelot . Just as [victims on the rack]5372-victims on the rack have fallen , it is said , by length of torture , into insensibility , and even calm repose , [his]172-lancelot brain had been wrought until all feeling was benumbed . [He]172-lancelot began to think what an interesting autobiography [his]172-lancelot life might make ; and the events of the last few years began to arrange themselves in a most attractive dramatic form . [He]172-lancelot began even to work out a scene or two , and where ‘[150-argemone] motives ’ seemed wanting , to invent them here and there . [He]172-lancelot sat thus for hours silent over [his]172-lancelot fire , playing with [his]172-lancelot old self , as though it were a thing which did not belong to [him]172-lancelot — a suit of clothes which [he]172-lancelot had put off , and which , ‘[150-argemone] For that it was too rich to hang by the wall , It must be ripped , ’ and then pieced and dizened out afresh as a toy . And then again [he]172-lancelot started away from [his]172-lancelot own thoughts , at finding [himself]172-lancelot on the edge of that very gulf , which , as [Mellot]182-claude had lately told [him]172-lancelot , [Barnakill]377-barnakill denounced as the true hell of genius , where Art is regarded as an end and not a means , and objects are interesting , not in as far as they form [our]5373-our spirits , but in proportion as they can be shaped into effective parts of some beautiful whole . But whether it was a temptation or none , the desire recurred to [him]172-lancelot again and again . [He]172-lancelot even attempted to write , but sickened at the sight of the first words . [He]172-lancelot turned to [his]172-lancelot pencil , and tried to represent with it one scene at least ; and with the horrible calmness of [some self - torturing ascetic]5374-some self - torturing ascetic , [he]172-lancelot sat down to sketch a drawing of [himself]172-lancelot and [Argemone]150-argemone on [her]150-argemone dying day , with [her]150-argemone head upon [his]172-lancelot bosom for the last time — and then tossed it angrily into the fire , partly because [he]172-lancelot felt just as [he]172-lancelot had in [his]172-lancelot attempts to write , that there was something more in all these events than [he]172-lancelot could utter by pen or pencil , than [he]172-lancelot could even understand ; principally because [he]172-lancelot could not arrange the attitudes gracefully enough . And now , in front of the stern realities of sorrow and death , [he]172-lancelot began to see a meaning in another mysterious saying of [Barnakill]377-barnakill ’s , which [Mellot]182-claude was continually quoting , that ‘[150-argemone] Art was never Art till it was more than Art ; that the Finite only existed as a body of the Infinite ; and that [the man of genius]2898-the man of genius must first know the Infinite , unless [he]2898-the man of genius wished to become not [a poet]2899-a poet , but [a maker of idols]2900-a maker of idols . ’ Still [he]172-lancelot felt in [himself]172-lancelot a capability , nay , an infinite longing to speak ; though what [he]172-lancelot should utter , or how — whether as [poet]5375-poet , [social theorist]5376-social theorist , [preacher]5377-preacher , [he]172-lancelot could not yet decide . [Barnakill]377-barnakill had forbidden [him]172-lancelot painting , and though [he]172-lancelot hardly knew why , [he]172-lancelot dared not disobey [him]377-barnakill . But [Argemone]150-argemone ’s dying words lay on [him]172-lancelot as a divine command to labour . All [his]172-lancelot doubts , [his]172-lancelot social observations , [his]172-lancelot dreams of the beautiful and the blissful , [his]172-lancelot intense perception of social evils , [his]172-lancelot new - born hope — faith it could not yet be called — in [a ruler and deliverer of [the world]475-the world]5378-a ruler and deliverer of the world , all urged [him]172-lancelot on to labour : but at what ? [He]172-lancelot felt as if [he]172-lancelot were [the demon in the legend , condemned to twine endless ropes of sand]5380-the demon in the legend , condemned to twine endless ropes of sand . [The world]475-the world , outside which [he]172-lancelot now stood for good and evil , seemed to [him]172-lancelot like [some frantic whirling waltz]5382-some frantic whirling waltz ; [some serried struggling crowd]5383-some serried struggling crowd , which rushed past [him]172-lancelot in aimless confusion , without allowing [him]172-lancelot time or opening to take [his]172-lancelot place among [their]5383-some serried struggling crowd ranks : and as for wings to rise above , and to look down upon the uproar , where were [they]5383-some serried struggling crowd ? [His]172-lancelot melancholy paralysed [him]172-lancelot more and more . [He]172-lancelot was too listless even to cater for [his]172-lancelot daily bread by writing [his]172-lancelot articles for the magazines . Why should [he]172-lancelot ? [He]172-lancelot had nothing to say . Why should [he]172-lancelot pour out words and empty sound , and add one more futility to the herd of ‘[2901-prophets that had become wind] [prophets that had become wind]2901-prophets that had become wind , and had no truth in [them]2901-prophets that had become wind ’ ? [Those who could write without a conscience , without an object except that of seeing [their]5384-those who could write without a conscience , without an object except that of seeing their own fine words , and filling their own pockets own fine words , and filling [their]5384-those who could write without a conscience , without an object except that of seeing their own fine words , and filling their own pockets own pockets]5384-those who could write without a conscience , without an object except that of seeing their own fine words , and filling their own pockets — let [them]5384-those who could write without a conscience , without an object except that of seeing their own fine words , and filling their own pockets do it : for [his]172-lancelot part [he]172-lancelot would have none of it . But [his]172-lancelot purse was empty , and so was [his]172-lancelot stomach ; and as for asking assistance of [[his]172-lancelot uncle]2357-his uncle , it was returning like the dog to [his]172-lancelot vomit . So one day [he]172-lancelot settled all bills with [his]172-lancelot last shilling , tied up [his]172-lancelot remaining clothes in a bundle , and stoutly stepped forth into [the street]4602-the street to find a job — to hold a horse , if nothing better offered ; when , behold ! on the threshold [he]172-lancelot met [Barnakill]377-barnakill [himself]172-lancelot . ‘[2901-prophets that had become wind] Whither away ? ’ said [that strange personage]5387-that strange personage . ‘[2901-prophets that had become wind] [I]0-i was just going to call on [you]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] To earn [my]0-i bread by the labour of [my]0-i hands . So [[our]2902-our fathers]2903-our fathers all began . ’ ‘[2903-our fathers] And so [[their]2903-our fathers sons]2904-their sons must all end . Do [you]0-i want work ? ’ ‘[0-i] Yes , if [you]0-i have any . ’ ‘[0-i] Follow [me]0-i , and carry a trunk [home]452-home from [a shop]2906-a shop to [[my]0-i lodgings]2737-my lodgings . ’ [He]172-lancelot strode off , with [Lancelot]172-lancelot after [him]172-lancelot ; entered [[a mathematical instrument maker]5388-a mathematical instrument maker ’s shop]5389-a mathematical instrument maker ’s shop in [the neighbouring street]5390-the neighbouring street , and pointed out a heavy corded case to [Lancelot]172-lancelot , who , with the assistance of [the shopman]5391-the shopman , got it on [his]172-lancelot shoulders ; and trudging forth through [the streets]5392-the streets after [[his]172-lancelot employer]5393-his employer , who walked before [him]172-lancelot silent and unregarding , felt [himself]172-lancelot for the first time in [his]172-lancelot life in the same situation as nine hundred and ninety - nine out of [every thousand of [Adam]179-adam ’s descendants]5394-every thousand of adam ’s descendants , and discovered somewhat to [his]172-lancelot satisfaction that when [he]172-lancelot could once rid [his]172-lancelot mind of [its]5395-its old superstition that [every one]807-every one was looking at [him]172-lancelot , it mattered very little whether the burden carried were a deal trunk or a Downing Street despatch - box . [[[His]172-lancelot employer]5393-his employer ’s lodgings]5398-his employer ’s lodgings were in [St. Paul ’s Churchyard]99-st. paul ’s churchyard . [Lancelot]172-lancelot set the trunk down inside the door . ‘[0-i] What do [you]2908-you charge ? ’ ‘[2908-you] Sixpence . ’ [Barnakill]377-barnakill looked [him]172-lancelot steadily in the face , gave [him]172-lancelot the sixpence , went in , and shut the door . [Lancelot]172-lancelot wandered down [the street]4602-the street , half amused at the simple test which had just been applied to [him]172-lancelot , and yet sickened with disappointment ; for [he]172-lancelot had cherished a mysterious fancy that with this strange being all [his]172-lancelot hopes of future activity were bound up . [Tregarva]173-tregarva ’s month was nearly over , and yet no tidings of [him]172-lancelot had come . [Mellot]182-claude had left [London]46-london on some mysterious errand of [the prophet]2753-the prophet ’s , and for the first time in [his]182-claude life [he]182-claude seemed to stand utterly alone . [He]182-claude was at one pole , and [the whole universe]5401-the whole universe at the other . It was in vain to tell [himself]182-claude that [his]182-claude own act had placed [him]182-claude there ; that [he]182-claude had friends to whom [he]182-claude might appeal . [He]182-claude would not , [he]182-claude dare not , accept outward help , even outward friendship , however hearty and sincere , at that crisis of [his]182-claude existence . It seemed a desecration of its awfulness to find comfort in anything but the highest and the deepest . And the glimpse of that which [he]182-claude had attained seemed to have passed away from [him]182-claude again,—seemed to be something which , as it had arisen with [Argemone]150-argemone , was lost with [her]150-argemone also,—one speck of the far blue sky which the rolling clouds had covered in again . As [he]182-claude passed under the shadow of [the huge soot - blackened cathedral]5402-the huge soot - blackened cathedral , and looked at [its]5402-the huge soot - blackened cathedral grim spiked railings and closed doors , it seemed to [him]182-claude a symbol of the spiritual world , clouded and barred from [him]182-claude . [He]182-claude stopped and looked up , and tried to think . The rays of the setting sun lighted up in clear radiance the huge cross on the summit . Was it an omen ? [Lancelot]172-lancelot thought so ; but at that instant [he]182-claude felt a hand on [his]182-claude shoulder , and looked round . It was [that strange man]5403-that strange man again . ‘[2908-you] So far well , ’ said [he]182-claude . ‘[2908-you] [You]2909-you are making a better day ’s work than [you]2909-you fancy , and earning more wages . For instance , here is a packet for [you]2909-you . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot seized it , trembling , and tore it open . It was directed in [Honoria]162-honoria ’s handwriting . ‘[182-claude] Whence had [you]2909-you this ? ’ said [he]182-claude . ‘[182-claude] Through [Mellot]182-claude , through whom [I]0-i can return [your]2909-you answer , if one be needed . ’ The letter was significant of [Honoria]162-honoria ’s character . It busied itself entirely about facts , and showed the depth of [her]162-honoria sorrow by making no allusion to it . ‘[150-argemone] [Argemone]150-argemone , as [Lancelot]172-lancelot was probably aware , had bequeathed to [him]172-lancelot the whole of [her]150-argemone own fortune at [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington ’s death , and had directed that various precious things of [hers]150-argemone should be delivered over to [him]172-lancelot immediately . [[Her]150-argemone mother]1404-her mother , however , kept [[her]1404-her mother chamber]2911-her chamber under lock and key , and refused to allow an article to be removed from its accustomed place . It was natural in the first burst of [her]150-argemone sorrow , and [Lancelot]172-lancelot would pardon . ’ All [his]172-lancelot drawings and letters had been , by [Argemone]150-argemone ’s desire , placed with [her]150-argemone in [her]150-argemone coffin . [Honoria]162-honoria had been only able to obey [her]150-argemone in sending a favourite ring of [hers]162-honoria , and with it the last stanzas which [she]162-honoria had composed before [her]162-honoria death : — ‘[172-lancelot] Twin stars , aloft in ether clear , Around each other roll away , Within one common atmosphere Of [their]2912-their own mutual light and day . ‘ And [myriad happy eyes]5404-myriad happy eyes are bent Upon [their]2912-their changeless love alway ; As , strengthened by [their]2912-their one intent , [They]2912-their pour the flood of life and day , ‘[172-lancelot] So [we]2913-we , through [this world]1108-this world ’s waning night , Shall , hand in hand , pursue [our]2913-we way ; Shed round [us]2913-we order , love , and light , And shine unto the perfect day . ’ The precious relic , with all its shattered hopes , came at the right moment to soften [his]172-lancelot hard - worn heart . The sight , the touch of it , shot like an electric spark through the black stifling thunder - cloud of [his]172-lancelot soul , and dissolved it in refreshing showers of tears . [Barnakill]377-barnakill led [him]172-lancelot gently within the area of the railings , where [he]172-lancelot might conceal [his]172-lancelot emotion , and it was but a few seconds before [Lancelot]172-lancelot had recovered [his]172-lancelot self - possession and followed [him]377-barnakill up the steps through the wicket door . [They]2913-we entered . The afternoon service was proceeding . The organ droned sadly in its iron cage to [a few musical amateurs]5405-a few musical amateurs . [Some nursery maids]5406-some nursery maids and [foreign sailors]5407-foreign sailors stared about within [the spiked felon ’s dock which shut off the body of [the cathedral]5409-the cathedral]5408-the spiked felon ’s dock which shut off the body of the cathedral , and tried in vain to hear what was going on inside [the choir]5410-the choir . As [a wise author]5411-a wise author — [a Protestant]4266-a protestant , too — has lately said , ‘[396-coleridge] the scanty service rattled in [the vast building]2915-the vast building , like a dried kernel too small for its shell . ’ [The place]3814-the place breathed imbecility , and unreality , and sleepy life - in - death , while the whole nineteenth century went roaring on its way outside . And as [Lancelot]172-lancelot thought , though only as a dilettante , of [old St. Paul ’s]5414-old st. paul ’s , the morning star and focal beacon of [England]3-england through centuries and dynasties , from old [Augustine]393-augustine and [Mellitus]394-mellitus , up to those [Paul]173-tregarva ’s Cross sermons whose thunders shook thrones , and to [noble Wren]395-noble wren ’s masterpiece of art , [he]172-lancelot asked , ‘[396-coleridge] Whither all this ? [Coleridge]396-coleridge ’s dictum , that [a cathedral]2916-a cathedral is a petrified religion , may be taken to bear more meanings than one . When will life return to this cathedral system ? ’ ‘[396-coleridge] When was it ever a living system ? ’ answered [the other]5415-the other . ‘[396-coleridge] When was it ever anything but a transitionary makeshift since the dissolution of the monasteries ? ’ ‘[396-coleridge] Why , then , not away with it at once ? ’ ‘[2917-you] [You]2917-you English have not done with it yet . At all events , it is keeping [[your]2917-you cathedrals]2918-your cathedrals rain - proof for [you]2917-you , till [you]2917-you can put them to some better use than now . ’ ‘[2917-you] And in the meantime ? ’ ‘[2917-you] In the meantime there is life enough in [them]2918-your cathedrals ; life that will wake [the dead]1254-the dead some day . Do [you]2917-you hear what [those choristers]2920-those choristers are chanting now ? ’ ‘[2920-those choristers] Not [I]0-i , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot ; ‘[0-i] nor any one round [us]2921-us , [I]0-i should think . ’ ‘[0-i] That is [our]2921-us own fault , after all ; for [we]2921-us were [not good churchmen]2922-not good churchmen enough to come in time for vespers . ’ ‘[2923-a churchman] Are [you]2917-you [a churchman]2923-a churchman then ? ’ ‘[2923-a churchman] Yes , thank [God]281-god . There may be [other churches than those of [Europe]100-europe or [Syria]33-syria]2924-other churches than those of europe or syria , and [right Catholic ones]2925-right catholic ones , too . But , shall [I]0-i tell [you]2917-you what [they]2920-those choristers are singing ? “ [He]281-god hath put down [the mighty]2926-the mighty from [their]2920-those choristers seat , and [hath]2927-hath exalted [the humble and meek]2928-the humble and meek . [He]281-god hath filled the hungry with good things , and the rich [He]281-god hath sent empty away . ” Is there no life , think [you]2917-you , in those words , spoken here every afternoon in the name of [God]281-god ? ’ ‘[2917-you] By [hirelings]2929-hirelings , who neither care nor understand — ’ ‘[2929-hirelings] Hush . Be not hasty with imputations of evil , within walls dedicated to and preserved by [the All - good]2930-the all - good . Even should [the speakers]2931-the speakers forget the meaning of [their]2931-the speakers own words , to [my]0-i sense , perhaps , that may just now leave the words more entirely [God]281-god ’s . At all events , confess that whatever accidental husks may have clustered round it , here is a germ of Eternal Truth . No , [I]0-i dare not despair of [you]2917-you English , as long as [I]0-i hear [your]2917-you priesthood forced by [Providence]304-providence , even in spite of [themselves]2920-those choristers , thus to speak [God]281-god ’s words about an age in which the condition of [the poor]698-the poor , and the rights and duties of [man]564-man , are becoming the rallying - point for all thought and all organisation . ’ ‘[281-god] But does it not make the case more hopeless that such words have been spoken for centuries , and [no man]1477-no man regards them ? ’ ‘[2917-you] [You]2917-you have to blame for that [the people]1331-the people , rather than [the priest]1803-the priest . As [they]1331-the people are , so will [he]1803-the priest be , in every age and [country]3302-country . [He]1803-the priest is but the index which the changes of [their]1331-the people spiritual state move up and down the scale : and as they will become in [England]3-england in the next half century , so will [he]1803-the priest become also . ’ ‘[1803-the priest] And can these dry bones live ? ’ asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot , scornfully . ‘[1803-the priest] Who are [you]2917-you to ask ? What were [you]2917-you three months ago ? for [I]0-i know well [your]2917-you story . But do [you]2917-you remember what [the prophet]2753-the prophet saw in [the Valley of Vision]101-the valley of vision ? How first that those same dry bones shook and clashed together , as if uneasy because they were disorganised ; and how [they]2939-they then found flesh and stood upright : and yet there was no life in them , till at last the Spirit came down and entered into [them]2939-they ? Surely there is shaking enough among the bones now ! It is happening to the body of [[your]2917-you England]2940-your england as it did to [Adam]179-adam ’s after [he]179-adam was made . It lay on [earth]724-earth , [the rabbis]2942-the rabbis say , forty days before the breath of life was put into it , and [the devil]600-the devil came and kicked it ; and it sounded hollow , as [England]3-england is doing now ; but that did not prevent the breath of life coming in good time , nor will it in [England]3-england ’s case . ’ [Lancelot]172-lancelot looked at [him]172-lancelot with a puzzled face . ‘[2917-you] [You]2917-you must not speak in such deep parables to [so young a learner]2944-so young a learner . ’ ‘[0-i] Is [my]0-i parable so hard , then ? Look around [you]2917-you and see what is the characteristic of [[your]2917-you country]2945-your country and of [[your]2917-you generation]2946-your generation at this moment . What a yearning , what an expectation , amid infinite falsehoods and confusions , of some nobler , more chivalrous , more godlike state ! [[Your]2917-you very costermonger]2947-your very costermonger trolls out [his]2947-your very costermonger belief that “ there ’s a good time coming , ” and the hearts of [gamins]2948-gamins , as well as [millenarians]2949-millenarians , answer , “ True ! ” Is not that a clashing among the dry bones ? And as for flesh , what new materials are springing up among [you]2917-you every month , spiritual and physical , for a state such as “ eye hath not seen nor ear heard?”—railroads , electric telegraphs , [associate - lodging - houses]2950-associate - lodging - houses , [club - houses]495-club - houses , sanitary reforms , [experimental schools]2952-experimental schools , chemical agriculture , a matchless school of inductive science , an equally matchless school of [naturalist painters,—and all this]2953-naturalist painters,—and all this in [the very workshop of [the world]475-the world]2954-the very workshop of the world ! Look , again , at the healthy craving after religious art and ceremonial,—the strong desire to preserve that which has stood the test of time ; and on the other hand , at the manful resolution of [[your]2917-you middle classes]2956-your middle classes to stand or fall by the Bible alone,—to admit no innovations in worship which are empty of instinctive meaning . Look at the enormous amount of practical benevolence which now struggles in vain against evil , only because it is as yet private , desultory , divided . How dare [you]2917-you , [young man]2236-young man , despair of [[your]2917-you own nation]2958-your own nation , while [[its]2958-your own nation nobles]2959-its nobles can produce [a Carlisle]2960-a carlisle , [an Ellesmere]2961-an ellesmere , [an Ashley]2962-an ashley , [a [Robert Grosvenor,—while]397-robert grosvenor,—while [its]2958-your own nation middle classes]2963-a robert grosvenor,—while its middle classes can beget [a Faraday]2964-a faraday , [a Stephenson]2965-a stephenson , [a Brooke]2966-a brooke , [an Elizabeth Fry]2967-an elizabeth fry ? See , [I]0-i say , what a chaos of noble materials is here,—all confused , it is true,—polarised , jarring , and chaotic,—here bigotry , there self - will , superstition , sheer Atheism often , but only waiting for [the one inspiring Spirit]2968-the one inspiring spirit to organise , and unite , and consecrate this chaos into the noblest polity [the world]475-the world ever saw realised ! What a destiny may be that of [[your]2917-you land]2970-your land , if [you]2917-you have but the faith to see [your]2917-you own honour ! Were [I]0-i not of [[my]0-i own country]2971-my own country , [I]0-i would be [an Englishman]1153-an englishman this day . ’ ‘[1153-an englishman] And what is [[your]0-i country]2945-your country ? ’ asked [Lancelot]172-lancelot . ‘[1153-an englishman] It should be [a noble one which breeds [such men as [you]0-i]2975-such men as you]2974-a noble one which breeds such men as you . ’ [The stranger]2568-the stranger smiled . ‘[1153-an englishman] Will [you]0-i go thither with [me]0-i ? ’ ‘[0-i] Why not ? [I]0-i long for travel , and truly [I]0-i am sick of [[my]0-i own country]2971-my own country . When the Spirit of which [you]0-i speak , ’ [he]0-i went on , bitterly , ‘[0-i] shall descend , [I]0-i may return ; till then [England]3-england is no place for the penniless . ’ ‘[0-i] How know [you]0-i that the Spirit is not even now poured out ? Must [your]0-i English Pharisees and [Sadducees]2977-sadducees , too , have signs and wonders ere [they]2978-they believe ? Will [man]564-man never know that “ [the kingdom of [God]281-god]5148-the kingdom of god comes not by observation ” ? that now , as ever , [His]564-man promise stands true,—“Lo ! [I]0-i am with [you]0-i alway , even unto the end of [the world]475-the world ” ? How many inspired hearts even now may be cherishing in secret the idea which shall reform the age , and fulfil at once the longings of every sect and rank ? ’ ‘[2983-those who are like him from whom it comes] Name it to [me]0-i , then ! ’ ‘[2983-those who are like him from whom it comes] Who can name it ? [Who can even see it]2982-who can even see it , but [those who are like [Him]564-man from whom it comes]2983-those who are like him from whom it comes ? [Them]2983-those who are like him from whom it comes a long and stern discipline awaits . Would [you]0-i be of [them]2983-those who are like him from whom it comes , [you]0-i must , like [the Highest who ever trod [this earth]2985-this earth]2984-the highest who ever trod this earth , go fasting into [the wilderness]1011-the wilderness , and , among the wild beasts , stand alone face to face with the powers of Nature . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i will go where [you]0-i shall bid [me]0-i . [I]0-i will turn shepherd among [the Scottish mountains]2987-the scottish mountains — live as an anchorite in [the solitudes of [Dartmoor]102-dartmoor]2988-the solitudes of dartmoor . But to what purpose ? [I]0-i have listened long to [Nature]132-nature ’s voice , but even the whispers of a spiritual presence which haunted [my]0-i childhood have died away , and [I]0-i hear nothing in [her]132-nature but the grinding of the iron wheels of mechanical necessity . ’ ‘[132-nature] Which is the will of [God]281-god . Henceforth [you]0-i shall study , not Nature , but [Him]281-god . Yet as for place — [I]0-i do not like [[your]0-i English primitive formations]2989-your english primitive formations , where [earth , worn out with struggling]2990-earth , worn out with struggling , has fallen wearily asleep . No , [you]0-i shall rather come to [Asia]103-asia , the oldest and yet the youngest continent,—to [[our]2991-our volcanic mountain ranges]2992-our volcanic mountain ranges , where [her]132-nature bosom still heaves with the creative energy of youth , around the primeval cradle of [the most ancient race of [men]612-men]2993-the most ancient race of men . Then , when [you]0-i have learnt the wondrous harmony between [man]564-man and [his]564-man dwelling - place , [I]0-i will lead [you]0-i to [a land where [you]0-i shall see the highest spiritual cultivation in triumphant contact with the fiercest energies of matter]2996-a land where you shall see the highest spiritual cultivation in triumphant contact with the fiercest energies of matter ; where [men have learnt to tame and use alike the volcano and the human heart]2997-men have learnt to tame and use alike the volcano and the human heart , where the body and the spirit , the beautiful and the useful , [the human and the divine]2998-the human and the divine , are no longer separate , and [men]612-men have embodied to [themselves]612-men on [earth]724-earth an image of the “ city not made with hands , eternal in the heavens . ” ’ ‘[3006-an asiatic one] Where is [this land]3001-this land ? ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot eagerly . ‘[3006-an asiatic one] [Poor human nature]3002-poor human nature must have its name for everything . [You]0-i have heard of [the country of Prester John]3003-the country of prester john , [that mysterious Christian empire , rarely visited by European eye]3004-that mysterious christian empire , rarely visited by european eye ? ’ ‘[0-i] There are legends of two such , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[3005-an ethiopian] [an Ethiopian]3005-an ethiopian and [an Asiatic one]3006-an asiatic one ; and [the Ethiopian]3007-the ethiopian , if [we]3008-we are to believe [Colonel Harris]398-colonel harris ’s Journey to [Shoa]104-shoa , is a sufficiently miserable failure . ’ ‘[3007-the ethiopian] True ; the day of [the Chamitic race]3009-the chamitic race is past ; [you]0-i will not say the same of [[our]3008-we Caucasian empire]3010-our caucasian empire . To [our]3008-we race the present belongs,—to [England]3-england , [France]105-france , [Germany]1-germany , America,—to [us]3008-we . Will [you]0-i see what [we]3008-we have done , and , perhaps , bring home , after long wanderings , a message for [[your]0-i country]2945-your country which may help to unravel the tangled web of this strange time ? ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i will , ’ said [Lancelot]172-lancelot , ‘[0-i] now , this moment . And yet , no . There is one with whom [I]0-i have promised to share all future weal and woe . Without [him]3012-him [I]0-i can take no step . ’ ‘[3012-him] [Tregarva]173-tregarva ? ’ ‘[173-tregarva] Yes — [he]173-tregarva . What made [you]0-i guess that [I]0-i spoke of [him]173-tregarva ? ’ ‘[0-i] [Mellot]182-claude told [me]0-i of [him]173-tregarva , and of [you]0-i , too , six weeks ago . [He]173-tregarva is now gone to fetch [him]173-tregarva from [Manchester]91-manchester . [I]0-i can not trust [him]173-tregarva here in [England]3-england yet . [The country]976-the country made [him]173-tregarva sad ; [London]46-london has made [him]173-tregarva mad ; [Manchester]91-manchester may make [him]173-tregarva bad . It is too fearful a trial even for [his]173-tregarva faith . [I]0-i must take [him]173-tregarva with [us]3014-us . ’ ‘[0-i] What interest in [him]173-tregarva — not to say what authority over [him]173-tregarva — have [you]0-i ? ’ ‘[0-i] The same which [I]0-i have over [you]0-i . [You]0-i will come with [me]0-i ; so will [he]173-tregarva . It is [my]0-i business , as [my]0-i name signifies , to save [the children alive whom [European society leaves carelessly and ignorantly to die]3016-european society leaves carelessly and ignorantly to die]3015-the children alive whom european society leaves carelessly and ignorantly to die . And as for [my]0-i power , [I]0-i come , ’ said [he]0-i , with a smile , ‘[0-i] from [a country which sends [no one]555-no one on [its]3017-a country which sends no one on its errands without first thoroughly satisfying itself as to his power of fulfilling them errands without first thoroughly satisfying itself as to [his]173-tregarva power of fulfilling [them]3019-them]3017-a country which sends no one on its errands without first thoroughly satisfying itself as to his power of fulfilling them . ’ ‘[0-i] If [he]173-tregarva goes , [I]0-i go with [you]0-i . ’ ‘[0-i] And [he]173-tregarva will go . And yet , think what [you]0-i do . It is a fearful journey . [They who travel]3020-they [it]3021-it , even as [they]3020-they came naked out of [[their]3020-they mother]3022-their mother ’s womb — even as [they]3020-they return thither , and carry nothing with [them]3020-they of all which [they]3020-they have gotten in this life , so must [those who travel to [[my]0-i land]3024-my land]3023-those who travel to my land . ’ ‘[3023-those who travel to my land] What ? [Tregarva]173-tregarva ? Is [he]173-tregarva , too , to give up all ? [I]0-i had thought that [I]0-i saw in [him]173-tregarva a precious possession , one for which [I]0-i would barter all [my]0-i scholarship , [my]0-i talents,—ay — [my]0-i life itself . ’ ‘[3025-an unseen god] A possession worth [your]0-i life ? What then ? ’ ‘[3025-an unseen god] Faith in [an unseen God]3025-an unseen god . ’ ‘[3025-an unseen god] Ask [him]173-tregarva whether [he]173-tregarva would call that a possession — [his]173-tregarva own in any sense ? ’ ‘[173-tregarva] [He]173-tregarva would call it a revelation to [him]173-tregarva . ’ ‘[173-tregarva] That is , a taking of the veil from something which was behind the veil already . ’ ‘[173-tregarva] Yes . ’ ‘[173-tregarva] And which may therefore just as really be behind the veil in other cases without its presence being suspected . ’ ‘[173-tregarva] Certainly . ’ ‘[173-tregarva] In what sense , now , is that a possession ? Do [you]0-i possess the sun because [you]0-i see it ? Did [Herschel]399-herschel create Uranus by discovering it ; or even increase , by an atom , its attraction on one particle of [his]173-tregarva own body ? ” ‘ [Whither]350-whither is all this tending ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [Hither]400-hither . [Tregarva]173-tregarva does not possess [[his]173-tregarva Father]453-his father and [[his]173-tregarva Lord]5418-his lord ; [he]173-tregarva is possessed by [them]5419-them . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ But [he]173-tregarva would say — and [I]172-lancelot should believe [him]173-tregarva — that [he]173-tregarva has seen and known [them]5419-them , not with [his]173-tregarva bodily eyes , but with [his]173-tregarva soul , heart , imagination — call it what [you]0-i will . All [I]172-lancelot know is , that between [him]173-tregarva and [me]172-lancelot there is a great gulf fixed . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ What ! seen and known [them]5419-them utterly ? comprehended [them]5419-them ? Are [they]5419-them not infinite , incomprehensible ? Can the less comprehend the greater ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [He]173-tregarva knows , at least , enough of [them]5419-them to make [him]173-tregarva what [I]172-lancelot am not . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ That is , [he]173-tregarva knows something of [them]5419-them . And may not [you]0-i know something of [them]5419-them also?—enough to make [you]0-i what [he]173-tregarva is not ? ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot shook [his]172-lancelot head in silence . ‘ Suppose that [you]0-i had met and spoken with [[your]0-i father]3830-your father , and loved [him]3830-your father when [you]0-i saw [him]3830-your father , and yet were not aware of the relation in which [you]0-i stood to [him]3830-your father , still [you]0-i would know [him]3830-your father ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Not the most important thing of all — that [he]3830-your father was [[my]172-lancelot father]3846-my father . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Is that the most important thing ? Is it not more important that [he]3830-your father should know that [you]0-i were [[his]3830-your father son]1227-his son ? That [he]3830-your father should support , guide , educate [you]0-i , even though unseen ? Do [you]0-i not know that [some one]666-some one has been doing that ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ That [I]172-lancelot have been supported , guided , educated , [I]172-lancelot know full well ; but by whom [I]172-lancelot know not . And [I]172-lancelot know , too , that [I]172-lancelot have been punished . And therefore — therefore [I]172-lancelot can not free the thought of a [Him]3830-your father — of [a Person]844-a person — only of a Destiny , of Laws and Powers , which have no faces wherewith to frown awful wrath upon [me]172-lancelot ! If it be [a Person who has been leading [me]172-lancelot , [I]172-lancelot must go mad , or know that [He]3830-your father has forgiven]401-a person who has been leading me , i must go mad , or know that he has forgiven ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot conceive that it is [He]3830-your father , and not punishment which [you]172-lancelot fear ? ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot was silent a moment ... ‘ Yes . [He]3830-your father , and not hell at all , is what [I]172-lancelot fear . [He]3830-your father can inflict no punishment on [me]172-lancelot worse than the inner hell which [I]172-lancelot have felt already , many and many a time . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Bona verba ! That is an awful thing to say : but better this extreme than the other ... And [you]172-lancelot would — what ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Be pardoned . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ If [He]3830-your father loves [you]172-lancelot , [He]3830-your father has pardoned [you]172-lancelot already . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ How do [I]172-lancelot know that [He]3830-your father loves [me]172-lancelot ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ How does [Tregarva]173-tregarva ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [He]173-tregarva is [a righteous man]5425-a righteous man , and [I]172-lancelot — ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Am [a sinner]5426-a sinner . [He]173-tregarva would , and rightly , call [himself]173-tregarva the same . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ But [he]173-tregarva knows that [God]281-god loves [him]173-tregarva — that [he]173-tregarva is [[God]281-god ’s child]5427-god ’s child . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ So , then , [God]281-god did not love [him]173-tregarva till [he]173-tregarva caused [God]281-god to love [him]173-tregarva , by knowing that [He]173-tregarva loved [him]173-tregarva ? [He]173-tregarva was not [[God]281-god ’s child]5427-god ’s child till [he]173-tregarva made [himself]173-tregarva one , by believing that [he]173-tregarva was [one]3305-one when as yet [he]173-tregarva was not ? [I]172-lancelot appeal to common sense and logic ... It was revealed to [Tregarva]173-tregarva that [God]281-god had been loving [him]173-tregarva while [he]173-tregarva was yet [a bad man]5430-a bad man . If [He]281-god loved [him]173-tregarva , in spite of [his]173-tregarva sin , why should [He]281-god not have loved [you]172-lancelot ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ If [He]281-god had loved [me]172-lancelot , would [He]281-god have left [me]172-lancelot in ignorance of [Himself]281-god ? For if [He]281-god be , to know [Him]281-god is the highest good . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Had [he]281-god left [Tregarva]173-tregarva in ignorance of [Himself]173-tregarva ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ No ... Certainly , [Tregarva]173-tregarva spoke of [his]173-tregarva conversion as of a turning to one of whom [he]173-tregarva had known all along , and disregarded . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Then do [you]172-lancelot turn like [him]173-tregarva , to [Him]173-tregarva whom [you]172-lancelot have known all along , and disregarded . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Yes — [you]172-lancelot ! If half [I]172-lancelot have heard and seen of [you]172-lancelot be true , [He]173-tregarva has been telling [you]172-lancelot more , and not less , of [Himself]173-tregarva than [He]173-tregarva does to [most men]5431-most men . [You]172-lancelot , for aught [I]172-lancelot know , may know more of [Him]173-tregarva than [Tregarva]173-tregarva does . The gulf between [you]172-lancelot and [him]173-tregarva is this : [he]173-tregarva has obeyed what [he]173-tregarva knew — and [you]172-lancelot have not . ’[172-lancelot] [... Lancelot]172-lancelot paused a moment , then — ‘ No!—do not cheat [me]172-lancelot ! [You]172-lancelot said once that [you]172-lancelot were [a churchman]2923-a churchman . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ So [I]172-lancelot am . [A Catholic of the Catholics]5433-a catholic of the catholics . What then ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Who is [He]173-tregarva to whom [you]172-lancelot ask [me]172-lancelot to turn ? [You]172-lancelot talk to [me]172-lancelot of [Him]173-tregarva as [[my]172-lancelot Father]3846-my father ; but [you]172-lancelot talk of [Him]173-tregarva to [men of]5435-men of [your]172-lancelot own creed as [The Father]402-the father . [You]172-lancelot have mysterious dogmas of a Three in One . [I]172-lancelot know [them]5436-them ... [I]172-lancelot have admired them . In all [their]5436-them forms — in the Vedas , in [the Neo - Platonists]403-the neo - platonists , in [Jacob Boëhmen]153-jacob boëhmen , in [your]172-lancelot Catholic creeds , in [Coleridge]396-coleridge , and the Germans from whom [he]173-tregarva borrowed , [I]172-lancelot have looked at them , and found in [them]5436-them beautiful phantasms of philosophy , ... all but scientific necessities ; ... but — ’[172-lancelot] ‘ But what ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot do not want cold abstract necessities of logic : [I]172-lancelot want living practical facts . If those mysterious dogmas speak of real and necessary properties of [His]173-tregarva being , they must be necessarily interwoven in practice with [His]173-tregarva revelation of [Himself]173-tregarva ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Most true . But how would [you]172-lancelot have [Him]173-tregarva unveil [Himself]173-tregarva ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ By unveiling [Himself]173-tregarva . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ What ? To [your]172-lancelot simple intuition ? That was [Semele]404-semele ’s ambition ... [You]172-lancelot recollect the end of that myth . [You]172-lancelot recollect , too , as [you]172-lancelot have read [the Neo - Platonists]5437-the neo - platonists , the result of [their]5437-the neo - platonists similar attempt . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Idolatry and magic . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ True ; and yet , such is the ambition of [man]564-man , [you]172-lancelot who were just now envying [Tregarva]173-tregarva , are already longing to climb even higher than [Saint Theresa]154-saint theresa . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot do not often indulge in such an ambition . But [I]172-lancelot have read in [your]172-lancelot Schoolmen tales of a Beatific Vision ; how that the highest good for [man]564-man was to see [God]281-god . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ And did [you]172-lancelot believe that ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [One]3305-one can not believe the impossible — only regret its impossibility . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Impossibility ? [You]172-lancelot can only see the Uncreate in [the Create]106-the create — the Infinite in [the Finite]107-the finite — the absolute good in that which is like the good . Does [Tregarva]173-tregarva pretend to more ? [He]173-tregarva sees [God]281-god in [His]173-tregarva own thoughts and consciousnesses , and in the events of [the world around [him]173-tregarva]5441-the world around him , imaged in the mirror of [his]173-tregarva own mind . Is [your]172-lancelot mirror , then , so much narrower than [his]173-tregarva ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot have none . [I]172-lancelot see but [myself]172-lancelot , and [the world]475-the world , and far above them , a dim awful Unity , which is but a notion . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Fool!—and slow of heart to believe ! Where else would [you]172-lancelot see [Him]173-tregarva but in [yourself]172-lancelot and in [the world]475-the world ? They are all things cognisable to [you]172-lancelot . Where else , but everywhere , would [you]172-lancelot see [[Him]173-tregarva whom [no man hath seen]5445-no man hath seen , or can see]5444-him whom no man hath seen , or can see ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ When [He]173-tregarva shows [Himself]173-tregarva to [me]172-lancelot in them , then [I]172-lancelot may see [Him]173-tregarva . But now — ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [You]172-lancelot have seen [Him]173-tregarva ; and because [you]172-lancelot do not know the name of what [you]172-lancelot see — or rather will not acknowledge it — [you]172-lancelot fancy that it is not there . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ How in [His]173-tregarva name ? What have [I]172-lancelot seen ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Ask [yourself]172-lancelot . Have [you]172-lancelot not seen , in [your]172-lancelot fancy , at least , an ideal of [man]564-man , for which [you]172-lancelot spurned ( for [Mellot]182-claude has told [me]172-lancelot all ) [the merely negative angelic — the merely receptive and indulgent feminine - ideals of humanity]5447-the merely negative angelic — the merely receptive and indulgent feminine - ideals of humanity , and longed to be [a man , like that ideal and perfect man]5448-a man , like that ideal and perfect man ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot have . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ And what was [your]172-lancelot misery all along ? Was it not that [you]172-lancelot felt [you]172-lancelot ought to be [a person with a one inner unity]5449-a person with a one inner unity , a one practical will , purpose , and business given to [you]172-lancelot — not invented by [yourself]172-lancelot — in the great order and harmony of the universe,—and that [you]172-lancelot were not one?—That [your]172-lancelot self - willed fancies , and self - pleasing passions , had torn [you]172-lancelot in pieces , and left [you]172-lancelot inconsistent , dismembered , helpless , purposeless ? That , in short , [you]172-lancelot were below [your]172-lancelot ideal , just in proportion as [you]172-lancelot were not [a person]844-a person ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [God]281-god knows [you]172-lancelot speak truth ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Then must [not that ideal of humanity]5451-not that ideal of humanity be [a person]844-a person himself?—Else how can [he]844-a person be [the ideal man]5453-the ideal man ? Where is [your]172-lancelot logic ? An impersonal ideal of a personal species ! ... And what is the most special peculiarity of [man]564-man ? Is it not that [he]844-a person alone of creation is [a son]5102-a son , with [a Father to love and to obey]5456-a father to love and to obey ? Then must not [the ideal man]5453-the ideal man be [a son]5102-a son also ? And last , but not least , is it not the very property of [man]564-man that [he]564-man is [a spirit invested with flesh and blood]5460-a spirit invested with flesh and blood ? Then must not [the ideal man]5453-the ideal man have , once at least , taken on [himself]5453-the ideal man flesh and blood also ? Else , how could [he]5453-the ideal man fulfil [his]5453-the ideal man own idea ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Yes ... Yes ... That thought , too , has glanced through [my]172-lancelot mind at moments , like a lightning - flash ; till [I]172-lancelot have envied [the old Greeks]5462-the old greeks [their]5462-the old greeks faith in a human [Zeus]405-zeus , [son of [Kronos]108-kronos]5463-son of kronos — [a human Phoibos]5464-a human phoibos , [son of Zeus]5465-son of zeus . But [I]172-lancelot could not rest in them . [They]5462-the old greeks are noble . But are they — are any — perfect ideals ? The one thing [I]172-lancelot did , and do , and will believe , is the one which [they]5462-the old greeks do not fulfil — that [man]564-man is meant to be the conqueror of [the earth]866-the earth , matter , nature , decay , death itself , and to conquer [them]5462-the old greeks , as [Bacon]235-bacon says , by obeying [them]5462-the old greeks . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Hold it fast;—but follow it out , and say boldly , the ideal of [humanity]5468-humanity must be one who has conquered nature — one who rules [the universe]3109-the universe — [one who has vanquished death itself]5470-one who has vanquished death itself ; and conquered [them]5462-the old greeks , as [Bacon]235-bacon says , not by violating , but by submitting to [them]5462-the old greeks . Have [you]5471-you never heard of one who is said to have done this ? How do [you]5471-you know that in this ideal which [you]5471-you have seen , [you]5471-you have not seen [the Son]5472-the son — [the perfect Man , who died and rose again , and sits for ever [Healer]406-healer , and [Lord]1679-lord , and Ruler of [the universe]3109-the universe]5473-the perfect man , who died and rose again , and sits for ever healer , and lord , and ruler of the universe ? ... Stay — do not answer [me]172-lancelot . Have [you]5471-you not , besides , had dreams of [an all - Father]5476-an all - father — from whom , in some mysterious way , all things and beings must derive [their]5462-the old greeks source , and that [Son]407-son — if [my]172-lancelot theory be true — among the rest , and above all the rest ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Who has not ? But what more dim or distant — more drearily , hopelessly notional , than that thought ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Only the thought that there is none . But the dreariness was only in [your]5471-you own inconsistency . If [He]5476-an all - father be [the Father of all]5477-the father of all , [He]5476-an all - father must be [the Father of [persons]1432-persons]5478-the father of persons — [He]5476-an all - father [Himself]5476-an all - father therefore [a Person]844-a person . [He]5476-an all - father must be [the Father of all in whom dwell personal qualities , power , wisdom , creative energy , love , justice , pity]5481-the father of all in whom dwell personal qualities , power , wisdom , creative energy , love , justice , pity . Can [He]5476-an all - father be [[their]1432-persons Father]566-their father , unless all these very qualities are infinitely [His]5476-an all - father ? Does [He]5476-an all - father now look so terrible to [you]5471-you ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [I]172-lancelot have had this dream , too ; but [I]172-lancelot turned away from it in dread . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Doubtless [you]172-lancelot did . Some day [you]5471-you will know why . Does that former dream of [a human Son]5483-a human son relieve this dream of none of its awfulness ? May not the type be beloved for the sake of [its]5483-a human son Antitype , even if the very name of [All - Father]5484-all - father is no guarantee for [His]5476-an all - father paternal pity ! ... But [you]5471-you have had this dream . How know [you]5471-you , that in it [you]5471-you were not allowed a glimpse , however dim and distant , of [Him]5476-an all - father whom [the Catholics]850-the catholics call [the Father]3232-the father ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ It may be ; but — ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Stay again . Had [you]5471-you never the sense of a Spirit in [you]5471-you — a will , an energy , an inspiration , deeper than the region of consciousness and reflection , which , like the wind , blew where it listed , and [you]5471-you heard the sound of it ringing through [your]5471-you whole consciousness , and yet knew not whence it came , or whither it went , or why it drove [you]5471-you on to dare and suffer , to love and hate ; to be [a fighter]5487-a fighter , [a sportsman]4275-a sportsman , [an artist]835-an artist — ’[172-lancelot] ‘ And [a drunkard]5490-a drunkard ! ’[172-lancelot] added [Lancelot]172-lancelot , sadly . ‘ And [a drunkard]5490-a drunkard . But did it never seem to [you]5471-you that [this strange wayward spirit]5492-this strange wayward spirit , if anything , was the very root and core of [your]5471-you own personality ? And had [you]5471-you never a craving for the help of [some higher , mightier spirit]5493-some higher , mightier spirit , to guide and strengthen [yours]5471-you ; to regulate and civilise its savage and spasmodic self - will ; to teach [you]5471-you [your]5471-you rightful place in the great order of [the universe]3109-the universe around ; to fill [you]5471-you with a continuous purpose and with a continuous will to do it ? Have [you]5471-you never had a dream of [an Inspirer?—a spirit of all spirits]5495-an inspirer?—a spirit of all spirits ? ’[172-lancelot] [Lancelot]172-lancelot turned away with a shudder . ‘ Talk of anything but that ! Little [you]5471-you know — and yet [you]5471-you seem to know everything — the agony of craving with which [I]172-lancelot have longed for guidance ; the rage and disgust which possessed [me]172-lancelot when [I]172-lancelot tried [one pretended teacher]5496-one pretended teacher after another , and found in [myself]172-lancelot depths which [their]5497-their spirits could not , or rather would not , touch . [I]172-lancelot have been irreverent to [the false]5498-the false , from very longing to worship [the true]5499-the true ; [I]172-lancelot have been a rebel to [sham leaders]5500-sham leaders , for very desire to be loyal to [a real one]5501-a real one ; [I]172-lancelot have envied [[my]172-lancelot poor cousin]5114-my poor cousin [[his]5114-my poor cousin Jesuits]5503-his jesuits ; [I]172-lancelot have envied [my]172-lancelot own pointers [their]5497-their slavery to [my]172-lancelot whip and whistle ; [I]172-lancelot have fled , as a last resource , to brandy and opium , for the inspiration which [neither man nor demon]5504-neither man nor demon would bestow ... Then [I]172-lancelot found ... [you]5505-you know [my]172-lancelot story ... And when [I]172-lancelot looked to [her]5506-her to guide and inspire [me]172-lancelot , behold ! [I]172-lancelot found [myself]172-lancelot , by the very laws of [humanity]5468-humanity , compelled to guide and inspire [her;—blind]5508-her;—blind , to lead [the blind!—Thank God]5509-the blind!—thank god , for [her]5506-her sake , that [she]5506-her was taken from [me]172-lancelot ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Did [you]5505-you ever mistake [these substitutes]5510-these substitutes , even [the noblest of [them]5510-these substitutes]5511-the noblest of them , for the reality ? Did not [your]5505-you very dissatisfaction with [them]5510-these substitutes show [you]5505-you that [the true inspirer]5512-the true inspirer ought to be , if [he]5512-the true inspirer were to satisfy [your]5505-you cravings , [a person]844-a person , truly — else how could [he]5512-the true inspirer inspire and teach [you]5505-you , [a person yourself!—but [an utterly infinite , omniscient , eternal person]5515-an utterly infinite , omniscient , eternal person]5514-a person yourself!—but an utterly infinite , omniscient , eternal person ? How know [you]5505-you that in that dream [He]5512-the true inspirer was not unveiling [Himself]5512-the true inspirer to [you]5505-you — [He]5512-the true inspirer , The Spirit , who is [the Lord and Giver of Life]5516-the lord and giver of life ; [The Spirit , who teaches [men]612-men [their]612-men duty and relation to those above , around , beneath [them]612-men]5517-the spirit , who teaches men their duty and relation to those above , around , beneath them ; [the Spirit of order , obedience , loyalty , brotherhood , mercy , condescension]5519-the spirit of order , obedience , loyalty , brotherhood , mercy , condescension ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ But [I]172-lancelot never could distinguish these dreams from each other ; the moment that [I]172-lancelot essayed to separate them , [I]172-lancelot seemed to break up the thought of an absolute one ground of all things , without which [the universe]3109-the universe would have seemed a piecemeal chaos ; and they receded to infinite distance , and became transparent , barren , notional shadows of [my]172-lancelot own brain , even as [your]5505-you words are now . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ How know [you]5505-you that [you]5505-you were meant to distinguish [them]5521-them ? How know [you]5505-you that that very impossibility was not the testimony of fact and experience to that old Catholic dogma , for the sake of which [you]5505-you just now shrank from [my]172-lancelot teaching ? [I]172-lancelot say that this is so . How do [you]5505-you know that it is not ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ But how do [I]172-lancelot know that it is ? [I]172-lancelot want proof . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ And [you]5505-you are [the man who was , five minutes ago , crying out for practical facts , and disdaining cold abstract necessities of logic]5522-the man who was , five minutes ago , crying out for practical facts , and disdaining cold abstract necessities of logic ! Can [you]5505-you prove that [your]5505-you body exists ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ No . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Can [you]5505-you prove that [your]5505-you spirit exists ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ No . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ And yet know that [they]5521-them both exist . And how ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Solvitur ambulando . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Exactly . When [you]5505-you try to prove either of [them]5521-them without the other , [you]5505-you fail . [You]5505-you arrive , if at anything , at some barren polar notion . By action alone [you]5505-you prove the mesothetic fact which underlies and unites [them]5521-them . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Quorsum hæc ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Hither . [I]172-lancelot am not going to demonstrate the indemonstrable — to give [you]5505-you intellectual notions which , after all , will be but reflexes of [my]172-lancelot own peculiar brain , and so add the green of [my]172-lancelot spectacles to the orange of [yours]5505-you , and make night hideous by fresh monsters . [I]172-lancelot may help [you]5505-you to think [yourself]5505-you into a theoretical Tritheism , or a theoretical Sabellianism ; [I]172-lancelot can not make [you]5505-you think [yourself]5505-you into practical and living Catholicism . As [you]5505-you of anthropology , so [I]172-lancelot say of theology,—Solvitur ambulando . Do n’t believe Catholic doctrine unless [you]5505-you like ; faith is free . But see if [you]5505-you can reclaim either society or [yourself]5505-you without it ; see if [He]5523-he will let [you]5505-you reclaim [them]5521-them . Take Catholic doctrine for granted ; act on it ; and see if [you]5505-you will not reclaim them ! ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Take for granted ? Am [I]172-lancelot to come , after all , to implicit faith ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Implicit fiddlesticks ! Did [you]5505-you ever read the Novum Organum ?
