[Mellot]182-claude told [me]172-lancelot that [you]5505-you were [a geologist]5524-a geologist . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Well ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ [You]5505-you took for granted what [you]5505-you read in geological books , and went to [the mine]3271-the mine and [the quarry]5526-the quarry afterwards , to verify it in practice ; and according as [you]5505-you found fact correspond to theory , [you]5505-you retained or rejected . Was that implicit faith , or common sense , common humility , and sound induction ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Sound induction , at least . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Then go now , and do likewise . Believe that [the learned , wise , and good]5527-the learned , wise , and good , for 1800 years , may possibly have found out somewhat , or have been taught somewhat , on this matter , and test [their]5527-the learned , wise , and good theory by practice . If a theory on such a point is worth anything at all , it is omnipotent and all - explaining . If it will not work , of course there is no use keeping it a moment . Perhaps it will work . [I]172-lancelot say it will . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ But [I]172-lancelot shall not work it ; [I]172-lancelot still dread [my]172-lancelot own spectacles . [I]172-lancelot dare not trust [myself]172-lancelot alone to verify a theory of [Murchison]408-murchison ’s or [Lyell]409-lyell ’s . How dare [I]172-lancelot trust [myself]172-lancelot in this ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Then do not trust [yourself]5505-you alone : come and see what [others]3280-others are doing . Come , and become a member of a body which is verifying , by united action , those universal and eternal truths , which are too great for the grasp of [any one time - ridden individual]5529-any one time - ridden individual . Not that [we]5530-we claim the gift of infallibility , any more than [I]172-lancelot do that of perfect utterance of the little which [we]5530-we do know . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Then what do [you]172-lancelot promise [me]172-lancelot in asking [me]172-lancelot to go with [you]172-lancelot ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Practical proof that these [my]172-lancelot words are true,—practical proof that they can make [a nation all that [England]3-england]5531-a nation all that england might be and is not,—the sight of what [a people]5532-a people might become who , knowing thus far , do what [they]5532-a people know . [We]5530-we believe no more than [you]5505-you , but [we]5530-we believe it . Come and see!—and yet [you]5505-you will not see ; facts , and the reasons of them , will be as impalpable to [you]5505-you there as here , unless [you]5505-you can again obey [your]5505-you Novum Organum . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ How then ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ By renouncing all [[your]5505-you idols]5533-your idols — the idols of the race and of the market , of the study and of the theatre . Every national prejudice , every vulgar superstition , every remnant of pedantic system , every sentimental like or dislike , must be left behind [you]5505-you , for the induction of the world problem . [You]5505-you must empty [yourself]5505-you before [God]281-god will fill [you]5505-you . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ Of what can [I]172-lancelot strip [myself]172-lancelot more ? [I]172-lancelot know nothing ; [I]172-lancelot can do nothing ; [I]172-lancelot hope nothing ; [I]172-lancelot fear nothing ; [I]172-lancelot am nothing . ’[172-lancelot] ‘ And [you]5505-you would gain something . But for what purpose?—for on that depends [your]5505-you whole success . To be famous , great , glorious , powerful , beneficent ? ’[172-lancelot] ‘ As [I]172-lancelot live , the height of [my]172-lancelot ambition , small though it be , is only to find [my]172-lancelot place , though it were but as [a sweeper of chimneys]5534-a sweeper of chimneys . If [I]172-lancelot dare wish — if [I]172-lancelot dare choose , it would be only this — to regenerate [one little parish in [the whole world]1313-the whole world]5535-one little parish in the whole world ... To do that , and die , for aught [I]172-lancelot care , without ever being recognised as [the author of [my]172-lancelot own deeds]5537-the author of my own deeds ... to hear them , if need be , imputed to another , and [myself]172-lancelot accursed as [a fool]5538-a fool , if [I]172-lancelot can but atone for the sins of ... [He]172-lancelot paused ; but [[his]172-lancelot teacher]5539-his teacher understood [him]172-lancelot . ‘[172-lancelot] It is enough , ’ [he]172-lancelot said . ‘[172-lancelot] Come with [me]0-i ; [Tregarva]173-tregarva waits for [us]3026-we near . Again [I]0-i warn [you]3027-you ; [you]3027-you will hear nothing new ; [you]3027-you shall only see what [you]3027-you , and all around [you]3027-you , have known and not done , known and done . [We]3026-we have no peculiar doctrines or systems ; the old creeds are enough for [us]3026-we . But [we]3026-we have obeyed the teaching which [we]3026-we received in each and every age , and allowed [ourselves]3026-we to be built up , generation by generation — as the rest of [Christendom]34-christendom might have done — into [a living temple]3028-a living temple , on the foundation which is laid already , and other than which [no man]1477-no man can lay . ’ ‘[738-the man] And what is that ? ’ ‘[410-jesus christ] [Jesus Christ]410-jesus christ — [THE MAN]738-the man . ’ [He]172-lancelot took [Lancelot]172-lancelot by the hand . A peaceful warmth diffused itself over [his]172-lancelot limbs ; the droning of the organ sounded fainter and more faint ; the marble monuments grew dim and distant ; and , half unconsciously , [he]172-lancelot followed like [a child]3467-a child through the cathedral door . [I]738-the man can foresee many criticisms , and those not unreasonable ones , on this little book — let it be some excuse at least for [me]738-the man , that [I]738-the man have foreseen them . [Readers]5541-readers will complain , [I]738-the man doubt not , of the very mythical and mysterious dénouement of a story which began by things so gross and palpable as field - sports and pauperism . But is it not true that , sooner or later , ‘[738-the man] omnia exeunt in mysterium ’ ? Out of mystery [we]3026-we all came at [our]3026-we birth , [fox - hunters]5542-fox - hunters and [paupers]5543-paupers , [sages]5544-sages and [saints]3642-saints ; into mystery [we]3026-we shall all return ... at all events , when [we]3026-we die ; probably , as it seems to [me]738-the man , some of [us]3026-we will return thither before [we]3026-we die . For if the signs of the times mean anything , they portend , [I]738-the man humbly submit , a somewhat mysterious and mythical dénouement to this very age , and to those struggles of it which [I]738-the man have herein attempted , clumsily enough , to sketch . [We]3026-we are entering fast , [I]738-the man both hope and fear , into [the region of prodigy]5546-the region of prodigy , true and false ; and [[our]3026-we great - grandchildren]5547-our great - grandchildren will look back on the latter half of this century , and ask , if it were possible that such things could happen in [an organised planet]5548-an organised planet ? [The Benthamites]411-the benthamites will receive this announcement , if it ever meets [their]411-the benthamites eyes , with shouts of laughter . Be it so ... nous verrons ... In the year 1847 , if [they]411-the benthamites will recollect , [they]411-the benthamites were congratulating [themselves]411-the benthamites on the nations having grown too wise to go to war any more ... and in 1848 ? So it has been from the beginning . What did [philosophers]5549-philosophers expect in 1792 ? What did [they]5549-philosophers see in 1793 ? [Popery]412-popery was to be eternal : but the Reformation came nevertheless . [Rome]21-rome was to be eternal : but [Alaric]413-alaric came . [Jerusalem]109-jerusalem was to be eternal : but [Titus]414-titus came . [Gomorrha]415-gomorrha was to be eternal , [I]738-the man doubt not ; but the fire - floods came ... ‘[738-the man] As it was in the days of [Noah]303-noah , so shall it be in the days of [the Son of Man]3031-the son of man . [They]3032-they were eating , drinking , marrying , and giving in marriage ; and the flood came and swept [them]3032-they all away . ’ Of course [they]3032-they did not expect it . [They]3032-they went on saying , ‘[738-the man] Where is the promise of [his]3031-the son of man coming ? For all things continue as they were from the beginning . ’ Most true ; but what if they were from the beginning — over a volcano ’s mouth ? What if the method whereon things have proceeded since the creation were , as geology as well as history proclaims , a cataclysmic method ? What then ? Why should not this age , as all others like it have done , end in a cataclysm , and a prodigy , and a mystery ? And why should not [my]0-i little book do likewise ? Again — [Readers]5541-readers will probably complain of the fragmentary and unconnected form of the book . Let [them]5541-readers first be sure that that is not an integral feature of the subject itself , and therefore the very form the book should take . Do not [young men]4657-young men think , speak , act , just now , in this very incoherent , fragmentary way ; without methodic education or habits of thought ; with the various stereotyped systems which [they]4657-young men have received by tradition , breaking up under [them]4657-young men like ice in a thaw ; with a thousand facts and notions , which [they]4657-young men know not how to classify , pouring in on [them]4657-young men like a flood?—a very Yeasty state of mind altogether , like a mountain burn in a spring rain , carrying down with it stones , sticks , peat - water , addle grouse - eggs and drowned kingfishers , fertilising salts and vegetable poisons — not , alas ! without a large crust , here and there , of sheer froth . Yet no heterogeneous confused flood - deposit , no fertile meadows below . And no high water , no fishing . It is in the long black droughts , when the water is foul from lowness , and not from height , that [Hydras]416-hydras and Desmidiæ , and [Rotifers]417-rotifers , and all uncouth pseud - organisms , bred of putridity , begin to multiply , and the fish are sick for want of a fresh , and the cunningest artificial fly is of no avail , and [the shrewdest angler]5552-the shrewdest angler will do nothing — except with a gross fleshly gilt - tailed worm , or the cannibal bait of roe , whereby [parent fishes]5553-parent fishes , like competitive barbarisms , devour [each other]565-each other ’s flesh and blood — perhaps [their]3032-they own . It is when [the stream]526-the stream is clearing after a flood , that the fish will rise ... When will the flood clear , and the fish come on the feed again ? Next ; [I]0-i shall be blamed for having left untold the fate of [those characters who have acted throughout as [[Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s satellites]5557-lancelot ’s satellites]5556-those characters who have acted throughout as lancelot ’s satellites . But indeed [their]5556-those characters who have acted throughout as lancelot ’s satellites only purpose consisted in [their]5556-those characters who have acted throughout as lancelot ’s satellites influence on [his]172-lancelot development , and that of [Tregarva]173-tregarva ; [I]0-i do not see that [we]5558-we have any need to follow [them]5556-those characters who have acted throughout as lancelot ’s satellites farther . [The reader]576-the reader can surely conjecture [their]5556-those characters who have acted throughout as lancelot ’s satellites history for [himself]576-the reader ... [He]576-the reader may be pretty certain that [they]5556-those characters who have acted throughout as lancelot ’s satellites have gone the way of [the world]475-the world ... abierunt ad plures ... for this life or for the next . [They]5556-those characters who have acted throughout as lancelot ’s satellites have done — very much what [he]576-the reader or [I]0-i might have done in [their]5556-those characters who have acted throughout as lancelot ’s satellites place — nothing . [Nature]132-nature brings [very few of [[her]132-nature children]1088-her children]5561-very few of her children to perfection , in these days or any other ... And for Grace , which does bring [its children]5563-its children to perfection , the quantity and quality of the perfection must depend on the quantity and quality of the grace , and that again , to an awful extent — [The Giver]609-the giver only knows to how great an extent — on the will of [the recipients]5565-the recipients , and therefore in exact proportion to [their]5565-the recipients lowness in the human scale , on the circumstances which environ [them]5565-the recipients . So [[my]0-i characters]5566-my characters are now — very much what [the reader]576-the reader might expect [them]5566-my characters to be . [I]0-i confess [them]5566-my characters to be unsatisfactory ; so are most things : but how can [I]0-i solve problems which fact has not yet solved for [me]0-i ? How am [I]0-i to extricate [[my]0-i antitypal characters]5568-my antitypal characters , when [their]5566-my characters living types have not yet extricated [themselves]5566-my characters ? When the age moves on , [my]0-i story shall move on with it . Let it be enough , that [[my]0-i puppets]5569-my puppets have retreated in good order , and that [I]0-i am willing to give to [those readers who have conceived something of human interest for [them]5566-my characters , the latest accounts of [their]5566-my characters doings]5570-those readers who have conceived something of human interest for them , the latest accounts of their doings . With the exception , that is , of [Mellot]182-claude and [Sabina]367-sabina . [Them]5566-my characters [I]0-i confess to be [an utterly mysterious , fragmentary little couple]5571-an utterly mysterious , fragmentary little couple . Why not ? Do [you]5572-you not meet with [twenty such]5573-twenty such in the course of [[your]5572-you life?—Charming people]5574-your life?—charming people , who for aught [you]5572-you know may be [opera folk from [Paris]63-paris]5575-opera folk from paris , or [emissaries from the Czar]5576-emissaries from the czar , or disguised [Jesuits]282-jesuits , or [disguised Angels ... who evidently ‘[0-i] have a history , ’]5577-disguised angels ... who evidently ‘ have a history , ’ and a strange one , which [you]5572-you never expect or attempt to fathom ; who interest [you]5572-you intensely for a while , and then are whirled away again in the great world - waltz , and lost in [the crowd]4817-the crowd for ever ? Why should [you]5572-you wish [my]0-i story to be more complete than theirs is , or less romantic than theirs may be ? There are more things in [London]46-london , as well as in [heaven and earth]2500-heaven and earth , than are dreamt of in [our]5580-our philosophy . If [you]5572-you but knew the secret history of [that dull gentleman opposite whom [you]5572-you sat at dinner yesterday!—the real thoughts of [that chattering girl whom [you]5572-you took down!—‘Omnia exeunt in mysterium]5582-that chattering girl whom you took down!—‘omnia exeunt in mysterium]5581-that dull gentleman opposite whom you sat at dinner yesterday!—the real thoughts of that chattering girl whom you took down!—‘omnia exeunt in mysterium , ’[0-i] [I]0-i say again . [Every human being]3670-every human being is a romance , a miracle to [himself]3670-every human being now ; and will appear as one to all [the world]475-the world in That Day . But now for the rest ; and [Squire Lavington]136-squire lavington first . [He]136-squire lavington is a very fair sample of the fate of [the British public]3035-the british public ; for [he]136-squire lavington is dead and buried : and [readers]5541-readers would not have [me]0-i extricate [him]136-squire lavington out of that situation . If [you]3037-you ask news of the reason and manner of [his]136-squire lavington end , [I]0-i can only answer , that like many others , [he]136-squire lavington went out — as candles do . [I]0-i believe [he]136-squire lavington expressed general repentance for all [his]136-squire lavington sins — all , at least , of which [he]136-squire lavington was aware . To confess and repent of the state of [the Whitford Priors estate]3038-the whitford priors estate , and of [the poor thereon]3039-the poor thereon , was of course more than [any minister , of any denomination]3040-any minister , of any denomination whatsoever , could be required to demand of [him]136-squire lavington ; seeing that would have involved a recognition of those duties of property , of which [the good old gentleman]3041-the good old gentleman was to the last [a staunch denier]3042-a staunch denier ; and which are as yet seldom supposed to be included in any Christian creed , Catholic or other . Two sermons were preached in [Whitford]7-whitford on the day of [his]136-squire lavington funeral ; one by [Mr. O’Blareaway]271-mr. o’blareaway , on the text from [Job]418-job , provided for such occasions ; ‘ When the ear heard [him]136-squire lavington , then it blessed [him]136-squire lavington , ’[271-mr. o’blareaway] etc . etc . : the other by [the Baptist preacher]3043-the baptist preacher , on two verses of the forty - ninth Psalm — ‘ [They]5583-their fancy that [[their]5583-their houses]5584-their houses shall endure for ever , and call [the lands]4929-the lands after [their]5583-their own names . ‘[3043-the baptist preacher] Yet [man]564-man being in honour hath no understanding , but is compared to the beasts that perish . ’ Waiving the good taste , which was probably on a par in both cases , [the reader]576-the reader is left to decide which of the two texts was most applicable . [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington is [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington no longer . [She]158-mrs. lavington has married , to the astonishment of [the world]475-the world in general , [that ‘[3043-the baptist preacher] excellent man]5588-that ‘ excellent man , ’ [Mr. O’Blareaway]271-mr. o’blareaway , who has been discovered not to be quite as young as [he]5588-that ‘ excellent man appeared , [his]5588-that ‘ excellent man graces being principally owing to a Brutus wig , which [he]5588-that ‘ excellent man has now wisely discarded . [Mrs. Lavington]158-mrs. lavington now sits in state under [[her]158-mrs. lavington husband]4183-her husband ’s ministry , as [the leader of the religious world in [the fashionable watering - place of [Steamingbath]110-steamingbath]5591-the fashionable watering - place of steamingbath]5590-the leader of the religious world in the fashionable watering - place of steamingbath , and derives [her]158-mrs. lavington notions of the past , present , and future state of [the universe]3109-the universe principally from those two meek and unbiased periodicals , the Protestant Hue - and - Cry and [the Christian Satirist]5593-the christian satirist , to both of which [O’Blareaway]271-mr. o’blareaway is a constant contributor . [She]158-mrs. lavington has taken such an aversion to [Whitford]7-whitford since [Argemone]150-argemone ’s death , that [she]158-mrs. lavington has ceased to have any connection with [that unhealthy locality]5594-that unhealthy locality , beyond the popular and easy one of rent - receiving . [O’Blareaway]271-mr. o’blareaway has never entered [the parish]3395-the parish to [his]271-mr. o’blareaway knowledge since [Mr. Lavington]276-mr. lavington ’s funeral ; and was much pleased , the last time [I]3045-an excellent man rode with [him]271-mr. o’blareaway , at [my]3045-an excellent man informing [him]271-mr. o’blareaway that [a certain picturesque moorland which [he]271-mr. o’blareaway had been greatly admiring]5596-a certain picturesque moorland which he had been greatly admiring , was [his]271-mr. o’blareaway own possession ... After all , [he]271-mr. o’blareaway is ‘[3045-an excellent man] [an excellent man]3045-an excellent man ; ’ and when [I]3045-an excellent man met a large party at [[his]271-mr. o’blareaway house]5597-his house the other day , and beheld [dory]419-dory and surmullet , champagne and [lachryma Christi]420-lachryma christi , amid all the glory of the Whitford plate ... ( some of it said to have belonged to the altar of [the Priory Church]5598-the priory church four hundred years ago ) , [I]3045-an excellent man was deeply moved by the impressive tone in which , at the end of a long grace , [he]271-mr. o’blareaway prayed ‘[3045-an excellent man] that the daily bread of [[our]3046-our less favoured brethren]3047-our less favoured brethren might be mercifully vouchsafed to [them]3047-our less favoured brethren . ’ ... [[My]0-i dear readers]5599-my dear readers , would [you]5599-my dear readers have [me]0-i , even if [I]0-i could , extricate [him]271-mr. o’blareaway from such an Elysium by any denouement whatsoever ? [Poor dear [Luke]137-mr. smith]5600-poor dear luke , again , is said to be painting lean frescoes for [the Something - or - other - Kirche at [Munich]111-munich]5601-the something - or - other - kirche at munich ; and [the vicar]3366-the vicar , under the name of Father Stylites , of [the order of [St. Philumena]421-st. philumena]5603-the order of st. philumena , is preaching impassioned sermons to [crowded congregations at [St. George]112-st. george ’s]5604-crowded congregations at st. george ’s , [Bedlam]113-bedlam . How can [I]0-i extricate [them]5599-my dear readers from that ? [No one]555-no one has come forth of it yet , to [my]0-i knowledge , except by paths whereof [I]0-i shall use [Lessing]176-lessing ’s saying , ‘[0-i] [I]0-i may have [my]0-i whole hand full of truth , and yet find good to open only [my]0-i little finger . ’ But who cares for [their]3050-they coming out ? [They]3050-they are but two more added to [the five hundred]5606-the five hundred , at whose moral suicide , and dive into [the Roman Avernus]114-the roman avernus , [a quasi - Protestant public]5607-a quasi - protestant public looks on with a sort of savage satisfaction , crying only , ‘[3048-we] Did n’t [we]3048-we tell [you]3049-you so?’—and more than half hopes that [they]3050-they will not come back again , lest [they]3050-they should be discovered to have learnt anything while [they]3050-they were [there]992-there . What are two among [that five hundred]3052-that five hundred ? much more among [the five thousand who seem destined shortly to follow [them]3050-they]3053-the five thousand who seem destined shortly to follow them ? [The banker]1279-the banker , thanks to [Barnakill]377-barnakill ’s assistance , is rapidly getting rich again — who would wish to stop [him]1279-the banker ? However , [he]1279-the banker is wiser , on some points at least , than [he]1279-the banker was of yore . [He]1279-the banker has taken up the flax movement violently of late — perhaps owing to some hint of [Barnakill’s]422-barnakill’s — talks of nothing but [Chevalier Claussen]423-chevalier claussen and [Mr. Donellan]424-mr. donellan , and is very anxious to advance capital to [any landlord who will grow flax on [Mr. Warnes]425-mr. warnes ’s method , either in [England]3-england or [Ireland]69-ireland]3055-any landlord who will grow flax on mr. warnes ’s method , either in england or ireland ... [John Bull]234-john bull , however , has not yet awakened sufficiently to listen to [his]234-john bull overtures , but sits up in bed , dolefully rubbing [his]234-john bull eyes , and bemoaning the evanishment of [his]234-john bull protectionist dream — altogether realising tolerably , [he]234-john bull and [[his]234-john bull land]3056-his land , [Dr. Watts]426-dr. watts ’ well - known moral song concerning the sluggard and [[his]234-john bull garden]5608-his garden . [Lord Minchampstead]250-lord minchampstead again prospers . Either [the nuns of [Minchampstead]39-minchampstead]5609-the nuns of minchampstead have left no Nemesis behind [them]5609-the nuns of minchampstead , like those of [Whitford]144-whitford priors , or a certain wisdom and righteousness of [his]250-lord minchampstead , however dim and imperfect , averts it for a time . So , as [I]426-dr. watts said , [he]250-lord minchampstead prospers , and is hated ; especially by [[his]250-lord minchampstead farmers]5610-his farmers , to whom [he]250-lord minchampstead has just offered long leases , and a sliding corn - rent . [They]5610-his farmers would have hated [him]250-lord minchampstead just the same if [he]250-lord minchampstead had kept them at rack - rents ; and [he]250-lord minchampstead has not forgotten that ; but [they]5610-his farmers have . [They]5610-his farmers looked shy at the leases , because [they]5610-his farmers bind [them]5610-his farmers to farm high , which [they]5610-his farmers do not know how to do ; and at the corn - rent , because [they]5610-his farmers think that [he]250-lord minchampstead expects wheat to rise again — which , being [a sensible man]5611-a sensible man , [he]250-lord minchampstead very probably does . But for [my]426-dr. watts story — [I]426-dr. watts certainly do not see how to extricate [him]250-lord minchampstead or [any one else]1547-any one else from [farmers]5613-farmers ’[426-dr. watts] stupidity , greed , and ill - will ... That question must have seven years ’ more free - trade to settle it , before [I]426-dr. watts can say anything thereon . Still less can [I]426-dr. watts foreshadow the fate of [[his]250-lord minchampstead eldest son]5614-his eldest son , who has just been rusticated from [Christ Church]5615-christ church for riding one of [Simmon]427-simmon ’s hacks through a china - shop window ; especially as [the youth]5616-the youth is reported to be given to piquette and strong liquors , and , like [[many noblemen]5617-many noblemen ’s eldest sons]5618-many noblemen ’s eldest sons , is considered ‘[426-dr. watts] not to have the talent of [[his]3057-his father]453-his father . ’ As for [the old lord]5619-the old lord [himself]5619-the old lord , [I]426-dr. watts have no wish to change or develop [him]5619-the old lord in any way — except to cut slips off [him]5619-the old lord , as [you]5620-you do off a willow , and plant two or three in [[every county]5621-every county in [England]3-england]5622-every county in england . Let [him]5619-the old lord alone to work out [his]5619-the old lord own plot ... [we]5623-we have not seen the end of it yet ; but whatever it will be , [England]3-england has need of [him]5619-the old lord as a transition - stage between feudalism and * * * * ; for many a day to come . If [he]5619-the old lord be not [the ideal landlord]5624-the ideal landlord , [he]5619-the old lord is nearer [it]5624-the ideal landlord than any [we]5623-we are like yet to see ... Except one ; and that , after all , is [Lord Vieuxbois]241-lord vieuxbois . Let [him]5619-the old lord go on , like [a gallant gentleman]5625-a gallant gentleman as [he]5619-the old lord is , and prosper . And [he]5619-the old lord will prosper , for [he]5619-the old lord fears [God]281-god , and [God]281-god is with [him]5619-the old lord . [He]5619-the old lord has much to learn ; and a little to unlearn . [He]5619-the old lord has to learn that [God]281-god is [a living God]5626-a living god now , as well as in the middle ages ; to learn to trust not in antique precedents , but in eternal laws : to learn that [[his]5619-the old lord tenants]5627-his tenants , just because [they]5627-his tenants are [children of [God]281-god]5628-children of god , are not to be kept [children]935-children , but developed and educated into [sons]3386-sons ; to learn that [God]281-god ’s grace , like [His]281-god love , is free , and that [His]5619-the old lord spirit bloweth where it listeth , and vindicates its own free - will against [our]5631-we narrow systems , by revealing , at times , even to [nominal Heretics and Infidels]5632-nominal heretics and infidels , truths which [the Catholic Church]886-the catholic church must humbly receive , as the message of [Him]5619-the old lord who is wider , deeper , more tolerant , than even [she]5634-she can be ... And [he]5619-the old lord is in the way to learn all this . Let [him]5619-the old lord go on . At what conclusions [he]5619-the old lord will attain , [he]5619-the old lord knows not , nor do [I.]5635-i. But this [I]426-dr. watts know , that [he]5619-the old lord is on the path to great and true conclusions .... And [he]5619-the old lord is just about to be married , too . That surely should teach [him]5619-the old lord something . The papers inform [me]426-dr. watts that [[his]5619-the old lord bride]5636-his bride elect is [[Lord Minchampstead]250-lord minchampstead ’s youngest daughter]5637-lord minchampstead ’s youngest daughter . That should be a noble mixture ; there should be [stalwart offspring , spiritual as well as physical , born of that intermarriage of the old and the new]5638-stalwart offspring , spiritual as well as physical , born of that intermarriage of the old and the new . [We]5631-we will hope it : perhaps [some of [[my]426-dr. watts readers]1497-my readers , who enter into [my]426-dr. watts inner meaning]5639-some of my readers , who enter into my inner meaning , may also pray for it . Whom have [I]426-dr. watts to account for besides ? [Crawy]177-crawy — though some of [[my]426-dr. watts readers]1497-my readers may consider the mention of [him]177-crawy superfluous . But to [those who do not]5642-those who do not , [I]426-dr. watts may impart the news , that last month , in [the union workhouse]4637-the union workhouse — [he]177-crawy died ; and may , for aught [we]5631-we know , have ere this met [Squire Lavington]136-squire lavington ... [He]177-crawy is supposed , or at least said , to have had a soul to be saved ... as [I]426-dr. watts think , a body to be saved also . But what is one more among so many ? And in [an over - peopled country like this]5644-an over - peopled country like this , too ... [One]3305-one must learn to look at things — and [paupers]5543-paupers — in the mass . [The poor of [Whitford]7-whitford]5647-the poor of whitford also ? [[My]426-dr. watts dear readers]5599-my dear readers , [I]426-dr. watts trust [you]5599-my dear readers will not ask [me]426-dr. watts just now to draw the horoscope of [the Whitford poor]3676-the whitford poor , or of any others . Really that depends principally on [yourselves]5599-my dear readers ... But for the present , [the poor of [Whitford]7-whitford]5647-the poor of whitford , owing , as it seems to [them]5647-the poor of whitford and [me]426-dr. watts , to quite other causes than an ‘[426-dr. watts] overstocked labour - market , ’ or too rapid ‘[426-dr. watts] multiplication of [their]3059-their species , ’ are growing more profligate , reckless , pauperised , year by year . [O’Blareaway]271-mr. o’blareaway complained sadly to [me]426-dr. watts the other day that the poor - rates were becoming ‘[426-dr. watts] heavier and heavier’—had nearly reached , indeed , what they were under the old law ... But there is one who does not complain , but gives and gives , and stints [herself]3060-she to give , and weeps in silence and unseen over the evils which [she]3060-she has yearly less and less power to stem . For in [a darkened chamber of the fine house at [Steamingbath]110-steamingbath]3061-a darkened chamber of the fine house at steamingbath , lies on a sofa [Honoria Lavington]428-honoria lavington — beautiful no more ; [the victim of some mysterious and agonising disease]3062-the victim of some mysterious and agonising disease , about which [the physicians]3063-the physicians agree on one point only — that it is hopeless . The ‘ curse of [the Lavingtons]248-the lavingtons ’[428-honoria lavington] is on [her]3060-she ; and [she]3060-she bears it . There [she]3060-she lies , and prays , and reads , and arranges [her]3060-she charities , and writes little books for [children]935-children , full of the Beloved Name which is for ever on [her]3060-she lips . [She]3060-she suffers — none but [herself]3060-she knows how much , or how strangely — yet [she]3060-she is never heard to sigh . [She]3060-she weeps in secret — [she]3060-she has long ceased to plead — for [others]3280-others , not for [herself]3060-she ; and prays for [them]3280-others too — perhaps some day [her]3060-she prayers will yet [he]3066-he answered . But [she]3060-she greets [all visitors]3067-all visitors with a smile fresh from heaven ; and [all who enter [that room]5086-that room]3068-all who enter that room leave [it]5086-that room saddened , and yet happy , like [those who have lingered a moment at the gates of paradise , and seen angels ascending and descending upon earth]3070-those who have lingered a moment at the gates of paradise , and seen angels ascending and descending upon earth . There [she]3060-she lies — who could wish [her]3060-she otherwise ? Even [Doctor Autotheus Maresnest]429-doctor autotheus maresnest , [the celebrated mesmeriser , who , though [he]429-doctor autotheus maresnest laughs at the Resurrection of [the Lord]817-the lord]3071-the celebrated mesmeriser , who , though he laughs at the resurrection of the lord , is confidently reported to have raised [more than one corpse to life]3073-more than one corpse to life [himself]429-doctor autotheus maresnest , was heard to say , after having attended [her]3060-she professionally , that [her]3060-she waking bliss and peace , although unfortunately unattributable even to autocatalepsy , much less to somnambulist exaltation , was on the whole , however unscientific , almost as enviable . There [she]3060-she lies — and will lie till [she]3060-she dies — the type of thousands more , ‘ [the martyrs by the pang without the palm]5651-the martyrs by the pang without the palm , ’[3060-she] who find [no mates in this life]3074-no mates in this life ... and yet may find [them]3074-no mates in this life in the life to come ... [Poor Paul Tregarva]173-tregarva ! Little [he]173-tregarva fancies how [her]3060-she days run by ! ... At least , there has been no news since that last scene in [St. Paul ’s Cathedral]115-st. paul ’s cathedral , either of [him]173-tregarva or [Lancelot]172-lancelot . How [[their]3075-their strange teacher]3076-their strange teacher has fulfilled [his]429-doctor autotheus maresnest promise of guiding [their]3075-their education ; whether [they]3075-their have yet reached [the country of [Prester John]430-prester john]3003-the country of prester john ; whether , indeed , that Caucasian Utopia has a local and bodily existence , or was only used by [Barnakill]377-barnakill to shadow out that Ideal which is , as [he]377-barnakill said of [the Garden of Eden]3545-the garden of eden , always near [us]3079-us , underlying the Actual , as the spirit does its body , exhibiting itself step by step through all the falsehoods and confusions of history and society , giving life to all in it which is not falsehood and decay ; on all these questions [I]0-i can give [[my]0-i readers]1497-my readers no sort of answer ; perhaps [I]0-i may as yet have no answer to give ; perhaps [I]0-i may be afraid of giving one ; perhaps the times [themselves]1497-my readers are giving , at once cheerfully and sadly , in strange destructions and strange births , a better answer than [I]0-i can give . [I]0-i have set forth , as far as in [me]0-i lay , the data of [my]0-i problem : and surely , if the premises be given , [wise men]3081-wise men will not have to look far for the conclusion . In homely English [I]0-i have given [[my]0-i readers]1497-my readers Yeast ; if [they]1497-my readers be what [I]0-i take [them]1497-my readers for , [they]1497-my readers will be able to bake with it [themselves]1497-my readers . And yet [I]0-i have brought [Lancelot]172-lancelot , at least — perhaps [Tregarva]173-tregarva too — to a conclusion , and an all - important one , which whoso reads may find fairly printed in these pages . Henceforth [his]172-lancelot life must begin anew . Were [I]0-i to carry on the thread of [his]172-lancelot story continuously [he]172-lancelot would still seem to have overleaped as vast a gulf as if [I]0-i had re - introduced [him]172-lancelot as [a gray - haired man]3083-a gray - haired man . Strange ! that the death of [one of [the lovers]2871-the lovers]3084-one of the lovers should seem no complete termination to [their]2871-the lovers history , when [their]2871-the lovers marriage would have been accepted by [all]2451-all as the legitimate dénouement , beyond which no information was to be expected . As if the history of love always ended at the altar ! Oftener it only begins there ; and all before it is but a mere longing to love . Why should [readers]5541-readers complain of being refused the future history of one life , when [they]5541-readers are in most novels cut short by the marriage finale from the biography of two ? But if , over and above this , [any reader]3088-any reader should be wroth at [my]0-i having left [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s history unfinished on questions in [his]172-lancelot opinion more important than that of love , let [me]0-i entreat [him]172-lancelot to set manfully about finishing [his]172-lancelot own history — a far more important one to [him]172-lancelot than [Lancelot]172-lancelot ’s . If [he]172-lancelot shall complain that doubts are raised for which no solution is given , that [[my]0-i hero]3089-my hero is brought into contradictory beliefs without present means of bringing them to accord , into passive acquiescence in vast truths without seeing any possibility of practically applying them — let [him]172-lancelot consider well whether such be not [his]172-lancelot own case ; let [him]172-lancelot , if [he]172-lancelot be as [most are]3090-most are , thank [God]281-god when [he]172-lancelot finds out that such is [his]172-lancelot case , when [he]172-lancelot knows at last that [those are most blind who say]3091-those are most blind who say [they]3091-those are most blind who say see , when [he]172-lancelot becomes at last conscious how little [he]172-lancelot believes , how little [he]172-lancelot acts up to that small belief . Let [him]172-lancelot try to right somewhat of the doubt , confusion , custom - worship , inconsistency , idolatry , within [him]172-lancelot — some of the greed , bigotry , recklessness , respectably superstitious atheism around [him]172-lancelot ; and perhaps before [his]172-lancelot new task is finished , [Lancelot]172-lancelot and [Tregarva]173-tregarva may have returned with a message , if not for [him]172-lancelot — for that depends upon [him]172-lancelot having ears to hear it — yet possibly for [strong Lord Minchampstead]250-lord minchampstead , probably for [good Lord Vieuxbois]241-lord vieuxbois , and surely for [the sinners]3092-the sinners and [the slaves of [Whitford Priors]144-whitford priors]3093-the slaves of whitford priors . What it will be , [I]0-i know not altogether ; but this [I]0-i know , that if [[my]0-i heroes]3094-my heroes go on as [they]3094-my heroes have set forth , looking with single mind for some one ground of human light and love , some everlasting rock whereon to build , utterly careless what [the building]3095-the building may be , howsoever contrary to precedent and prejudice , and [the idols of the day]3096-the idols of the day , provided [God]281-god , and nature , and the accumulated lessons of all the ages , help [them]3094-my heroes in its construction — then [they]3094-my heroes will find in time the thing [they]3094-my heroes seek , and see how the will of [God]281-god may at last be done on [earth]724-earth , even as it is done in [heaven]1101-heaven . But , alas ! between [them]3094-my heroes and [it]3099-it are [waste raging waters]3100-waste raging waters , foul mud banks , thick with dragons and sirens ; and many a bitter day and blinding night , in cold and hunger , spiritual and perhaps physical , await [them]3094-my heroes . For it was a true vision which [John Bunyan]363-john bunyan saw , and one which , as the visions of [wise men]3081-wise men are wo nt to do , meant far more than [the seer]3102-the seer fancied , when [he]363-john bunyan beheld in [his]363-john bunyan dream that there was indeed [a land of [Beulah]116-beulah]3103-a land of beulah , and [Arcadian Shepherd Paradise]117-arcadian shepherd paradise , on whose [mountain tops the everlasting sunshine lay]3104-mountain tops the everlasting sunshine lay ; but that the way to [it]3105-it , as these last three years are preaching to [us]3106-us , went past [the mouth of [Hell]118-hell]3107-the mouth of hell , and through [the valley of the Shadow of Death]3108-the valley of the shadow of death .
